story:
SET YOUR OWN DONATION AND BACK THE SERIES WITH ANY AMOUNT YOU CAN! PART 1 OF THIS CAMPAIGN SAW TWO NEW EPISODES FUNDED AND SHOT! A THIRD NEW EPISODE REACHED FUNDING ON 8/16! EVERY $5,000 RAISED = A NEW EPISODE! PLEASE READ BELOW AND HELP KEEP THE SLUMBER PARTIES COMING!

UPDATED - JULY 1, 2020: Remember when we thought we were going to be able to just keep accepting donations on the original campaign page after the initial 60-day campaign period had ended? Well... although the original campaign page was indeed still accepting donations in the form of reward purchases  (YAY!)... unfortunately the original campaign page would no longer allow backers to set their own donation amount  (BOO!)... so here we are with PART 2 - the next (and final) part of the campaign to resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER!  Same campaign, same rewards, same great show!  

We know that reading a ton of text can be tedious for some, but everything you could possibly need to know about this campaign is explained in detail below and Adam Green is very good about personally posting consistent and thorough updates in the "Updates" section of this campaign. Please note that since IndieGoGo's "Rewards" section (located to the right) has a very strict limit on the amount of text creators can use to describe each reward, we've thoroughly explained the rewards further down in this campaign overview. Please read the full description of each reward before purchasing one. Remember, you can always set your own donation amount and every dollar helps our effort to produce SCARY SLEEPOVER! Rewards are merely incentives for more generous donations. You do not need to purchase one of the rewards to help back the series!

Perhaps you've been following the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER since Part 1 of this campaign launched in January. Perhaps you've already contributed once or twice and helped get the first THREE episodes of Season 3 produced. If you already know all of the details about the campaign and just have questions about how the money we had already raised is going roll over to Part 2 of our crowd fund effort- feel free to scroll down to the very bottom of this campaign description.

Perhaps you didn't know about the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER until you watched one of the new episodes that this campaign has funded so far. Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson" premieres for the general public on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel on July 4th while Episode 3.2 "Brian Quinn" will premiere on August 22nd! If so - WELCOME! We've been waiting for you! Between the above video and the information below you'll find everything you need to know about the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER. This campaign was off to a solid start with two new episodes reaching funding before the COVID-19 pandemic arrived and totally wet the bed on our slumber party fun.  We temporarily paused our crowd funding efforts in March as the United States went into lockdown- but now that the country is starting to open up again it's time for the show to go on and for our resurrection efforts to continue!  We only have 60 days to get the rest of Season 3 green-lit. However many episodes reach funding in this second (and final) part of our campaign - that's our third season. Hopefully we get to make a full season for you! 

WHAT IS SCARY SLEEPOVER?

Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is an on-line reality series that features some of the biggest names in genre entertainment like you've never seen them before... in their pajamas! In each episode a different celebrity artist joins filmmaker Adam Green (HATCHET, FROZEN) for a slumber party at his studio where they spend the night playing games, watching movies, eating junk food, and having extremely candid conversations that reveal their biggest real life fears. The 29 existing episodes that made up Seasons 1 and 2 have been watched over 1 million times between ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel!

It was Green's goal in creating SCARY SLEEPOVER to not only entertain audiences but to make a real connection between artists and fans. While the show may be inherently funny and contain a lot of truly hilarious moments, it is also bursting with genuine heart. Since every guest already has a personal relationship with Green they are comfortable opening up about themselves in an extremely honest and candid manner that you just don't find anywhere else. Through its many emotional and revealing moments SCARY SLEEPOVER has given fans a much deeper look at who these artists really are and just how much we all truly have in common as a community. 

THE GUESTS SO FAR:

Previous guests have include: Slash (GUNS N ROSES), Sid Haig (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Kane Hodder (FRIDAY THE 13TH), Danielle Harris (HALLOWEEN), Dee Snider (TWISTED SISTER), Derek Mears (SWAMP THING), Bill Moseley (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Emma Bell (THE WALKING DEAD), Tony Todd (CANDYMAN), Joe Lynch (MAYHEM), Brea Grant (DEXTER), Felissa Rose (SLEEPAWAY CAMP), Neil Marshall (GAME OF THRONES), Ti West (HOUSE OF THE DEVIL), Kristina Klebe (HALLOWEEN), Lucky McKee (MAY), Clare Kramer (BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER), Todd Farmer (MY BLOODY VALENTINE), Tiffany Shepis (VICTOR CROWLEY), Tom Holland (CHILD'S PLAY), Laura Ortiz (HOLLISTON), Darren Lynn Bousman (SAW), Zach Galligan (GREMLINS), Jeffrey Reddick (FINAL DESTINATION), Doug Benson (THE LEGO BATMAN MOVIE), and Brian Quinn (IMPRACTICAL JOKERS).

THE HISTORY OF SCARY SLEEPOVER:

Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER originally ran from 2015 - 2016 with a Christmas Special in 2017. Full-length uncensored versions of episodes ran on ArieScope.com while ArieScope's YouTube Channel carried shorter, censored versions. The show was (and remains) free to watch no matter which platform you watched it on.  As beloved as the series may have become, unfortunately our model of making the show with our own money and giving it away to fans for free eventually took its toll on us. Producing the show was taking up all of our time and we were sinking further and further into debt the longer we worked on it. So it was with a heavy heart that we had to roll up our sleeping bags and say goodnight to the slumber parties after the 2017 Christmas Special. 

The amount of work that goes into producing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER is on par with an episode of any network television reality show - only we were doing it without a budget of any kind whatsoever.  Not only is a crew required for every shoot but episodes can take anywhere from 40 to 60 hours  (in some cases far longer) to complete post-production. We were having to work through the nights and over the weekends around our actual production jobs in order to make SCARY SLEEPOVER happen, often times giving up paid work and falling behind on deadlines in our personal careers.  As much as we loved doing the show, no one involved could carry on producing a show where the people behind it were literally paying to work on it. So after 29 wonderful episodes, the reality of the situation won out and we called it a night.

WHAT PROMPTED THIS RESURRECTION? 

Over the summer of 2019 two crucial things happened that caused us to start rethinking SCARY SLEEPOVER.  In July an article titled "Adam Green Saved My Life" was posted on NightmareNostalgia.com. In the piece, writer Landon Evanson bravely discussed his on going battle with depression and how SCARY SLEEPOVER had helped him through some of his darkest nights when he was having suicidal thoughts. It wasn't that the series possessed a magical cure for depression but by Landon connecting with the relationships and sincerity on display in SCARY SLEEPOVER, he saw just how fortunate his own friends make his life. We highly encourage you to read Landon's article here.

It was Landon's story that first got us talking about resurrecting SCARY SLEEPOVER. Just like our show had helped him realize what he has in his own life, Landon's article helped us see what we have in our show. Landon, if you see this - thank you for showing us that what we do matters. We're so very grateful that you're still here and that our work was there to help you when you needed it! 

Just two months later, our dear friend Sid Haig passed away. Sid was a major part of our ArieScope family having appeared in HATCHET 3, our sit-com HOLLISTON, several of our annual Halloween short films, an episode of our original series HORRIFIED, two episodes of THE MOVIE CRYPT podcast, and two episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER (his original episode in 2015 and the Christmas Special in 2017). While we had known that Sid was ill for a long time and though he had lived the fullest life a man could ever dream of living, his passing was still absolutely devastating to all of us. Sid had hundreds of films and television shows under his belt - not to mention countless interviews that he had given during his lifetime. Yet out of everything that fans could have turned to when he passed, it was Sid's 2015 episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER that many reached for to remember him with. His episode was suddenly viewed over 100,000 times within the first 48 hours of his passing and in turn, all of the episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER quickly began climbing up and up in views as a whole new audience discovered the series. Once again we began to question our decision for walking away from the show before ever asking the community we were serving if they would help us. We were ready to try and resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER.  

After the financial hit that making the series had caused us the first time around, the most obvious change we knew we'd have to make was that our crew would need to be paid something for all of their hours of work this time. While our loyal crew may be willing to work on the show for far below any kind of standard industry rates, with bills to pay and children at home to feed... the days of everyone always working for free are over. It was also crucial to all of us that if we were to bring the series back certain technical areas of the production would need to be improved on. For instance, one of our biggest concerns is making sure that we can afford to have a professional sound mixer and operator on set this time around. In making the first two seasons of the show we had to throw out so many incredible moments due to unusable sound. 

As an example, our final episode (the Christmas Special in 2017) was so plagued with sound problems that it was almost never released at all. Kane Hodder, Danielle Harris, Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, and Felissa Rose were Adam Green's guests for that special episode. In the end, we knew that we couldn't not show the world such an incredible gathering with all of those horror icons having Christmas dinner and a slumber party together, so we fixed up the audio as best as we could and we released the episode with sound that legitimately made us ashamed. To make it worse, we had to throw out many wonderful moments that we captured between the group because the microphones we had weren't working at all. That night was such an incredible moment in time that will never happen again- (Sid would learn that he was seriously ill shortly after we shot) and our audio was unusable simply because we didn't have a budget to work with. It was heartbreaking. And we can't let that happen again. This time around we have to have help.

If you've already watched the first new episode that this campaign produced (Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson") then you can see just what an improvement having a little bit of a budget has made on a technical level. Our new crowd funded episodes look and sound so much better than the episodes from Seasons 1 or 2! It's a night and day difference thanks to YOUR help!

WHAT WE'RE ASKING FOR:

In order to keep bringing you new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, in order to keep the series independent, and in order to keep the series free to watch and accessible to all... we're asking for a budget of $5,000 (USD) per episode. That's IT. Could we ask for more? Absolutely. Should we? Probably. But right now all we want is to be able to make the show for you again without it negatively effecting our lives and putting us in debt like it did before. For every $5,000 raised we will put a new episode into production. It's that simple. Ultimately you decide just how many episodes you'll get based on how much and how often you donate.

Given the size of SCARY SLEEPOVER's audience and how many times the episodes are viewed, the meager $5k per episode budget that we collectively arrived at is more than fair. It is the bare minimum we need to pay our crew somethingfor their work, to improve the quality of the show, and to keep the series free to watch on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel - platforms that are readily accessible to all. Remember, not only does Indiegogo take 5% of what we raise as their own "platform fee" but they also automatically set aside 5% of whatever we raise as a contingency to cover "chargebacks" (backers who default on whatever they pledged). So that's 10% gone right off the bat. Then the banks charge fees on every individual pledge. Every donation that comes from someone within the US has 2.9% + .30 taken out for a "transaction fee" while donations that come from other countries have a much higher amount taken out plus a hefty "transfer fee" (at least $25 or more) on top of that!  Finally, at the end of the year we'll also need to pay taxes on every dollar that came in just like all US citizens have to do. We know this is all information that is likely just making your eyes glaze over and your head spin. No, you don't need to call an exorcist. It's unfortunately just how crowdfunding goes and there is no way around it. But hopefully you're getting a clear picture of just how much we're trying to make this work on as tight of a budget as possible.

"ONCE A NEW EPISODE IS GREEN-LIT, HOW LONG BEFORE WE CAN WATCH IT?"

Every time we hit another $5,000 goal we'll get started making an episode. Producing an episode can take anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. It all depends on guest/crew availability but we usually move rather fast. Ideally we raise the funding quickly so that can start shooting episodes back to back and churning them out one right after the next, but we have to see how this goes. We'll post updates and include the most accurate ETA we can for when we expect the next episode to be ready. To be clear- this endeavor is not going to pay anyone enough to turn down production jobs and stand by waiting for the next episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER to get green-lit. Please be reasonable. We'll get new episodes made as fast as we can and in a timely fashion. Episodes will be released simultaneously on ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel. The same exact version will be released on both platforms. Want to help see episodes get made faster? Share this campaign on social media and encourage others to donate! 

THIS CAMPAIGN ENDS ON AUGUST 31, 2020. If things go well and we make a complete season (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes that we contribute on our own)...? Well, then we will most certainly do this again for a 4th season! If we don't even come close to a full season? Then we unfortunately need to listen to our audience and accept that the party is over. 

"SO WHAT DO I GET FOR DONATING?"

You get THE SHOW!  Look, we know people love their buttons, posters, "shout outs," shopping bags, T-shirts, and other crowdfunding rewards but we want to bring you as many episodes as possible for as low a production budget as possible. If we start creating and shipping a bunch of useless "stuff" all over the world we would need to raise WAY more per episode just to pay for all of it and we'd be spending our time shipping rewards instead of making the actual show. Donate because you want to watch new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, not because you want an official pencil sharpener or other random item with the show's logo on it. We're putting every dollar into the show, not squandering it on T-shirts.

OK, FINE!  We created some wicked cool rewards that won't take anything away from the budget of the show itself and require us to raise the minimum amount we need to raise just so that we can pay for "Scary Sleepover" hair ties, spatulas, staplers or other useless stuff that we all know you don't really need. Unfortunately, IndieGoGo's interface massively limits the amount of space where you can describe each reward so we've listed more thorough descriptions below. Remember- you can donate any amount you'd like. It's not like you have to purchase one of the rewards if you'd rather give less and just contribute what you can afford to give to help make the show happen!

The Unlisted Reward =  This one is our reward to everyone who helps. For every 6 episodes that get green-lit we will create a 7th episode on our own that consists of outtakes and moments that you didn't see in the previous 6 episodes. With Seasons 1 and 2 we always did a mid-season and an end of season outtake episode. So just like the two previous seasons, we're only doing this for every 6 episodes that get green-lit. If the donations come to a complete stop after just 4 or 5 episodes? Well, that's unfortunately where the season ends. We'd love nothing more than to be able to do a full 14 episode season just like we used to (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes) but that's entirely up to you the audience.

$50 = Scary Stream-over Party! When this next season of Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is over you will receive a private invitation to an all-night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" with Adam and Arwen that is exclusively for backers who donated $50 or more. Please remember that at this point we have no idea how many episodes will ultimately become green-lit so we have no way of knowing exactly how many episodes will constitute Season 3. We have to play it by ear and see what happens. Point is- everyone in this tier and above will be invited to an all-night Scary Sleepover live stream where we all watch movies, play games, talk about our fears together, and pig out on junk food. If you've ever enjoyed one of THE MOVIE CRYPT's annual live "Yorkiethons" or participated in MOVIE CRYPT LIVE (a monthly live stream for Patrons of the podcast) - this is gonna be similar to that only better! When the season ends a weekend night will be announced for the "Stream-over." When that weekend arrives a private link to the stream will go out to everyone who purchased a reward this season. Adam and Arwen will be on the stream with everyone all night. Knowing them they will have some surprises up their sleeves so you never know who else might show up and crash the party! This exclusive live "Stream-over" will essentially recreate what you see Adam and his guests do on the show and most likely go for an 8-hour stretch like 7pm PST until 3am PST (or hours like that).  We will give everyone at least 3 week's notice for when the slumber party is going to happen. Our apologies if the night that this winds up taking place doesn't work for you but we're going to give everyone plenty of notice. Ideally this "Stream-over" will take place within a month of whenever the final episode of the season is released but for all we know Adam could be on set in the middle of directing a movie in Tunisia by then. Just know that one way or another we will make this event happen. We're all already looking forward to it!

$100 = Thank You Credit! Not only will you get an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" listed above but you will be immortalized by having your name on screen at the end of an episode. (Watch the end of Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson" for an example.) This is sincerely a big deal to us as we're crediting you on screen right alongside our beloved crew. Having donated to and worked on crowd funded projects ourselves, one thing that we really hate to see is when the credits acknowledging the very people who made the project happen fly by so fast or are shoved up into the corner of the screen so small that no one could ever possibly read them. Hey, we get it. The average audience member immediately shuts off whatever they are watching once the credits start and with on-line content a "play" doesn't count as completed unless it plays until the end. That's why we do our ending credits for SCARY SLEEPOVER while there is something still happening - even if it is merely dialogue continuing on underneath the credits. We give people a reason to finish watching the entire episode. Therefore, everyone who ever watches an episode that you backed is going to see that you were part of making it happen. Please take this one seriously. We sure do as our crew is our family. To be acknowledged in our work alongside our brothers and sisters is an honor.

$250 = Personalized "Thank You" video & Early Access! Not only will you get all of the above (a thank you credit and an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party"), you'll also receive a private link to see the episode that you backed almost a full week ahead if its premiere on-line! Best of all, there will be a personalized introduction from Adam Green and Arwen thanking you for helping SCARY SLEEPOVER continue at the front of it! We debated offering this one for awhile as truthfully it takes a lot more time to make happen than you might think. (Any editors out there know how many hours it can actually take to create individual episodes for a variety of people, export them, and upload them to a private server.) But if you're going to back us this generously we want to make sure you see in our eyes just how appreciated you actually are. Sincerely, this one is a reward for us just as much as it may be a reward for you. A personalized video is the closest we can come to actually shaking your hand or full-on hugging you. You're a goddamn hero and we love you for caring this much about what we do. Let us tell you how we feel about you to your face. Just ask anyone who participated at this reward level for Episode 3.1 since that one is already out. They were not disappointed!

$5000 = Executive Producer! This is as big as it gets because at this level you're one of us. By singlehandedly financing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER you will be credited on screen as the sole Executive Producer at the top of the episode. Your "Executive Producer" credit will join "Created By" and "Guest Star" as the only credits at the beginning of the episode! You'll also be invited to join us on set when the episode shoots. NOTE: You are responsible for getting yourself to our studio in Los Angeles. We will give you as much advance notice of the shoot night as possible. In fact, you'll find out what date it is being scheduled for when we do. Scheduling SCARY SLEEPOVER's shoot nights is a lot like a game of human Tetris in that we're juggling our guest's and our entire crew's availability. That can give us extremelylimited options. There have been times in the past where a guest tells us "I'd love to do it! I'm in town tomorrow but then I'm not back again for 8 months. Can you make that work?" and then we have to scramble to put the shoot together right up until the moment the guest arrives at the front door. Hopefully our audience backs enough episodes that we have some options for you as far as shoot nights go but if there aren't any other episodes in the pipeline we may not. For instance, if you can't get here for the very next episode we're going to be shooting, perhaps there are other shoot nights coming up that are a little bit further off in the calendar and that have more notice before they take place. Again, we have no way of knowing just how many episodes we're going to wind up making as it all depends on how this campaign goes. Just know that we'll do everything we possibly can to make the shoot happen on a night when you can be here for it. Please keep in mind that we can't control it if a guest or crew member suddenly falls ill or has an emergency arise and forces us to reschedule a shoot at the last minute any more than we can reschedule an entire shoot if you suddenly can't make it at the last minute. Our advice: Do this because you want to produce your own episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER and treat the set visit as an added bonus. Chances are good it will all work out but we have to be as thorough as possible in these descriptions.

Keep in mind, donations go toward the next episode in line being financed. It does not mean you continue to keep getting that reward for all future episodes as well. 

So, there you go! Rewards!

NOW... LET'S DO THIS!

While over 1 million people may have already watched Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER, the reality is that very few are actually going to step up and help. They're going to wait and hope that other people donate - then watch the show. It's just how this goes. But if we didn't have at least a little bit of faith in our audience we wouldn't have gone through the effort of making the video you watched above or putting together this campaign. We believe in you!

This is the moment when you show us what SCARY SLEEPOVER means to you. Do the slumber parties continue or are they truly over? We sincerely hope that you'll consider backing us generously and continuously as the series (hopefully) continues on and on. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign.

*** A NOTE TO THOSE WHO DONATED TO PART 1 OF THIS CAMPAIGN AFTER IT HAD PASSED $10,000 *** : At the time of this posting, our first campaign is sitting at $11,434. While the simplest way to keep things neat and easy to follow would be if we took that $1,434 and re-donated it into this campaign... if we did that then IndieGoGo would tax and take fees out of that money a second time. It would be a waste of your precious dollars that should be going towards episodes. At the same time, if we change our current easy to comprehend rule of "every $5,000 = a new episode" to be "once we hit $3,566 episode 3.3 is green-lit... then once we hit $8,566 episode 3.4..." you can see how confusing that will quickly become for everyone who checks out this campaign. So here's what we're doing... all "thank you" and "early access" rewards that were purchased as part of that $1,434 are going to be honored in Episode 3.2 "Brian Quinn!" That way you get your rewards earlier with the very next episode that comes out. (Obviously all end of season "Scary Stream-Over Party" rewards continue to be held back until the actual end of the season.) When this second part of the campaign launches it will automatically start at $0.00 so we'll stick with that. That way we keep everything easy to follow with the "every $5,000 - a new episode" rule. We're still obviously going to put every dollar of that $1,434 into the crowd fund. This second (and final) campaign only runs for 60 days. So wherever it ultimately ends up- we'll add $1,434 to that total. In the end, the money serves the exact same purpose (getting more episodes made) but this way it doesn't throw the total raised off the rails and require everyone to start doing math in order to figure out how close/far away we are from green-lighting the next episode. Keep in mind, IndieGoGo doesn't release a single dollar to us until 15 business days after a campaign closes. So it isn't like we could touch that $1,434 any sooner. Adding it to the total at the end of this final 60 day campaign is the same as saying it is in there now. We know this may be an extremely obvious solution but we'd always rather over explain and be as transparent as possible then have our beloved backers wondering what the plan is. Every dollar raised (from the first campaign and from this one) is going towards getting new episodes made - period. Those who donated among that extra $1434 raised in Part 1 are just going to get their "thank you" and "early access" rewards redeemed earlier! :)

Most sincerely-

The ArieScope Family

SCARY SLEEPOVER: RESURRECTION VIDEO made by Sean Becker, Will Barratt, Adam Green, and Arwen. Massive thanks to Lola Barbare ("Arwen"), Jeremy Wanek (Arwen VFX), Kevin Barbare, and to Josh Ethier for letting us pretend to yell at you.
story_txt:
SET YOUR OWN DONATION AND BACK THE SERIES WITH ANY AMOUNT YOU CAN! PART 1 OF THIS CAMPAIGN SAW TWO NEW EPISODES FUNDED AND SHOT! A THIRD NEW EPISODE REACHED FUNDING ON 8/16! EVERY $5,000 RAISED = A NEW EPISODE! PLEASE READ BELOW AND HELP KEEP THE SLUMBER PARTIES COMING!
UPDATED - JULY 1, 2020: Remember when we thought we were going to be able to just keep accepting donations on the original campaign page after the initial 60-day campaign period had ended? Well... although the original campaign page was indeed still accepting donations in the form of reward purchases  (YAY!)... unfortunately the original campaign page would no longer allow backers to set their own donation amount  (BOO!)... so here we are with PART 2 - the next (and final) part of the campaign to resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER!  Same campaign, same rewards, same great show!  
We know that reading a ton of text can be tedious for some, but everything you could possibly need to know about this campaign is explained in detail below and Adam Green is very good about personally posting consistent and thorough updates in the "Updates" section of this campaign. Please note that since IndieGoGo's "Rewards" section (located to the right) has a very strict limit on the amount of text creators can use to describe each reward, we've thoroughly explained the rewards further down in this campaign overview. Please read the full description of each reward before purchasing one. Remember, you can always set your own donation amount and every dollar helps our effort to produce SCARY SLEEPOVER! Rewards are merely incentives for more generous donations. You do not need to purchase one of the rewards to help back the series!
Perhaps you've been following the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER since Part 1 of this campaign launched in January. Perhaps you've already contributed once or twice and helped get the first THREE episodes of Season 3 produced. If you already know all of the details about the campaign and just have questions about how the money we had already raised is going roll over to Part 2 of our crowd fund effort- feel free to scroll down to the very bottom of this campaign description.
Perhaps you didn't know about the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER until you watched one of the new episodes that this campaign has funded so far. Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson" premieres for the general public on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel on July 4th while Episode 3.2 "Brian Quinn" will premiere on August 22nd! If so - WELCOME! We've been waiting for you! Between the above video and the information below you'll find everything you need to know about the resurrection of SCARY SLEEPOVER. This campaign was off to a solid start with two new episodes reaching funding before the COVID-19 pandemic arrived and totally wet the bed on our slumber party fun.  We temporarily paused our crowd funding efforts in March as the United States went into lockdown- but now that the country is starting to open up again it's time for the show to go on and for our resurrection efforts to continue!  We only have 60 days to get the rest of Season 3 green-lit. However many episodes reach funding in this second (and final) part of our campaign - that's our third season. Hopefully we get to make a full season for you! 
WHAT IS SCARY SLEEPOVER?
Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is an on-line reality series that features some of the biggest names in genre entertainment like you've never seen them before... in their pajamas! In each episode a different celebrity artist joins filmmaker Adam Green (HATCHET, FROZEN) for a slumber party at his studio where they spend the night playing games, watching movies, eating junk food, and having extremely candid conversations that reveal their biggest real life fears. The 29 existing episodes that made up Seasons 1 and 2 have been watched over 1 million times between ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel!It was Green's goal in creating SCARY SLEEPOVER to not only entertain audiences but to make a real connection between artists and fans. While the show may be inherently funny and contain a lot of truly hilarious moments, it is also bursting with genuine heart. Since every guest already has a personal relationship with Green they are comfortable opening up about themselves in an extremely honest and candid manner that you just don't find anywhere else. Through its many emotional and revealing moments SCARY SLEEPOVER has given fans a much deeper look at who these artists really are and just how much we all truly have in common as a community. 
THE GUESTS SO FAR:
Previous guests have include: Slash (GUNS N ROSES), Sid Haig (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Kane Hodder (FRIDAY THE 13TH), Danielle Harris (HALLOWEEN), Dee Snider (TWISTED SISTER), Derek Mears (SWAMP THING), Bill Moseley (THE DEVIL'S REJECTS), Emma Bell (THE WALKING DEAD), Tony Todd (CANDYMAN), Joe Lynch (MAYHEM), Brea Grant (DEXTER), Felissa Rose (SLEEPAWAY CAMP), Neil Marshall (GAME OF THRONES), Ti West (HOUSE OF THE DEVIL), Kristina Klebe (HALLOWEEN), Lucky McKee (MAY), Clare Kramer (BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER), Todd Farmer (MY BLOODY VALENTINE), Tiffany Shepis (VICTOR CROWLEY), Tom Holland (CHILD'S PLAY), Laura Ortiz (HOLLISTON), Darren Lynn Bousman (SAW), Zach Galligan (GREMLINS), Jeffrey Reddick (FINAL DESTINATION), Doug Benson (THE LEGO BATMAN MOVIE), and Brian Quinn (IMPRACTICAL JOKERS).
THE HISTORY OF SCARY SLEEPOVER:
Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER originally ran from 2015 - 2016 with a Christmas Special in 2017. Full-length uncensored versions of episodes ran on ArieScope.com while ArieScope's YouTube Channel carried shorter, censored versions. The show was (and remains) free to watch no matter which platform you watched it on.  As beloved as the series may have become, unfortunately our model of making the show with our own money and giving it away to fans for free eventually took its toll on us. Producing the show was taking up all of our time and we were sinking further and further into debt the longer we worked on it. So it was with a heavy heart that we had to roll up our sleeping bags and say goodnight to the slumber parties after the 2017 Christmas Special. The amount of work that goes into producing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER is on par with an episode of any network television reality show - only we were doing it without a budget of any kind whatsoever.  Not only is a crew required for every shoot but episodes can take anywhere from 40 to 60 hours  (in some cases far longer) to complete post-production. We were having to work through the nights and over the weekends around our actual production jobs in order to make SCARY SLEEPOVER happen, often times giving up paid work and falling behind on deadlines in our personal careers.  As much as we loved doing the show, no one involved could carry on producing a show where the people behind it were literally paying to work on it. So after 29 wonderful episodes, the reality of the situation won out and we called it a night.
WHAT PROMPTED THIS RESURRECTION? 
Over the summer of 2019 two crucial things happened that caused us to start rethinking SCARY SLEEPOVER.  In July an article titled "Adam Green Saved My Life" was posted on NightmareNostalgia.com. In the piece, writer Landon Evanson bravely discussed his on going battle with depression and how SCARY SLEEPOVER had helped him through some of his darkest nights when he was having suicidal thoughts. It wasn't that the series possessed a magical cure for depression but by Landon connecting with the relationships and sincerity on display in SCARY SLEEPOVER, he saw just how fortunate his own friends make his life. We highly encourage you to read Landon's article here.
It was Landon's story that first got us talking about resurrecting SCARY SLEEPOVER. Just like our show had helped him realize what he has in his own life, Landon's article helped us see what we have in our show. Landon, if you see this - thank you for showing us that what we do matters. We're so very grateful that you're still here and that our work was there to help you when you needed it! 
Just two months later, our dear friend Sid Haig passed away. Sid was a major part of our ArieScope family having appeared in HATCHET 3, our sit-com HOLLISTON, several of our annual Halloween short films, an episode of our original series HORRIFIED, two episodes of THE MOVIE CRYPT podcast, and two episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER (his original episode in 2015 and the Christmas Special in 2017). While we had known that Sid was ill for a long time and though he had lived the fullest life a man could ever dream of living, his passing was still absolutely devastating to all of us. Sid had hundreds of films and television shows under his belt - not to mention countless interviews that he had given during his lifetime. Yet out of everything that fans could have turned to when he passed, it was Sid's 2015 episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER that many reached for to remember him with. His episode was suddenly viewed over 100,000 times within the first 48 hours of his passing and in turn, all of the episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER quickly began climbing up and up in views as a whole new audience discovered the series. Once again we began to question our decision for walking away from the show before ever asking the community we were serving if they would help us. We were ready to try and resurrect SCARY SLEEPOVER.  
After the financial hit that making the series had caused us the first time around, the most obvious change we knew we'd have to make was that our crew would need to be paid something for all of their hours of work this time. While our loyal crew may be willing to work on the show for far below any kind of standard industry rates, with bills to pay and children at home to feed... the days of everyone always working for free are over. It was also crucial to all of us that if we were to bring the series back certain technical areas of the production would need to be improved on. For instance, one of our biggest concerns is making sure that we can afford to have a professional sound mixer and operator on set this time around. In making the first two seasons of the show we had to throw out so many incredible moments due to unusable sound. 
As an example, our final episode (the Christmas Special in 2017) was so plagued with sound problems that it was almost never released at all. Kane Hodder, Danielle Harris, Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, and Felissa Rose were Adam Green's guests for that special episode. In the end, we knew that we couldn't not show the world such an incredible gathering with all of those horror icons having Christmas dinner and a slumber party together, so we fixed up the audio as best as we could and we released the episode with sound that legitimately made us ashamed. To make it worse, we had to throw out many wonderful moments that we captured between the group because the microphones we had weren't working at all. That night was such an incredible moment in time that will never happen again- (Sid would learn that he was seriously ill shortly after we shot) and our audio was unusable simply because we didn't have a budget to work with. It was heartbreaking. And we can't let that happen again. This time around we have to have help.
If you've already watched the first new episode that this campaign produced (Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson") then you can see just what an improvement having a little bit of a budget has made on a technical level. Our new crowd funded episodes look and sound so much better than the episodes from Seasons 1 or 2! It's a night and day difference thanks to YOUR help!
WHAT WE'RE ASKING FOR:
In order to keep bringing you new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, in order to keep the series independent, and in order to keep the series free to watch and accessible to all... we're asking for a budget of $5,000 (USD) per episode. That's IT. Could we ask for more? Absolutely. Should we? Probably. But right now all we want is to be able to make the show for you again without it negatively effecting our lives and putting us in debt like it did before. For every $5,000 raised we will put a new episode into production. It's that simple. Ultimately you decide just how many episodes you'll get based on how much and how often you donate.
Given the size of SCARY SLEEPOVER's audience and how many times the episodes are viewed, the meager $5k per episode budget that we collectively arrived at is more than fair. It is the bare minimum we need to pay our crew somethingfor their work, to improve the quality of the show, and to keep the series free to watch on ArieScope.com and on ArieScope's YouTube channel - platforms that are readily accessible to all. Remember, not only does Indiegogo take 5% of what we raise as their own "platform fee" but they also automatically set aside 5% of whatever we raise as a contingency to cover "chargebacks" (backers who default on whatever they pledged). So that's 10% gone right off the bat. Then the banks charge fees on every individual pledge. Every donation that comes from someone within the US has 2.9% + .30 taken out for a "transaction fee" while donations that come from other countries have a much higher amount taken out plus a hefty "transfer fee" (at least $25 or more) on top of that!  Finally, at the end of the year we'll also need to pay taxes on every dollar that came in just like all US citizens have to do. We know this is all information that is likely just making your eyes glaze over and your head spin. No, you don't need to call an exorcist. It's unfortunately just how crowdfunding goes and there is no way around it. But hopefully you're getting a clear picture of just how much we're trying to make this work on as tight of a budget as possible.
"ONCE A NEW EPISODE IS GREEN-LIT, HOW LONG BEFORE WE CAN WATCH IT?"
Every time we hit another $5,000 goal we'll get started making an episode. Producing an episode can take anywhere from a few weeks to a couple of months. It all depends on guest/crew availability but we usually move rather fast. Ideally we raise the funding quickly so that can start shooting episodes back to back and churning them out one right after the next, but we have to see how this goes. We'll post updates and include the most accurate ETA we can for when we expect the next episode to be ready. To be clear- this endeavor is not going to pay anyone enough to turn down production jobs and stand by waiting for the next episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER to get green-lit. Please be reasonable. We'll get new episodes made as fast as we can and in a timely fashion. Episodes will be released simultaneously on ArieScope.com and ArieScope's YouTube channel. The same exact version will be released on both platforms. Want to help see episodes get made faster? Share this campaign on social media and encourage others to donate! 
THIS CAMPAIGN ENDS ON AUGUST 31, 2020. If things go well and we make a complete season (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes that we contribute on our own)...? Well, then we will most certainly do this again for a 4th season! If we don't even come close to a full season? Then we unfortunately need to listen to our audience and accept that the party is over. 
"SO WHAT DO I GET FOR DONATING?"
You get THE SHOW!  Look, we know people love their buttons, posters, "shout outs," shopping bags, T-shirts, and other crowdfunding rewards but we want to bring you as many episodes as possible for as low a production budget as possible. If we start creating and shipping a bunch of useless "stuff" all over the world we would need to raise WAY more per episode just to pay for all of it and we'd be spending our time shipping rewards instead of making the actual show. Donate because you want to watch new episodes of SCARY SLEEPOVER, not because you want an official pencil sharpener or other random item with the show's logo on it. We're putting every dollar into the show, not squandering it on T-shirts.
OK, FINE!  We created some wicked cool rewards that won't take anything away from the budget of the show itself and require us to raise the minimum amount we need to raise just so that we can pay for "Scary Sleepover" hair ties, spatulas, staplers or other useless stuff that we all know you don't really need. Unfortunately, IndieGoGo's interface massively limits the amount of space where you can describe each reward so we've listed more thorough descriptions below. Remember- you can donate any amount you'd like. It's not like you have to purchase one of the rewards if you'd rather give less and just contribute what you can afford to give to help make the show happen!
The Unlisted Reward =  This one is our reward to everyone who helps. For every 6 episodes that get green-lit we will create a 7th episode on our own that consists of outtakes and moments that you didn't see in the previous 6 episodes. With Seasons 1 and 2 we always did a mid-season and an end of season outtake episode. So just like the two previous seasons, we're only doing this for every 6 episodes that get green-lit. If the donations come to a complete stop after just 4 or 5 episodes? Well, that's unfortunately where the season ends. We'd love nothing more than to be able to do a full 14 episode season just like we used to (12 crowd funded episodes + 2 outtake episodes) but that's entirely up to you the audience.
$50 = Scary Stream-over Party! When this next season of Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER is over you will receive a private invitation to an all-night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" with Adam and Arwen that is exclusively for backers who donated $50 or more. Please remember that at this point we have no idea how many episodes will ultimately become green-lit so we have no way of knowing exactly how many episodes will constitute Season 3. We have to play it by ear and see what happens. Point is- everyone in this tier and above will be invited to an all-night Scary Sleepover live stream where we all watch movies, play games, talk about our fears together, and pig out on junk food. If you've ever enjoyed one of THE MOVIE CRYPT's annual live "Yorkiethons" or participated in MOVIE CRYPT LIVE (a monthly live stream for Patrons of the podcast) - this is gonna be similar to that only better! When the season ends a weekend night will be announced for the "Stream-over." When that weekend arrives a private link to the stream will go out to everyone who purchased a reward this season. Adam and Arwen will be on the stream with everyone all night. Knowing them they will have some surprises up their sleeves so you never know who else might show up and crash the party! This exclusive live "Stream-over" will essentially recreate what you see Adam and his guests do on the show and most likely go for an 8-hour stretch like 7pm PST until 3am PST (or hours like that).  We will give everyone at least 3 week's notice for when the slumber party is going to happen. Our apologies if the night that this winds up taking place doesn't work for you but we're going to give everyone plenty of notice. Ideally this "Stream-over" will take place within a month of whenever the final episode of the season is released but for all we know Adam could be on set in the middle of directing a movie in Tunisia by then. Just know that one way or another we will make this event happen. We're all already looking forward to it!
$100 = Thank You Credit! Not only will you get an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party" listed above but you will be immortalized by having your name on screen at the end of an episode. (Watch the end of Episode 3.1 "Doug Benson" for an example.) This is sincerely a big deal to us as we're crediting you on screen right alongside our beloved crew. Having donated to and worked on crowd funded projects ourselves, one thing that we really hate to see is when the credits acknowledging the very people who made the project happen fly by so fast or are shoved up into the corner of the screen so small that no one could ever possibly read them. Hey, we get it. The average audience member immediately shuts off whatever they are watching once the credits start and with on-line content a "play" doesn't count as completed unless it plays until the end. That's why we do our ending credits for SCARY SLEEPOVER while there is something still happening - even if it is merely dialogue continuing on underneath the credits. We give people a reason to finish watching the entire episode. Therefore, everyone who ever watches an episode that you backed is going to see that you were part of making it happen. Please take this one seriously. We sure do as our crew is our family. To be acknowledged in our work alongside our brothers and sisters is an honor.
$250 = Personalized "Thank You" video & Early Access! Not only will you get all of the above (a thank you credit and an invite to the all night, on-line "Scary Stream-over Party"), you'll also receive a private link to see the episode that you backed almost a full week ahead if its premiere on-line! Best of all, there will be a personalized introduction from Adam Green and Arwen thanking you for helping SCARY SLEEPOVER continue at the front of it! We debated offering this one for awhile as truthfully it takes a lot more time to make happen than you might think. (Any editors out there know how many hours it can actually take to create individual episodes for a variety of people, export them, and upload them to a private server.) But if you're going to back us this generously we want to make sure you see in our eyes just how appreciated you actually are. Sincerely, this one is a reward for us just as much as it may be a reward for you. A personalized video is the closest we can come to actually shaking your hand or full-on hugging you. You're a goddamn hero and we love you for caring this much about what we do. Let us tell you how we feel about you to your face. Just ask anyone who participated at this reward level for Episode 3.1 since that one is already out. They were not disappointed!
$5000 = Executive Producer! This is as big as it gets because at this level you're one of us. By singlehandedly financing an episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER you will be credited on screen as the sole Executive Producer at the top of the episode. Your "Executive Producer" credit will join "Created By" and "Guest Star" as the only credits at the beginning of the episode! You'll also be invited to join us on set when the episode shoots. NOTE: You are responsible for getting yourself to our studio in Los Angeles. We will give you as much advance notice of the shoot night as possible. In fact, you'll find out what date it is being scheduled for when we do. Scheduling SCARY SLEEPOVER's shoot nights is a lot like a game of human Tetris in that we're juggling our guest's and our entire crew's availability. That can give us extremelylimited options. There have been times in the past where a guest tells us "I'd love to do it! I'm in town tomorrow but then I'm not back again for 8 months. Can you make that work?" and then we have to scramble to put the shoot together right up until the moment the guest arrives at the front door. Hopefully our audience backs enough episodes that we have some options for you as far as shoot nights go but if there aren't any other episodes in the pipeline we may not. For instance, if you can't get here for the very next episode we're going to be shooting, perhaps there are other shoot nights coming up that are a little bit further off in the calendar and that have more notice before they take place. Again, we have no way of knowing just how many episodes we're going to wind up making as it all depends on how this campaign goes. Just know that we'll do everything we possibly can to make the shoot happen on a night when you can be here for it. Please keep in mind that we can't control it if a guest or crew member suddenly falls ill or has an emergency arise and forces us to reschedule a shoot at the last minute any more than we can reschedule an entire shoot if you suddenly can't make it at the last minute. Our advice: Do this because you want to produce your own episode of SCARY SLEEPOVER and treat the set visit as an added bonus. Chances are good it will all work out but we have to be as thorough as possible in these descriptions.
Keep in mind, donations go toward the next episode in line being financed. It does not mean you continue to keep getting that reward for all future episodes as well. 
So, there you go! Rewards!
NOW... LET'S DO THIS!
While over 1 million people may have already watched Adam Green's SCARY SLEEPOVER, the reality is that very few are actually going to step up and help. They're going to wait and hope that other people donate - then watch the show. It's just how this goes. But if we didn't have at least a little bit of faith in our audience we wouldn't have gone through the effort of making the video you watched above or putting together this campaign. We believe in you!
This is the moment when you show us what SCARY SLEEPOVER means to you. Do the slumber parties continue or are they truly over? We sincerely hope that you'll consider backing us generously and continuously as the series (hopefully) continues on and on. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign.

While the simplest way to keep things neat and easy to follow would be if we took that $1,434 and re-donated it into this campaign... if we did that then IndieGoGo would tax and take fees out of that money a second time. It would be a waste of your precious dollars that should be going towards episodes. At the same time, if we change our current easy to comprehend rule of "every $5,000 = a new episode" to be "once we hit $3,566 episode 3.3 is green-lit... then once we hit $8,566 episode 3.4..." you can see how confusing that will quickly become for everyone who checks out this campaign. So here's what we're doing... all "thank you" and "early access" rewards that were purchased as part of that $1,434 are going to be honored in Episode 3.2 "Brian Quinn!" That way you get your rewards earlier with the very next episode that comes out. (Obviously all end of season "Scary Stream-Over Party" rewards continue to be held back until the actual end of the season.) When this second part of the campaign launches it will automatically start at $0.00 so we'll stick with that. That way we keep everything easy to follow with the "every $5,000 - a new episode" rule. We're still obviously going to put every dollar of that $1,434 into the crowd fund. This second (and final) campaign only runs for 60 days. So wherever it ultimately ends up- we'll add $1,434 to that total. In the end, the money serves the exact same purpose (getting more episodes made) but this way it doesn't throw the total raised off the rails and require everyone to start doing math in order to figure out how close/far away we are from green-lighting the next episode. Keep in mind, IndieGoGo doesn't release a single dollar to us until 15 business days after a campaign closes. So it isn't like we could touch that $1,434 any sooner. Adding it to the total at the end of this final 60 day campaign is the same as saying it is in there now. We know this may be an extremely obvious solution but we'd always rather over explain and be as transparent as possible then have our beloved backers wondering what the plan is. Every dollar raised (from the first campaign and from this one) is going towards getting new episodes made - period. Those who donated among that extra $1434 raised in Part 1 are just going to get their "thank you" and "early access" rewards redeemed earlier! :)
Most sincerely-
The ArieScope Family
SCARY SLEEPOVER: RESURRECTION VIDEO made by Sean Becker, Will Barratt, Adam Green, and Arwen. Massive thanks to Lola Barbare ("Arwen"), Jeremy Wanek (Arwen VFX), Kevin Barbare, and to Josh Ethier for letting us pretend to yell at you.

story:
The Story

We are living in a society where the notion promoting accomplishments without proper acknowledgements is acceptable. As the trend of women in professional and political careers begin to grow, the roles and responsibilities of their positions becomes a high demand. However, the stress in powerful leadership positions plays an effect mentally and physically. 


How does the strong, independent woman cope with being a leader without the feeling of being alone? In Patricia’s Independence, it portrays the lifestyle of a career driven woman who suffers the consequences of selfish actions and the struggle with overcoming an addiction.


The film also takes a look at how Patricia’s selfish behavior is affecting her family. She has to make a choice whether her demanding career is worth the sacrifice with losing quality time at home or whether she is flexible enough to spend time with them.

 

“The demands and responsibilities in my career path can be challenging. There are several women that I know who has made ultimate sacrifices with their careers just to make sure they are home on time to put their little ones to bed. This film represents the balance between work and family and the importance of seeking help from friends and family.”  - Producer/Creator - Felicia Johnson

About the Film

Patricia Watkins is a career driven marketing consultant who is always on a tight schedule. She is married to Cecil Watkins, a district attorney, a mother to her daughter Tasha and raising her nephew, Brandon. She remains on a tight schedule and tends to cram and complete all of her responsibilities in one day. Her boss wants her to attend an important meeting with a client but it conflicts with her schedule. She promised her nephew Brandon to attend his baseball game. Her husband Cecil tries to offer his help to ease her schedule but she refuses the help from him due to her selfish attitude. Patricia also suffers from an opioid addiction. She constantly takes them to keep her alert throughout the day. However, it ultimately ruins her busy schedule and ultimately forces her to slow down.
 

The Approach

Our approach shows a fast paced and busy environment for Patricia. The beginning shot shows a wide POV of her family sitting together in the kitchen eating breakfast. However, Patricia does not join them. She fixes their plates, jot down their activities on her phone and leaves the room. There is a slow motion shot of her walking down the street with her sunshades and a cup of coffee as she enters her office. It shows the audience her inner self-centered diva attitude. Since Patricia’s routine tends to be quick, there are quick close up shots of her grabbing her keys, phone and popping her opioid pills before she moves on to the next activity. When she goes to an event that does not relate to her job, she either doesn’t pay attention or becomes tired. During Tasha’s dance practice, Patricia is busy answering emails on her phone while bobbing her head to the music. When she attends Cecil’s gala for his law firm, there is a close up shot of her yawning while popping another opioid pill. The audience will feel the sense of her always being the center of attention.
 

The Tone

The tone approach in this film is shown through Patricia’s interactions between her family and her job. Her family environment seems too stern and almost treated like a business. There is a shot of Tasha and Brandon sitting on the bench waiting for Patrcia outside of school. Yet, there is no interaction between them at all. The color scheme is dim, yet the students that surround them are colorful. There are certain tensions between Cecil and Patricia. When Cecil tries to offer his help, Patricia cuts him off while they talk and convinces him that she can do it on her own. The audience can get a sense that Cecil’s patience is running short. Patricia loves Brandon and Tasha. But she struggles with showing them the nurturing love they deserve. The audience can see that Patricia rather shows her support by dropping them off to their practices and games. Yet she rarely pays attention to them.  When Patricia is in her office, she is vibrant, communicative and there are repetitive phrases that she uses such as “I’ve got this” or “How can I help?” Her job is her motivator rather than her family.
 

The Characters

Patricia Watkins – Patricia is a well-educated and self-centered DC lobbyist who takes the meaning of “doing bad all by myself” to another level. She is the top lobbyist at the Smith Firm and has landed several accounts for the company. She is even considered a “gold mine” in the eyes of her supervisor Stuart Smith. 

Patricia is addicted to her work and treats her family like a business. Tasha and Brandon must maintain a 3.5 GPA, be involved in at least 2 activities, they have to send daily reports of their daily schedules and they even have to maintain a certain weight and size. She constantly rejects spending quality time with Cecil since she is always spending the majority of her time at the office. However, when it comes to classy affair events for couples, she will take the time to be with him.

Her selfish attitude is affecting her family emotionally. She will be faced with situations that will force her to change her perspective from independent into having a nurturing and supportive personality.


Cecil Watkins - Is a district attorney in Washington, DC. He met Patricia at George Washington University and the two married immediately after graduation. They have a daughter named Tasha. He also takes care of his nephew Brandon. He is an easy going kind of guy and has been accustomed with Patricia taking control of things that he should handle. He is now at a point where he is tired of her selfish attitude and wants to take back his role as head of the household.

Tasha Watkins - Tasha is the daughter of Cecil and Patricia. She is smart, witty, a straight "A" student and is heavily involved in her dance team and playing the piano. She challenges herself daily to be the best at everything. She is eager to attend NYU to receive a scholarship in music. When she was in the accident with Patricia, she sprained her wrist which is giving her difficulty to play the piano. She blames Patricia for her injury but she tries to maintain her status of challenging herself to stay on top. 

Brandon Taylor – Brandon is the nephew of Patricia and the son of Cecil and Annette. He is passionate about baseball and spends most of his time with his teammates. Similar to Cecil, he is an easy going kind of boy. He is aware of Patricia's attitude but pays it no attention at all. However, he begins to realize Patricia constantly misses his baseball games and makes promises that she can't keep. 

Stuart Smith - Stuart Smith is the CEO of Smith Consultants LLC. He is Patricia’s supervisor. Patricia is one of his top marketing consultants at his firm and has recruited several clients through her exquisite approaches. When he wants to land a big contract with a major company, he knows he can rely on Patricia. However, he doesn’t pay attention to how much work and pressure he puts on her.

Mrs. Davis (Piano Teacher) - Mrs. Davis is Tasha’s piano teacher. She loves teaching her classical music and Tasha is one of her top piano students. She knows that Patricia puts a lot of pressure on Tasha to stay on top of her music and other school activities. Not only is she Tasha’s piano teacher, she is also a mentor to her. She is a listening ear whenever Tasha needs to talk or receive some guidance.

Darlene Taylor – Darlene is the mother of Patricia and Annette. She raised them by herself since their father Clifford struggled with alcohol addiction and being abusive to her. She also worked as a nurse and had odd shifts at the hospital. It prevented her from spending quality time with her daughters. She encouraged Patricia and Annette to always stay close and to look out for each other since she never had a close relationship with her own sister who was a drug addict. She currently helps Patricia with the children by watching them in case Cecil has to work late. She compensates her lost time she had as a mother to Patricia and Annette by establishing a strong bond with the grandchildren. 

 

COVID Procedure Plan 

Since our pre-production for our web series has been postponed due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, we are doing everything to keep the momentum going such as planning table reads, Zoom chats with cast and crew, arranging logisitical plans for locations, props, costumes and much more to come.

Once it is safe to be back on set, we plan to finish five more episodes based on the pilot. We also plan to finish post production from our pilot to begin submitting to film festivals and will be available online for viewers to watch (YouTube, Facebook Watch, and IGTV).

Please be assured that we will resume our production in a timely fashion in a safe and healthy atmosphere.

story:
Hello Bootleg Fanatics!

We are on our knees begging for your support to help Bootleg continue and prosper.

We are currently operating with no sponsors (except for 1 episode), and the only revenues we receive are from Youtube Ads, which is nearly nothing.

We want to update our video equipment, audio equipment, provide incentives to our guests, help continue paying for their transportation round trips, and their meals.   Your donations will be greatly appreciated!

With the donations, we will be providing you all with more Bootleg Opinions where we shout opinions in your face for Celebrity Drag Race, All Stars 5, and Season 12... plus a special surprise new series!  That's 4 seasons of crap!!!

Donate today to help your favorite local queen, Miss Yuhua Hamasaki, out.

SUPPORT LOCAL DRAG!

story:
I DO takes place in a city that is constantly moving, as seen through the eyes of Zoe,  a European woman who is herself perpetually in the process of change.

I DO, the series, based in Brooklyn, is the story of Zoe’s screwball attempts to cast someone in the role of her husband in order to obtain a visa to live and work in the US. 

Zoe, as an outsider, a French immigrant, is always a bit clueless about the societal codes needed to truly do a competent job of casting a husband. Each time she thinks she might have found Mr. or Mrs. Right, alas, something happens to put the kabosh on the deal. With each failed attempt, she learns a life lesson. So even if she never comes any closer to marriage, she at least receives an education along the way.

 

A word from Actress/Writer/Director Nathalie Schmidt:

I DO, the webseries, is my personal take on Franco-American relations. It’s both absurdly funny and profoundly heartfelt at the same time.

I DO also pays tribute to New York, a place I fell in love with years ago when I received a Fulbright Scholarship to study musical comedy here. At that time, it seemed to me that every different kind of person that could exist on this earth could find a place in this exciting inclusive city. But it would be naïve to think that in today’s America the “melting pot” ideal has been attained.  As Zoe (our main character) discovers by trying to get married for papers, it’s not easy being an outsider, French or otherwise. The life of an immigrant is a roller-coaster ride, with low points and highs, but no matter what obstacles she faces, Zoe pirouettes and always lands on her feet. I hope you will support my campaign to make this webseries, with the knowledge that Zoe and I will get the job done – no matter what, or as we say in France… à tout prix!

 

Why is this series important and unique to make?

This series, through Zoe’s encounters with different characters both men and women, shows various snapshot portraits of a very specific time and place of Brooklyn today. It also shows the cultural diversity of the borough. The drama and comedy of the narrative of each episode allows the viewer to not only laugh at the farcical conceit of the series, but also hear the differing conceptions and perspectives people have on marriage, love, and relationships.

Since Zoe is a French woman, the series also explores the cultural differences between French and American manners. This will be an ongoing source of humor and both reflect and push the boundaries of the audience’s perception of ethnicity, race, gender relationships, and domestic immigration.

The goal of this series is to take the audience on a hilarious journey in the melting pot culture of New York City through the eyes of Zoe, a French woman, and to foster tolerance and a humanistic regard for immigrant communities much less privileged than the character of Zoe.

I DO has 2 distributors: SeekaTV and FootprintTV

 

Why do we need your help? 

In order to make the series successful, we need your help in covering expenses in regards to locations, food for the cast and crew, cast and crew wages. 

Our crew consists of: director of photography, assistant camera, assistant director, sound mixer,  producer, production assistant, gaffer, grip, production assistant, make up and hair, continuity person, editor, sound editor, final sound mixer.

 

Director/Co-Writer: Nathalie Schmidt

Nathalie is an actress from Paris, France. She has performed in more than thirty plays and thirty films. She has co-written and directed a feature film in France. She is continuing on to make her first series, I DO. 

Nathalie has written and performed in several cabaret shows in New York. She is also an artist and previously held three art shows in Paris and three in NY. She currently has one coming in December 2018 in the West Village

story:
The Lady is Strange

Victoria Strange is the daughter of a Duke and a well-known mystery author. After a life-altering encounter Victoria has taken to living aboard The Zeppelin Chanteuse. The airship, which is the size of a small floating city, is cheeky playground for adults where many mysteries, romances and curiosities abound. 

In exchange for a little extra luxury in her abode, Lady Strange writes for the Chanteuse Gazette, chronicling the happening of our floating fair city. While she’d much rather cover the glitterati and politics of the day, her talents for spotting when something is amiss often finds her in proximity of murder. Strange’s curious nature and inquisitive investigative instincts can’t help but to find her often assisting in finding out who done the deed. Victoria’s efforts are not always appreciated but her posits are usually right. 

 Now, if only she could solve the personal mystery of how to satisfy a nagging hunger and stop losing time. It’s dreadful blessing or delightful curse that has our strong female lead seeking to find her way after the aforementioned life-changing incident. Lady Strange is blessed in that she will never age, but cursed with the hunger of a vampire. Due to the manner of her conversion she is subjected to blackouts and is often frustrated by the loss of time. 

 Imagine being in one place only to find yourself in another in what feels like a blink of an eye, but actually has occurred over the passage of much time, with no idea as to where you’ve been or what you’ve done. Victoria is determined to solve this her greatest mystery. 

 The Lady is Strange indeed. 

To this end we need your help! Be a part of bringing these fabulous adventures off the page and onto the small screen. Your support of our little project will help to cover the essential hard costs associated with producing a project such as this. Every dollar will be used for renting equipment, creating props, costuming, special fx, renting locations, post-production and most importantly FEEDING ALL OF OUR AMAZING VOLUNTEERS! Did we mention this is a labour of love? 

 The Lady is Strange is truly an indie project. With a lot of love, teamwork and hopefully support from you, we will be able to realize and bring these characters and stories on the small screen.

Who We Are

Founded in 2012 by producing partners Kimberly Gauger & Manuel De La Cruz, Grumpy Man is committed to telling intriguing, culturally diverse and creatively empowering stories. In each of Grumpy Man’s productions, audiences will be able to relate to and/or see reflection of themselves and people that they know.

  • Kim Gauger - Creator/Producer
    • Living in Edmond, Oklahoma   Kim developed an interest of working in advertising and dreamed to one day create her own projects for the film and TV industry. She is a very motivated and driven woman who is always willing to go the extra mile. Kim is happily married to her husband Cole and blessed with two daughters. They currently reside in Boulder, Colorado.
  • Manuel De La Cruz - Creator/Producer
    • Although Manny lacks the background of highly esteemed writers, he takes great pride writing about what he knows. Manny currently resides in the same South Texas town he grew up in, with his wife, Tracy, and 2 kids, as well as an inordinate amount of English Bulldogs. He still works in the hardware business, gathering even more stories every single “ordinary” day.
  • Andy Lauer - Creator/Producer
    • Mr. Lauer, is a feature and documentary filmmaker. He has mentored under the direction of filmmakers Oliver Stone, Michael Bay, David Fincher and James Burrows. He has shot on every medium (Red, Blk Widow, 16, S16, 35, etc., in the toughest of conditions (The North Pole) and the most unique situations (underwater, inside shark cages.)
  • Judi Lewinson - Writer
    • As a writer, director and producer, Ms. Lewinson has enjoyed an adventure filled career, packed with eclectic projects in Canada, the United States and West Indies.  The diverse nature of her work coupled with an unwavering commitment to excellence serves as a testament to her love of entertaining and delivering top notch work.

 Imagine being in one place only to find yourself in another in what feels like a blink of an eye, but actually has occurred over the passage of much time, with no idea as to where you’ve been or what you’ve done. Victoria is determined to solve this her greatest mystery. 
 The Lady is Strange indeed. 

To this end we need your help! Be a part of bringing these fabulous adventures off the page and onto the small screen. Your support of our little project will help to cover the essential hard costs associated with producing a project such as this. Every dollar will be used for renting equipment, creating props, costuming, special fx, renting locations, post-production and most importantly FEEDING ALL OF OUR AMAZING VOLUNTEERS! Did we mention this is a labour of love? 
 The Lady is Strange is truly an indie project. With a lot of love, teamwork and hopefully support from you, we will be able to realize and bring these characters and stories on the small screen.

Who We Are
Founded in 2012 by producing partners Kimberly Gauger & Manuel De La Cruz, Grumpy Man is committed to telling intriguing, culturally diverse and creatively empowering stories. In each of Grumpy Man’s productions, audiences will be able to relate to and/or see reflection of themselves and people that they know.


Kim Gauger - Creator/ProducerLiving in Edmond, Oklahoma   Kim developed an interest of working in advertising and dreamed to one day create her own projects for the film and TV industry. She is a very motivated and driven woman who is always willing to go the extra mile. Kim is happily married to her husband Cole and blessed with two daughters. They currently reside in Boulder, Colorado.


Manuel De La Cruz - Creator/ProducerAlthough Manny lacks the background of highly esteemed writers, he takes great pride writing about what he knows. Manny currently resides in the same South Texas town he grew up in, with his wife, Tracy, and 2 kids, as well as an inordinate amount of English Bulldogs. He still works in the hardware business, gathering even more stories every single “ordinary” day.


Andy Lauer - Creator/ProducerMr. Lauer, is a feature and documentary filmmaker. He has mentored under the direction of filmmakers Oliver Stone, Michael Bay, David Fincher and James Burrows. He has shot on every medium (Red, Blk Widow, 16, S16, 35, etc., in the toughest of conditions (The North Pole) and the most unique situations (underwater, inside shark cages.)


Judi Lewinson - WriterAs a writer, director and producer, Ms. Lewinson has enjoyed an adventure filled career, packed with eclectic projects in Canada, the United States and West Indies.  The diverse nature of her work coupled with an unwavering commitment to excellence serves as a testament to her love of entertaining and delivering top notch work.

story:
It's the generation of idiotic choices!

Let's just be honest, the last couple generations have found entertainment in some pretty crude humor. Whether it be from constantly making up different challenges, depending if you are a millennial or a Gen Z, you've seen the rise of the plank challenge, cinnamon challenge, mannequin challenge, tide pod eating challenge... you get the picture. The real question is do you want to see all these challenges go to the next level? 

Think of the most insane challenge you've heard, now add two toddlers with amazing abilities. Little F*cking Wizards wants to bring you the most outlandish and psychotic adventures, and see where it goes. Without the cause and effect of causing harm to ourselves or others, of course, because that's how people end up in prison. 

A Budget Breakdown

Although we are trying to make a fun and entertaining web series, we are a professional team who have aspired to do something of this magnitude for quite some time. 

Our budget breaks down into separate parts, which include indiegogo being only 25% of what we need to reach our goal and make this series happen. 

The rest of our budget will be coming from certain sponsors we reach out too, When those people are brought on, we will be telling all of you! The 75% will come from independent sponsors, businesses, and community groups. 

The portion you would be helping with is to pay the costs of having an amazing animator come onto this project, and create the world of the two little f*cking wizards themselves, Po and Foster. 

Why Give if I don't receive?

The great thing is we have some great perks for people who donate and become contributors to the project, check to the side to see our perks and find one that best suites you.

Are you a student and can barely afford to live? Can you only give 5 or 10 dollars? Don't hesitate, everything helps and we appreciate the people who donate any amount to our show!

Our perks range from shout outs, to the original concept art, wrists bands and much more! 

Can't contribute? Have no fear!

Don't worry we understand, But if you love this project idea and want to see it flourish check out our Facebook Page at: https://www.facebook.com/Little-Fcking-Wizards-... 

Share the campaign and concept video you saw above! The more views and shares the greater the chances are people will see this and want to contribute! 

No time to share or don't have access to any of the social medias? That's okay too, however you're seeing this message keep us in your minds and tell your friends the good ol' fashioned way, by mouth when you see them. You're probably going to want to just share it, but we are open to anything, if you just want to keep us in your thoughts that's always good for us too. 

Thank you so much for reading, hope you enjoyed, become part of our team and see Little F*cking Wizards terrorize a town, so you don't have too!
