story:
Short Summary

As both an entertainment journalist and a person who loves/consumes way too much TV, I often find myself thinking about the LGBTQ themed shows and movies that are being produced.

Even when I love a show or movie - like Call Me By Your Name - I still have often left feeling frustrated by who is being featured in those prominent roles. 

I quickly realized, that far too often LGBTQ people are not given the chance to tell their own stories.

Last year, I did a research piece for Them about Hollywood's legacy of homophobic hiring practices. While writing this article, I began to fully grasp how Hollywood has created an internal culture where heterosexual actors are not only cast in gay roles, but are also commended as being "brave" for playing these parts. Meanwhile, openly LGBTQ actors are often not given the opportunity to play leading LGBTQ roles, or leading heterosexual roles. All of this seems to be done under some belief that mainstream audiences will be too freaked out to attend a "fully gay movie" or watch a "fully gay show" where not only are the characters gay on screen, but the actors are, as well, in real life.

I call bullshit. 

And if there's one thing I've learned, it's that if you want change, you'd better try to change it yourself. 

I recently began doing stand up comedy, and I've writing for many years. As I began crafting stand up material, I started to visualize scenes in my head, which eventually lead to the creation of a "modern day gay" character, and a longer narrative.

Thus, Modern Day Gay, the web series, was born. I know this doesn't mean much coming from me since I wrote it, but I really do believe it's going to be funny, provocative, and enjoyable. YAY! 

This show will follow a totally fictional, anal retentive, controlling, anxiety ridden, uptight, yet SOMEHOW SUPER LIKABLE,  character named...Seamus...who is trying to find love/himself/meaning/mental stability in the wake of a longterm relationship ending abruptly. It will fictionally portray the LOL moments of trying to date, get laid, get a ring on your lil finger, start a family, etc. as a gay man in the post-marriage equality world. 

I want to take Modern Day Gay from being words on a page, to being a quality produced, funny web series. I want to use Modern Day Gay as a platform that uses humor to unpack issues that affect people in the LGBTQ community, and to unpack issues that affect people. Period.

I want to use Modern Day Gay to challenge Hollywood's belief that a show with a gay main character, or even 'gay' in the title, can only be watched and enjoyed by gay people. 

Making a web series is, unfortunately, expensive if you want to do it right. Your contribution will help cover the costs of film equipment, paying a crew, paying actors, post production, and marketing and distribution. 

Hollywood crews all too often underrepresent women, people of color, LGBTQ people, and people who identify as being in multiple of those groups, and with Modern Day Gay, we are committed to doing the exact opposite, both onscreen and off. 

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down:

  • The $10,000 mark is a minimum amount needed to be able to create multiple episodes. The more money we can raise, the more episodes we make. NOBODY LIKES A CLIFFHANGER, so please help us raise enough so we don't have to stop in the middle of the season ^_^
  • Depending on how much you are able to give, we have some CUTE perks! From stickers, to t-shirts, to a launch party, to producer credits, WE.HAVE.IT.ALL.! 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will just make less episodes. BUT THAT WOULD BE SAD SO PLEASE HELP US EXCEED OUR GOAL <3 <3

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

- Help finance a project that prioritizes giving opportunities to people who are often overlooked in Hollywood. 

- Help create a platform to talk about important social issues while LOLing but not being insensitive! 

- Prove to Hollywood that LGBTQ shows with LGBTQ actors can thrive, be financially successful, commercially popular, and watched by diverse audiences without having to prominently feature straight actors playing the lead LGBTQ roles or straightwashing the content! 

As a writer, comedian, and A GAY MAN WITH A LOT TO SAY, I am so excited for this project! I really believe in it, and if you are curious, but are not sold, then please reach out to me. I would be happy to chat more about it over the phone!

Risks & Challenges

One of the major challenges I foresee is longterm funding. I plan to overcome this challenge by trying to fund the entire first season up front, and then marketing the sh*t out of it, so the second season can be funded by (cute, not freaky!) sponsors (whose values are not questionable!). 

Another risk is HAVING TOO MUCH FUN and leaving Hollywood producers SHOOK when they realize gay people can play gay roles! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand not everyone can give money, but there are many other ways you can help! IF think this project sounds chic of the week and/or important, then please send it to people you know who might be interested in learning more!

When it comes to marketing, nothing is more powerful than a share on social media!! I just made up that statistic, but it could be true, so PLEASE SHARE THIS ON FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, etc.! Follow @SeamusKirst and @ModernDayGay and tag both accounts!

And that's all there is to it. THANK YOU SO MUCH <3

story:
WHAT IS AETHER: A WEBSERIES?

Aether is a 12-episode sci-fi drama webseries.  It tells the story of two teens, Tyler and Bernadette, who are beta testers for a brand new, fully immersive gaming system called Aether.  It’s a VRMMORPG - that stands for “virtual reality, massive multi-player role-playing game.”

Inside the game, there are adventures, quests, and a pristine world, based off of our own, for them to explore.  The game world is set in a post-apocalyptic future. For those who are wondering Aether is an adventure epic quest type game, not a first-person shooter. There is plenty of content already out there focused on that and we want to be different. We want to explore the fun and joy that can be found in going on a grand adventure. And that is what Aether is, a grand adventure. The real world is set in the not-so-distant future, where universal wifi is common, but homework is still a drag.  Where gaming graphics look as real as real-life, but parents and teens are still at odds.

In their real lives, Tyler and Bernadette have real problems that many of us can relate to.  Tyler struggles at school partially because of his gaming habit. Though he does try. Bernadette is strong and independent. She does not need a knight in shining armor to rescue her. Though she does get herself into sticky situations now and again where a partner comes in handy. Each episode also reveals details of a conspiracy going on behind the scenes of the new technology.  In the wrong hands, it could cause a global crisis.

 

WHY ARE YOU MAKING AETHER?

We are a group of award-winning filmmakers passionate about telling new stories in new ways.  We are based in the beautiful state of Virginia, where we’ve all been working in the film and television industry for many years.  Each of us has a unique skill-set to bring to the table.

One of our main goals is to showcase the talents of the amazing actors and crew based here in Virginia.  To make that happen, we want to create original content, born from storytellers right here at home. “Aether” is one such story, and we plan to shoot this project right here in Eastern Virginia, with the crew and talent based in this area.

The Aether webseries is actually a prequel to a larger sci-fi political thriller that we are hoping to shop around soon.  We want to pitch this full-length television series to platforms like Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, or a television network. Having a full television series produced right here in Virginia would bring jobs to the creative workforce, as well as helping bring money to the state and other industries. 

In April 2018, Netflix sent an open letter to the governor of Virginia, stating their strong interest in shooting more films and shows in this state.  Could Aether be one of those shows?

This webseries will serve as a proof-of-concept, when we are ready to pitch the full show to networks.  That is why it is crucial to get this project off the ground now. But we need your help to get there and realize these dreams.

 

WHAT DO YOU NEED?

We need $6,000 to produce the first 6 episodes of Aether.  All of that money goes toward what you actually see on screen, such as wardrobe, props, and locations. 

After that is raised, we have a stretch goal to raise an additional $$$$, in order to pay our cast and crew.  As of now, the cast and crew are generously volunteering their time to work on this project.  We want to be fully funded - stretch goal and all - so we can do justice to this story and to the amazing people who are helping us create it.    

 

WHERE EXACTLY DOES THE MONEY GO?

Your donations will cover the following budget items:

In-game Wardrobe             $1,300

Real-world Wardrobe        $500

Props                                      $450

Locations                              $500

Meals for Cast & Crew     $1,360

Expendables                        $190

Fees                                        $300

Production Insurance       $1400

 

TOTAL                                    $6,000

 

WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

Glad you asked!  To the right, you can browse the different funding areas available.   Each area comes with a different perk - a thank you gift from us to you.  In addition, you (or your business) will be listed as a special thank-you in the credits.  We deeply appreciate ANY donation amount. We realize there are a lot of worthy projects out there, and we are humbled that you’ve chosen to support ours.      

 

ARE THERE OTHER WAYS I CAN HELP?

Yes there are!  We understand not everyone can contribute financially.  But, there are other important ways you can help this project succeed: 

First, please help us spread the word to other potential donors by sharing this campaign link on Facebook and Twitter.

Secondly, please invite your friends to join the “Aether: A Webseries” group on Facebook.  This is where we are building a fanbase for the show. Establishing a fanbase NOW, will help us demonstrate to networks that there’s interest in producing this series. This is one place where the numbers really matter.  So please, join the group and invite friends!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/287690758669835

story:
Who We Are

  •  Farmin' Dreams Studios is an Award-Winning Film Production Group based in Atlanta, GA, The company was founded in 2014 and is comprised of Dave Rajkumar, Jamar Rivers, Aaron Riddle and Jamhar Dixon. 

  • Our goal is to reach a worldwide audience with our films, to transform lives. We want to make films that challenge people to seize every opportunity and live their lives to the fullest.

  • This campaign is so important, because it will help fund a very special TV Pilot. It will allow us to put it out there, for the world to see. Once the Pilot gets picked up, we will tell the rest of this unique and incredible story, which comes from the dark imagination of writer/director Dave Rajkumar.

What We Need & What You Get

  •  The average cost for a 30-minute comedy pilot is $2 million. An hour-long drama averages out at $5.5 million. Obviously, we’re not there yet. So we asked some favors and are working diligently with our wonderful city of Atlanta to keep costs low. We need only $45,000 to make this Pilot a reality. Your contributions would assist us by providing a budget to invest in the equipment, props and locations we need to get this project made. It will also help us to pitch and distribute this series to many different networks.
  • Perks include a copy of the TV Pilot, signed posters, autographed scripts, custom T-shirts, tickets to the premiere, producer credit and more!
  • We want for you to be able to say you were a part of the team that created Rebirth.

The Impact

  • This project is not just unique for us, it's also unique for the Indiegogo community. We want to collaborate with the community through your contributions and furthermore have you be a part of our team. We would love to list your name in the credits of the film and on the Imdb page.
  • We would like to show the empowerment and the unseen heroism in everyday women through the story of a young girl trying to figure herself out and realize the power she has always had within her. Also, we wanted to show that everything doesn't have to be black and white, figuratively and literally, with an up and coming leading lady that doesn't fit the typical societally constricted look that we're used to. We've always strived to be, and thrived as, a diversified team by nature and have seen the benefits of the insights from different communities we're a part of and lucky enough to work with. With a core production team of diverse ethnic backgrounds and origins, from Caribbean to east Indian, Lebanese, caucasian, native American and African american, it's kind of hard not to.
  • Our team has completed multiple projects with little to no funding at all. Again and again we rose through the challenges and other logistics that were presented during filming, to bring our vision to light. Each time we came out stronger and if ever we failed, we failed forward, to gain the momentum to keep pushing toward our goals. We want to inspire creative people and thereby inspire the world. We're all amazing pieces of a puzzle to this crazy journey we call "Life".

Our goal is to reach a worldwide audience with our films, to transform lives. We want to make films that challenge people to seize every opportunity and live their lives to the fullest.
This campaign is so important, because it will help fund a very special TV Pilot. It will allow us to put it out there, for the world to see. Once the Pilot gets picked up, we will tell the rest of this unique and incredible story, which comes from the dark imagination of writer/director Dave Rajkumar.

What We Need & What You Get

 The average cost for a 30-minute comedy pilot is $2 million. An hour-long drama averages out at $5.5 million. Obviously, we’re not there yet. So we asked some favors and are working diligently with our wonderful city of Atlanta to keep costs low. We need only $45,000 to make this Pilot a reality. Your contributions would assist us by providing a budget to invest in the equipment, props and locations we need to get this project made. It will also help us to pitch and distribute this series to many different networks.
Perks include a copy of the TV Pilot, signed posters, autographed scripts, custom T-shirts, tickets to the premiere, producer credit and more!
We want for you to be able to say you were a part of the team that created Rebirth.

The Impact

This project is not just unique for us, it's also unique for the Indiegogo community. We want to collaborate with the community through your contributions and furthermore have you be a part of our team. We would love to list your name in the credits of the film and on the Imdb page.
We would like to show the empowerment and the unseen heroism in everyday women through the story of a young girl trying to figure herself out and realize the power she has always had within her. Also, we wanted to show that everything doesn't have to be black and white, figuratively and literally, with an up and coming leading lady that doesn't fit the typical societally constricted look that we're used to. We've always strived to be, and thrived as, a diversified team by nature and have seen the benefits of the insights from different communities we're a part of and lucky enough to work with. With a core production team of diverse ethnic backgrounds and origins, from Caribbean to east Indian, Lebanese, caucasian, native American and African american, it's kind of hard not to.
Our team has completed multiple projects with little to no funding at all. Again and again we rose through the challenges and other logistics that were presented during filming, to bring our vision to light. Each time we came out stronger and if ever we failed, we failed forward, to gain the momentum to keep pushing toward our goals. We want to inspire creative people and thereby inspire the world. We're all amazing pieces of a puzzle to this crazy journey we call "Life".

story:
Short Summary

Are you ready to have a VOICE during and after the upcoming elections! From #metoo and beyond, The PJS! a.k.a The Political Junkies! offers everyone—from millennials to boomers— something new,  something fresh; a show that separates the noise from the news and puts the fun back into politics. The program, to be produced out of Washington, will provide the hottest political news; analysis and conversation and allow interaction with the audience.

Former CNN Political Commentator Roland Martin will moderate a panel of expert political junkies including: MSNBC Political Analyst and University Politics Professor Dr. Jason Johnson; BBC Political Analyst and SiriusXM POTUS Channel Host Eric Ham; and international journalist Tetiana Anderson, who anchored the news at TRT World in Istanbul, Turkey, after domestic reporting at NBC News and CBS News.

Behind the camera; from concept to showtime

The PJs! co-creator and executive producer Rick Blalock will be showrunner. A two-time Emmy winner, Blalock wrote and produced segments for CNN’s political team and CNN’s coverage of the 2016 Presidential Election and was a part of the network’s Emmy-winning coverage of the 2011 Egyptian Revolution.

“The PJs! brings together the best in journalism, analysis and politics and will break the mold,” said Blalock “In addition to in-studio opinion and analysis, The PJs! will give ‘political junkies’ everywhere their daily fix on who’s up, who’s down and what’s really happening behind the walls of power in Washington. As a team, Roland, Tetiana, Jason and Eric are America’s best kept political-news secret, but a secret no longer.”

“We also plan to take viewers on the road,” said Ham, also co-creator and executive producer. “Not to just the usual stomping grounds of Capitol Hill, the Supreme Court and the White House, but places such as the World Bank, Embassy Row, think tanks, K-Street lobby shops and fascinating places around the globe.”

What we need and what you get!

The show needs your help. We need to raise approximately $2.5 million to fund Year One of this weekly digital production. Choose a perk, and BE A PJ TODAY!

All of the funds we receive will be invested in producing and filming our first year of weekly episodes. We've calculated that $48,000 is needed to create a respectable, good-quality episode—the quality you demand and deserve. Even still, our campaign goal is a nickel compared to what is commonly spent per television episode in this day and age.

The following is a list of what the money will be spent on. Of course, if the goal is not met, we will be forced to prioritize the production's needs.

If goal is met:

  •     Cast
  •     Crew
  •     Studio
  •     Camera equipment
  •     Sound equipment
  •     Lighting equipment
  •     Art department (Set/Props)
  •     News gathering and research
  •     Post Production and Graphics
  •     Editing
  •     Color correction
  •     Sound editing/mixing
  •     License Fees / Music rights
  •     Transportation
  •     Lodging

Every dollar counts! We appreciate any help you can give and want to make sure you get something amazing in return. Check out all of our perks!
 
Still have questions about our project and need answers before donating your hard-earned money? E-mail us at info@thepjs.org.
 
Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has the option of donating money to our campaign, but we still appreciate any help you can give. This includes spreading the word! Please share our campaign on social media or tell anyone whom you think might be interested.

story:
MOOCH

THE SERIES

 

OUR STORY AND CAMPAIGN:

Producers Toni D'Antonio, Lou Martini, Jr., writer/producer Jon Saks and actress Kathy Searle are raising funds for a new, original Television Series called Mooch. It's a unique, hilarious journey of two city slicker sisters on the lam, but for two very different reasons. An embarrassing viral video derails the acting career of one sister (Kathy Searle), forcing her to go into hiding with the only person she can trust, her estranged sister, a former ex-mob wife hiding in the witness protection program (Toni D'Antonio). How their worlds collide in the middle of nowhere, USA, along with its cast of crazy supporting players creating a tremendous ensemble and the wit and imagination of Jon Saks words will surprise and delight audiences. Famous actress with pee tape? Check. Ex-Mafia wife in Witness Protection? Check. Hilarity? Most definitely.

With a cast of talented and recognizable actors bringing these flawed, identifiable, and funny characters to life, we feel confident that this new show will fare extremely well in the comedy television marketplace. Our ultimate goal is to be picked up by a major network, however, cable and digital platforms provide enormous oppotunties and options for distribution and exhibition as well. 

A new, fun mash up of Thelma and Louise, The Heat, The Sweetest Thing, Frankie and Grace, My Blue Heaven and Two Broke Girls.

MOOCH. Being yourself has never been more dangerous.

 

WHO WE ARE:

Producer - Toni D'Antonio     www.tonidantonio.com

Producer - Lou Martini, Jr.     www.loumartinijr.com  

Writer/Producer - Jon Saks     www.jonsaks.com  

Actress - Kathy Searle     www.kathysearle.com  

Production Company - Shake The Tree Productions     www.shakethetreeproductions.com    

 

THE CAST

Kathy Searle

Toni D'Antonio

Melanie Nicholls-King

Lou Martini, Jr.

Ward Horton

Andre B. Blake

Rick Zahn

Jim Conroy

Jennifer Jiles

Courtney Rada

 
And more great talent to follow and be announced in the coming weeks.

 

OUR MISSION:

Contributing to this campaign will have a huge impact on the face of new content. As our team proudly stands for ... Encouraging Change. Demanding Equality. Embracing Diversity. Striving for Excellence. All through Content Creation and Story Telling. 

As you will see through our material, our diverse casting choices, our non-gender specific hiring of crew and our commitment to equal pay, we are resolute in acheiving the highest standards of quality material and the fiercest integrity for our work environment. 

Shake The Tree Productions.

Dedicated to the art of story telling. 

Develop. Create. Deliver. Inspire. 

 

WHAT WE NEED FUNDING FOR:

Your generous contributions will be put to good use for the following necessities to shoot and sell successfully:

Cast and Production Crew: $24,000.00

Equipment Rentals (Camera, Lighting and Sound): $10,000.00

Craft Services (Feeding cast and crew): $5000.00

HMU (Hair, Makeup and Wardrobe): $3000.00

Props/Locations: $3000.00

Editing: $5000.00

Music: $2500.00

Marketing, Contingency and Miscellaneous: $5000.00

Production Insurance: $2500.00

Total Goal: $60,000.00

 

WHAT YOU GET:

Give and you GET!!! 

$10.00 gets you a "SHOUT OUT THANK YOU" in the credits and on social media!

$25.00 gets you an AUTOGRAPHED SCRIPT by the entire cast. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$50.00 gets you a SET VISIT on one day of shooting. Come watch the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew and help us create TV magic!  And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$100.00 gets you ON SCREEN AS AN EXTRA. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew and help us create TV magic! And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$250.00 gets you ON SCREEN WITH A ONE LINE SPEAKING PART in the series pilot. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew and help us create TV magic! Your name will appear in the end credits. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$500.00 gets you to PLACE A PERSONAL PROP IN A SCENE that will be featured for 30 seconds of film time. Maybe your high school photo, your child's picture, your business' magnet on a fridge... your prop, your scene choice, your moment. A set visit, an autographed script by the cast and a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$750.00 gets you a chance to WRITE A LINE OF DIALOGUE. You will have a private 15 minute phonecall with writer Jon Saks and you and he will come up with a personal line that you have added to someone's dialogue. On set visit the day your line will be spoken. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$1000.00 gets you a day on set to ASSIST THE DIRECTOR.  Call “Action & Cut” for 2 scenes during a day of shooting. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$1250.00 gets you a day on set to be an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER.  Sit in on Production meetings and watch the moniters with the Producers during a day of shooting. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! Your name will also appear in the end credits as Associate Producer and on IMDB. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media!

$1500.00 gets you a day on set to be an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER AND A RED CARPET WALK at the first screening.  Sit in on Production meetings and watch the moniters with the Producers during a day of shooting. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! Your name will also appear in the end credits as Associate Producer and on IMDB. Join us at the wrap party. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media! 

$2000.00 gets you a SPEAKING ROLE OPPOSITE ONE OF THE STARS (3 line minimum) of the series. Come be part of the producton, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! Your name will also appear in the end credits with a character name in the cast and on IMDB. Join us at the wrap party. Walk the red carpet at the first screening. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media! 

$5000.00 gets you in the inner circle of EXECUTIVE PRODUCER status. Sit in on Pre-Production and Production meetings. Watch the moniters with the Producers during the entire shoot. Come be part of the production team, take pictures on set with the cast and crew, join us for lunch and help us create TV magic! Your name will also appear in the end credits as Executive Producer and on IMDB. Join us at the wrap party. Walk the red carpet at the first screening. Receive a swag bag of goodies. And a "Shout Out Thank You" in the credits and on social media! 

** YOUR GENEROSITY AND HELP IN SPREADING THE WORD WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL IN GETTING THIS SERIES MADE AND SOLD FOR THE WORLD TO SEE **

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

There are a number of factors that are always difficult to overcome while creating new content. However...We have a diverse, driven, knowledgable team of writers, directors, producers, editors and other production personnel with over 20+ years of experience. Our first feature film, ALTO, performed well at over a dozen festivals, garnered 6 awards and is currently being distributed by Multicom Entertainment Group, Inc. on multiple digital platforms. We have also produced and shot a number of TV sizzles and pilots, music videos and commercials. Our veteran team of industry professionals have logged thousands of hours of expereinces insuring quality work on time and on budget.

We have recently acquired and signed with a reputable Sales Agent who is currently shopping/pitching our content to the likes of Netflix, Showtime, Amazon, Discovery, A & E and Lifetime, among others, and there is already quite a bit of interest on our other projects which is very exciting. We feel extremely confident this project will be a viable commodity which will garner some attention and success as we continue to attend markets and festivals and build the necessary relationships with distributors, networks and digital platform executives. 

​

IF YOU CAN'T CONTRIBUTE:

NO WORRIES AT ALL.... Just please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign through emails, texts and social media. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I have watched numerous kids shows with kids and it dawned on me that they did not have any vested interest in the characters - because the episodes are “freestanding” and do not add up to an overall arc. 

I realized there needed to be a tween show involving characters in a ongoing storyline, just like adult-oriented programs do. The show would still have the silliness and goofy antics of middle schoolers, but would also give a humanistic and human quality to the characters and story.  Enter ARTHUR FUTURO.

 

Meet the Team Behind ARTHUR FUTURO 

Creator/Executive Producer

David W. Schoner, Jr.

David Schoner is currently the Associate Director for the New Jersey Motion Picture and Television Commission. He has produced two award-winning independent films (A Dangerous Place and Murder Reincarnated) distributed by outlets such as Screen Media, Netflix, Blockbuster and York Entertainment. He also has set up feature film screenplay proposals that have been recognized by organizations such as the Producers Guild of America, Independent Feature Project (IFP) and the Panasonic Digital Filmmakers Award. In his spare time, David serves on the Board of Directors of the Garden State Film Festival, Women in Media-Newark Film Festival, Westfield International Film Festival Monmouth International Film Festival and is a member of the Cedar Grove Board of Education. He engages in fundraising and is involved in various educational and child-related charitable endeavors.

Writer

Ryan D. Moore

Ryan D. Moore is a comedy writer based out of New Jersey. He writes for the sketch comedy group American Breakfast and co-wrote their web series GOD WORKS FROM HOME. He also co-wrote the award-winning short film GRAFTERS which was screened at the Cannes short film corner. The film also won Best Short at the Orlando Film Festival and Best Short Lead Actor and Best Director at the Atlantic City Downbeach Festival. Ryan recently won Best Short Script for LIVING WITH POSEIDON at the Big MINI Media Festival for the project. He is currently getting his masters in creative writing with a concentration in screenwriting and is working on various projects.

Director

Joseph Morabito, Jr.

Joseph Morabito was born, raised, and still resides in New Jersey. He has created content for companies such as; World Wrestling Entertainment, ESPN, NBC/Universal, and Disney. Joe’s credits include director, producer, editor and writer. His freelance credits include; “Part of Our World” (docu-short, 2013), “Birthday Boy” (short, 2014), “That’ll Be The Day” (bio-short, 2015), and “Gumshoe” (short, 2015). Joe received a Bachelor of Science degree in Film & Television from Full Sail University in Winter Park, Florida.

Editor

Karl Erikson

Karl Erikson is an award winning filmmaker from right here in New Jersey. He is also the lead editor and production manager for Stonehouse media in Lambertville, NJ. Currently he is in pre-production for his first feature length film, a buddy crime comedy, Disarray Days. It is important to note that Karl loves picnics.

 

Production Designer

Burak Aydogan

From building a set to resemble an alternate world of the year 2000 that takes place in the 80s, to designing a haunted party house in March for Halloween in the early 90s, then building a small-scale neighborhood with a functioning Ferris wheel, Burak Aydogan has always been dedicated to go all in for a project. With a garage full of every tool known to man, and an imagination that has no limit, he will craft things that are very unique to the eye and have functionality!  

 

Wardrobe Designer

Brynne Nicole

Aka "B" is a freelance stylist, fashion consultant, and blogger. Her love for the fashion industry has been a constant throughout her life and continued to grow during her teenage years, while taking classes in Sewing/Fashion Merchandising and modeling for Wilhelmina Philadelphia. Given the opportunity to work behind the scenes with designers, photographers, and meeting icons such as Betsy Johnson only made it flourish more. B enjoys every opportunity to create with others and has since started to self-promote and collaborate with models and photographers from the NYC/NJ area. Her most recent stylist work includes shoots with model Louisa Warwick, TV Personalities Raquel "Rocky" Santiago (Bad Girls Club) and Maya Sieber (Ice Road Truckers), actress Amanda Iannuzzi, and American Idol contestant Jax. On the side she maintains a blog (Whiskeyinabcup.com) and also styles/runs a social media account for a local NJ consignment shop, Woodstock Vibes

 

Set Photographer

Teresa Psykaty

Over 30 years of collective artistic experience, diversity and talent.   

Her love for photography began at the age of 12.  Influenced and inspired by the photography greats Ansel Adams and Cartier Bresson’s approach , she began a life long love affair of capturing candid and dramatic moments.    

Her work has been published nationally and internationally.  Gourmet, OK! , Celebrity Page, RadarOnline, Huffington Post, Bella NY and Bella LA as well as serving Neiman Marcus, MvVO Art, Accessible Art Fair, various New York Fashion Week designers, Jose Eber Salon, Tumblr, Stoli Vodka and other respected companies as “house photographer”. Her photograph are regularly featured on major television network shows as well as other respected media outlets.   

Because of her extensive art background, Teresa sees things from an artistic perspective which sets her apart from other photographers. Her passion is evident from the moment she enters a room. Her reputation, integrity, talent and consistency make her one of NYC’s most sought after photographers.

 

Graphic Designer

Deanna Palma

Deanna is an artist and graphic designer with a passion for all things fiction, fantasy, anime and sci-fi. By day she is a Marketing Manger/Graphic Designer at a leading distributor of amusement equipment. By night (in her free time), Deanna takes every opportunity to be creative. Whether it's drawing, painting,  designing, or crafting she is always working on an artistic project. She has worked on a number of projects for the Great Mustachio including the Cedar Grove Waves Memorial Installation
story_txt: I have watched numerous kids shows with kids and it dawned on me that they did not have any vested interest in the characters - because the episodes are “freestanding” and do not add up to an overall arc. I realized there needed to be a tween show involving characters in a ongoing storyline, just like adult-oriented programs do. The show would still have the silliness and goofy antics of middle schoolers, but would also give a humanistic and human quality to the characters and story.  Enter ARTHUR FUTURO. Meet the Team Behind ARTHUR FUTURO Creator/Executive ProducerDavid W. Schoner, Jr.David Schoner is currently the Associate Director for the New Jersey Motion Picture and Television Commission. He has produced two award-winning independent films (A Dangerous Place and Murder Reincarnated) distributed by outlets such as Screen Media, Netflix, Blockbuster and York Entertainment. He also has set up feature film screenplay proposals that have been recognized by organizations such as the Producers Guild of America, Independent Feature Project (IFP) and the Panasonic Digital Filmmakers Award. In his spare time, David serves on the Board of Directors of the Garden State Film Festival, Women in Media-Newark Film Festival, Westfield International Film Festival Monmouth International Film Festival and is a member of the Cedar Grove Board of Education. He engages in fundraising and is involved in various educational and child-related charitable endeavors.WriterRyan D. MooreRyan D. Moore is a comedy writer based out of New Jersey. He writes for the sketch comedy group American Breakfast and co-wrote their web series GOD WORKS FROM HOME. He also co-wrote the award-winning short film GRAFTERS which was screened at the Cannes short film corner. The film also won Best Short at the Orlando Film Festival and Best Short Lead Actor and Best Director at the Atlantic City Downbeach Festival. Ryan recently won Best Short Script for LIVING WITH POSEIDON at the Big MINI Media Festival for the project. He is currently getting his masters in creative writing with a concentration in screenwriting and is working on various projects.DirectorJoseph Morabito, Jr.Joseph Morabito was born, raised, and still resides in New Jersey. He has created content for companies such as; World Wrestling Entertainment, ESPN, NBC/Universal, and Disney. Joe’s credits include director, producer, editor and writer. His freelance credits include; “Part of Our World” (docu-short, 2013), “Birthday Boy” (short, 2014), “That’ll Be The Day” (bio-short, 2015), and “Gumshoe” (short, 2015). Joe received a Bachelor of Science degree in Film & Television from Full Sail University in Winter Park, Florida.EditorKarl EriksonKarl Erikson is an award winning filmmaker from right here in New Jersey. He is also the lead editor and production manager for Stonehouse media in Lambertville, NJ. Currently he is in pre-production for his first feature length film, a buddy crime comedy, Disarray Days. It is important to note that Karl loves picnics. Production DesignerBurak AydoganFrom building a set to resemble an alternate world of the year 2000 that takes place in the 80s, to designing a haunted party house in March for Halloween in the early 90s, then building a small-scale neighborhood with a functioning Ferris wheel, Burak Aydogan has always been dedicated to go all in for a project. B enjoys every opportunity to create with others and has since started to self-promote and collaborate with models and photographers from the NYC/NJ area. Her most recent stylist work includes shoots with model Louisa Warwick, TV Personalities Raquel "Rocky" Santiago (Bad Girls Club) and Maya Sieber (Ice Road Truckers), actress Amanda Iannuzzi, and American Idol contestant Jax. On the side she maintains a blog (Whiskeyinabcup.com) and also styles/runs a social media account for a local NJ consignment shop, Woodstock Vibes Set PhotographerTeresa PsykatyOver 30 years of collective artistic experience, diversity and talent.   Her love for photography began at the age of 12.  Influenced and inspired by the photography greats Ansel Adams and Cartier Bresson’s approach , she began a life long love affair of capturing candid and dramatic moments.    Her work has been published nationally and internationally.  Gourmet, OK! , Celebrity Page, RadarOnline, Huffington Post, Bella NY and Bella LA as well as serving Neiman Marcus, MvVO Art, Accessible Art Fair, various New York Fashion Week designers, Jose Eber Salon, Tumblr, Stoli Vodka and other respected companies as “house photographer”. story:
Решил попробовать запустить крауд 128 серии.

Получится- хорошо, не получится- тоже неплохо. Чему быть- тому не миновать! Пардон на буржуйском сайте- на русском погребут под процентами и бумажками.. Да - так да, нет- так нет... :)

Что такое сериал "Масяня" я думаю объяснять не надо. Заранее говорить ничего не буду про сюжет, иначе не интересно будет... Никаких ништякв не разадю ибо фигня это всё. Если кому чего от меня надо - и так сделаю. без каких-то там финансовых заслуг. Но думаю пять самых больших участников с титры занести. И хватит этого.

story:
Truth ‘N Food:

Season 2 & Chef Classes

"Just the two of us! We can make it if we try! Just the two of us, you and I!"

That's right, just one Chef and one Filmmaker brought you a full 9 episode digital series, following and highlighting the people who put food on our tables.

 

 

With the first season under our belt, we are proud to have experienced some incredible stories and shared them with you.

There are so many important people that are part of our food system and culture, who we feel do not get enough attention or appreciation and we have a mission to bring them to light. 

Below is the teaser for Season 1, which shows some of these extraordinary adventures.

Check out the Season 1 trailer below!

 

With just the two of us producing everything from cooking to filming and editing, as well as social media and distribution, it has been an incredibly rewarding experience.

But with so many other stories that need to be told, we cannot stop here. We must keep going and that’s why we need your support.

What You Fund & What You Get:

Season 2:

If we meet our funding goals, it will enable us to go beyond our current reach, increase in length and scope and allow us to dive deeper into these beautiful stories.

Planned Episodes:

For example, right now we have a two-part episode planned with Quinault Indian Nation, that will share an unprecedented view into ancient culture and traditions of food.

There’s also a family run, premier Ramen bar, producing handmade noodles and incredible bone broths and fermented sauces, as well as the only Maple Syrup farm on the West Coast, that is revolutionizing sustainable tree management.

 

 

Chef’s Classes:

With your help, not only will you get a whole new season of fascinating episodes, but also a series of high-quality but approachable chef´s classes from Taus.

Chef Classes by Taus

 

We understand that during these COVID times, many people are stuck at home but struggle with making wholesome meals. Chef Taus will help you improve your cooking skills so that you can provide amazing meals for yourself and others for many dinners to come.

 

 

But that’s not all!

The Perks:

In our Perks, you have the option of bundling chef’s classes with items from some of our Season One Collaborators, such as Hama Hama Oyster Company, Valley Farms and Bruce McGlenn of Human Nature Hunting School.

In a showing of support, these purveyors are offering one-time only exclusive packages of their products that can be used along with the chef’s classes.

Products From Our Purveyors

Valley Rabbits:

With these organic, sustainably raised rabbits, Chef Taus will teach you how to break down a whole rabbit as well as create dishes like tartare and premium burgers with garnishes and sauces.     

    

 

Hama Hama Oyster Company:

Hama Hama Oyster Company is an institution of the Pacific Northwest and farms some of the highest quality shellfish in the U.S.

In these classes, Taus will teach you how to shuck and garnish oysters in your own kitchen.

 

 

As one of our perk options, you also have the ability to gain access to Q&A sessions with Chef Taus about all your culinary needs.

Check out the teasers for our Hama Hama & Valley Farms Episodes!

 

 

And remember, you can buy multiples of any given perk!

Testimonials:

Valley Farms Customer – Truth ‘N Food Season 1 Reaction

Hello,

I am a return customer, but it wasn't until I saw the Truth 'n Food episode about your special farm and practices, that I really understood your level of attention and passion for producing the best possible product.

I immediately placed an order for several dozen eggs (from your happy chickens), chicken breast and thighs and a pound of bison (which I think may comes from a neighboring farm) - all was promptly delivered this week. My family DEVOURED the bison (in form of burgers) this evening, and we all agreed that it was one of the best burgers we have ever had (only seasoned with salt and grilled on a cast iron flat griddle.) The dedication to your animals' quality of life translates to an incredible product, and we feel lucky to have enjoyed it.

Look forward to enjoying the remainder of our order.

Thank You!

A Thought From John & Taus:

Our passion to seek out amazing and underrepresented people in our food system is undeniable, and with your support we can share a more diverse and impactful Season 2.

This is more than just a hobby, this is something we wish to build over time and expand to new, far off places with more beautiful, hardworking people.

Help Truth ‘N Food and by extension, those people who are responsible for putting food on your table and creating unforgettable memories.

Thank you!

Taus & John

 

*In our funding goal, a portion of the proceeds will go directly to our purveyors to pay for these items

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with friends and family using email, Facebook, and Twitter!

story:
L.Y.F.E. is REAL!

Welcome To The Good L.Y.F.E.

My name is Jerail Fennell, and I am the creator of L.Y.F.E., a YouTube Series that I created during the Global Coronavirus Pandemic. I wanted to tell an authentic story about four college students trying to maneuver through Love. Youth. Freedom. and Education.  If you're a college graduate, current college student, or just someone making your way through L.Y.F.E. as well, this show will hit home with you! 

Our campaign is simple. We are seeking to raise funds to complete season one of L.Y.F.E. If you loved episode one, then you are in for the ride of your life. During season one, we touch on important topics surrounding us today, including the BLM movement, #MeToo, Depression in College, Consent, Sexual Relations, Domestic Violence, and much more. We have eight episodes of L.Y.F.E. written and two filmed. 

Your contribution will allow us to tell this coming of age story that needs to be told. There is some story that will resinate with you in some way. You will also be supporting a group of  black actors, writers, and directors. No amount is too small, really. 

Let's Talk Turkey. 

So, where would the money be going? I'm happy you asked: 

Funding will go solely to the production of L.Y.F.E. which includes, equipment, locations, actors, support staff. Up to this point, I have funded the project out of my own pocket, and have also got a few investors for future episodes, but there is always room for more.  

What do you get for being an investor of L.Y.F.E.? Let's talk about perks: 

  • First Look At All New Episodes - We all like to be first, right? 
  • Extras including behind the scenes and outtakes
  • L.Y.F.E. T-Shirt ($50 or more)
  • Personal video messages from the cast and producers 
  • Early release of the Season 2 Premiere 
  • Sponsorship of an episode ($100 or more) 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone isn't in the position the contribute monetarily; I get it! But there are many other ways you can help! 

You have social media? Share the series and tell everyone how good it is. You can also share the link from this page to others who may be interested in contributing. 

That's all there is to it.

Thank You! #LYFE 

- Jerry

story:
• Are you, or someone you love, a current or past theatre student?

  • Are you, or someone you love, living "the adjunct life" at a University or community college?

  • Are you trying to "make it" in the performing arts? 

  • Are you saddled with student loan debt?

This is your story!

 

So, what is B.F.A. In... ? Is there a plot? 

B.F.A. In... is a new web series that chronicles the lives of undergraduate theatre students, and adjunct professors living in New York City. 

The plot centers around Mariah Carroll, a former child star, who is hired as a contingent faculty member at the University of New York City, to teach in an emerging theatre department, and the group of freshmen students she is tasked with developing into actors and artists over the next four years. 

B.F.A. In... is a bright and witty commentary on the university system and addresses many of the current issues affecting higher education performing arts programs, including student loan debt, lack of funding for the arts, underpaid adjunct labor, and employment prospects following graduation. 

 

But, have you been outside lately? The world is falling apart... Why would I donate my money to a web series? 

This is exactly why we need art and storytelling now more than ever. B.F.A. In... offers solutions to problems facing artists and academics, both on and off screen. Through humor, consciousness raising, and employing young artists on our staff and creative team, B.F.A. In... is determined to bring these conversations to the forefront.

 

Okay... I'm Sold. What do you need to make this happen? 

As you probably can guess by now, creating a web series is expensive.

We need to raise $17,000 to shoot our entire first season (5 episodes). Yes, that sounds like A LOT of money, but with your help, we can make this possible. 

Your donations will help pay for:

  • Equipment
  • Transportation for Cast/Crew
  • Meals for Cast/Crew
  • Location Permits
  • Editing
  • Marketing
  • ... and most importantly, Provide Stipends to our Hardworking Cast and Crew. 

B.F.A. In... is being filmed on a low budget, but we are confident that with your support, if we make our fundraising goal, we will be able to shoot the entire first season. 

Will You Forget About Me Once I Donate? 

Absolutely not! We see you as a valued member of our team. Check out some of the perks on the side of this page to see the ways in which we plan to thank you for your support. If there isn't a perk that directly appeals to you, hit us up via e-mail or on our Facebook page, and let us know how you'd like to be involved. 

 

What Are Some Other Ways to Stay Inspired, Involved and Connected while B.F.A. In... is being created? 

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and contacts
  • Follow us on Facebook. 
  • Join our mailing list. 
  • Tag us in posts on social media by using #BFAInTheWebSeries #JointheClass #SchoolsBackInSession 
  • If you are unable to make a financial donation, please consider sponsoring our web series by providing catering, transportation or rehearsal space.

Who Are the Artists Involved in this Web Series? 

B.F.A. In... features the talents of Tiff "Iffy" Roma, Anna Savant, John Mazurek, Tyrus Holden, Michael Rehse, Ryan Victor Pierce, Vinny Eden Ortega, Ian Fields Stewart, Giovanni Patrick, Lauren Elizabeth Morra, Noura Boustany Jost, Larissa Jeanniton, Keleigh Principi, Jesse Krebs, Dinae Anderson-Ruano and Jamie Saunders 

It is written and created by Ashley Marinaccio

Directed by Ashley Marinaccio and Noura Boustany Jost 

with

Cinematography by Dakota Holmes-Dodge 

Costume and Wardrobe Design by Laura Wynne 

Art and Logo Design by Melanie Roth

Original Music by Valerie Forgione 

Location Scouting by Matthew DeNapoli Champagne 

Read full bios of the artists on our website.

Tag us in posts on social media by using #BFAInTheWebSeries #JointheClass #SchoolsBackInSession 
If you are unable to make a financial donation, please consider sponsoring our web series by providing catering, transportation or rehearsal space.


Who Are the Artists Involved in this Web Series? 
B.F.A. In... features the talents of Tiff "Iffy" Roma, Anna Savant, John Mazurek, Tyrus Holden, Michael Rehse, Ryan Victor Pierce, Vinny Eden Ortega, Ian Fields Stewart, Giovanni Patrick, Lauren Elizabeth Morra, Noura Boustany Jost, Larissa Jeanniton, Keleigh Principi, Jesse Krebs, Dinae Anderson-Ruano and Jamie Saunders 
It is written and created by Ashley Marinaccio
Directed by Ashley Marinaccio and Noura Boustany Jost 
with
Cinematography by Dakota Holmes-Dodge 
Costume and Wardrobe Design by Laura Wynne 
Art and Logo Design by Melanie Roth
Original Music by Valerie Forgione 
Location Scouting by Matthew DeNapoli Champagne 
Read full bios of the artists on our website.

story:
My name is John Lee. I am a filmmaker from Brooklyn, NY by way of Cleveland, OH. I started acting when I was 7 years old but took it serious in 2012. That is when I got casted into 2 major Hollywood films, Captain America 2 & Draft Day.

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. In order to complete my first project and make it industry quality I decided to hire a professional crew. This is important as I want to share the best product possible.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. I cannot put out the best product alone. I need your commitment to view, share, and contribute.
  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you. The total cost of the film will be $3,500.00 which may seem like a lot BUT in the film world that's pennies! These movies you see on the big screen have multi-million dollar budgets!
  • ANY AMOUNT donation you will get access to watch the first episode and I will give a personal shoutout to you through social media messaging or email.
  • $21.00 donation you will get all that plus a social media special shoutout!
  • $22.00 - $50.00  you will get all that plus a shoutout in the credits.
  • $51.00 - $99.00 you will get all that plus an autographed photo of the cast.
  • $100.00 - $499.00 you will get all that plus a personal video from the cast and myself.
  • Anything raised in this campaign will go towards the production of the film,
  • This TV show will be important for many reasons. With the country being torn back and forth through political hate. We need a light hearted look into the many cultural differences we share under the USA. Brooklyn is a microcosm of all the diversity this great country has to offer.
  • Trying to do this on my on is not easy. Scheduling actors and finding locations to shoot at requires patience and understanding. Those two things are teaching me to become a better human being, I will push through with your encouragement and the drive to change the world by promoting art. 
  • Donations alone are not the only way you can help me. By simply sharing the link out, spreading the word of the project or a positive message would mean the world to me!
story_txt:
My name is John Lee. I am a filmmaker from Brooklyn, NY by way of Cleveland, OH. I started acting when I was 7 years old but took it serious in 2012. That is when I got casted into 2 major Hollywood films, Captain America 2 & Draft Day.

Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. In order to complete my first project and make it industry quality I decided to hire a professional crew. This is important as I want to share the best product possible.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. I cannot put out the best product alone. I need your commitment to view, share, and contribute.


Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you. The total cost of the film will be $3,500.00 which may seem like a lot BUT in the film world that's pennies! These movies you see on the big screen have multi-million dollar budgets!
ANY AMOUNT donation you will get access to watch the first episode and I will give a personal shoutout to you through social media messaging or email.
$21.00 donation you will get all that plus a social media special shoutout!
$22.00 - $50.00  you will get all that plus a shoutout in the credits.
$51.00 - $99.00 you will get all that plus an autographed photo of the cast.
$100.00 - $499.00 you will get all that plus a personal video from the cast and myself.
Anything raised in this campaign will go towards the production of the film,
This TV show will be important for many reasons. With the country being torn back and forth through political hate. We need a light hearted look into the many cultural differences we share under the USA. Brooklyn is a microcosm of all the diversity this great country has to offer.
Trying to do this on my on is not easy. Scheduling actors and finding locations to shoot at requires patience and understanding. Those two things are teaching me to become a better human being, I will push through with your encouragement and the drive to change the world by promoting art. 
Donations alone are not the only way you can help me. By simply sharing the link out, spreading the word of the project or a positive message would mean the world to me!

story:
WHAT IS IT?

HOLY Sh**, Mary! is a female driven web-series presented by three executive producers Julia Cancella, AC Mettenheimer and Guzel Saitbatalova. It is the story of a young mathematician named Mary as she gets settled in her new life as a research assistant for a prestigious academic institution in Los Angeles, California. Surrounded by the wild, wonderful, and very different City of Angels, alongside her friends JJ, Mae-Yin and Chris, Mary will discover the many layers LA has, but more importantly, she will find herself in the process. #hsmtheshow makes fun of LA with a fresh pair of an outsider’s eyes. 

WHO?

(HOLY) Sh**, Mary! is based on an idea by Anna-Catharina Mettenheimer, who is one of the Executive Producers alongside M. Julia Cancella and Guzel Saitbatalova. Besides running the show, the trio also has production roles: Julia is the screenwriter, AC the lead actress and Guzel the director. The production team is led by Arda Bengü, our beloved and overloaded producer, and Isabel Sega is the witty AD who keeps the set on track.

Anna-Catharina Mettenheimer

Anna-Catharina "AC" grew up all over the world including the US, Mexico, Germany and Scotland. AC initially loved to perform as a dancer from a young age, and then got cast in an Oscar Wilde play in seventh grade. She graduated with a Bachelor Honors in Ancient History from the University of London in 2012, her final thesis focusing on Greek theatre. After working at the most commercially successful children's movie production company in Germany, and as PA to the CEO of a movie licensing and distribution company, she decided to follow her passion, moving to Los Angeles in 2016. AC is excited to graduate from the UCLA Ext. School's Acting Program and plans to further continue her studies at the Howard Fine Studio. "Holy Sh**, Mary!" has been her passion project for almost a year now and she can't wait to see her favorite character come to life! 

Guzel Saitbatalova

Born and raised in Russia, Guzel Saitbatalova got her Finance Degree from Saint Petersburg State University of Economics, but quickly realized that was not her cup of tea. So instead of counting other's people money as a bank clerk, she moved to Los Angeles right after her graduation in 2015. This year, Guzel got an Academic Certificate in Entertainment Studies from UCLA in order to pursue career as a director. Being an executive producer, she directed all of the episodes of the HOLY Sh**, Mary! web-series. Guzel also wrote and directed the short film The Last Day On Earth as well as the documentary Behind The Yellow Door.  

Julia Cancella

M. Julia Cancella is a Brazilian/Portuguese screenwriter with a Film Degree from PUC-Rio, Brazil, an MBA in Marketing and Management and an Academic Certificate in Screenwriting from UCLA. Hailing from Rio de Janeiro, she worked as a video editor, a film producer and a marketing executive before moving to Los Angeles to pursue a screenwriting career. Besides writing the HOLY Sh**, Mary! web-series, Julia wrote and directed the short film White and Colors as well as the visually ambitious project Tommy and the Geometric Figures. Her next step is to see Nowhere, a coming-of- age feature, launched from the page to the big screen.

Arda Bengu

Arda Bengu is a Turkish filmmaker, born and raised in Istanbul. His love of film blossomed early, when a new DVD Rental store opened in his neighborhood. The owner of the store, a family friend, lent Arda an unending supply of DVDs for FREE! as long as he returned one before renting the next. Arda studied science and math in high school, but his cinephilia eventually led him to film school. He graduated from Istanbul BILGI University in 2010 with a bachelor’s degree in Film and Television. Upon graduation, Arda immediately fulfilled his mandatory six month military service. Returning in 2011, he found a job as a camera assistant on a TV series. A year later, he decided to change his career trajectory and became an assistant director. With more than five years of filmmaking experience, Arda has worked on three feature films, four TV series, eight TV commercials and countless short-films. While most of his recent roles were assistant directing, he has also taken various roles in different departments from producing to editing. Over a year ago, Arda changed his life and moved to America. Fate led him to Los Angeles where he earned his certificate degree in Film Producing through the UCLA Extension Program. Arda's next goal is to become the first acclaimed Turkish director based in Hollywood.

Carlos Suarez

Carlos Suárez is a cinematographer from Caracas, Venezuela, based in Los Angeles, California. He holds a bachelor's degree in Mass Media Communications from the Andrés Bello Catholic University in Caracas. As well as a Master´s degree in Cinematography from the New York Film Academy. Having worked extensively in the fields of documentary photography and portrait photography, he got his start as a trainee at Cinemateriales Rental House in Caracas. Carlos has been trained by cinematographers such as Rafael Marziano SVC, Anthony B Richmond ASC BSC, Mike Williamson and Jacek Laskus ASC.

Isabel Sega

Born in Maracaibo - Venezuela and known for famous call sheets, Isabel graduated in 2015 from a bachelors in filmmaking. After directing her first feature film Where is Memo she moved to Los Angeles (like everyone else) to pursue her dream of bossing people around on sets. She loves fried plantains and after 10 hours of shooting she usually starts speaking with a fake Italian accent.  

GOT IT! NOW, WHEN AND HOW?

Mary’s journey started in August 2016 when Guzel, Julia and AC got together to start putting all their ideas on paper. In September same year, the PILOT was successfully shot, which showed it’s possible to aim for a good project with ambitious prospects, even without a budget. The Pilot is in post-production and the five remaining episodes of the first season are currently in production. Season 1 is scheduled to air in fall this year. With only a micro-budget and lots of love, courage and hard work, the show can’t afford to pay cast and crew members the fair amount for their work; however, we do believe in the project and have high hopes (based on a lot of work, research and feedback) that the show can reach a rewarding level of public interest and work as an investment for all, giving us the opportunity to show the industry how qualified we are and lead us to Hollywood’s good grace!

THAT'S AWESOME! NOW, WHAT IS THE FIRST SEASON?

#hsmseason1 has 6 episodes of around 10 minutes each. Find, below, a synopsis for each one:

“PILOT” Young Idahoan mathematician Mary (Anna-Catharina Mettenheimer) moves to LA to work as a research assistant for a prestigious academic institution. Her first step in the City of Angels is to find a home and a roommate… but that’s no easy task!

“JESUS“ (S01E02) Settled in her new home and with her new roommate and friend JJ (Hamid Jahangard), Mary faces a second LA must: buy a car. After several failed attempts, Mary meets geeky-witty Mae-Yin (Jolie Chi) and not only ends up buying her car, but also making a new friend. And getting a crush: a very hot bartender named Greg (Conner Floyd).

“LA GIRL” (S01E03) Some may say Mary is an LA girl now. And what LA person does not go to the gym? That’s how JJ convinces Mary to join him and his brother Chris (Marcos Favela) on “buddy day” at the gym. Maybe it’s the hot weather, maybe the hot bodies, but in LA going to the gym is more than just work-out clothes and lots of energy!

“BO WILLIAMS” (S01E04) It’s party time! Bo Williams, a very famous youtuber, is hosting a big party and the trio finds a way to attend it. Outside her comfort zone, Mary ends up finding out a big secret that can change famous Bo’s entire life. But Bo Williams is not the only one hiding something and JJ and Mae-Yin discover a big secret Mary is keeping about her 5 years relationship with boyfriend Jonathan (Bruce Clifford).

“THE INTERVENTION” (S01E05) Half shocked, half outraged, JJ, Mae-Yin and Chris decide to hold an intervention to make Mary realize her relationship with Jonathan is too… outdated for 2017, but Mary is too focused on an upcoming deadline at work to listen to her friends. That’s until she receives a call from Jonathan with some big bad news.

“SPACE MARY”(season finale) Devastated and full of brownies, Mary wanders around LA while trying to understand which wrong decisions led her to the bad place she is right now. Surrounded by people, opinions and advice, Mary finally realizes that what she needs is to be brave enough to take the next step. Alone. And so she does…

Aren’t you just curious to know what’s gonna happen to Mary on season 2? We are! So let’s get together and make #hsmseason1 happen! We count on each and every one of you!

If you love storytelling as much as we do and wish to see our web-series finished up, please consider joining our campaign. You can rest easy knowing that 100% of your contribution will be going towards every step it takes to produce this project. 

Oh, and thank you so very much!

story:
"Cops and Monsters" is an on-going, award winning supernatural webseries from Scotland. Set in a near-future Scotland, we follow newbies Maya Hedges and Martin Carmichael as they join the Paranormal Investigation Team Scotland (PITS). Series 1 follows their case of Lycan A202, a dangerous werewolf assassin on the run.

The team: made up of upcoming filmmakers and actors, alongside professional, established cast and crew, have shot 9 episodes of Cops and Monsters, which makes up series 1. Now with the final episode in post-production, we are running this small completion fund campaign in order to finish the final episode and cover the costs of the following: a full cinema screening for potential distributors, fans, cast, crew, press and industry professionals; a copy of the series 1 DVD and/or blu-ray for all cast and crew; to produce and ship remaining perks for the last campaign and to cover our costs for MCM Comic Con Scotland on the 23rd and 24th of September to further promote our show and hopefully raise funds to shoot series 2 in 2018.

We are so extremely grateful for the on-going support and contributions we have received throughout the life of "Cops and Monsters" and for all of our episodes so far. We really couldn't do this without you. We have managed to secure some amazing guest stars from Doctor Who (Sophie Aldred, Caitlin Blackwood), Harry Potter (James Payton), Raven (James Mackenzie) and Wolfblood (Rachel Teate and Leona Kate Vaughan) as well as enter the series into festivals around the world, where we have won two awards - including the Best Web Series Award for the Los Angeles Film Festival. 

With your support on this campaign we will be able to afford the costs of the cinema screening on August 12th as well as providing all of our cast and crew a full copy of series 1 on DVD. Your support will also ensure that all final costs for series 1 - visual effects, sound design and music - are completed and paid for. We will also be able to complete the production of the perks for our remaining campaign and this campaign, allowing us to post them out to our backers around the world.

And finally, we will be able to buy a stall at MCM Comic Con Scotland this year, to further promote the show and host a Q and A panel with clips from the series. Hopefully reaching a larger fanbase and securing support for series 2 in 2018.

In return for your support we're offering:

  • The complete series 1 on DVD or blu-ray
  • A signed copy of the series 1 finale script
  • 3 different A3 posters - one of which is designed by Stuart Manning of Doctor Who
  • Associate, executive and producer perks on IMDb and a shout out for everybody who backs this campaign on our series 1 finale behind the scenes video
  • Laminated A4 prints of our poster designs, signed by the team.
  • Tickets to our exclusive cinemas screening on August 12th 7pm where you can meet our cast and crew
  • An exclusive link to our series 1 finale before we release it to the public

All of our series 1 episodes so far are FREE to watch on our official YouTube page or you can watch them now below:

Simple: because there isn't anything like this on British TV at the moment. We've had Torchwood, Being Human, The Fades, Primeval, In the Flesh, MisFits, etc, over the years but sadly they never stay around long enough and at the moment we have nothing like it. So we have created a supernatural police thriller to (hopefully) entertain genre fans, providing them with an exciting story and a group of dynamic characters to support or hate!

We're also doing this so the hard working cast and crew of the show have a chance to build on their experiences while getting paid to do so at the same time! 

Hopefully we'll either be picked up by a production company so we can develop the show further with a much bigger budget and resources, or the show will be used as a calling card for all who work on it to progress in their respective careers. It's about creating opportunities. 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't hit our goal then we can still finish the final episode but it will take longer to release it and produce our DVDs and remaining perks. We'll also struggle to cover the cost of the cinema hire in August and probably not be able to attend MCM Comic Con Scotland due to their costs for a stall for the 2 day event. We have been really lucky so far and we've been successful in funding each episode of series 1, so we hope this same can be achieved for this completion fund campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can follow us on Twitter and Facebook. You can also subscribe to our official YouTube channel here. Spread the word of the show and this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and so on - get them excited about our show and help us hit our goal of £1000 so we can finish it all.

If we're really lucky and hit the goal, and then raise even more, we can put that into our funds to produce another bonus episode before we start looking into pre-production for series 2 next year.

You can follow us on Twitter and Facebook. You can also subscribe to our official YouTube channel here. Spread the word of the show and this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and so on - get them excited about our show and help us hit our goal of £1000 so we can finish it all.
If we're really lucky and hit the goal, and then raise even more, we can put that into our funds to produce another bonus episode before we start looking into pre-production for series 2 next year.

story:
Short Summary

Set in modern day Los Angeles, "#Unsupervised: The S(eries)" shines on the lives of five slightly mismatched roommates as they make their way through life, with plenty of crazy shenanigans on the side.

The show has mass appeal to generations old and new, and accomplishes something similar to what shows like “Friends” and “Cheers” did. From romance to sexuality from parties to politics, these characters experience it all, and our fans find it to be “hilariously relatable.” A successfully funded campaign will allow us to shoot and cut season two and bring these characters back.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To give you a bit of a background...

  • HardlyFamous Productions began season one with a meager kick-starter goal of $500. This helped us get the essentials together so that we could begin filming. However, our vision and team grew and between equipment, food and props, the money left our hands all too quickly. Instead of giving up, we continued to fund the project ourselves.
  • With season one successfully filmed, edited and out there, we've found ourselves in need of funding to start production on season two. With a budget of $10,000, we can focus on successfully producing and professionally marketing season two, while working to expand the HardlyFamous Productions team and take it to the next level—Netflix.

The Impact

Ah, the millennials. The hardworking, life-hacking, political activating, meme sharing generation. What even are we sometimes? Incredibly fascinating, that's what. We see a problem and address it head on... by posting about it on Twitter. And guess what, we've changed the world because of it. Why not continue to share in the glorious impact that is the millennial generation by contributing to the heart of it all: media. 

"#Unsupervised: The S(eries)" combines the issues of today with light hearted comedy. With steadfast determination, we look forward to the day when season two makes its way into the world. 

Risks & Challenges

With a big dream and a growing team, our dedication and enthusiasm shot through the roof. Unfortunately, so did our budget. As with everything in the movie business, without a proper source of income, the project dies.

By supporting "#Unsupervised", you'll be investing in the future of new media content. And we guarantee it to be a well-developed, professionally shot, produced, distributed, and marketed project. 

We already have a growing fanbase and an eager viewership. Risk is merely a board game. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The HardlyFamous family is so grateful for any and all support, and we're so fortunate that in this day and age it is as easy as 1, 2, 10.

Getting the word out is huge. We encourage everybody to help spread the word via Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and Twitter. We can't wait to have our family grow even bigger.

story:
Short Summary 

I am a sketch comedy writer and actor, working with other comedians and actors to develop a new television show for digital streaming services. Some of my online comedy can be found on Instagram @MonteBellTV and on Youtube: Monte Bell. My ultimate goal is to shine a light on talented people who aren't  given the exposure, benefits or money to make their mark on the world.

Synopsis

Joel is a young man from Staten Island trying to keep a roof over his head and evolve his relationship with his girlfriend. His life is immediately changed when he meets Samantha, an heir to a multimillion dollar investment empire, who Joel stops from trying to commit suicide on his watch. After losing his job, Joel is met with a proposal that will financially secure him for the rest of his life, but only if he agrees to date Samantha. Joel struggles with trying to keep his agreement a secret from his girlfriend; as well as trying to keep his two best friends and cousin from getting him into all kinds of day-to-day trouble in light of their discovery of his impending fortune.

 

What We Need To Get Started

We are looking for a funding of $45,000 to get our pilot film production rolling.

These donations will be used for the expenses of: Cameras and filming equipment. Lighting and sound equipment. Film and audio editing software. Props and costumes. Filming permits. Cast and crew paperwork. Location rentals.

Risks & Challenges 

The project being filmed is a pilot episode; meaning that there is risk that a network may choose to not pick it up or with all of its original components. However, we are very confident in our project and are aiming at more than one programming network. We expect to be fought over once production is completed. In the unlikelyhood that  the show is not picked up all by one of our targeted providers, it will be formatted into a web series and all contributors will be notified of the change.

Those who contribute will have up to date information about the show's progress. Large contributers will recieve credit as an associate producer once production is finalized.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If not financially able to help, you can help a lot by spreading the word about this campaign. Thank You.

story:
Short Summary

  • Ellevan is a world record holder, Freestyle Master, Music Producer and Vocalist and as you'll see soon, one hell of a unique performer. 
  • In 2018, he and his team released 365 songs with music videos, as well as shot this live special with some of Toronto's finest musicians, by the way, it is completely improvised*. 
  • We want to build an actual 'Special' experience around the songs made that night. Similar to Flight of the Conchords episodic brilliance.
  • This is a life line to a larger vision and purpose. A statement of trusting flow. We've dumped everything into this. You're the string of hope to completion. 
  • A lot of amazing people came together to manifest this night and event. We have brands and people who gave their time for the sake of this art to thank for bringing it together against much odds at the time. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5000 to push this thing to where it needs to be. Not only to win over popular streaming platforms like Netflix, Prime, etc. but to give this unique type of content the boost it deserves.
  • Works include: Editing, Special Effects, Additional shots, Locations, Sustainable Production and Writing time. 
  • Perks vary from executive producer roles / credits, to custom one-of-a-kind boxes and messages from Ellevan, directly. 
  • We have a flexible goal, so we'll still get a portion of our money, but after working the numbers, this is what we need. Although walking 50% of the road is better than walking none of it. We'll operate any way we can. And we greatly appreciate your support. 

THE SIZZLER TO THE SPECIAL!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1L8mm_KEQH4

The Impact

  • Ellevan is trying to prove that you don't have to plan everything. That Flow State will take care. Your contribution really makes a difference in getting this message out.
  • Ellevan crowd funded his first album, first tour, and now, his chance to bring his first live special to life is dependant on your generosity.
  • I'm a creative freelance, living and working, giving all I have to the craft. Your investment in me, is an investment in art. Let it flow right through.

Risks & Challenges

  • Ellevan and his team set a goal to release 365 music videos in 2018. Was it easy? no. Did they accomplish it? Absolutely. Did they also shoot this special during this time? yep.                                                  Things come up. We don't stop. You can trust you will get an experience.
  • Ellevan is the talent, producer, project manager and director, working solely with Darnell of MC2 Music Media and Shimon as lead audio supervisor to bring this to life. We need help. Your contributions allow us to focus and get this project done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Let's get the word out! Copy this URL and post it to your favourite social or text it!
  • Share this campaign with your rich uncle right now! Tell him what a nice boy Ellevan is.

<3 <3 <3
