story:
The Angry Elephant Productions

In 2013 our group was created in the hopes of building an organization that made content to represent everyone - a group that was culturally and socially aware and gave back to its community. 

Check out the video above to see some footage from our previous works. 

Today we're asking for your help- we're a growing organization, and to be completely frank we don't have much money to throw around. However we have a passion for creating, a hard working and talented team and stories to tell. But we cannot do it without you. 

Completing these projects will be a step forward for our team of growing artists, not only to make a name and a career for themselves but in giving them an opportunity to explore and refine their craft. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to collect $5000 to help us this year. With these funds we hope to complete from pre- to post-production, our series that is in progress; a narrative ridesharing series, 'Riding in Cars with Strangers'  following Emi Diaz, a young woman who's just moved to a new city, as she explores through rideshares with unique and sometimes zany characters.

Our perks range from early viewings, being credited on our narrative shorts and even an invitation to join us at a private screening! 

If we are not able to reach our final goal, the funds will still be put to the creation of our content- although it may take a tad longer to get out into the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you can't afford to donate, but if you are still interested in helping us- we always need more help. 

Whether you are offering use of your services as film crew, are able to donate snacks, loan equipment, help with permits or have any advice- it is all welcome, just please email us (check out our FAQs) if you are able to help, 

And the most help of all would be for you to SHARE! LIKE our posts! FOLLOW us on Facebook and Instagram! And remember to check out our YouTube channel!

story:
Here's the Tea

Hi everyone! I'm Jordyn Boscia, the creator & writer of End Of Day, thanks for visiting our page! With the immeasurable help of Matthew Zimmerman, director, and Ean Schultz, director of photography, our team is back and ready to produce another season of EOD. After meeting in college, friends that became collaborators began editing scripts, conceptualizing short films, and realizing shared goals - with pizza, beers, and too many Uber rides from Manhattan to Queens #LongDistance

This past spring our team shot and produced End Of Day: Season 1 in New York. The experience we each gained on the ground propelled us to developing another season, while building personal momentums by working on other projects, and once more realizing a shared goal of creating End Of Day: Season 2.

We Need Money to be Funny

Alright sharks, we're looking for $2,500 in order to produce this second season. In return, you'll be able to stream our full season for FREE on YouTube, and anywhere our mothers post on social media #ThanksMoms 

Here's a list of what your contribution will help cover:

  • Location rentals! Our show is about the theatre after all, so we will need to rent rehearsal studio space for shooting
  • Props! I got rid of my Norton Shakespeare because it was too heavy and well, we'll need another one, among various other items
  • Food! We'd prefer to not starve the talent
  • Transportation! We will be traveling to Lawng Eyeland for some shoots and we'd like to cover the cost of the good ole' LI double R train fare

What This Means to Us

For the same cost as an oat-milk latte, a happy-hour cocktail, or a single movie ticket, you can take part in the production of our series. We need the support of the community of creatives and viewers we're going to share this work with. Making a personal donation is how you can make an active choice in the kind of content you want to binge-watch while you pound takeout.

Other Ways You Can Help

Send our campaign to your mom's friend's dentist's cousin's nephew's camp friend & share our IndieGoGo page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or your Tinder! 

Thanks for reading! We appreciate you, yes you. 

Check out End Of Day Season 1: here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmpnxRVm8Bt5tM...

story:
Do you ever get the sense that powerful forces are actively working against you and your family, trying to implement an agenda that you don’t agree with?

I sure do, especially since I became a parent. Having kids made me realize just how toxic the culture is for children, and how many dangerous foes they have in the world.

The fact is, we live in an atmosphere in which we are constantly being sold products, taught ideas, and given commands that are bad for our physical, spiritual, psychological, relational, and emotional health. 

Becoming a parent also made me aware of just how hard it is to escape these messages and counter this assault. Indeed, it is almost impossible to protect my children from the barrage; in order to do so we would have to live off the grid in a cave somewhere. 

That hasn't been a viable option, so instead I have thrown myself into research. Who and what is behind these messages and products? And why do big political and corporate interests seem to push them so strongly? 

This project is the result.

It turns out that our sense is correct. There are nefarious forces at work, and there have been for a long time. The history of America is full of greedy and corrupt cultural gatekeepers who have used their money and power for their own gain, while trying to cover up the damage caused to the rest of us. 

We'll tell those hidden stores in this documentary-series, American Lies.

In doing so, we will show how Big Media, Big Pharma, Big Government, and Big Philanthropy have used fake science and propaganda to to undermine the Church, destroy the American family, and make us all sick. It's a tale that involves some of the biggest counterfeits, cons, and cover-ups in United States history. 

​--------------------------

"In doing so we will show how Big Media, Big Pharma, Big Government, and Big Philanthropy  have used fake science and propaganda to undermine the Church, destroy the American family, and make us all sick. It's a tale that involves some of the biggest counterfeits, cons, and cover-ups in United States history."

--------------------------

For example, we’ll look at the truth behind some of the people our history books set up as "heroes,” such as Alfred Kinsey, Margaret Mead, Hugh Hefner, and Helen Gurley Brown, as well as philanthropists such as such as the the Rockefellers, Bill Gates, and Warren Buffet.

We’ll examine pharmaceutical companies such as Merck and Searle, as well as the abortion giant Planned Parenthood.

And as we do we’ll see the extent to which these organizations and private individuals have made use of media propaganda and government corruption to further their nefarious ends.

Ends that include undermining Christianity, breaking apart the traditional family, selling us drugs they knew were harmful, and, of course, actually getting rid of large portions of the human population.  

We are not a healthy society. But the fact is, it's not entirely our fault. We’ve been sold a pack of lies, and as the truth is known, we can turn it around and put things right again. 

Please join me as we try to accomplish one small part of that task, and let’s get this series made. 

Thank you,

Don Johnson

About The Producer

Don Johnson is the founder of Runaway Planet Pictures and the president of Don Johnson Evangelistic Ministries. His two most recent projects are the feature length documentaries Unprotected and Convinced. Both are available on Amazon Prime and the Formed streaming platform. 

Here is a clip from Unprotected to give you a feel for the kind of stories we like to tell.
 
 

Potential Episode List

Here is the list of topics and stories we hope to cover in this series. They all involve lies that have kept us from living a flourishing, healthy life. (Some of these are fairly broad, so the coverage of any of the following may involve telling several smaller stories within the larger topic.) 

The Fake Scientists: Much of the sexual revolution was sold as "scientific." Researchers such Margaret Mead (Coming of Age in Samoa), Alfred Kinsey (Sexual Behavior in the Human Male and Sexual Behavior in the Human Female), and Larry Lader (Abortion) provided the supposedly objective facts that undergirded the arguments of the sexual revolutionaries such as Betty Friedan and led to decisions such as Roe v. Wade. However, the studies were all flawed, and often downright false. We'll tell several stories in this category. 

  • Click here to listen to The Fraud at the Foundation of the Sexual Revolution (The Story of Alfred Kinsey) on the American Lies Podcast
  • Click here to listen to Bill Gates and the Neocolonial Population Controllers on the American Lies Podcast

The Fake News Industry: Is it even possible to find objective news content anymore? Or is it all propaganda?

  • Click here to listen to The Master Manipulator (The Story of Edward Bernays) on the American Lies Podcast

Pleasure, Inc.: We'll look into the toxic relationship between certain companies in media, science, and pharmaceuticals to expose the lie that the hook-up culture is harmless and enjoyable for everyone.

Mature Audiences: Big pornography is widely accepted to be harmless adult entertainment. Here is story behind that lie.

The Divorce Industrial Complex: Kids are resilient and divorce is not a big deal, right? False.

The Meaning of Love: Where did we get the idea that marriage is whatever you want it to be? It wasn't from anything based in objective reality.

Made This Way: Where did we get the idea that gender and sexual orientation are whatever you want it to be? 

Choice or Child?:  The story behind the widespread acceptance abortion is one of outright deceit and propaganda.

The Hidden Consequences of the Pill: The contraceptive pill has been a disaster for women, psychologically, emotionally, economically, and physically. We'll tell that story, showing how the pill has led to everything from from depression to cancer.

On the Cover: The most popular career goal among young people today is to be famous. Not famous for being good at something, just famous.  How did it come to this?

Scam U.: The corruption on college campuses is out of control. Here's the story they don't want you know. 

Little Big Leagues: For hundreds of thousands of American kids, childhood now consists of what is essentially full time pro-style sports (or other scheduled extracurricular activities). Is this really what it takes to be fulfilled, and how did we come to believe that it is? 

A Tough Commute: The story of how the suburbs came to be seen as the pinnacle of the American Dream. 

No Alternative: The story of how Rockefeller and his descendants in Big Pharma destroyed the natural medicine industry and have lied to us about what it takes to stay healthy and cure disease.

Got Marketing?:  How food producers convinced us that consuming mass quantities of [insert food product here] is good for you, even when it isn't. (Also applies to products such as tobacco.)

Vaccine Chaos: The mass inoculation and immunization of the population for everything from mumps to HPV has had a boatload of buried consequences, often literally. There is a reason the government has paid out billions in damages; we'll uncover many of the hidden truths.

  • Click here to listen to Polio, Panic, and the Virus in the Vaccine on the American Lies Podcast

Color Blind: Where did some folks get the idea that America’s race problem has essentially been solved?

  • Click here to listen to The Bible Alone is Not Enough: How Protestantism Failed in the Face of American Racism, and Often Made it Worse on the American Lies Podcast 

With Liberty and Justice for Some: America is supposed to be fair. Our examination of the justice system will show you how far it is from its name.

Fake Faiths: The story behind some of the biggest religious hoaxes in American history, including the backstory on Scientology.

The Health and Wealth Gospel: The most popular theological trend in America is the belief that Jesus wants us to be rich. This is the story of how American Christianity flipped Jesus's gospel on its head. 

Hyperpluralism: We'll dig into American religious history to examine the idea that every religion is equal and that it doesn't matter where a particular faith came from.

When We All Get to Heaven: Where did we get the idea that everyone ends up in eternal bliss, no matter what kind of life they have lived?

The Budget

Right now we are just trying to raise enough money to get the first few episodes done; we know that these are tough economic times for many people. However, we also feel that in these times, getting the truth out is more important than ever, and that if we can get an some episodes done, that there will be plenty of momentum to keep getting them produced.

Other Ways to Help

Along with supporting this project with a donation, you can also help by praying and sharing it with as many people as possible. The lies are effective because they get spread so pervasively - it's time to do the same with the truth! 

Thank you!
story_txt:
Do you ever get the sense that powerful forces are actively working against you and your family, trying to implement an agenda that you don’t agree with?
I sure do, especially since I became a parent. Having kids made me realize just how toxic the culture is for children, and how many dangerous foes they have in the world.
The fact is, we live in an atmosphere in which we are constantly being sold products, taught ideas, and given commands that are bad for our physical, spiritual, psychological, relational, and emotional health. 
Becoming a parent also made me aware of just how hard it is to escape these messages and counter this assault. Indeed, it is almost impossible to protect my children from the barrage; in order to do so we would have to live off the grid in a cave somewhere. 
That hasn't been a viable option, so instead I have thrown myself into research. Who and what is behind these messages and products? And why do big political and corporate interests seem to push them so strongly? 
This project is the result.
It turns out that our sense is correct. There are nefarious forces at work, and there have been for a long time. The history of America is full of greedy and corrupt cultural gatekeepers who have used their money and power for their own gain, while trying to cover up the damage caused to the rest of us. 
We'll tell those hidden stores in this documentary-series, American Lies.
In doing so, we will show how Big Media, Big Pharma, Big Government, and Big Philanthropy have used fake science and propaganda to to undermine the Church, destroy the American family, and make us all sick. It's a tale that involves some of the biggest counterfeits, cons, and cover-ups in United States history. 
​--------------------------
"In doing so we will show how Big Media, Big Pharma, Big Government, and Big Philanthropy  have used fake science and propaganda to undermine the Church, destroy the American family, and make us all sick. It's a tale that involves some of the biggest counterfeits, cons, and cover-ups in United States history."
--------------------------
For example, we’ll look at the truth behind some of the people our history books set up as "heroes,” such as Alfred Kinsey, Margaret Mead, Hugh Hefner, and Helen Gurley Brown, as well as philanthropists such as such as the the Rockefellers, Bill Gates, and Warren Buffet.
We’ll examine pharmaceutical companies such as Merck and Searle, as well as the abortion giant Planned Parenthood.
And as we do we’ll see the extent to which these organizations and private individuals have made use of media propaganda and government corruption to further their nefarious ends.
Ends that include undermining Christianity, breaking apart the traditional family, selling us drugs they knew were harmful, and, of course, actually getting rid of large portions of the human population.  
We are not a healthy society. But the fact is, it's not entirely our fault. We’ve been sold a pack of lies, and as the truth is known, we can turn it around and put things right again. 
Please join me as we try to accomplish one small part of that task, and let’s get this series made. 
Thank you,
Don Johnson
About The Producer
Don Johnson is the founder of Runaway Planet Pictures and the president of Don Johnson Evangelistic Ministries. His two most recent projects are the feature length documentaries Unprotected and Convinced. Both are available on Amazon Prime and the Formed streaming platform. 

Here is a clip from Unprotected to give you a feel for the kind of stories we like to tell.
 

 
Potential Episode List
Here is the list of topics and stories we hope to cover in this series. They all involve lies that have kept us from living a flourishing, healthy life. (Some of these are fairly broad, so the coverage of any of the following may involve telling several smaller stories within the larger topic.) 
The Fake Scientists: Much of the sexual revolution was sold as "scientific." Researchers such Margaret Mead (Coming of Age in Samoa), Alfred Kinsey (Sexual Behavior in the Human Male and Sexual Behavior in the Human Female), and Larry Lader (Abortion) provided the supposedly objective facts that undergirded the arguments of the sexual revolutionaries such as Betty Friedan and led to decisions such as Roe v. Wade. However, the studies were all flawed, and often downright false. We'll tell several stories in this category. 

Click here to listen to The Fraud at the Foundation of the Sexual Revolution (The Story of Alfred Kinsey) on the American Lies Podcast
Click here to listen to Bill Gates and the Neocolonial Population Controllers on the American Lies Podcast

The Fake News Industry: Is it even possible to find objective news content anymore? Or is it all propaganda?
Click here to listen to The Master Manipulator (The Story of Edward Bernays) on the American Lies Podcast
Pleasure, Inc.: We'll look into the toxic relationship between certain companies in media, science, and pharmaceuticals to expose the lie that the hook-up culture is harmless and enjoyable for everyone.
Mature Audiences: Big pornography is widely accepted to be harmless adult entertainment. Here is story behind that lie.
The Divorce Industrial Complex: Kids are resilient and divorce is not a big deal, right? False.
The Meaning of Love: Where did we get the idea that marriage is whatever you want it to be? It wasn't from anything based in objective reality.
Made This Way: Where did we get the idea that gender and sexual orientation are whatever you want it to be? 
Choice or Child?:  The story behind the widespread acceptance abortion is one of outright deceit and propaganda.
The Hidden Consequences of the Pill: The contraceptive pill has been a disaster for women, psychologically, emotionally, economically, and physically. We'll tell that story, showing how the pill has led to everything from from depression to cancer.
On the Cover: The most popular career goal among young people today is to be famous. Not famous for being good at something, just famous.  How did it come to this?
Scam U.: The corruption on college campuses is out of control. Here's the story they don't want you know. 
Little Big Leagues: For hundreds of thousands of American kids, childhood now consists of what is essentially full time pro-style sports (or other scheduled extracurricular activities). Is this really what it takes to be fulfilled, and how did we come to believe that it is? 
A Tough Commute: The story of how the suburbs came to be seen as the pinnacle of the American Dream. 
No Alternative: The story of how Rockefeller and his descendants in Big Pharma destroyed the natural medicine industry and have lied to us about what it takes to stay healthy and cure disease.
Got Marketing?:  How food producers convinced us that consuming mass quantities of [insert food product here] is good for you, even when it isn't. (Also applies to products such as tobacco.)
Vaccine Chaos: The mass inoculation and immunization of the population for everything from mumps to HPV has had a boatload of buried consequences, often literally. There is a reason the government has paid out billions in damages; we'll uncover many of the hidden truths.
Click here to listen to Polio, Panic, and the Virus in the Vaccine on the American Lies Podcast
Color Blind: Where did some folks get the idea that America’s race problem has essentially been solved?

Click here to listen to The Bible Alone is Not Enough: How Protestantism Failed in the Face of American Racism, and Often Made it Worse on the American Lies Podcast 
With Liberty and Justice for Some: America is supposed to be fair. Our examination of the justice system will show you how far it is from its name.
Fake Faiths: The story behind some of the biggest religious hoaxes in American history, including the backstory on Scientology.
The Health and Wealth Gospel: The most popular theological trend in America is the belief that Jesus wants us to be rich. This is the story of how American Christianity flipped Jesus's gospel on its head. 
Hyperpluralism: We'll dig into American religious history to examine the idea that every religion is equal and that it doesn't matter where a particular faith came from.
When We All Get to Heaven: Where did we get the idea that everyone ends up in eternal bliss, no matter what kind of life they have lived?

The Budget
Right now we are just trying to raise enough money to get the first few episodes done; we know that these are tough economic times for many people. However, we also feel that in these times, getting the truth out is more important than ever, and that if we can get an some episodes done, that there will be plenty of momentum to keep getting them produced.
Other Ways to Help
Along with supporting this project with a donation, you can also help by praying and sharing it with as many people as possible. The lies are effective because they get spread so pervasively - it's time to do the same with the truth! 
Thank you!

story:
TaCen - The Active Christian Entertainment Network

The team at TaCen have a heart to show the love of Christ through Christian programming.  Programs will encompass shows for youth, teachers, artists, missions, Pastors, Bikers, feature films, mini-series, cooking and Bible study and many other shows that will help the people see that Christians can have fun. Programs to help your finances, programs for our seniors and all types of adventurous folks. 

The teams at Tacen have prayed about the programming for the network and are working really hard to put it together for the launch of the network. 

Tacen is looking forward to being a part of building the Kingdom.  The Lord Jesus Christ is first and foremost in everything we do at Tacen. Thank you for joining us in the venture.  We appreciate any donation but most importantly prayer for this important tool to minister the word of God through the visual and performing arts

We are in phase 1 of development

During phase 1 we need to raise $10,000 for the launch of TaCen - The active Christian entertainment network. 

Your Contribution

When you contribute to the network you are helping us spread the word of God and to show folks the love of Christ.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time.  Or if you do contribute.  We appreciate and honor your prayers.  Please share this with as many people as you can.  There is power in the share.  When you hit the share button you have a part in helping us spread the word of God through these TV shows.

story:
The ZoomRoom

Non ci siamo arresi, abbiamo continuato a lavorare seguendo le linee guida dettate da quel geniaccio di Theodore Roosevelt: "Fai ciò che puoi, dove sei, con quel che hai". Quindi, dato che eravamo tutti quarantenati, abbiamo deciso di fare una serie, restando ognuno a casa sua. E l'abbiamo fatta. Per primi.

8 episodi, con durata dai 12 ai 18 minuti, sono stati prodotti e pubblicati su Facebook a partire dal 25 marzo. E ne pubblicheremo altri due, entro il 1° giugno 2020, per chiudere la PRIMA STAGIONE.

Ma ora le cose stanno per cambiare: con l'allentamento delle costrizioni imposte dalla pandemia da Coronavirus, saremo in grado di dare vita ad una SECONDA STAGIONE. Vogliamo produrre 6 episodi da 25 minuti, con una qualità superiore, sempre nel rispetto dei protocolli da pandemia. Il primo step è quello di produrre il PRIMO EPISODIO della Seconda Stagione.

Ma non saremo più davanti ad una chat a casa nostra. No. Ci saranno scene in esterno, in auto, nei bar, negli uffici. Insomma, solite locations. E, ogni tanto, ci sarà qualche scena in chat, tanto per non perdere il legame con la stagione precedente.

Cosa ci serve. E perché.

Abbiamo bisogno di voi per un aiuto alla produzione del PRIMO EPISODIO della SECONDA STAGIONE. Ci servono mezzi (telecamera, microfoni, software, costumi, locations, oggettistica) di qualità superiore per offrirvi un prodotto di qualità superiore. È matematica.

Abbiamo fatto due conti, e possiamo farcela alla modica cifra di 2000 euro.

Questo progetto è molto importante per noi e, speriamo, anche un po' per voi. Rappresenta un segnale forte di coesione sociale, un esempio di cosa è possibile fare anche in mezzo a tante difficoltà.

La PRIMA STAGIONE che abbiamo prodotto e distribuito su Facebook ci ha insegnato tanto. I video degli episodi e quelli delle interviste agli attori sono stati visti per un totale di oltre 44.000 minuti, pari a 733 ore, pari ad una visualizzazione ininterrotta della durata di 30 giorni. Si può parlare di un discreto successo? Sì. E quindi ne parliamo.

La sfida e i rischi.

Raccogliere 2000 euro in questo momento, in Italia, è davvero una sfida difficile. Ne siamo perfettamente consapevoli, ma ci proviamo lo stesso.

Questa operazione di RACCOLTA FONDI è strutturata come FLESSIBILE. Vuol dire che, si raggiunga o meno l'importo richiesto, i fondi raccolti verranno comunque incassati.

E se si dovesse raccogliere davvero troppo poco?

Facile. Vi diciamo già da ora che la somma raccolta verrà utilizzata per pubblicizzare su Facebook la PRIMA STAGIONE già esistente, in modo da aumentare la possibilità che "qualcuno che conta" possa proporci una distribuzione televisiva o web (tipo Raiplay, Infinity, Now TV, ecc... E no, quell'altro nome non lo facciamo. Anzi, sì: Netflix).

Se non puoi donare nulla,

non importa. Sappiamo quanto sia duro questo periodo per moltissime persone. Davvero. D'altra parte, è stato duro anche per noi. Quindi ci basta anche solo il pensiero, un augurio o una condivisione di questa campagna di raccolta fondi sul tuo profilo Facebook, tramite Whatsapp o qualsiasi altro strumento di divulgazione.

Grazie di cuore,

The ZoomRoom Staff

story:
Episode 2: Landscape of Brutality

 

Series Overview

Executive produced by Black Lives Matter Cleveland, this documentary series will showcase the systemic failures of Ohio law enforcement across the state—one city at a time. The initial four-episode season explores police abuse in the city of Euclid, Ohio.  

Episode 1 is already complete and lays out the style and journalistic integrity which will define this project.  Episodes 2 – 4 are in various stages of post-production, with episode 2 slated for release in the final week of the campaign.

Season one thesis statement:

The culture of the Euclid police department is toxic both to the community it ostensibly serves and to the police officers who are shaped by it.

We are introduced to the STATE OF INJUSTICE series via a thorough investigation into the case of Luke Stewart, a young Black man who was killed by Euclid police shortly after being woken up in his parked car.

Episode two will be released on the eve of the fourth anniversary of Stewart’s killing, March 12th at 7pm, as a livestream screening and panel discussion. This installment exposes the commonality of aggressive tactics used by its majority White officers towards Black residents, as evidenced by the beatings of Lamar Wright and Richard Hubbard III.

The third episode will examine the racist roots of Euclid’s city government and policing in the context of the present-day experiences of young people of color living in the majority Black suburb. 

The season concludes with a thorough examination of what is and is not included in Euclid’s police training. In 2018, evidence of internal police training that made light of use of force was exposed in a lawsuit filed by the Stewart family. This documentary will reveal for the first time that in 2017 Euclid police hired the training services of controversial “Killology” expert, Lt. Dave Grossman.

The aggressive training that Euclid officers received was only half of the problem, though. The final episode will also highlight the legal research and analysis conducted by Mariah Crenshaw of Chasing Justice, LLC. Crenshaw’s investigation reveals a disturbing pattern of non-compliance with state training requirements for officers both in Euclid and in police departments across the state.

Any and all additional funds will be put towards the production of season 2 as we move just south of Euclid to examine some incredible examples of corruption and violent policing in the embattled city of East Cleveland. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our target is what we need to raise to complete season one within four months of the launch of this campaign. We are not beholden to corporate advertising dollars, which allows us to maintain our journalistic integrity. 

Up until now the filmmakers have donated their time shooting interviews and doing deep-dive research into the issues plaguing Euclid and other cities' police departments across the state.

Now we need funds earmarked for post-production to complete season one, create our interactive website and build a model for future episodes and seasons.  Sadly, there is no shortage of stories of police misconduct to report on. 

10% of all funds raised will go directly to Black Lives Matter Cleveland to support the important work they are doing in the community.  We aim to partner with BLM chapters around the state and the country for future episodes and seasons of STATE OF INJUSTICE.

The Website

We plan to make stateofinjustice.com a comprehensive supplement to the series. Visitors will be able to review research materials, legal rulings, and extended interviews. In addition to these resources, those moved to take action will find various ways to donate their time or money.

The Impact

  • Police corruption and violence towards Ohio’s Black and minority residents is an epidemic that needs to see the light of day.  Local news has largely failed to report on these issues adequately or without a pro-cop spin.  Our research lays it bare, warts and all, and challenges audiences to look at the true nature of an inherently racist institution.
  • Director Roger Glenn Hill is an award-winning filmmaker (Huckleberry (2018), Flying Paper (2014) and Struggle (2012)) Journalist Brian “BZ” Douglas has—in a short time—delivered scoops on corruption in Cleveland politics and police that have rippled all the way to the New York Times.  Black Lives Matter Cleveland has roots in the community and they have been at the frontlines of social change both in Cleveland and the state as a whole.
  • We delayed this funding campaign until we had an episode that is completely finished and displays the quality and integrity we plan to bring to all episodes of State of Injustice, it’s already real and has great potential for growth depending on the success of this campaign.

Risks & Challenges

We’ve mitigated some of your risk simply by waiting until we had a sample of a finished product to show, but there are always risks and challenges to overcome.

  • We’ve developed a team that has a track record of finishing what we start.  As experienced filmmakers, journalists and activists we know that the next challenge is always right around the bend. Fortunately our shared experiences have equipped us with the fortitude to overcome these challenges.
  • While our team is capable and talented we are currently stretched a bit thin, which is why we are always on the lookout for new blood to bring onto the project.  Ideally this series will employ a variety of directors, producers, editors and camera operators working together to produce gripping exposés of police injustice across the state of Ohio and regions around the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

We want this campaign to go viral.  Our reporting has already exposed issues that have NEVER been reported on in mainstream news.  We have our fingers on the pulse of police corruption here in our state and need folks like you to help us amplify this message.

  • Share the campaign on social media using Indiegogo’s share tools.
  • Volunteer to contribute to future episodes by reaching out to us.
  • Send us your hot tips of corruption in your town or city.

It takes a village to fight for justice.  We want you to join our struggle.

Volunteer to contribute to future episodes by reaching out to us.

story:
How might the world be different if all children learned to face social and emotional challenges with honesty and empathy?  Addressing this question in my storytelling and teaching has been my life’s work.  We want to share Stinky Tales with a wider audience, entertaining and empowering kids everywhere.

The Story Behind Stinky Tales

 

Our original songs are upbeat and engaging (not condescending), and carry the core message of each episode.  Like our stories, our music is both kid-friendly and music-lover approved.  

Clips from the Show

 

Parent Testimonials

 
Check out our photo gallery with pictures from behind the scenes, the making of our puppets, and more!
https://www.flickr.com/gp/138395841@N08/0hgsf4
 

With your help, we can take this modest beginning and produce our first season of Stinky Tales. Expenses include:

  • Video Cameras
  • Tripods
  • Lights
  • Green screen
  • Editing  
  • Audio Equipment
  • Art design/fabrication
  • Camera Operator
  • Production Assistant
  • Writing Assistant
  • Editor
  • Marketing  
  • Web Expenses
  • Business/Legal

Stretch Goals:

  • 3rd Camera
  • Larger Studio Space
  • Set Design/Construction
  • Additional Crew
  • Puppets “Rose” & “Oliver” are designed & ready to be built.
  • Additional Puppets are imagined & ready to design/build: “Rose” (Stinky’s little sister) and “Dagbert” (Dillard’s little brother).
  • Stinky Tales hand-puppets for children to be designed/built.
  • Merchandising
story_txt:
How might the world be different if all children learned to face social and emotional challenges with honesty and empathy?  Addressing this question in my storytelling and teaching has been my life’s work.  We want to share Stinky Tales with a wider audience, entertaining and empowering kids everywhere.
The Story Behind Stinky Tales


 
Our original songs are upbeat and engaging (not condescending), and carry the core message of each episode.  Like our stories, our music is both kid-friendly and music-lover approved.  

Clips from the Show


 

Parent Testimonials


 
Check out our photo gallery with pictures from behind the scenes, the making of our puppets, and more!
https://www.flickr.com/gp/138395841@N08/0hgsf4
 

With your help, we can take this modest beginning and produce our first season of Stinky Tales. Expenses include:

Video Cameras
Tripods
Lights
Green screen
Editing  
Audio Equipment
Art design/fabrication
Camera Operator
Production Assistant
Writing Assistant
Editor
Marketing  
Web Expenses
Business/Legal

Stretch Goals:

3rd Camera
Larger Studio Space
Set Design/Construction
Additional Crew
Puppets “Rose” & “Oliver” are designed & ready to be built.
Additional Puppets are imagined & ready to design/build: “Rose” (Stinky’s little sister) and “Dagbert” (Dillard’s little brother).
Stinky Tales hand-puppets for children to be designed/built.
Merchandising

story:
What is The Kings?

     "The Kings" is a dramedic (dramatic+comedic) original series that looks to redefine what it means to be Asian-American by starring two as compelling American leads. Seemingly every show or movie with an Asian character has focused on some part of their Eastern origins - whether it be through accent, cultural ties, or stereotypes. With "The Kings," we want to show that Asian-Americans are... Americans. Period.

     We are more than our good grades. We are more than our laundromats and dry-cleaners. We are artists and dancers and poets and lovers and athletes and painters and musicians and some of us have perfect American accents and some of us, admittedly, are poor drivers, but others are not, and all of us are more than the sum of these stereotypes. We and so many others cannot wait to express ourselves. To reveal to you our hearts and our souls. To live and laugh and love and die on the screen and the stage. Now is only the beginning.        

What is the money for? 

GOAL: $20K for 3 episodes (half-season)

STRETCH GOAL: $40K for 6 episodes (full-season)

     We have 6 episodes comprising Season 1 that we cannot wait to show you! But first, filming them is going to be expensive. While we're not making the next Mission Impossible (yet), the cost for quality work is high, and we are more than willing to invest for it.

     Your donations will help fund camera and equipment rentals, location/music/parking permits, our crew's wages, insurance, hair and makeup, sound, wardrobe, FOOD (sorry, caps), art design, post-production, and the actors! We have a wonderful cast and crew and want to thank them with more than just words - they deserve it. It's also important to us that we have zero wage gap between actors and actresses. Talent's pay will be determined on level of billing (extra, co-star, guest-star, series regular).

     I (chriskingwong) will not be accepting payment. This is my passion project - my goal is to get "The Kings" outside investing, into prestigious film festivals, and (hopefully) picked up. I'll gladly forego any daily rate to make that a reality. Part of production is saving all the money we can. The other is investing in top-tier cast, crew, and equipment. 

     Getting more granular on budget breakdowns is tough since every episode will range drastically in terms of required equipment, crew, and cast. Each episode is approx. 10-15 mins. long and we've estimated that a ~$7K budget per episode will be about the average required to film. What we CAN do is provide updates as we go into pre-production for our season and give inside scoops into what we're planning, how we're approaching, and an estimated timeline of deliverables. So much of this will be contingent on how much we raise - the more we receive, the more options we have available.

     We will be updating all of our backers throughout the duration of the campaign, immediately after it ends, and on regular time intervals thereafter (probably monthly). We don't want this to be a one-sided endeavor, so please share your feedback - this is a journey that we want all of you to take with us!

     Whatever you can donate is IMMENSELY appreciated. We've added some fun perks to the list to help spice things up, but every little bit counts. Money tight? Share with your friends! Money not tight? Give until it is, then share with your friends!

Meet the Team!

     Chris King Wong (co-lead|creator|writer|exec producer) is a Chinese-American actor with experience in both dramatic and comedic roles on stage and camera. His prior work has premiered at the Cannes Film Festival, CAAMFest, the Maine International Film Festival, the Asian Film Festival of Dallas, and accumulated hundreds of thousands of views on online streaming sites.

     He has undergone acting, vocal, and movement training at UC San Diego, the Beverly Hills Playhouse of SF, and with private coaches. He is currently represented by RPM Talent in LA, MDT Agency in SF, and Dream Talent Management.

     Anna Sun (co-lead) is a Korean-American actress, writer, and producer. She is starring in 2 different feature films slated to shoot this year, begins production for a short film she wrote in a few weeks called "Been Waiting," and runs the Beverly Hills Playhouse of SF as its Senior Stage Manager where she trains with Rob Zimmerman and Peter Allas. 

     She is currently represented by NYLO Model + Talent Agency.

     My-Hanh Lac (director) is a filmmaker with a passion for narrative drama.  My's work is influenced by her own life experiences, love for storytelling, and her drive to carve out a place for women in the male-dominated film industry. 

     Her first narrative short film "Budai" was featured in the 2017 Festival de Cannes Short Film Corner and premiered with an original score and live orchestra. In the Spring of 2018, Multi Storied Pictures selected My as the inaugural grant recipient for The Storied Screenplay Development Program. The grant will allow her to develop the script for her upcoming feature film, “Aye, Boy."

     YuMee Jang (exec producer) is an independent producer who, in the past two years, has produced three feature films! One of these films, "The Valley," has won 7 awards across domestic and international film festivals, including best drama in the Long Island Film Festival.  

     Prior to her role as a producer, she has served as a line producer, unit production manager, and assistant director on several SF & LA based network TV shows and feature films. YuMee has worked on films with micro budgets to multi million dollar projects. With years of experience as a Line Producer/Producer and a background in production, she has extensive knowledge when bringing a project to life.

        Alfonso Faustino (exec producer) is an actor and producer who has appeared in several films and television pilots. He was also the associate producer for a film called "A Beginner’s Guide To Snuff." He produced his first play, Brilliant Lies, through the Beverly Hills Playhouse and Firescape Theatre, where he also trains as a student under the tutelage of Rob Zimmerman and Peter Allas.

Risks & Challenges

     Creating a series is hard, let alone one that goes against the norm. There will undoubtedly be hurdles that we face during production, pitching, and, ultimately, as artists.

     What I can promise you is that I have never worked with a more dedicated, professional, passionate, and resilient group of storytellers. For those of you who have met us, I have no doubt you could attest. For those of you we haven't met, I hope that our passion and vision is palpable in every word, video, social media post, article, etc. We will be continuously updating you all via Indiegogo, social media, and our website. None of this is possible without your support.

Lastly.

     To every boy who has ever been told that they are not enough of a man, to every woman who has ever been fetishized, and to every Asian-American who has ever been made to feel less than, subservient, or otherwise degraded, let this story uplift you. Let this story be your voice. Let this story pave the way through laughter and joy, through kindness and empathy, and with love in our hearts.

     To all of the kings and queens out there, this story is for you.

All Hail,

The Kings

story:
What is "Anoraks" anyway?

A few years ago, we created the nerd web sitcom "Anoraks".  It is an affectionate look at sci-fi fans and fandom (at first, it was mainly Doctor Who, but we explore other types of television and movie franchises as well). As a creative team, we are all fans ourselves, so have first-hand knowledge of how warm, passionate, and often-times how ridiculous and obsessed fandom can be!

The creative team consists of Darren Floyd as head writer and series creator, (writer of three published novels and former head of an award winning horror publishing company), Ed Sinclair (award-winning documentary director) as director and co-writer, and Sian Floyd as producer. Through a combination of people’s generosity and talent, we managed to produce the first season of ten episodes, (each between 5 and 14 minutes), on a serious micro-budget where much of the financial investment came from ourselves and a handful of our wonderful friends.

The biggest news this year is the addition of a new cast member in the form of acclaimed stand-up comedian, Lorna Prichard, who will bring a new and younger voice to the Anorak's worlds of fandom.  With series two already feeling more expansive, more references to the wider SF and Fantasy worlds and we've also included a host of new secondary characters, and more guest stars dependant upon a bigger budget, so that we can attract professional cast and crew, and shockingly, pay them!


Your contribution will help us achieve our goal of producing a truly high-quality product. If you have already seen some of series one's episodes, then you know that we have tried to make broadcast type of stories on less than a shoe-string budget.  

Our team is mostly made up of experienced professionals who have come together to make something that they all find exciting, refreshing, challenging and worthwhile. There would be little point in making something that nobody watches, but the traffic on our website alone and the likes on our Facebook page, the comments and the re-tweets seem to have shown that indeed, we do have an audience out there and that we are working for them.

By getting involved in our fund-raising campaign, you have the chance to make sure we continue to bring interesting stories set in Cardiff to a worldwide audience. You will help us gain access to more resources through your financial support, and you will allow us to expand our team to better address the nature of these new and more complex scripts. Already we have designed a new website for the show, and a new logo too. That all came about because of previous investment from some of our closest friends, and their belief in us has been so greatly appreciated. By investing in our series two campaign, you too will ensure that the "Anoraks" legacy continues.

So what does Series Two look like so far?

As of the start of this campaign, we have written nine of the ten episodes and each episode will run approximately fifteen minutes in length, (which is more than most web series). Our initial intention to produce tight, quippy, and somewhat sarcastic 5-minute episodes failed as soon as series one began. Instead, we realised that our characters have a scope that not only should be explored but lives that needed to be explored. While comedy remains our first priority, we have also found that drama works incredibly well in our episodes too. How can you sustain the happy times without the bad times to give the happy times meaning? 


One thing in series one that we weren’t entirely satisfied with, was filming the convention episode. Facing other people's very tight schedules and commitments, and then filming guerrilla-style at a live event was indeed extremely tough, though we still very much appreciate everyone who helped us out and the willingness of the convention organisers and the hotel to aid us in any way. This year's batch of episodes once again crosses paths with a convention and instead of us showing up on the doorstep of an existing event, we have decided after much deliberation, to hold a one-day mini-event ourselves, so we can have some control over the schedule and allow time for our special guest stars to participate in filming. We've tentatively called it "NerdFest2018" and one of the contributor's perks to our fund-raising campaign is the chance to not only attend the event but to also attend a special cocktail party and meet our guests, the cast and crew!


Other perks include the opportunity to actually be in an episode - yes, we've written two small but surprisingly integral roles especially for contributors.  Other perks are signed shooting scripts of series one and two, specially pressed DVDs of the first and second series and exclusive merchandise including T-shirts, magnets and badges - this is a one-time chance for contributors to get in on the ground level and also bag one-of-a-kind collectables!

The last time we held a fund-raiser, we set a target goal and we nearly achieved it - we reached 92% funded. But because we also stipulated that the campaign was all-or-nothing, we sadly, ended up with nothing. This time, we've decided to hold an open fund-raiser. Our ambitious target of £9000 would be ideal to see this second series through by covering all our expenses and paying everyone in full to participate.   So, if we meet our goal this year, then series two will be like a well-oiled machine.

While the budget has been more concisely written, here is what we've basically allocated to each item line:

Main cast: £4000

Guest cast: £2500

Crew: £2000

Location expenses/permits: £400

Catering:  £100

The above total is very little if you think about shooting ten episodes and their associated rehearsal times, but this is what the campaign is aiming for. We've already decided to pay out of pocket for some item lines that you don't see here but that include: rehearsal space rental, rehearsal pay for the actors, a script supervisor, additional filming equipment, office supplies, additional catering, additional transportation. We also hope that by putting on a mini-con, we can raise funds to not only pay for the event itself, but also help offset any of our additional costs.

Why is your contribution so important to us?

We are not making television, we are making a web series. While doing so is quite freeing in terms of the lack of corporate creative control or other issues, what is most prominent is the lack of funding available to creative film-makers who engage with a web-based product. We have no access to license fees or broadcast funds, and we certainly have no access to arts council or film council funds because of the very nature of our project. Any help comes down to you, the audience.

Often geek and nerd culture has been used for easy laughs in the media, so this is an opportunity to own our world. Whether your geek poison of choice is Doctor Who, Marvel or Harry Potter, the culture of fandom and it's politics is a rich mine of comedy gold! As fans ourselves, what we want to do with "Anoraks" is to show to the world how warm and funny, but also how complicated such fan communities are and can be. What is it that drives a fan? What motivates someone to spend all their money and give all their time over to cult television shows and films? Can the same be said of sports fans or of music fans? Sure it can. And "Anoraks" is a self-reflexive look at not only the world of geek fandom, but also how it touches on those other worlds when sometimes those worlds collide (see what we did there? LOL!).

Series one has already proven that there is an audience out there for our type of web series. We'd like to expand that universe to give people more. Also we feel that audiences have invested in our characters by now and would like to see how their lives evolve and change. It is only natural in any on-going story, and believe us, our actors have their work cut out for them this year!

So, will you join us in helping make series two even better than the first series?

What's the point of giving money?

Throughout the planning and filming series one, we were faced with some unique challenges that at times felt like an uphill battle. There was the time in Episode 6 when we weren’t allowed to use a tripod in front of Ianto’s shrine in Cardiff Bay and were stopped by security who were sympathetic to our cause, and relayed our desire to acquire the proper permits to film, but alas, to no avail. The odd work-around though was to film about twenty feet away! But that meant we lost a key shot. Later in the series we weren’t as easily able to book actors and crew for specific filming days because they had to take paid work over our project. That said, we were eventually  able to film around their commitments but we also completely wrote off three otherwise viable scripts to accommodate the changes.

Any investment on your part, no matter how small, will help us to avoid such issues in the past. Indeed, we've already been in touch with the city of a Cardiff to sort out various location permits at our own expense. Who knew certain public spaces weren't so public after all? Well, we did actually, though guerilla-style film-making is really giving way to a more professional way of shooting, so we need to be just as professional in our approach to making this series.

With your help, we can do just that.

What else can I do to help?

We are essentially based in Cardiff, Wales, so all the cast and crew were either born in Wales or currently live and work here. We make no secret of the fact that we have deliberately set "Anoraks" in Wales either and we're proud to showcase the area and it's people. We've even started inserting the Welsh language into scripts, though we're not at the subtitling stage just yet!

If you would like to be a part of our journey, then why not contribute to the campaign? That is the first step towards making sure the series happens and happens well. If you live in the area, you may want to consider being an extra. We will be giving details of such opportunities on our website as we near production. And finally, please share this campaign with any one you think might be interested in the work we do.  Through word of mouth, (or even email), we can reach potentially thousands of like-minded individuals.

We have each of us, in the past, contributed to other fund-raising campaigns, so we all know the type of "ask" that we're seeking. And in each of those other cases, we felt it was for something unique, something that we truly believed in and something that we felt the greater world should see. We hope you feel the same about our project.

As fans ourselves, what we want to do with "Anoraks" is to show to the world how warm and funny, but also how complicated such fan communities are and can be. What is it that drives a fan? What motivates someone to spend all their money and give all their time over to cult television shows and films? Can the same be said of sports fans or of music fans? Sure it can. And "Anoraks" is a self-reflexive look at not only the world of geek fandom, but also how it touches on those other worlds when sometimes those worlds collide (see what we did there? LOL!).Series one has already proven that there is an audience out there for our type of web series. We'd like to expand that universe to give people more. Also we feel that audiences have invested in our characters by now and would like to see how their lives evolve and change. It is only natural in any on-going story, and believe us, our actors have their work cut out for them this year!So, will you join us in helping make series two even better than the first series?What's the point of giving money?Throughout the planning and filming series one, we were faced with some unique challenges that at times felt like an uphill battle. There was the time in Episode 6 when we weren’t allowed to use a tripod in front of Ianto’s shrine in Cardiff Bay and were stopped by security who were sympathetic to our cause, and relayed our desire to acquire the proper permits to film, but alas, to no avail. The odd work-around though was to film about twenty feet away! But that meant we lost a key shot. Later in the series we weren’t as easily able to book actors and crew for specific filming days because they had to take paid work over our project. That said, we were eventually  able to film around their commitments but we also completely wrote off three otherwise viable scripts to accommodate the changes.Any investment on your part, no matter how small, will help us to avoid such issues in the past. Indeed, we've already been in touch with the city of a Cardiff to sort out various location permits at our own expense. Who knew certain public spaces weren't so public after all? Well, we did actually, though guerilla-style film-making is really giving way to a more professional way of shooting, so we need to be just as professional in our approach to making this series.With your help, we can do just that.What else can I do to help?We are essentially based in Cardiff, Wales, so all the cast and crew were either born in Wales or currently live and work here. We make no secret of the fact that we have deliberately set "Anoraks" in Wales either and we're proud to showcase the area and it's people. We've even started inserting the Welsh language into scripts, though we're not at the subtitling stage just yet!If you would like to be a part of our journey, then why not contribute to the campaign? That is the first step towards making sure the series happens and happens well. If you live in the area, you may want to consider being an extra. We will be giving details of such opportunities on our website as we near production. And finally, please share this campaign with any one you think might be interested in the work we do.  Through word of mouth, (or even email), we can reach potentially thousands of like-minded individuals.We have each of us, in the past, contributed to other fund-raising campaigns, so we all know the type of "ask" that we're seeking. And in each of those other cases, we felt it was for something unique, something that we truly believed in and something that we felt the greater world should see. We hope you feel the same about our project.

story:
Short Summary

The award winning comedy web series Tales From Pussy Willow is back and needs your support to make season 3!

Tales From Pussy Willow is satirical sketch show for adult audiences exploring queer, feminist and absurdist themes. It takes the form of 2 – 3 minute animated episodes which each explore a different situation within the fictional British town of Pussy Willow. There is a recurring cast of characters, who bring the town to life and connect the episodes.

The pioneering animation style incorporates live action filming of actors’ heads shot against green screen, which are then composited on animated bodies in animated worlds.

The series just won Best Comedy and Best LGBTQ Series awards at the London Short Series Festival and has had a whole host of international nominations.

The BAFTA qualifying festival London Short Film Festival describes Tales From Pussy Willow as "A tonic for the Soul".

See what Diva magazine and the F-Word wrote about the series. 

“Kate’s works take difficult to digest topics and stylistically repurpose them to generate conversation and reflection, demonstrating the importance of art as a tool for change.”

What We Need & What You Get

The green screen footage with the actors has already been shot, all the post production magic now needs to happen creating the animation and compositing together.

Expect more killer lines and absurdity in Season 3 including first fully animated offshoot episode The Secret Lives of Lesbians Cats! Lots of the old characters are back including some guest appearances from Orgasm Unicorn!

So much love and enthusiasm goes into the production, which enables us to get things done at a fraction of the cost. But we still need £1000 per episode to bring it all to life. With six episodes in series three, that's £6000. You can help us get there!

The episodes waiting to be made are as follows:

It’s Not My Job

Dani’s simple request to get their form processed turns into a Heroes Journey to some unexpected places. May include guest unicorn appearance.

Queerer Than Thou

Who is the queerest of them all? This queer off will reveal all! Warning: may include vogueing karate.

The Secret Lives of Lesbians Cats

What do lesbians cats do all day? What do they really think about their owners? The Secret Lives of Lesbians Cats will reveal all!

Feed the Ducks

Misread the park signs at your peril. What do Pussy Willow ducks really like to eat? Warning: may include swearing ducks

The Land of Sorry

Frans gets trapped in a sorry force field on her way to the pub in a hidden part of Pussy Willow – The Land of Sorry

Flat Hunting

Anahita goes flat hunting but what will the estate agent have on offer? May include special guest cat appearance.

Expect videos from the cast and creator to be posted in the upcoming period with exclusive insight into the stories behind the episodes and anecdotes on filming. 

There’s a whole host of perks and rewards including signed artwork prints, a studio visit to see the work in progress up to executive producer!

Are you a business owner or own a brand? You may like the product placement perk where you can see your e.g. arts event, beer or company placed within the characters or environment

Meet the team

Writer/Director/Animator: Kate Jessop

Tales From Pussy Willow is the brainchild of award winning animation filmmaker Kate Jessop. Her work spans across narrative shorts, artists’ film and comedy web series. She has exhibited extensively internationally being showcased in festivals such as Raindance and Tricky Women and has undertaken artist residencies in Berlin, Istanbul and Reykjavik. She has represented the UK in the best of Women in Film and TV, was a Virgin Media Shorts Finalist and has global distribution deals with Shorts International and REVRY.

Animator: Leo Crane

Leo is an award winning animator and co-Founder of Figuration Ltd, a creative community for the figurative arts. He draws, paints, animates, and leads workshops and events. He graduated from Bournemouth University with MA (Distinction) in Computer Animation and an award-winning film for the London Library. He regularly collaborates with cultural and community organisations, including the V&A, The Hepworth Wakefield, British Library, Animate Projects, Pride in London and Dulwich Festival. He exhibits and sells his work, which now sits in private collections in the UK, Australia, Brazil and America.

Actor: Anna Maguire

Anna Maguire is a director, writer and actress. As an actor she has appeared on stage and screen, most recently finishing work on Kim Nguyen’s THE HUMMINGBIRD PROJECT, which premiered at TIFF in 2018 and played at the BFI London Film Festival. She attended the 2014/2015 CFC Actors Conservatory in Toronto, and has performed with the Old Vic, the BBC and 20th Century Fox.  Her directorial work has screened internationally, winning awards such as Best British Short Film at LSFF 2017 and Best Director at the BFI Future Film Festival in 2016.

Actor: Peyvand Sadeghian

Peyvand trained with the National Youth Theatre GB , and studied BA Drama & Theatre Arts at Goldsmiths College, University of London.   Credits include Offie nominated and 5* sell out show TURKEY by Frankie Meredith at the Hope Theatre in 2017, and Peoples Choice Award winner I HAVE A MOUTH AND I WILL SCREAM at Vault Festival 2018, and feature films 90 MINUTES (Simon Baker), and THE NUMBERS (Andrew Elias) due for release in 2019. She is currently an Associate Artist at Soho Theatre, and is receiving support from Popelei Theatre and Camden Peoples' Theatre in making her own show. Keep up to date via Twitter/Instagram @peyvandofpersia

Actor: Mikey O'Connor

Mikey O’Connor is a Anglo-American actor, voice over artist, musician and writer.   In theatre, he has appeared in the West End with the Reduced Shakespeare Company, the original London cast of Million Dollar Quartet, Howard Davies' production of Hay Fever as well as numerous national tours.  He has appeared in the films Pride, Messages and The Road To Guantanamo.  His Voice Over credits are numerous including Lego Marvel Super Heroes, Homefront 2, Xenoblade Chronicles 2 and Gladiators Of Rome. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute anything right now please spread the word on social media!

The Facebook page is:  https://www.facebook.com/talesfrompw

Follow Instagram for artwork updates @AnimationGirlBand

Creator Kate Jessops Twitter @katejessopfilm

story:
Why

My name is Kwaku El, I'm a convert to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, a BYU student, and a lover film, television, and italian sodas.

For the past two and a half years I've hosted a small talkshow called "Saints Unscripted" (formerly known as 3 Mormons) and it's been amazing! This was the first weekly Latter-day Saint talkshow by young people, for everyone. 

The show got a lot of criticism, and then a huge amount of praise. It was different than anything our culture has done before. People kept telling us how much they wanted more gospel centered media online. Mothers and Fathers excited that their children can go on youtube, and watch videos about the gospel, that don't feel like church. 

It made me realize we need more. We need more vlogs, sketches, interviews, music, short films, and devotionals made by young people, about the restored gospel of Jesus Christ. We need to use media in a relevant way; and it starts now!

The project will begin with one channel, and by February 2019, two active channels will be producing content. This campaign is the one to get us all going!

What We Need

Quality & Advertising are the MOST important parts of a media channel. We want each video to be high quality in regards to video, audio, writing, and editing. In today's incredibly competitive independent media world, only well made videos gain traction. The money used will go to the following:

Blackmagic URSA mini & Camera Lenses

Studio Lights

Tripod, batteries, and other necessities

Adobe Premiere Subscription 

Advertisement 

Payment to editors 

& More!

The Impact

This project is valuable due to the urgency of gospel centered content online. Content that can be as engaging and entertaining as secular media, but more hopeful, insightful, and spiritual.

Teenagers, young adults, and investigators often want to watch gospel centered media. Yet often times our church culture produces content that members call too serious, and too broad. With this new project we will be preaching the gospel in ways that keep people engaged, excited, and informed, while not feeling like Church. The amount of lives this could change is endless. The amount of seeds planted will be endless.

In 2018, media can be very hostile toward the church. People often misrepresent our doctrine, belittle our leaders, and throw different forms of prejudice our way; hoping to frighten investigators and damage testimonies. This channel will be a way to fight against that by reclaiming the narrative, and proudly stating our beliefs in a remarkable way.

Risks & Challenges

Challenge #1- Lack of exposure. 
One of the most difficult issues to overcome with media channels is the lack of exposure. With the budget we are seeking for, we will be able to advertise our way out of obscurity and gain momentum.

Challenge #2- Quality.
To have a successful media platform today, high quality is a necessity. The majority of our budget will be for the necessary equipment.

Challenge #3- Discipleship.
It's important to get christlike media at the forefront of attention, however we don't want to lose the message for popularity. Using President Kimball's 1977 Devotional, "The Gospel Vision of the Arts" as a foundation, we are confident in our ability to hold artistic integrity, use media literacy, and hold firm in the bounds of discipleship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute share this video on ALL of your social media!

If you can contribute, share this video on ALL of your social media!

You can donate to the paypal: kwakuelfilm@gmail.com

story:
First, what we do:

We (Tanner, Eric, and Nico) currently produce a storytelling podcast called the Legends Myths and Whiskey podcast. During each 60-90 minute episode we do three things:

  • Tell two stories, each from different cultures.
  • Discuss those stories and everything they make us think or feel.
  • Taste and review a whiskey throughout the duration.

In addition to this, our own in-house composer, Nico Vettese, creates original scores for each story. These scores are painstakingly produced to match the culture from which their stories originate; that includes the use of culture-specific instruments.

There are a lot of example on our Bandcamp page, here are fourteen of them: https://lmaw.bandcamp.com/album/stories-iii

We also create Mythosymphonies, which are like audiobooks with full musical scores and which focus on a particular culture's full pantheon or maybe one well-known story. Two examples are our Beowulf Mythosymphony and our Japan Mythosymphony.

We do what we do with a single goal in mind: Understanding leads to appreciation which leads to tolerance. We share stories from all over the world and all across history, and we do it because we want people to understand themselves and each other better. We're all different and we have different histories, but all of those histories are rich and interesting and if we can learn to appreciate our own and others, the world could be a better place.

What we need and what you get:

We need $20K. It will cover all of the following:

  • The construction of a new studio space in our new home (here's a rough design)
  • Physical equipment and digital licensing (here's a breakdown)

You're will get the following for your support:

  • Clear vinyl stickers
  • T-shirts
  • Recognition as a supporter
  • Permanent membership in our LMAW Insiders program
  • You could get flown to our studio for an on-site appearance
  • You could OWN a piece of Satyr Productions, LLC

 

Thanks for your support!

story:
An LGBTQ romantic comedy I wrote, directed and produced over 18 years ago. 

A Luv Tale is currently available on Amazon.

AND NOW I'M BRINGING YOU

Set in Harlem, A Luv Tale: The Series continues to examine love and friendship between four lesbians navigating their fascinating lives through a world of art, music and fashion. With wit and humor our characters face the challenges within the LGBTQ community and life itself: equality, diversity, inclusion, transgender issues and love.

Filmed with an entirely new cast, A Luv Tale: The Series will feature fresh new talent, with cameo appearances by some of the original cast members from A Luv Tale: The Movie.

We will hold screenings and panel discussions across the country to give an opportunity for LGBTQ voices to be heard.

We are seeking funding for the first 8 episodes of our web-series, a promotional tour and screenings in select cities.

Indiegogo is one of the best ways to offer YOU -- friends, family, supporters and members of the LGBTQ community an opportunity to be a part of creating content that is not only entertaining but also important. A Luv Tale: The Series, preserves, promotes and celebrates the richness of this diverse community.

Here’s how you can get involved, and the rewards for your contributions.
