story:
Plot Summary

Nate Sheridan has been spinning his wheels at a mediocre job for years. As his fortieth birthday looms on the horizon, he has started to wonder if he'll amount to anything more. But the Darkness is rising, and Nate's about to learn that his past and his future have something incredible in store. Supernatural forces are on the rise in the streets of Chicago, and destiny always gets its way.

 

Production - Phase One

The first step in the process is a proof-of-concept "mini-pilot," featuring three our lead characters and a few guest stars to give investors a taste of "Foretold" and where it's heading. 

Your support for this part of the process will go cover the following expenses:

  • Paying cast and crew ($1,700)
  • Specialty staff with experience in film combat and creature makeup ($830)
  • Meals and craft services on set ($1,560)
  • Camera and lighting equipment rental ($4,000)
  • Other categories include marketing, insurance, locations fees, and more

You can click here for a detailed breakdown of this mini-pilot's expenses.

 

Post Production and Submissions

The initial "mini-pilot" will be submitted to festivals and to investors and production companies to garner interest in the target markets for our piece. The next step is to complete the show's full pilot for submission to the New York Television Festival for 2020.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any film project, there are no guarantees of success, but with a strong team and a great story, we believe we have a recipe for success. We're pulling together a fantastic collection of people in front of and behind the camera that represent the vibrant voices of Chicago's finest talent. "Humane Resources," also created by Shaun Baer, was included in several festivals and received critical acclaim. With the lessons learned from "Humane Resources: Season One" our team is confident we're developing a series that people will be clamoring for.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar gets us that much closer to producing this show. But, if you're not able to contribute financially but would love to see this story come to life, you can still help out!

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family
  • Get the word out on social media
  • If you're "in the biz" and want to get involved, reach out to us and let us know

Learn More

Visit our website to learn more about the cast and crew, and for updated on our progress. You can also check back here as the campaign continues. Thank you for supporting "Foretold."

NOW LET'S GO SAVE THE WORLD!
story_txt:
Plot SummaryNate Sheridan has been spinning his wheels at a mediocre job for years. As his fortieth birthday looms on the horizon, he has started to wonder if he'll amount to anything more. But the Darkness is rising, and Nate's about to learn that his past and his future have something incredible in store. Supernatural forces are on the rise in the streets of Chicago, and destiny always gets its way. Production - Phase OneThe first step in the process is a proof-of-concept "mini-pilot," featuring three our lead characters and a few guest stars to give investors a taste of "Foretold" and where it's heading. Your support for this part of the process will go cover the following expenses:
Paying cast and crew ($1,700)
Specialty staff with experience in film combat and creature makeup ($830)
Meals and craft services on set ($1,560)
Camera and lighting equipment rental ($4,000)
Other categories include marketing, insurance, locations fees, and more
You can click here for a detailed breakdown of this mini-pilot's expenses. Post Production and SubmissionsThe initial "mini-pilot" will be submitted to festivals and to investors and production companies to garner interest in the target markets for our piece. The next step is to complete the show's full pilot for submission to the New York Television Festival for 2020. Risks & ChallengesAs with any film project, there are no guarantees of success, but with a strong team and a great story, we believe we have a recipe for success. We're pulling together a fantastic collection of people in front of and behind the camera that represent the vibrant voices of Chicago's finest talent. "Humane Resources," also created by Shaun Baer, was included in several festivals and received critical acclaim. With the lessons learned from "Humane Resources: Season One" our team is confident we're developing a series that people will be clamoring for. Other Ways You Can HelpEvery dollar gets us that much closer to producing this show. But, if you're not able to contribute financially but would love to see this story come to life, you can still help out!
Share this campaign with your friends and family
Get the word out on social media
If you're "in the biz" and want to get involved, reach out to us and let us know
Learn MoreVisit our website to learn more about the cast and crew, and for updated on our progress. You can also check back here as the campaign continues. Thank you for supporting "Foretold."NOW LET'S GO SAVE THE WORLD!

story:
Short Summary

We started Chick-a-BOOM! TV because we have been unable to find fun, informative, and entertaining video programming for women in the outdoors. We decided it was time for us to step up and do something about it. 

Instead of just a pre-taped video format, we opted for a conversational approach that allows us to live stream our shows on FaceBook so that you, our audience, can participate in the discussion with our panelists by posting your comments and questions throughout the show. We can then bring your voice into our live discussion with our panelists. We want to hear from YOU! 

After the live show, the video continues to be available for viewing in perpetuity on YouTube and through other avenues. The show is approximately 45 minutes long. 

The visual style of our program is a bit of a mash-up akin to “The View, meets The Ellen Show, meets Outdoor Magazine.” 

We deliver content that is educational, relatable and adventurous in a raw, entertaining format that resonates and motivates.  The destinations and disciplines will be diverse in nature, from mountain peaks, to high waves to crag climbing, if it happens in Mother Nature, we’re discussing it with you on CHICK-A-BOOM! TV.

The panel of anchors and guests rotates depending on topic with no more than 5 panelist with the core team being Cyndi Wyatt and Marilee Valkass. As the audience base grows, we will incorporate field reporting in diverse locations.

Through the perspective of women, CHICK-A-BOOM! tv leaves the audience with a simple message.  Ignite the fuse to your adventurous lifestyle.   

Our current goal is to product one 45 minute show per month live streaming on FaceBook and then posted to YouTube for subsequent viewing.  

Our first two episodes were produced with the generosity of ButcherBird Studios, but they can't work for free forever. With our proof of concept more or less achieved, we are ready to launch Chick-a-BOOM! TV into a financially viable endeavor by soliciting subscriber and sponsorship support. But we need your help now to help us maintain our momentum while we furiously work to make this happen. We need to bridge the gap!

To learn a little bit more about us, read on. 

MEET OUR PANEL

Cyndi Wyatt: Creator, Producer and Host

Cyndi lives by the mantra, Engage. Exert. Evolve.  Engage your mind in nature, exert yourself beyond your comfort zone and evolve into a better self.  She is a locally known and accomplished ultra-runner, having completed 33 ultra racers, seven of them 100 mile distances. She is an REI Outdoor School Field Instructor, Fitness Ambassador and Sales Lead.  In her spare time she engages the community in non-competitive trail running and backpacking adventures.  She is the first female to be the recipient of the 2016 Mark Fulton Award given at the 8,000-meter challenge, and is a LOWA Boots, Rinse Soap Co. and Vital4U ambassador. Mother of three, Cyndi turned to ultra-running as her source of empowerment. She is committed to leaving a legacy of empowerment in the outdoors, to inspire other women to overcome life’s obstacles.

 

Host: Marilee Valkass: 

Marilee has spent most of her life pursuing, creating and sharing adventure. From her earliest years, she spent weekends and vacations camping, hiking, backpacking, biking and skiing with her dad. 

Her passion for adventure continues to dominate her adult life as she has immersed herself into mountain biking, mountaineering, backcountry skiing, trekking and bike touring in foreign countries. 

She thrives on challenging herself in new and familiar outdoor pursuits such as mountain bike and adventuring racing, peak bagging challenges, skydiving, paragliding, via ferratas, river rafting, SUPing, cross country and skate skiing. 

Marilee finds her greatest joy in sharing adventure with others. She is an outdoor educator for REI Co-op, an Adventure Coach and a dedicated student of all things outdoors. 

Co-Host: Saveria Tilden

Sharing her love of the outdoors with others is Saveria’s passion and career. Saveria owns her own company, The AdventurUs, and works as a marketing strategy and strategic partnership consultant with companies and organizations committed to connecting people to the outdoors. Saveria has also worked for REI Outdoor School as an Instructor, teaching a variety of classes including kayaking, SUP, biking, rock climbing, map and compass/navigation, hiking, backpacking and more. Educating and empowering others to have fun and be safe in the outdoors is a priority. Her volunteer efforts include being a member on the Board of Directors for the American Hiking Society and a backcountry trip leader with the Sierra Club Angeles Chapter. She is certified as a Wilderness First Responder, Leave No Trace Master Educator & AMGA SPI Climbing Guide.  You can learn more about Saveria and her adventures at www.TheAdventurUs.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help producing episode three.  This idea came to me 2 years ago, but didn’t pursue it because I envisioned it produced professionally, like you can see in episode 1 and 2.  That’s because Butcherbird Studios and namely Jason Milligan, believed in our message and donated their time and resources to make this vision a reality.  It takes a (6) person crew and thousands of dollar’s worth of equipment to give us the look and flawless streaming you deserve.  Your donation will help us produce episode 3 in front of a live audience at the REI – Burbank location.

We have the extreme gift to film episode three at REI – Burbank inside their community room with a LIVE audience.  We are bringing in Wendy Engelberg  Girlz Gone Riding Director.

The benefits to you are:

The top 50 donations that live in the Los Angeles area can be a part of our live audience!

Meet in person our special guest; Wendy Engelberg, Director of Girlz Gone Riding 

If you don’t live in the area, you can still participate on Facebook live. 

We want to continue to bring your fresh content and sponsorship coupons and prizes.

We want to bring you t-shirts that scream “Chick-a-BOOM! Tv”, and share pictures of your rocking them at mountain tops and down in the valleys!

We want to meet you on the trails.

The benefits to Chick-a-BOOM! Tv are:

Your contribution pays for Butcherbird Studios.  

We need the 6 person team during our live show and moving all the equipment to REI for the day will be a full day’s of work.

It gives us three episodes to pull from to make a well-rounded marketing piece for investors.

We need $2,000 to make Episode 3 look as professional as the previous episodes.

This is our first step at bringing you closer to the confidence you should feel outdoors. 

The Impact

Mother Nature offers grounding, empowerment, strength (physical and emotional), peace, confidence, and clarity.  Women benefit from all of these attributes Mother Nature offers, but we’re still afraid, suppressed, or because of our obligations to our family, don’t feel we have the time to enjoy these activates.  We can tell you, we NEED to explore, seek, wander, summit, and sweat, because when we do, we SOAR!  Not only at home are we more calm and happy, but in the workplace we are strong and confident.

Let’s step outside together.

  • Whether you are just acknowledging your craving for adventure or want to take your adventure to a higher level.  We can take you there!  No questions are too trivial, too personal or too crazy sounding to us.  We love it all and are inspired by you too. Let’s ignite the fuse to this outdoors discussion movement.  

Risks & Challenges

The leaders on this panel have committee their lives to empowering women. Our knowledge is valuable and we’ll never stop being their for you.

Commit the dollar amount that you feel comfortable with.

Base the donation $ amount on the information and entertainment value you got out of watching the first (2) episodes.  

Audio books cost $20+  

A risk is, if we don’t make our dollar goal and can’t pay the studio to produce the quality you’ve seen in the past two episodes.  If this happens, we are committed to bringing you a show, via GoPro live, on Facebook.

We have so much more entertaining knowledge from a women’s perspective to offer you, help us so the audio is clear, the messaging is clear and we can expand to field reporting as well and bring in leaders in the industry. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us create a following.  

Share this Indiegogo campaign with friends and let them know why it’s important

Watch the show April 23rdon FB, 6pm PST

Interact with our panel

“Like” us, “Share” us ( https://www.facebook.com/groups/279703359595456/)

Thank you

story:
First and Foremost:

At this time, we are not releasing too much information on the show due to the possibility of infringement from external sources.  More details will come as we progress.

What We Can Tell You:

Paranormal Studies will be a revolutionary show that will educate and entertain everyone.  The show is being made by paranormal researchers for paranormal researchers.  This will be 100% real with no frills and no jump scares.  The entertainment will still be there due to subject matter.  Being completely different than any show out there.

 Our goal is to film a total of 8 episodes this year.  Those episodes, after completion, will then be subjected to network television.  As a fall back, we have an option readily available.  So regardless, this show will be seen.  It will be out there for viewership.

We are talking to a couple highly regarded figures in the paranormal community to help us with this show.  To what level remains to be seen.

Who Is Involved?

The show is going to be produced by David Glidden.  He is a paranormal researcher of 13+ years.  He also has two documentary films out and another web series under his belt.

Helping with filming will be Richard Rose.  A film school graduate of Full Sail University, Richard also has experience within the paranormal field.

Helping us out as an episode coordinator is Dan Williams.  Dan has been involved in paranormal research for 20+ years.  His methodology and unique data collection is the foundation to the Paranormal Research Institute.

Throughout each episode there will be appearances and participation by various individuals whom will be named later.

Our Goal:

The goal of this show is to bring the paranormal field back to legitimacy.  Keeping it's focus on research and education, we think this show is the missing link in reality tv.  

Why We Need You!?

Creating a show of this magnitude and caliber unfortunately takes capital.  Those who know, nobody makes money being a paranormal investigator.  To bring people what they want and need to see does and will cost a lot of money.  Being that we are individuals and not a major production company, the funding starts with us but we cannot do this alone.  Although the goal amount seems lofty, it is a fair amount due to the production costs of each episode.  YOU are the glue that will keep this show alive!  Be the reason behind the future of paranormal reality television!

Social Media:

FACEBOOK

story:
As artists who work in projects we believe in, the costs of a large expansive animation studio setup are difficult to meet. This poses itself as a hindrance for us in reaching our dreams. In order to counter this, we have started a small studio setup; wherein we handle more and more projects virtually, making it an affordable option for quality work.
This studio is primarily made for service projects.

In the last five years, even since this studio’s inception; we have added some worthy service projects to our portfolio. However, ever since the competition is ever rising and awareness is limited due to our resources, we are facing challenges in order to keep stability for our employees. Our remote employees do not have any consistency in terms of workflow and the working capital also gets compromised due to this. The team that works on projects consists of core animators, artists and technicians who have done impeccable work in the past fourteen years. With their expertise shadowing the studio, we are managing to deliver quality. However, we are being tied up due to lack of required resources.

This is when we realized, that we wanted to take it a notch ahead. Generating more employment is necessary on a local and global level, but in today’s digital age, even targeting global audience is not a big challenge. Hence, our idea of IP animated TV series project simultaneously while working on the development of this platform has given us a base to resume our dream. We are currently stuck with a project, but with your help, another animation masterpiece is surely going to reach a step closer to its completion.

What We Need ?

As of current progress, we have completed a Show Pitch Bible and even created the Title Promotional Theme song for Mr. Buddy. We would be very grateful,if fellow passion animation lovers such as you could help us with 2D animation visual development. At the moment our skill base is met with.We just require funding to complete our project. Additionally, our hardworking team needs to be rewarded monetarily.So,to keep the project on we need our compositors, animators,Creative Director, Art director and even visual developers to have some compensation. We basically need a little support so this dream gets out of the pipeline and realizes in the animation realm.

Recorded Title Song(Full Version):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q-7yBMHtICg

Studio URL :

www.inventorheads.com

About Project Overview :

Story Line :

Buddy believes in making every day look magical! But his inventions will not be enough to explore the historic past of his hidden precious thing.

With his inventive tricks, he manages to win any race and with his grit and determination,he is battling all the evil hurdles that await on his way to the precious thing

Show Synopsis :
In the world of treasure hunters , there has never been a hunt that is so
exhilarating and challenging . And a challenging hunt needs an equally dynamic
Hunter. No magic tricks, no superpowers, with his sharp mind and resourceful
inventions, Buddy believes in making every day look magical! But his inventions
will not be enough to explore the historic past of his city's hidden treasures.
So,Join Buddy on a journey to explore a hidden past of India like never before.
From the high walls of ancient forts to deep dark corners of caves, from creating
automated skateboards to bike racing, Buddy is on a mission to being back the
lost pride and dignity for his city and to bring back a treasured item that many
have tried to hunt.With his inventive tricks, he manages to win any race and with his grit and
determination, he is battling all the evil hurdles that await on his way to the
treasure.

Here's Brief About Project Development Info

                                 

Mr.Buddy :

Buddy is 13 year old boy living in City. Curious eyes and a mischievous smile,Buddy is like any other 13 year old boy who is always up for an adventure. Buddy however is also very very smart , unlike other kids he is not smitten by new gadgets. He loves to make his own new gadgets and invention, especially with old scrap items. This is his favorite hobby . He is optimistic and approaches every challenge with a positive approach.

 

Vanz (Buddy Mom) : Buddy's mother is a 33 years old smart woman who is mostly seen running the cafe . Unlike her husband ,who is handling the kitchen operations, she is the front office and hence always looks presentable.She is a typical cosmopolitan mother who wants to work as well as dotes on her son and is quite a multitasker. She is the positive one in the family and always encourages Buddy for adventures. She agrees with Buddy's father on bringing up Buddy in a humble manner and not spoil him with gifts.She wears comfortable kurtis and pants , has the typical wheatish skin tone and long hair. She is strict yet extremely loving towards Buddy.

Ashu (Buddy Dad) :

Buddy's Father (Mr. Reddy) - Buddy's father is Mister Reddy a 36 year old man running a
cafe in the middle of Charminar. unlike, other in Charminar who are running a dhaba or   restaurant, Buddy's father has opened a cafe where most young eaters and foreign tourists
visit.

All Character Designs:

Primitive Visuals :

 

Risks & Challenges

Due to unpredictable factors such as factory production and shipping time, some rewards may be delayed and all the products are susceptible to changes.
Some packages may get lost or held in customs. All the delivery dates are an estimate.
That being said, we'll minimize the risks by keeping a buffer for the inventory and the shipping time.
We will also keep backers updated on this page if any problem should arise.
For any inquiries or questions contact us at vanikalvala@inventorheads.com
We'll be grateful for your patience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute yourself (we get it!) - you'd be doing us a great service by simply sharing it and encouraging your friends to share it.  Seriously, please do this if you are reading this sentence with your eyeballs

No magic tricks, no superpowers, with his sharp mind and resourcefulinventions, Buddy believes in making every day look magical! But his inventionswill not be enough to explore the historic past of his city's hidden treasures.So,Join Buddy on a journey to explore a hidden past of India like never before.From the high walls of ancient forts to deep dark corners of caves, from creatingautomated skateboards to bike racing, Buddy is on a mission to being back thelost pride and dignity for his city and to bring back a treasured item that manyhave tried to hunt.With his inventive tricks, he manages to win any race and with his grit anddetermination, he is battling all the evil hurdles that await on his way to thetreasure.
Here's Brief About Project Development Info
                                  
Mr.Buddy :
Buddy is 13 year old boy living in City. Curious eyes and a mischievous smile,Buddy is like any other 13 year old boy who is always up for an adventure. Buddy however is also very very smart , unlike other kids he is not smitten by new gadgets. He loves to make his own new gadgets and invention, especially with old scrap items. This is his favorite hobby . He is optimistic and approaches every challenge with a positive approach.

 
Vanz (Buddy Mom) : Buddy's mother is a 33 years old smart woman who is mostly seen running the cafe . Unlike her husband ,who is handling the kitchen operations, she is the front office and hence always looks presentable.She is a typical cosmopolitan mother who wants to work as well as dotes on her son and is quite a multitasker. She is the positive one in the family and always encourages Buddy for adventures. She agrees with Buddy's father on bringing up Buddy in a humble manner and not spoil him with gifts.She wears comfortable kurtis and pants , has the typical wheatish skin tone and long hair. She is strict yet extremely loving towards Buddy.

Ashu (Buddy Dad) :
Buddy's Father (Mr. Reddy) - Buddy's father is Mister Reddy a 36 year old man running acafe in the middle of Charminar. unlike, other in Charminar who are running a dhaba or   restaurant, Buddy's father has opened a cafe where most young eaters and foreign touristsvisit.


All Character Designs:

Primitive Visuals :


 


Risks & Challenges
Due to unpredictable factors such as factory production and shipping time, some rewards may be delayed and all the products are susceptible to changes.Some packages may get lost or held in customs. All the delivery dates are an estimate.That being said, we'll minimize the risks by keeping a buffer for the inventory and the shipping time.We will also keep backers updated on this page if any problem should arise.For any inquiries or questions contact us at vanikalvala@inventorheads.comWe'll be grateful for your patience.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute yourself (we get it!) - you'd be doing us a great service by simply sharing it and encouraging your friends to share it.  Seriously, please do this if you are reading this sentence with your eyeballs

story:
About This Series

This story brings you into the harsh world of inner-city LGBT+ youth that many don’t know exist.  From homelessness to bullying to suicide, we give you a glimpse into these delicate lives in an effort to bring light to their stories.  You’ll also get to see why the types of organizations depicted in this series are very much needed in minority communities, although they are not widely accessible.

 

Why This Series Matters

The depiction of LGBT+ people in film is often controlled by Hollywood and seldom gives you a glimpse into the lives our urban minority members of the LGBT+ community.  There is a growing need to help normalize what it means to be gay in society as the impact is detrimental:

  • A pathology exists within black and other minority populations where LGBT+ teens, pre-teens, and young adults are being tossed out of their homes, attacked, bullied, exploited, and even killed.     
  • Gay and lesbian teens are 4 times more likely to commit suicide and transgender teens are 10 times more likely to commit suicide.
  • 43% of homeless people who use shelters and drop-in centers in the United States identify as being LGBT+.
  • Each episode of LGBT+ victimization, such as physical or verbal harassment or abuse, increases the likelihood of self-harming behavior by 2.5 times on average.

In other words, this matters because lives are at stake and their stories often go unheard. As a member of the LGBT+ community (Jimmy) and good-standing members of the human race (my non-LGBT+ team), we feel obligated to do what we can to bring awareness to these very important issues and to treat them fairly and respectfully.

 

Working with Taskforce

The community center depicted in this series pays homage to a wonderful organization I became aware of just a few years ago, though they have been on a goodwill mission helping LGBT+ youth and anyone else for many years.  Founded in 1990, Taskforce Prevention and Community Services provides HIV and STI preventative services, education, mentoring, and care to the African American community while provide a safe space for disenfranchised adolescents and young adults who live in communities with limited resources…the majority of whom identify as LGBT+.  Taskforce is also an avid supporter of the Chicago Ballroom scene. We have been fortunate enough to work on film/media projects with this organization dealing with violence prevention, HIV and STI education, domestic violence, and more.

As a key component of the mission of this series, we look to forward to conducting workshops with the young patrons served by Taskforce to review the series’ scripts and get input on the difficulties of growing up in minority communities with limited resources and often poor regard for the LGBT+ community.  We are also excited to have solicited the acting skills of some of these young people for our series with plans to include even more.  It is important that we treat their stories carefully and pay them fairly for their time and efforts. 

 

Filming is Expensive!

The cost of producing this series is approximately $7,000 per episode.  We have a flexible goal of $35,000 to record the next 5 episodes in this series spread over 33 days of filming.  If we are fortunate enough to get more, we will add more exciting and much needed episodes.  Though the scope of this series has a broad and important impact, we are keeping our costs down thanks to our filmmaker’s extensive experience with corporate project management and corporate video production. 

Our production expenses include film equipment rentals and acquisitions (lenses, sound, lighting, stabilization, etc.), cast and crew pay (feature and background actors, director, cinematographer, production team, sound recordist, grip, make-up and wardrobe, etc.), transportation and travel, craft services, insurance, location fees, film permits, post production (editing, color correction and grading), and more. We are fortunate enough to own our own cinema camera and b-roll cameras.

 

Our Cast and Crew

Our team is led by Chicago Filmmaker, Jimmy Lee Lard, who has an extensive background in corporate video production and project management and has worked on award-winning television productions such as Fox’s Empire and the NBC dramas, Chicago PD, Chicago Fire, and Chicago Med. Supporting him are a talented team including cinematographer, Geralron H. Mason.

Our main character for this series is Jamaican-born actor and model, Raymond McPherson.  Casting for the series continues through the summer of 2019 and will include youth from Taskforce Prevention and Community Services as well as other talented individuals. Filming begins Summer 2019.

 

Your Contribution is Vital!

We cannot fund projects like these without support from people like you!  Your contribution helps with the cost of production, and if we can help it, that will include as many high-risk, disenfranchised, LGBT+ youth and young adults as we can!  Our goal is to tell their stories with hopes that we can help to normalize what it means to be LGBT+ in America.  We want to do this with high production value and care and need your support to do that!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, please help us by spreading the word about this campaign.  Share the link to this page  and also, kindly join us on social media at: www.facebook.com/theletterashortfilm

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone and Welcome to "GET SEASON ONE OF GIRL MEETS GOY MADE!"

My name is Amanda Shilo Braverman, and I am the creator and writer of "Girl Meets Goy". I have written a show that is about relationships with a twist. "Goy" means not Jewish in the Yiddish language. I think you can see where I am going...

This started as a passion project that I needed to get made. I saved up my money and created a proof of concept (POC) that was 9 mins long, to show networks and production companies what the show could look like. I submitted to a few film festivals and was a finalist for:

 

 

Now that that is done, I have been writing season 1! The actors that were in the POC have been on board since the first read-through of the Pilot script.

It is very important to me that I get this show made because I feel that a lot of people would relate to the characters:

 

 

Audiences will learn a little bit about the Jewish culture through the main character and her family. I am writing story lines about Inter-religion relationships, At work romances, starting new careers later in life, following your dreams and so much more with a comedic and musical twist.

Here is a sneak peek at the first Musical Number:

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $50,000 from crowdfunding to pay for pre production costs and to get the first few episodes filmed. As the show is meant to be a musical, we need to pay for a composer, a studio, a mixing engineer and any other fees that come up with recording 30 plus songs. The rest of the money would go towards the first episode, pay the actors and musicians involved. We are looking to ensure everyone’s safety and want to ensure that we are taking the appropriate precautions during this time. We are looking into procuring appropriate transportation for crew and talent so they can safely get to rehearsals and recording sessions. 

  • Donate $10 you will receive an Instagram Shout Out thanking you for your support!
  • Donate $15 you will receive a signed postcard from the main characters 
  • Donate $30 you will receive a signed copy of "Girl Meets Goy: A guide to the "Jewish" Slang" A picture colouring book/dictionary of Jewish words used throughout the show (plus some bonus ones)
  • Donate $50 you will receive a Girl Meets Goy T-shirt.
  • Donate $125 you will get a personal video message from the creator (Plus a T-shirt and signed copy of the book!).
  • Donate $500 you will get a signed copy of the pilot script. (Plus a T-shirt and signed copy of the book!).
  • Donate $10,000 you will get an digital copy of the songs that will be in the show! (Plus a T-shirt and signed copy of the book!).
  • Donate $15,000, Amanda (the creator and writer) will give you a sneak peek of what the future episodes look like before anyone else.  (Plus a T-shirt and signed copy of the book!).
  • Donate $50,000, you will get your name in the credits and 5% equity, plus all the above! (Plus a T-shirt and signed copy of the book!).
  • If I don't receive all the money requested, the show will go on! This is just a portion of the money we need to start production rolling! 

 

Here Are Some Teasers!

  

 

 

 

Exciting News When We Get the Funding!

Dynamic duo Sebastian Hugeneck and Igor Meshcheriakov will be joining the "Girl Meets Goy" team as song-producers for the show once we raise the funds!

                           Sebastian Hugeneck                                                          Igor Meshceriakov

 

Your contributions will go into ensuring we get this team for season one!

Why do we want this team so badly? Let us introduce you to them:

 

Sebastian Hugeneck- Composer:

Sebastian Hugeneck grew up in Vienna, Austria absorbed in classical music. He took to piano like bread to butter discovering that composing was his calling. By 17 Sebastian was leading a rock band that was gaining a small following and was considering going down the conventional path and training at a conservatory when he discovered a new passion in film music. Sebastian devoured and analyzed numerous scores while studying psychology at the University of Vienna. For an entire decade Sebastian grew specialized in creating original melodies, storytelling and emotions. He’s scored short films, web series, documentaries, musicals, and feature films, many of which have gone on to play at festivals and win awards. Sebastian also expanded into assisting productions and has had an active role in the development of the documentaries “ Rose Colored Glasses” and “Our 1/4 Life Crisis”. Sebastian is now developing the original musical TV show “Inward Edward” with his wife and collaborator Sonia Suvagau and is currently set to score the indie feature films “Box of Freedom” and “Unidentified Female Object”. Sebastian currently lives in Toronto, Canada and has recently formed the new indie rock band “MOT” which has just released their first EP.

 

Igor Mescheriakov- Audio- Engineer:

Igor’s passion for music and sound developed at a young age. Born and raised in Vladivostok, Russia, Igor immersed himself in its vibrant and upcoming music scene, constantly being part of various art-projects and bands. Upon arrival to Canada Igor continued to hone his skills by enrolling himself into two separate music and production programs, the Certificate of Introduction to Commercial Jazz at Humber College and the Audio Production Program at the Harris Institute in Toronto.. Igor has contributed to an array of projects as a boom operator and production sound mixer for such productions as the web series “CodeSwitch” and the indie feature “Unidentified Female Object” which he is also set to do sound design on. Igor recently scored the short film “Need Some Light in Purgatory” which played at Toronto International Film Festival of South Asia. He’s acted as audio assistant for stage set up, mix-prep and live mixing. Most recently Igor has been composing, coproducing, recording, and mixing for his new band MOT which has just launched their first EP. He is currently specializing himself in the art of mixing and mastering while continuing to apply his versatility wherever needed.

 

Check out their new EP:

Spotify:

https://open.spotify.com/album/1Yt7jR7GAbUIHXeR...

Apple Music:

https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/id1528192111

Deezer: http://www.deezer.com/album/168064202

YouTube Music:

https://music.youtube.com/playlist?list=OLAK5uy...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time you can still do the following:

  • Follow "Girl Meets Goy" on social media!
    • http://www.girlmeetsgoy.com
    • https://www.facebook.com/girlmeetsgoy/
    • https://www.instagram.com/girl_meets_goy/
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends, family and community!

story:
Who am I and what am I trying to achieve?

Hello there!

My name is Josh Macrow. I am a puppeteer currently studying at The Royal Central School of Speech and Drama.

For my final project I am making a TV Pilot with a key focus on puppetry. I am a huge Sci-Fi fan who really wants to push his puppetry to the limit.

Unfortunately, making puppets and films is expensive which is why I need your help. I will be making puppets, building sets, and sourcing locations. Any donations will help make the film and feed my magnificent crew. 

 

Why the crowdfunder? 

I have set my goal at £1,500. What will this cover?

  • Many of my voluntary crew will be travelling from all over the UK. My main goal is to pay for their transport, fed them, and give them a suitable place to stay. 
  • The Alien puppets that will be built for the production need to be made from the right materials to look realistic. These materials cost money and without this I will have nothing to puppeteer except my bare hand. 
  • The Aliens need somewhere to live. I will be building multiple sets for the Pilot and to make them look the best they can. For this I will need to be able to buy the right materials to get the job done.
  • Rewards for you! Some of the budget will be spent on producing lovely gifts so you can always remember what you helped to create. Have a look and see what perks interest you.

 

What will this help me achieve?

For many years I have been a freelance puppeteer, working for my company JJ Puppets, performing solo shows for parties and events, as well as working for multiple theatre companies all over the country.  I have always dreamed of being a professional television puppeteer and my hope is if I can make this project the best it can be, I will have a great example of my work to show to professionals in the industry. 

 

What else can be done to help?

I understand that not everyone is in a position to help me with the funds. If this is the case but you would still like to help, please considering doing the following:

  • Share this campaign with anyone that may be interested.
  • If you are creative and would like to help with the project, please email josh@jjpuppets.co.uk.

Thank you for your time and enjoy your day!

 

Kind Regards,

 

Josh Macrow

story:
About .org 

We're 20+ year nonprofit veterans and our mission is, through humor, to raise awareness about the climate crisis, environmental justice, and the nonprofit industrial complex. We're making a mockumentary sitcom (dotorgshow.com) because so many funny and ridiculous (...and sometimes dysfunctional) things happen in nonprofits, we just have to write about them. 

.org tells the story of the staff of a small environmental nonprofit in the South who must fight to accomplish their mission despite funding struggles, hapless leadership, and living in a culture of climate denial.

This short web series is an independent production, filmed in documentary style with a mix of improvisation and scripted material. We're filming in the South because the South is funny and we want to support the incredible creative talent in this area. (And also this is where the showrunner can sneak in to film at places after hours - shhhhhh.)

In true nonprofit spirit, we're doing this on a shoestring budget and borrowing everything we can. We are, however, committed to paying the folks involved in this at least something, because artists and creative people should not always be asked to do everything for free-sies.

Your support will help us finish post-production of Episode 1, and to film episode 2 this fall. Yay! Oh boy do we have a lot of stories to tell! Thank YOU so much for helping us tell them. 

Why We're Doing This Indiegogo-thing

Just like the small nonprofits we intend to focus on -- some may say "make fun of" -- in .org, we need more $$. Those complimentary packets of ketchup only go so far, you know. 

Our goal is to complete the first 2 episodes and use those to apply for those harder to obtain large funding sources like GRANTS and sponsorships and stuff.  We aim to raise $10,000 in the next few months, which will allow us to complete the first 2 episodes, and to begin developing and writing the scripts for the next few episodes. It may not be obvious since everyone's Grandmother has a youtube channel now, but writing and video editing can be HARD! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We also welcome folks to help in ways that are non-monetary.

Can you help us get the word out about this to your networks, and especially to your friends who work at a nonprofit? They need cheering up, trust me. 

Do you have crazy nonprofit stories that we need to know about? Hit us up, either in line at Harris Teeter, or at our website, www.dotorgshow.com.

Do you have a home or office in or near Durham, NC, where we could film? (Do you have a pool? Can we just come use your pool????)

Do you have equipment we could borrow? How about a trove of cool clothes we could borrow sometime for costumes? Do you hoard wigs? (It's OK we don't judge).

Are you a musician who would like to perform on an episode and/or contribute some music?  

Do you have any airline miles you don't plan on using and would share? 

Thanks for helping us in ANY way you see fit!
story_txt:
About .org 
We're 20+ year nonprofit veterans and our mission is, through humor, to raise awareness about the climate crisis, environmental justice, and the nonprofit industrial complex. We're making a mockumentary sitcom (dotorgshow.com) because so many funny and ridiculous (...and sometimes dysfunctional) things happen in nonprofits, we just have to write about them. 
.org tells the story of the staff of a small environmental nonprofit in the South who must fight to accomplish their mission despite funding struggles, hapless leadership, and living in a culture of climate denial.
This short web series is an independent production, filmed in documentary style with a mix of improvisation and scripted material. We're filming in the South because the South is funny and we want to support the incredible creative talent in this area. (And also this is where the showrunner can sneak in to film at places after hours - shhhhhh.)
In true nonprofit spirit, we're doing this on a shoestring budget and borrowing everything we can. We are, however, committed to paying the folks involved in this at least something, because artists and creative people should not always be asked to do everything for free-sies.
Your support will help us finish post-production of Episode 1, and to film episode 2 this fall. Yay! Oh boy do we have a lot of stories to tell! Thank YOU so much for helping us tell them. 

Why We're Doing This Indiegogo-thing
Just like the small nonprofits we intend to focus on -- some may say "make fun of" -- in .org, we need more $$. Those complimentary packets of ketchup only go so far, you know. 
Our goal is to complete the first 2 episodes and use those to apply for those harder to obtain large funding sources like GRANTS and sponsorships and stuff.  We aim to raise $10,000 in the next few months, which will allow us to complete the first 2 episodes, and to begin developing and writing the scripts for the next few episodes. It may not be obvious since everyone's Grandmother has a youtube channel now, but writing and video editing can be HARD! 

Other Ways You Can Help
We also welcome folks to help in ways that are non-monetary.
Can you help us get the word out about this to your networks, and especially to your friends who work at a nonprofit? They need cheering up, trust me. 
Do you have crazy nonprofit stories that we need to know about? Hit us up, either in line at Harris Teeter, or at our website, www.dotorgshow.com.

Do you have equipment we could borrow? How about a trove of cool clothes we could borrow sometime for costumes? Do you hoard wigs? (It's OK we don't judge).

Thanks for helping us in ANY way you see fit!

story:
Our Rad Campaign:

 

Why are we here?

  • Hi! I'm Ash Willeby, the writer. 

While I went through college, I worked on film sets, small and large. I've held many positions, including- Production Assistant, Craft Services, Second A.D., Prop Master, Set Decorator, Art Director, and Production Designer.

After getting my Master's in Psychology, I decided my skills and temperament were better suited to screenwriting. I write female-driven comedies, so I can see more stories I relate to get onto the big screen.

You may have seen my numerous posts about my feature A GOOD RUCKUS collecting laurels. It's the story of Carole Franklin, a teacher in her fifth year who gets so bored of the daily grind that she invents some excitement for herself and her best friend. 

 

  • This is the web series that focuses on Carole, as a newbie teacher. The first season will be about Carole finding her footing, learning her strengths, and making a friend. 

 

 

  • Any contribution will assist in us making a high-quality pilot that can be used to secure funding for the remainder of the series.  

 

 

Get Stoked!

 

What's up for grabs?

  • If you're looking for your next IMDb credit, there are multiple perks for you. 
  • Or get your first IMDb credit! We'll create a page for you. 
  • Maybe you just love that 80s movie vibe, and want to see what happens. 
  • There is something for all budgets.

 

What are the Cliques?

 

Using Funds, To The Max!

 

What are the funds actually for?

We want to make a high-quality pilot for this web series. So, we want to hire skilled professionals to help this idea manifest. 

Some of our talented friends, who do this for a living, have agreed to adjusted fee schedules, because they want to see this pilot made. 

Not only will this pilot be the beginning of the Web Series: A GOOD RUCKUS, the footage can also be used to showcase the style and  comedy of the award-winning feature-length script of the same name.

 

  • Location: To be able to film at the High School, with kids, we need to have stellar insurance. We will also need to cover any facility fees, including janitorial, permits, and for staff/admin to be present.

  • Lodging: Our High School location is a bit out of town. We'll need to have places for the crew to sleep after a long day of shooting. No driving accidents due to exhaustion!

  • Equipment: We will need to rent sound, grip, lighting and camera packages, to make sure filming goes smoothly.

  • Food: I, for one, get grumpy when I’m hungry. No use having any hangry cast or crew. We will ensure everyone has plenty to eat on set, including those with dietary restrictions.

  • Post Production: We need this pilot to have that sweet 80s feel! Editing, Soundtrack, Graphics… some of the things no one notices when they are done right.

 

Professional Crew? Wicked!

 

What all do we need?

 

Good lighting is important on a long day in a library full of windows. Our Grip and Electric Departments will make sure we look like we’re in the same ten minutes, all day long.

Great sound is vital for any film. We will need quality equipment and expertise.

Hair and Makeup will help us balance the subtle nods to the 80s with current trends.

Catering and Craft Services will ensure everyone is fed and hydrated. And that we’ll have coffee… lots of coffee…

Art Department will help make sure everything looks great- and stays the same throughout filming.

Camera department will capture the magic.

 

The current crew slated for this production are people we have worked with before in Austin. They’ve worked on indies as well as larger productions (such as The Leftovers, Fear The Walking Dead, Alita: Battle Angel). We're glad to have so many of our talented friends agree to help us make this pilot! 

 

Stretch Goals

 

What would help make this pilot Totally Tubular?

  • 5,000:  We can get a composer, to help us get that 80s feel. Hey, we might even create a theme song!

  • 7,500: Pick-up shots, and another editing session, to create a true Proof of Concept for our feature.

  • 9,000: We’ll be able to do a second day of shooting. This would be great, since some of the kids will be actual students at the High School. Kids need shorter shoot days, so not being rushed will result in a better finished pilot.

  • 10,000: We can submit to festivals, and share this pilot with many more 80s-inspired film lovers. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Thanks for reading…or skimming (that’s what I usually do, to be honest) to the end!

By now, hopefully, you're wondering how you can get involved in this fun 80s-inspired romp.

Luckily for you, we're offering some rad, affordable perks, including IMDb credits. You can see the full list right over there. ==>

Don’t have the funds right now? No worries brah, there are other (100% free!) ways you can still help!!

Spread the word about our totally tubular campaign and our pilot.

Like and Share our Facebook page: A Good Ruckus  

Follow us on Twitter

It’s where we'll keep you updated on the production progress. We’ll post clips and pictures of pre-production, shooting, and post-production! 

We appreciate anything you can do to help!

Thanks for your support!

By now, hopefully, you're wondering how you can get involved in this fun 80s-inspired romp.
Luckily for you, we're offering some rad, affordable perks, including IMDb credits. You can see the full list right over there. ==>
Don’t have the funds right now? No worries brah, there are other (100% free!) ways you can still help!!
Spread the word about our totally tubular campaign and our pilot.
Like and Share our Facebook page: A Good Ruckus  
Follow us on Twitter
It’s where we'll keep you updated on the production progress. We’ll post clips and pictures of pre-production, shooting, and post-production!

Thanks for your support!

story:
Arthur, Maria, Tommy and Francesco are the protagonists of Black Juice, a web series that follows the adventures of these four children. At first glance it may seem that everyone is one of the classic stereotypes of storytelling, but some more and some less, they all want to be discovered and tell their own stories. The theme of the series is "When the end meets the beginning": The kids are ready to show you the beginning but the end will be discovered only by watching carefully the episodes ( 5 at the moment ). 

 

Arthur, Maria, Tommy e Francesco sono i protagonisti di Black Juice, una serie web che segue l'avventura di questi quattro bambini. A primo impatto possono sembrare i classici stereotipi della narrazione, ma chi più e chi meno, hanno tutti voglia di farsi scoprire e raccontare le proprie storie. Il tema della serie è “Quando la fine incontra l'unione!”: I ragazzi sono pronti a mostrarvi  l'inizio, ma la fine la scoprirete da soli  solo  partecipando e guardando con attenzione le puntate ( 5 al momento).

 

 

Arthur: 13-year-old boy becomes passionate about the world of theater when his life seemed to plunge into the shadow of his solitude.

Maria: A very resourceful and extroverted girl who, despite her young age, has found the perfect way to leave everything behind.

Tommy: 10 year old boy, lives his life trying to make everyone around him feel good. His smile is the ace up his sleeve!

Francesco: 13 year old boy who tries in every way the approval from others especially of the girls always showing his hard and provocative side.


What do these four children in a small suburb outside Milan have in common? The story, set in a more or less remote past, is concentrated in a theater where we see the development of the characters and the unfolding of the events. Theater is what the protagonists have in common, it is the place where, paradoxically, everyone takes off their mask to show who they are without social prejudices. A liberating place that will reveal to us who these guys really are.

 

Arthur: un ragazzo di 13 anni che si appassiona al mondo del teatro quando la sua vita sembra immergersi nell'ombra della sua solitudine.

Maria: Una ragazza molto intraprendente ed estroversa che, nonostante la sua giovane età, ha trovato il modo perfetto di lasciarsi tutto alle spalle.

Tommy: un bambino di 10 anni, vive la sua vita cercando di far star bene tutti quelli che lo circondano. Il sorriso è il suo asso nella manica!

Francesco: ragazzo di 13 anni che cerca in tutti i modi l'approvazione degli altri, in particolare delle ragazze, mostrando sempre il suo lato duro e provocatorio.


Che cosa hanno in comune questi quattro bambini di un piccolo paese di periferia fuori Milano? La storia, ambientata in un passato più o meno remoto, si concentra in un teatro dove vediamo lo sviluppo dei personaggi e lo svolgersi delle vicende. Il teatro è ciò che accomuna i protagonisti, è il luogo dove, paradossalmente, ognuno toglie la sua maschera per mostrare ciò che è senza pregiudizi sociali. Un luogo liberatorio che ci svelerà chi sono veramente questi ragazzi.

 

Let us introduce ourselves: our names are Chiara and Laura, two film and new media students, we are who’s at the heart of this project. From directors to executive producers we managed to produce the first two episodes of Black Juice at the end of the academic period with a low budget, through our commitments and sacrifices; most of the budget was used to pay our little actors and all the technical crew believes in the project so much that they have come to work hours and hours without any financial gain. But now we need you! Do you believe in new and upcoming projects? Do you want to support creativity and starting points in the career of young people? Do you simply want to know how the story will end? The price of a coffee is enough to enable us to carry out this incredible project! We have a thousands of ideas and three other episodes already written that are just waiting to be put into reality. We know how difficult it can be, the risks and the challenges in creating a web series and for this reason we wanted to create a simple way to collect the necessary funds to complete the first season of Black Juice! If you decide to follow us in this adventure of ours we want to thank your contribution with fantastic prizes! Check the different levels and see which plan is best for you. And if you want to follow our progress more closely follow us on our Instagram page: https://instagram.com/blackjuice_bj

For any information write to us : blackjuice.produzione@gmail.com

 

Ci presentiamo: siamo Chiara e Laura, due studentesse di cinema e nuovi media, siamo chi c’è al cuore di questo progetto. Da registe a produttrici esecutivi siamo riuscite a svolgere la produzione delle prime due puntate di Black Juice alla fine del periodo accademico con un low budget, attraverso i nostri impegni e sacrifici; la maggior parte del budget è servita per pagare i nostri piccoli attori e tutta la troupe tecnica crede nel progetto tanto da essere arrivati a lavorare ore e ore senza nessun tornaconto economico. Ma adesso abbiamo bisogno di te! Credi nei nuovi e avvenienti progetti? Vuoi supportare la creatività e lo slancio nella carriera dei giovani? Vuoi anche solo sapere come andrà a finire la storia? Bastano i soldi di un caffè per permetterci di portare a termine questo incredibile progetto! Abbiamo mille idee e altre tre puntate già scritte che aspettano solo di essere girate. Sappiamo quanto può essere difficile, i rischi e le sfide nella creazione di una web serie e per questo abbiamo voluto creare un modo semplice di raccogliere i fondi necessari per portare a termine la prima stagione di Black Juice! Se decidi di seguirci in questa nostra avventura vogliamo ringraziare il tuo contributo con dei fantastici premi! Controlla i diversi livelli e vedi quale piano fa più al caso per te. E se vuoi seguire i nostri progressi più da vicino seguici sulla nostra pagina instagram: https://instagram.com/blackjuice_bj

Per qualsiasi informazione scriveteci : blackjuice.produzione@gmail.com

story: This campaign has ended.
story_txt: This campaign has ended.

story:
Short Summary 

Midnight Bytes is a sci-fi/thriller/dark comedy short film anthology written by a young, up-and-coming, diverse writer staff that tackles topics like designer babies, self-driving AI cars, perception, philosophy and social systems and constructs that exist in our world or may exist in the not so distant future. By donating you're supporting a unique set of voices bent on changing the world through film, television and digital media that makes people laugh, think and feel -- ideally at the same time.

Meet Our Writing Staff (Photos in our Image Gallery)

Ken Rudnick (IMDb): Born in Los Angeles means two things for Ken: one, he says “the” when referring to freeways and thinks it is normal, and two, he’s never really grown up. Ken shot his first short film at the age of 7, a stop motion production about toy cars racing. He grew up training in martial arts and was an instructor at his dojo through high school and college. Ken has written one act plays for UCLA’s LCC Theatre Company (founded by Randall Park in ‘95); sketch comedy for weekly performance teams at The Second City Hollywood, UCB, and iO West; and feature films for hire. But he dreamed of running TV shows and so he created Midnight Bytes. Ken currently works in TV writer support staff positions, most recently as the Writers’ PA on the final season of Fresh Off The Boat.

 

Vik Ramen (IMDb):  Born in Starnberg, Germany and raised in the labs at the Max Planck Institute, Vik has always been fascinated by the implications of science and technology on society. Vik’s focus on using the power of media to improve the trajectory of humanity in the future has led to public appearances with Actor Kal Penn, Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti, and President Barack Obama. Coming off his directorial debut in the dystopian short film, "Welcome to Life," featured in the Silver State Film Festival (Las Vegas), Marina del Rey Film Festival, and Golden State Film Festival (Hollywood), he’s seeking to further explore the many possible futures of humanity through the medium of film and television. 

 

Megan Maher (IMDb): Megan Maher is a writer from Boca Raton, FL and a graduate of the University of Central Florida. Currently, Megan is Showrunner Assistant for the upcoming limited series Washington Black at Hulu. She is also the creator, writer, and director of the short film trilogy, “Clandestine Magic”; co-creator of the webseries “Perspectives”; and a journalist and editor for the popular tv, film and books blog, Black Girl Nerds. Megan is a well-rounded writer with an emphasis on magical realism. Diverse and the youngest of six, Megan cultivates the audience by delivering a distinct and original voice in her story telling.

 

Jacob Arbittier (IMDb): Jacob Arbittier is a director and producer living in Los Angeles. He's originally from the east coast and the moment he first watched BLAIR WITCH PROJECT as a kid knew his mission was to create genre work that stays with audiences. Jacob studied at Syracuse University and has worked with major Hollywood production companies including Blumhouse and Dreamworks Animation.

 

Hannah Ahn (IMDb):  Born near Silicon Valley, Hannah always thought she’d grow up to be a Girl who Codes. Instead, she ended up flying to the opposite coast to study anthropology and human rights at Columbia University. A Guggenheim Criminal Justice Fellow, she worked for public defenders and visited clients on Rikers Island before pivoting yet again to become a writer. She enjoys using sci-fi elements to explore themes of social justice. Most recently, she wrote and directed a short called “Poisonberries,” which screened at the Athena Film Festival. She is currently a literary assistant at Culture Creative Entertainment.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding will be used for production and post production costs as well as festival submissions and marketing. 

Obviously we've called in A LOT of favors, but we NEED $6,263.11 to get us through production. The rest will cover our post production costs and film festival submissions. We talked to a lot of people who have fundraised before and one of the biggest mistakes was not raising enough to cover through post production. That is why we're asking for the full $7,500. That will make sure we can get a quality finished project and present it at great festivals and opportunities.

You can view our full budget here.

But you also get something for supporting! CHECK OUT OUR PERKS! Signed scripts, opportunities to meet and sit in with our writers' room, and much more! 

If we don't reach our goal... we'll still be using all the funds we receive to produce this episode... it's just gonna mean skipping a few meals for a while lol. 

 

The Impact

Our goal is to create 5-8 minute episodes that challenge audiences to think about technology, society, and ethics through emotional, character-driven stories. 

We have an outstanding, fresh, diverse cast of talent that your donations will help support by allowing us to make the best film possible and compensate them for their time. 

 

Meet Our Cast (Photos in our Image Gallery)

 

Frankie Kevich: EMMA BOYDE, MB 102

Born in Vancouver, Canada, Frankie Kevich is a Polish-Filipino actor who immigrated to Southern California at the age of 15. Frankie has written, acted and directed one-act plays with LCC Theatre Company, UCLA’s Asian American Theatre Company founded by Randall Park. She will be performing an online play reading of 6 Letters in an online digital drama fest with On Brand Productions. Frankie has also acted in a number of independent short films which have won awards at student film festivals like Campus Movie Fest and CEC Shorttakes. 

 

Delanie Wiedrich: OLIVIA LAWRENCE, MB 102

Delanie Wiedrich is an actor and singer from the small coal mining town of Hazen, North Dakota. Delanie graduated from Minnesota State University, Mankato with her BFA in Musical Theatre in the spring of 2019 and immediately moved to Los Angeles, California where she is now based full time. She has an extensive background in musical theatre with some of her favorite roles including Christine Colgate in Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, Esmeralda in The Hunchback of Notre Dame and Amneris in Aida. In Los Angeles, she most recently appeared in Iah Bear Production’s, Crease. Outside of her acting career, Delanie is a passionate teacher at The Youth Academy of Dramatic Arts. 

 

Edmund Truong: MAX WILSON, MB 102 

Edmund is a multi-award winning actor hailing from Orange County. He has film projects that have screened across the festival circuit including: The International Film Festival of New York, The Indie Fest Film Awards and The 48 HFP Filmmapalooza Festival Awards. 

 

Rick Jonce: MITCHELL ROSS, MB 102 

Rick is a 6-foot-7, 25-year-old actor/music producer who has a special interest in Comedy or anything that may "blow your mind" so to speak, but he’s always down to work on a project that someone is passionate about. He makes music as well. It has often been described as "ethereal-sounding beats", like something you would hear in a Hipster's car in 2050. Feel free to put him in whatever crazy roles you need someone for - i.e. the next Cheese-a-Saurus Rex or Chewbacca or something.

 

Rohnie Williams: ALBERT HENDERSON, MB 102

Rohnie has acted in roles for smaller theatrical shows and has written a few, including a one-act comedy that premiered at UCLA. He was almost the host of Blue’s Clues and he isn’t bitter about it.

 

Candace Nelson: JENNA FOX, MB 102

Candace Nelson is an actor and director from a small farm town in Nebraska. She graduated from the University of Nebraska Lincoln with a BFA in Film and New Media and a BA in Theatre Performance. Upon graduation she moved to Los Angeles with an internship for the Television Academy where she worked with directors on the shows The Big Bang Theory, Jimmy Kimmel Live, and Good Girls. From there she has continued to work in film production behind the scenes, and acting most recently with a commercial for Glion Scooter and the film Crease through IahBear Productions. In her freetime she is a freelance poet, writer, and enthusiastic cat person.

 

Myra Vitela: JENNA’S FRIEND, MB 102

Myra Vitela is a Mexican-American actor that has appeared in various television and digital series, short and feature films. She graduated from the School of Arts at UCLA and has trained at several acting schools, including Scott Sedita Acting Studio and Groundlings. Outside of acting, she is also an artist with experience in drawing, painting, photography, and graphic design. She is fluent in Spanish.

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks associated with this project include:

- Not being able to film due to COVID. In that case we will hold the funds untouched until it is safe to make the project. 

- Not raising enough to cover costs. To solve this we will stick to our strict schedule to make sure we can meet all the bare minimums to making this happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Follow us on  INSTAGRAM! And then share our fundraising images and videos to help us out.

2. Share on Facebook! 

3. Follow our social media accounts and watch the episodes when they are released! 

4. Wish for us to get donations at 11:11 AM or PM each day.

5. Stay safe and healthy!!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Midnight Bytes is a sci-fi/thriller/dark comedy short film anthology written by a young, up-and-coming, diverse writer staff that tackles topics like designer babies, self-driving AI cars, perception, philosophy and social systems and constructs that exist in our world or may exist in the not so distant future. By donating you're supporting a unique set of voices bent on changing the world through film, television and digital media that makes people laugh, think and feel -- ideally at the same time.
Meet Our Writing Staff (Photos in our Image Gallery)
Ken Rudnick (IMDb): Born in Los Angeles means two things for Ken: one, he says “the” when referring to freeways and thinks it is normal, and two, he’s never really grown up. Ken shot his first short film at the age of 7, a stop motion production about toy cars racing. He grew up training in martial arts and was an instructor at his dojo through high school and college. Ken has written one act plays for UCLA’s LCC Theatre Company (founded by Randall Park in ‘95); sketch comedy for weekly performance teams at The Second City Hollywood, UCB, and iO West; and feature films for hire. But he dreamed of running TV shows and so he created Midnight Bytes. Ken currently works in TV writer support staff positions, most recently as the Writers’ PA on the final season of Fresh Off The Boat. Vik Ramen (IMDb):  Born in Starnberg, Germany and raised in the labs at the Max Planck Institute, Vik has always been fascinated by the implications of science and technology on society. Vik’s focus on using the power of media to improve the trajectory of humanity in the future has led to public appearances with Actor Kal Penn, Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti, and President Barack Obama. Coming off his directorial debut in the dystopian short film, "Welcome to Life," featured in the Silver State Film Festival (Las Vegas), Marina del Rey Film Festival, and Golden State Film Festival (Hollywood), he’s seeking to further explore the many possible futures of humanity through the medium of film and television.  Megan Maher (IMDb): Megan Maher is a writer from Boca Raton, FL and a graduate of the University of Central Florida. Currently, Megan is Showrunner Assistant for the upcoming limited series Washington Black at Hulu. She is also the creator, writer, and director of the short film trilogy, “Clandestine Magic”; co-creator of the webseries “Perspectives”; and a journalist and editor for the popular tv, film and books blog, Black Girl Nerds. Megan is a well-rounded writer with an emphasis on magical realism. Diverse and the youngest of six, Megan cultivates the audience by delivering a distinct and original voice in her story telling. Jacob Arbittier (IMDb): Jacob Arbittier is a director and producer living in Los Angeles. He's originally from the east coast and the moment he first watched BLAIR WITCH PROJECT as a kid knew his mission was to create genre work that stays with audiences. Jacob studied at Syracuse University and has worked with major Hollywood production companies including Blumhouse and Dreamworks Animation. Hannah Ahn (IMDb):  Born near Silicon Valley, Hannah always thought she’d grow up to be a Girl who Codes. Instead, she ended up flying to the opposite coast to study anthropology and human rights at Columbia University. A Guggenheim Criminal Justice Fellow, she worked for public defenders and visited clients on Rikers Island before pivoting yet again to become a writer. She enjoys using sci-fi elements to explore themes of social justice. Most recently, she wrote and directed a short called “Poisonberries,” which screened at the Athena Film Festival. She is currently a literary assistant at Culture Creative Entertainment.

What We Need & What You Get
Our funding will be used for production and post production costs as well as festival submissions and marketing. 
Obviously we've called in A LOT of favors, but we NEED $6,263.11 to get us through production. The rest will cover our post production costs and film festival submissions. That will make sure we can get a quality finished project and present it at great festivals and opportunities.
You can view our full budget here.
But you also get something for supporting! CHECK OUT OUR PERKS! Signed scripts, opportunities to meet and sit in with our writers' room, and much more! 
If we don't reach our goal... we'll still be using all the funds we receive to produce this episode... it's just gonna mean skipping a few meals for a while lol.

We have an outstanding, fresh, diverse cast of talent that your donations will help support by allowing us to make the best film possible and compensate them for their time.
