story:
If you've ever felt lost, alone, or just need a good laugh; "Eileen's Garden" is your new home.

Synopsis

Eileen and Eve are two sisters, living together in a garden. Eileen, a budding actor, will warm your heart with her positive outlook on life. Eve, a college student, shows a comedic side to life's most common anxieties. Taking place during a pandemic, the sisters use the quarantine as an excuse to reunite with the happiness they felt as kids. Eileen and Eve embark on satiric misadventures, while taking on life's big questions. Through existentialism and absurd humor, "Eileen's Garden" is like a survival guide for young adults. "Eileen's Garden" was written with the purpose of providing comfort and entertainment for viewers struggling with their mental health. Each episode features original music by Canadian artists.

About "Eileen's Garden" 

"Eileen's Garden" is a coming of age series written by Sadie Stranks. Following the often overlooked point of view of women in their twenties; "Eileen's Garden" tackles relatable issues, such as mental health, women's safety and animal rights. These issues are presented in a comedic way through absurd humor and satire. The overall goal of this series is to provide comfort to viewers struggling with their own lives. We can't solve your problems, but we can certainly distract you from them.

Official Trailer:

 
"Eileen's Garden" teaches life lessons in unusual ways. Viewers will learn about Veganism by watching Eileen rob a farm, while dressed like Michael Cera. Discover the pursuit of happiness, when Eileen and Eve impersonate Mormons. Eileen will teach you how to coexist with your mental health with a moldy shoe she finds in the trash. "Eileen's Garden" is a wild trip you won't soon
forget!
 

Our goal is to produce ten ten-minute episodes, to complete season one. "Eileen's Garden" will be available for streaming on YouTube. Each episode of "Eileen's Garden" features original music by Canadian artists. Our team believes in supporting Canadian talent. We hope our series will introduce these emerging individuals to the mainstream. 

 
 

"Eileen's Garden" is an absolute laugh riot. Prepare for a series unlike anything you've ever seen before

 

All money submitted to our fundraiser contributes to producing season one of "Eileen's Garden." With your support, we know we can create something truly remarkable.

.

 

FOLLOW US ON TIKTOK

THE CAST

Eileen (22) [Played by Sadie Stranks] Eileen is the heart of the show. She is lovable and fun. Her most noticeable trait is empathy. Eileen is always the friend that checks in and validates those around her. Her empathy is extended to wildlife, as she is a vegan. Eileen’s attitude comes from existential consciousness. She knows she won’t live forever and uses that as motivation to have as much fun as possible. Eileen is an up and coming actress. If she has to have a job to benefit our capitalist society, then at least it’ll be a fun one! Though the film industry isn’t as welcoming as she’d hoped; nothing will stop Eileen from accomplishing her goals.

"Maybe home isn't a place. Maybe home is two arms and a heartbeat."

- Eileen Marie

Eve (25) [Played by Heather Dennis] Eve is Eileen’s older sister. She’s studying second year law in college. She’s not certain what she wants to do, but she knows she wants to work within the system. She feels frustrated with the way things are handled and wants to change them. Eve does things in extremes. When she is sad, all of her is sad. When she is happy, all of her is happy. Like any other starving student, Eve is an anxious mess. There is so much that is out of her control. The more she focuses on it, the more it seems to swallow her whole. Through Eileen’s guidance, Eve will learn to let go of these fears and enjoy life, come what may.

"You can't stop doing what you love because you feel scared"

- Eve Marie

BARBRA (22)  [Yet to be cast] Eileen’s best friend/former roommate. Barbra is strong and confident. She’s also cynical and morally bankrupt. Anyone else might be turned off by this, but to Eileen, Barbra is perfect. Each girl has what the other lacks. In a way, Eileen and Barbra complete each other. Barbra is a journalist student. She wants to write for a newspaper and expose the capitalist pigs that run our society.

"Morals are just ways to guilt people into not doing what they really want."

- Barbra Baker

GWEN (24) [Yet to be cast] Barbra’s older sister. If Eileen and Eve have the ideal sister relationship, Barbra and Gwen are far more realistic. Constantly arguing and insulting each other. Their relationship is a complete mess. Gwen is an alcoholic, persistently jumping from one boyfriend to another. She doesn’t know what she wants to do with her life. All she really wants is to feel wanted. To feel loved by those around her. Is that too much to ask?

"Don't stop letting people into your life."

- Gwen Baker

JANET (25) [Yet to be cast] Janet is too cool for school. She’s a cop and a damn good one. Though she doesn’t get the praise she deserves on the force, she knows they’d be lost without her. Janet always comes across as powerful and intriguing. You can’t help but be drawn to her. Eileen and Eve’s adventures often get out of hand. That’s when Janet has to come in and clean up the mess. Janet is closest to Eve. Partially because they’re the same age and have interests in the law. Partially because Eve has been arrested multiple times.

"Well, that person doesn't pay my bills. So I don't give a flying crap and we're moving on."

- Janet White

CHARLIE (21) [Yet to be cast] Charlie is the ultimate male role model. He’s relatable, charming, a good listener and very respectful. Charlie always wears vintage clothes from the thrift store he works at. He’s closest to Eileen and studies journalism with Barbra in school. Charlie regularly talks to a therapist, particularly about losing his mother at a young age. As season two progresses, Charlie comes to a life altering realization in therapy. Eileen is the first person he shares his secret with.

"I started to question what manning up really means."

- Charlie Stevenson

Through The Looking "Grass"

Eileen and Eve are both legal aged adults, living in Canada. Given the environment, it's only natural for the sisters to experiment with "locally grown plants." They do live in a garden after all. To avoid an issues with censorship, anytime a character is high it will be symbolized with them wearing sunglasses. This allows the concept to be communicated to the viewer without actually showing weed.

Season One

If being in your twenties in the 2020s wasn’t stressful enough, now the world has unexpectedly been put in quarantine. No longer able to work or be in a school environment, Eileen and Eve have resorted to moving back to their parent’s. Their solitude is found in the garden, where they explore relatable anxieties and find positive conclusions. Is it the end of the world or the start of their greatest adventure?

Future Seasons

Season Two: Are We There Yet?
Eileen’s acting career begins. Unfortunately, it’s not as glamorous as it seems on TV. Audition after audition with no progress. The few roles she does land go from embarrassing to just plain degrading. Eileen finally gets cast in a horror movie. Too bad she’s playing the creature! Here she meets Bill. A successful actor who takes Eileen under his wing. With Bill’s help, Eileen might get her big break after all.

Eve is excited to start her next semester of college. Finally allowed back on campus, Eve thought this would fix all of her problems. She couldn't have been more wrong. Manipulative teachers, endless nights of no sleep, mountains of assignments. The only thing higher then Eve's anxiety is her student loans! Why does pursuing an education have to be this painful? Eve questions if it's really worth finishing her college education or is it time to pursue a different path.

Season Three: Life On The Murder Scene
Eileen has finally established her career. She assumed everything would be easy from this point, but she couldn’t be more wrong. The industry is far darker than Eileen ever imagined. Directors on drugs, psycho paparazzi, nutty actors; Eileen will see it all. Will Eileen’s lighthearted nature change the industry, or will the industry change her? Featuring true stories from the film industry.

Eve always wanted to be a lawyer. Being in control, helping others, benefiting her community; it was everything she had dreamed of. So why doesn't Eve want it anymore? Eve is given the opportunity to assist on a court case. During this experience Eve learns that the law doesn't guarantee justice. Far from it. Eve comes to the bitter realization that many of our laws benefit those who are guilty far more than those who are victims. As her world begins to crumble around her, Eve is faced with a difficult choice. Should she continue to serve the law, knowing it's corruption; or does she abandon her life's work in favour of truly aiding those around her?  

Season Four: Me Too
Eileen has had enough of the sexism only actresses have to experience. It’s time to take a stand. With the help of her fellow actresses; Eileen starts her own production company. The ladies team up to produce empowering films featuring all female casts (Trans females are of course included). In previous seasons, Eileen has despised some of these actresses. This season they learn they don’t have to compete with each other. If they work together, they can all make it.

As Eve reflects on her education, she realizes how limited her knowledge is. Despite eighteen years of schooling, Eve doesn't have any basic life skills at all. She was never taught how to pay taxes, how to change a tire; or even simple things, like how to tie a tie. Eve was never taught how to love herself or how to take care of her mental health. This inspires Eve to create her own school curriculum. Designed to teach school subjects, as well as essential life skills; Eve's classes quickly grow a following. Eve decides to take this one step further and attempts to overthrow the school board. After all, isn't it about time that someone tore down the wall?

Praise For "Eileen's Garden"

The following are quotes from a focus group.

"I wish I had this show when I was younger." - Adaire Brunson [22]

"I love the music." - Hilary Brook [14]

"It felt like an 80s movie." - Michael Burdo [30]

"It's the only show I've ever seen that has female leads that talk about things other than men."         - Katherine Bloom [36]

"Hilarious, feel good. It gave me a new perspective" - Sarah Walter [21]

"Filled with memorable life lessons. A guide to adulting." - Nikita Su [21]

"Funniest show I've ever seen!" - Stacy Pepper [12]

"I never thought I'd like Mormons, but here we are." - Jeff Morris [18]

Our Team

Sadie Stranks

Sadie Stranks is an ACTRA actor from Toronto. She has appeared in series such as, "The Hot Zone: Anthrax," "Haunted Hospitals" and "Holly Hobbie." Sadie writes every episode of “Eileen’s Garden” and plays the titular character, "Eileen Marie".

Alana Omolayole

Alana’s career spans 18 years and includes a diverse range of projects in both film and television. She has worked under the umbrella of broadcasters such as Discovery, National Geographic and Netflix. Alana has proven to be resourceful, agile and inventive.

Susan Exton Stranks

Susan Exton Stranks is a hair dresser with IATSE. Selected credits include "Man From Toronto," "Miss America" and "Shazam." She was on an academy award winning team when she did hair in "Suicide Squad."

Peter H Stranks

Peter Stranks is a stills photographer with IATSE. Selected credits include "V Wars," "Awake" and "Trigger Point." Peter shoots for TV, film and print. Peter recently shot for National Geographic.

 

My Story

In July of 2019, Sadie Stranks began to develop a sitcom following two roommates, struggling through their twenties. Stranks felt that there were no shows at the time that spoke to her generation.

“It seemed like every show focused on high school students or adults in their thirties. There was nothing for young adults trying to find their place in the world.” Explained Stranks. “I had just begun my acting career. It didn’t take long for me to realize how limiting roles were for women. The characters I was auditioning for were often just there to serve their male protagonist. These characters had no urgency or thoughts beyond finding a boyfriend. They didn’t feel like real women to me at all.”

Stranks used this limitation as motivation to create a series that wouldn’t alienate female viewers, but instead focus on things they cared about.

“Anytime I wasn’t on set, I was in my best friend’s basement. We’d spend all night listening to indie music and debating existential theories. I remember this one time where we spent three hours discussing whether humans had free will or not. I wanted to create a show that validated those ideas and focused on the absurdity of our existence from a comedic perspective.”

Stranks had studied satire and script writing, along with acting at Seneca College. It was during this time that she discovered her passion for writing.

By March of 2020, Stranks’ series was in production. The weekend they were scheduled to film the pilot episode; was the weekend the world was put on lock down, due to the spread of Covid-19. Within a day, the film industry was shut down and Stranks’ series was put on hiatus. Not wanting to be alone in her apartment, Stranks went home to live with her parents during the quarantine. As bleak as things seemed, Stranks found a way to move forward.

“Self employment means there will always be times when there is no work. That’s when it’s up to you to create your own work. To me, this was just one of those moments.” Stranks stated.

Stranks quickly got to work on a quarantine version of the series that could be filmed safely during the pandemic.

“During my time at Second City, I was taught that the only things needed to create a scene are two actors and a room. I began to write scripts that could be shot in one location with just two actors.“ Stranks explained.

Stranks’ parents were enthusiastic about the project and agreed to crew it. Not surprising, considering Stranks comes from a family of film makers. They planned to film as many episodes as they could during the lock down. They would then use the footage they created to go after funding to produce the rest of the series properly. Episodes would be filmed primarily in the family's backyard. This reoccurring location inspired the name, "Eileen's Garden." There were drastic changes that had to be made to accommodate their new environment.

“My original series focused on Eileen [Stranks’ character.] and her roommate, Barbra." Stranks describes. “Barbra's character was inspired by the friend I had spent the summer of 2019 with. When I pitched the concept of a quarantined series to Barbra’s actress, she expressed it wasn’t something she wanted to be a part of. I understood, but this meant that Barbra couldn't be the lead character anymore. I had to go back to the drawing board and create someone else to act alongside Eileen. Eve was created to replace Barbra. Barbra was changed to a supporting role."

Heather Dennis was brought in to play the newly created character, Eve Marie. Though Stranks and Dennis had never met before filming, they quickly became close friends.

"I think everything worked out for the best." Stranks says, with a smile. "Heather and I have amazing chemistry on and off camera. There's no one else I'd rather do this series with."

The Stranks family and Dennis were the only consistent crew members on set. Friends would come to set and lend a hand whenever they were able to; but there were many days of filming with just the four of them. "Eileen’s Garden" never had more then seven people on set. This was done to minimize the risk of spreading Covid-19. This raised many challenges, as most shows rely on crews built of hundreds of people. Filming the first two episodes was no easy task. Everyone took on multiple roles. By the end of the lock down, the first two episodes of "Eileen's Garden" had been filmed.

"I'm really proud of what we accomplished." Stranks begins. "The first two episodes are practically perfect. You would never know they were created with such limited resources. We didn't have money, or a large crew, or anything you're suppose to have when you're filming. We just had a script and a few people that believed in it."

Those wanting to see the quarantine episodes will have a chance! One of the rewards listed on IndieGoGo is a virtual screening of the second episode, "The Book Of Moron." Known as one of the funniest episodes of the series. Those wanting to see the completed series must support "Eileen's Garden" through IndieGoGo.

Thank You To All Who Support,

"Eileen's Garden."

We'll see ya in the garden!

We can't solve your problems, but we can certainly distract you from them.
Official Trailer:
 "Eileen's Garden" teaches life lessons in unusual ways. Viewers will learn about Veganism by watching Eileen rob a farm, while dressed like Michael Cera. Discover the pursuit of happiness, when Eileen and Eve impersonate Mormons. Eileen will teach you how to coexist with your mental health with a moldy shoe she finds in the trash. "Eileen's Garden" is a wild trip you won't soonforget! Our goal is to produce ten ten-minute episodes, to complete season one. "Eileen's Garden" will be available for streaming on YouTube. Each episode of "Eileen's Garden" features original music by Canadian artists. Our team believes in supporting Canadian talent. We hope our series will introduce these emerging individuals to the mainstream.   "Eileen's Garden" is an absolute laugh riot. Prepare for a series unlike anything you've ever seen before All money submitted to our fundraiser contributes to producing season one of "Eileen's Garden." With your support, we know we can create something truly remarkable.. FOLLOW US ON TIKTOKTHE CASTEileen (22) [Played by Sadie Stranks] Eileen is the heart of the show. She is lovable and fun. Her most noticeable trait is empathy. Eileen is always the friend that checks in and validates those around her. Her empathy is extended to wildlife, as she is a vegan. Eileen’s attitude comes from existential consciousness. She knows she won’t live forever and uses that as motivation to have as much fun as possible. Eileen is an up and coming actress. If she has to have a job to benefit our capitalist society, then at least it’ll be a fun one! Though the film industry isn’t as welcoming as she’d hoped; nothing will stop Eileen from accomplishing her goals."Maybe home isn't a place. Maybe home is two arms and a heartbeat."- Eileen MarieEve (25) [Played by Heather Dennis] Eve is Eileen’s older sister. She’s studying second year law in college. She’s not certain what she wants to do, but she knows she wants to work within the system. She feels frustrated with the way things are handled and wants to change them. Eve does things in extremes. When she is sad, all of her is sad. When she is happy, all of her is happy. Like any other starving student, Eve is an anxious mess. There is so much that is out of her control. The more she focuses on it, the more it seems to swallow her whole. Through Eileen’s guidance, Eve will learn to let go of these fears and enjoy life, come what may."You can't stop doing what you love because you feel scared"- Eve MarieBARBRA (22)  [Yet to be cast] Eileen’s best friend/former roommate. Barbra is strong and confident. She’s also cynical and morally bankrupt. Anyone else might be turned off by this, but to Eileen, Barbra is perfect. Each girl has what the other lacks. In a way, Eileen and Barbra complete each other. Barbra is a journalist student. She wants to write for a newspaper and expose the capitalist pigs that run our society."Morals are just ways to guilt people into not doing what they really want."- Barbra BakerGWEN (24) [Yet to be cast] Barbra’s older sister. If Eileen and Eve have the ideal sister relationship, Barbra and Gwen are far more realistic. Constantly arguing and insulting each other. Their relationship is a complete mess. Gwen is an alcoholic, persistently jumping from one boyfriend to another. She doesn’t know what she wants to do with her life. All she really wants is to feel wanted. To feel loved by those around her. Is that too much to ask?"Don't stop letting people into your life."- Gwen BakerJANET (25) [Yet to be cast] Janet is too cool for school. She’s a cop and a damn good one. Though she doesn’t get the praise she deserves on the force, she knows they’d be lost without her. Janet always comes across as powerful and intriguing. You can’t help but be drawn to her. Eileen and Eve’s adventures often get out of hand. That’s when Janet has to come in and clean up the mess. Janet is closest to Eve. Partially because they’re the same age and have interests in the law. Partially because Eve has been arrested multiple times."Well, that person doesn't pay my bills. So I don't give a flying crap and we're moving on."- Janet WhiteCHARLIE (21) [Yet to be cast] Charlie is the ultimate male role model. He’s relatable, charming, a good listener and very respectful. Charlie always wears vintage clothes from the thrift store he works at. He’s closest to Eileen and studies journalism with Barbra in school. Charlie regularly talks to a therapist, particularly about losing his mother at a young age. As season two progresses, Charlie comes to a life altering realization in therapy. Eileen is the first person he shares his secret with."I started to question what manning up really means."- Charlie StevensonThrough The Looking "Grass"Eileen and Eve are both legal aged adults, living in Canada. Given the environment, it's only natural for the sisters to experiment with "locally grown plants." They do live in a garden after all. To avoid an issues with censorship, anytime a character is high it will be symbolized with them wearing sunglasses. This allows the concept to be communicated to the viewer without actually showing weed.Season OneIf being in your twenties in the 2020s wasn’t stressful enough, now the world has unexpectedly been put in quarantine. No longer able to work or be in a school environment, Eileen and Eve have resorted to moving back to their parent’s. Their solitude is found in the garden, where they explore relatable anxieties and find positive conclusions. Is it the end of the world or the start of their greatest adventure?Future SeasonsSeason Two: Are We There Yet?Eileen’s acting career begins. Unfortunately, it’s not as glamorous as it seems on TV. Audition after audition with no progress. The few roles she does land go from embarrassing to just plain degrading. Eileen finally gets cast in a horror movie. Too bad she’s playing the creature! Here she meets Bill. A successful actor who takes Eileen under his wing. With Bill’s help, Eileen might get her big break after all.Eve is excited to start her next semester of college. Finally allowed back on campus, Eve thought this would fix all of her problems. She couldn't have been more wrong. Manipulative teachers, endless nights of no sleep, mountains of assignments. The only thing higher then Eve's anxiety is her student loans! Why does pursuing an education have to be this painful? Eve questions if it's really worth finishing her college education or is it time to pursue a different path.Season Three: Life On The Murder SceneEileen has finally established her career. She assumed everything would be easy from this point, but she couldn’t be more wrong. The industry is far darker than Eileen ever imagined. Directors on drugs, psycho paparazzi, nutty actors; Eileen will see it all. Will Eileen’s lighthearted nature change the industry, or will the industry change her? Featuring true stories from the film industry.Eve always wanted to be a lawyer. Being in control, helping others, benefiting her community; it was everything she had dreamed of. So why doesn't Eve want it anymore? Eve is given the opportunity to assist on a court case. During this experience Eve learns that the law doesn't guarantee justice. Far from it. Eve comes to the bitter realization that many of our laws benefit those who are guilty far more than those who are victims. As her world begins to crumble around her, Eve is faced with a difficult choice. Should she continue to serve the law, knowing it's corruption; or does she abandon her life's work in favour of truly aiding those around her?  Season Four: Me TooEileen has had enough of the sexism only actresses have to experience. It’s time to take a stand. With the help of her fellow actresses; Eileen starts her own production company. The ladies team up to produce empowering films featuring all female casts (Trans females are of course included). In previous seasons, Eileen has despised some of these actresses. This season they learn they don’t have to compete with each other. If they work together, they can all make it.As Eve reflects on her education, she realizes how limited her knowledge is. Despite eighteen years of schooling, Eve doesn't have any basic life skills at all. She was never taught how to pay taxes, how to change a tire; or even simple things, like how to tie a tie. Eve was never taught how to love herself or how to take care of her mental health. This inspires Eve to create her own school curriculum. Designed to teach school subjects, as well as essential life skills; Eve's classes quickly grow a following. Eve decides to take this one step further and attempts to overthrow the school board. After all, isn't it about time that someone tore down the wall?Praise For "Eileen's Garden"The following are quotes from a focus group."I wish I had this show when I was younger." - Adaire Brunson [22]"I love the music." - Hilary Brook [14]"It felt like an 80s movie." - Michael Burdo [30]"It's the only show I've ever seen that has female leads that talk about things other than men."         - Katherine Bloom [36]"Hilarious, feel good. It gave me a new perspective" - Sarah Walter [21]"Filled with memorable life lessons. A guide to adulting." - Nikita Su [21]"Funniest show I've ever seen!" - Stacy Pepper [12]"I never thought I'd like Mormons, but here we are." - Jeff Morris [18]Our TeamSadie StranksSadie Stranks is an ACTRA actor from Toronto. She has appeared in series such as, "The Hot Zone: Anthrax," "Haunted Hospitals" and "Holly Hobbie." Sadie writes every episode of “Eileen’s Garden” and plays the titular character, "Eileen Marie".Alana Omolayole Alana’s career spans 18 years and includes a diverse range of projects in both film and television. She has worked under the umbrella of broadcasters such as Discovery, National Geographic and Netflix. Alana has proven to be resourceful, agile and inventive.Susan Exton StranksSusan Exton Stranks is a hair dresser with IATSE. Selected credits include "Man From Toronto," "Miss America" and "Shazam." She was on an academy award winning team when she did hair in "Suicide Squad."Peter H StranksPeter Stranks is a stills photographer with IATSE. Selected credits include "V Wars," "Awake" and "Trigger Point." Peter shoots for TV, film and print. Peter recently shot for National Geographic. My StoryIn July of 2019, Sadie Stranks began to develop a sitcom following two roommates, struggling through their twenties. Stranks felt that there were no shows at the time that spoke to her generation.“It seemed like every show focused on high school students or adults in their thirties. There was nothing for young adults trying to find their place in the world.” Explained Stranks. “I had just begun my acting career. It didn’t take long for me to realize how limiting roles were for women. The characters I was auditioning for were often just there to serve their male protagonist. These characters had no urgency or thoughts beyond finding a boyfriend. They didn’t feel like real women to me at all.”Stranks used this limitation as motivation to create a series that wouldn’t alienate female viewers, but instead focus on things they cared about.“Anytime I wasn’t on set, I was in my best friend’s basement. We’d spend all night listening to indie music and debating existential theories. I remember this one time where we spent three hours discussing whether humans had free will or not. I wanted to create a show that validated those ideas and focused on the absurdity of our existence from a comedic perspective.”Stranks had studied satire and script writing, along with acting at Seneca College. It was during this time that she discovered her passion for writing.By March of 2020, Stranks’ series was in production. The weekend they were scheduled to film the pilot episode; was the weekend the world was put on lock down, due to the spread of Covid-19. Within a day, the film industry was shut down and Stranks’ series was put on hiatus. Not wanting to be alone in her apartment, Stranks went home to live with her parents during the quarantine. As bleak as things seemed, Stranks found a way to move forward.“Self employment means there will always be times when there is no work. That’s when it’s up to you to create your own work. To me, this was just one of those moments.” Stranks stated.Stranks quickly got to work on a quarantine version of the series that could be filmed safely during the pandemic.“During my time at Second City, I was taught that the only things needed to create a scene are two actors and a room. I began to write scripts that could be shot in one location with just two actors.“ Stranks explained.Stranks’ parents were enthusiastic about the project and agreed to crew it. Not surprising, considering Stranks comes from a family of film makers. They planned to film as many episodes as they could during the lock down. They would then use the footage they created to go after funding to produce the rest of the series properly. Episodes would be filmed primarily in the family's backyard. This reoccurring location inspired the name, "Eileen's Garden." There were drastic changes that had to be made to accommodate their new environment.“My original series focused on Eileen [Stranks’ character.] and her roommate, Barbra." Stranks describes. “Barbra's character was inspired by the friend I had spent the summer of 2019 with. When I pitched the concept of a quarantined series to Barbra’s actress, she expressed it wasn’t something she wanted to be a part of. I understood, but this meant that Barbra couldn't be the lead character anymore. I had to go back to the drawing board and create someone else to act alongside Eileen. Eve was created to replace Barbra. Barbra was changed to a supporting role."Heather Dennis was brought in to play the newly created character, Eve Marie. Though Stranks and Dennis had never met before filming, they quickly became close friends."I think everything worked out for the best." Stranks says, with a smile. "Heather and I have amazing chemistry on and off camera. There's no one else I'd rather do this series with."The Stranks family and Dennis were the only consistent crew members on set. Friends would come to set and lend a hand whenever they were able to; but there were many days of filming with just the four of them. "Eileen’s Garden" never had more then seven people on set. This was done to minimize the risk of spreading Covid-19. This raised many challenges, as most shows rely on crews built of hundreds of people. Filming the first two episodes was no easy task. Everyone took on multiple roles. By the end of the lock down, the first two episodes of "Eileen's Garden" had been filmed."I'm really proud of what we accomplished." Stranks begins. "The first two episodes are practically perfect. You would never know they were created with such limited resources. We didn't have money, or a large crew, or anything you're suppose to have when you're filming. We just had a script and a few people that believed in it."Those wanting to see the quarantine episodes will have a chance! One of the rewards listed on IndieGoGo is a virtual screening of the second episode, "The Book Of Moron." Known as one of the funniest episodes of the series. Those wanting to see the completed series must support "Eileen's Garden" through IndieGoGo.Thank You To All Who Support,"Eileen's Garden."We'll see ya in the garden!

story:
Who Are We?

Meridian Smith was born and raised in Washington state. They are currently a film student at an university in Olympia, WA and were a student at The Seattle Film School's three-week intensive program. They are a filmmaker as well as one of the co-founders of A Redefining Gaze Productions. Meridian was also a member of a band, Meimei, created to fill a felt disparity amongst the local music scene.

Jackie Sin, the other co-founder of A Redefining Gaze Productions, was born in Hong Kong and raised in both Hong Kong and Bellevue, WA. They are currently a Women and Gender Studies/Film Studies double major at Seattle University in Seattle, WA. They are also a filmmaker.

Together, Meridian and Jackie are the creators/writers/directors/producers of Instrumental Closet. This will be the first official project of A Redefining Gaze Productions, a company that strives to provide more diverse representation in the industry.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, we are going to raise $3000 to bring this project to life.

Currently, we are in the post-production stage of the project. Our goal is to finish editing by mid-September to begin releasing episodes at the beginning of October with the entire season out by the end of January.

With 22 episodes, here is where your help comes into play. We filmed over the span of a month and hope to gain back what we have spent so far. The money that we raise after that will go towards paying the actors and anyone else involved, such as crew members and our creators of art and music.

It is imperative that queer people of color are both represented in media and paid for their work. 

To thank you for your contribution, our perks range from getting a song download to a personalised thank you postcard!

At the end of the day, we're committed to sharing an original series that provides more representation for the LGBTQ community and people of color. If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we will continue to work hard on this project and produce as much as we can.

The Impact

The role of media and representation is hugely significant to the members of the community who are being represented. Often times, people of marginalized communities, such as people of color and queer individuals are misrepresented through stereotypes or are completely absent from published narratives. This work aims to create better representation by adding to the anthology of work by and for the LGBTQ+ community. This web series also works to engage with a story about the steps taken to self-acceptance and coming to terms with the political significance of being queer artists within our contemporary society. 

How Else Can You Help?

We understand that not everyone may have the money to contribute, but you can still be a part of this campaign by helping us spread the word. You can tweet, post, like, and share on any social media you have. This is a great way to help us regardless of what monetary contributions you might be able to make!

story:
I (Sabean Bea) Originally wrote this series as I felt there wasn't a representation for real people in comedy in the UK in the same way there was in America. Anything that was based for working class showed crime and gang wars etc. I wanted something a lot more light which showed the reality of living and growing up working class and the natural funny situations and problems that came from different classes, our differences and similarities. All of the characters are based on people I know or knew at the time along with some of the situations. I personally find the best things are sometimes the ones you can relate the most to which gave me the idea to get writing. Then as I started to attempt to gather my team I met the Directors who helped me make the script more TV ready and started to put our brains together in how we could make the dream a reality.....This is where we begin

The campaign is about generating the support and financial means to make the pilot a reality. This will allow us to pay for a pilot that's TV ready in terms of quality. So , what the money already has, and will be going towards: 

Audition space - Hired out a safe and suitable private space where actors could come to audition for the lead roles. 

Read through and marketing photo-shoot - The images you can already see are pre-edited images taken by a professional photographer Dan Fearon to help show our vision and to assist in marketing the pilot once shot. On the same day we had out first read through which took the majority of the day - we would preferably like to pay everyone for their time and efforts

Going forward - 

Actors wages - We have 4 lead actors and 1 supporting actor who we have agreed to pay for up to 3 days filming.  (equity minimum ) 

Crew XON films- On a low budget but high quality arrangement we have noted we will need 6 members of crew, including sound, lighting and director of photography. We intend to pay them again for up to 3 days filming equity minimum.  

Location - On the smaller scale we still potentially would need to pay towards location for two of the scenes. 

Post production - To get this all edited and looking shiny and ready to go we are going to need a little portion of money for the sound syncing and grading. 

Screening! - A heap of the money will go towards a screening which we will invite producers and TV channels to come and watch.

Street Doctors - If we raise our goal we intend to give what remains to street doctors charity

If we can raise our budget it will truly help us achieve our vision. At the moment we're investing as much of our own funds as we can but it doesn't quite cut what we will require to really make this happen. We appreciate anything you can give towards it and hope you'll get to see it come to life! We cannot do this without you.

We will keep the page updated with our progresses. 

Thank you in advance :) 

Sabean, Elijah, Andre and the rest of the cast & crew x

story:
First thing's first. Do you like our videos? We hope so. If you don't know for sure, check them out here! 

You came back after watching those? Coool! We hoped you would. 

Those videos you just watched are written, produced, shot, directed, and performed by a group of Chicago comedians. All of us hope to make a career of this one day. And this is how you can help us start. Up until this point, all of our videos have been funded out of our own pockets. And when you're a struggling comedian in Chicago, those pockets aren't filled with much other than a few old Chipotle receipts. 

With your contributions, we can continue this project with the same high quality videos we have been producing. 

Okay, so what's the money for? 

Well like we said, this ragtag group of Chicago comedians have been paying a lot out of their own pockets to work on a project that they are passionate about. Because as we've learned--you can't do anything for free. That being said, those pockets are pretty dry right now. So what do we need? Well in order to continue on with the great content we've had so far, we need a  few expenses covered. These expenses include: travel, equipment (lighting, sound, camera), location rentals, food (the old frozen pizza Brittany found in her freezer has only lasted us two shoots), props, costumes, paying our graphic designers, and more. 

Cool! Anything else? 

We have so far been able to produce three episodes of our show and it has cost us quite a bit. Any donation helps in any way and is much appreciated--otherwise we may not be able to continue to go on. With your help, we can continue this project as long as the White House is inhabited by an orange man child--and hopefully even after that. 

I'd love to but....

We totally understand some people can't help us out financially and that is totally fine! Hey, we're right there with you. We do ask that if you can't help us here to please support us in other ways. Pass this campaign around, subscribe to our YouTube channel, like us on Facebook, check out our website, follow us on Twitter and Instagram. 

Peace, love, Hillary Clinton.

story:
Super Shorts

We will be releasing short films, once a week, for the next seven weeks. These short films take place in the Electron Blade universe and tell short snippets of stories that are complimentary to the story of our pilot. The first of these shorts follows Astoria Kortzy.

Short Summary

Tommy Kraft, creator of "Star Trek - Horizon", a Star Trek fan film garnering over 5.5 million views on YouTube, has teamed up with actress and writer, Callie Bussell in creating quality science fiction, forming their company TK2 Films. 

After years of cultivating a friendship, Tommy and Callie bonded heavily over dealing with unrelenting mental and physical health issues. Electron Blade started as a seed of an idea, and flourished under their necessity to find meaning in what often felt like a meaningless existence. As the themes in the story will show, it became their hope in the face of despair. After a winter's worth of writing, rewriting, rerewriting, casting, creating, and growing their team of talented individuals, everything has fallen into place, except one thing: the funds to make it happen.

Tommy and Callie on the set of RUNAWAY.

The Electron Blade Universe, called Fal'Rath, is a persistent universe spanning across multiple media genres including graphic novel, television, film, music, and novelization. In building this universe from the ground up, all of the media will heavily interconnect, sharing multiple characters viewpoints, and uncovering pieces of Fal'Rath's history and mystery layer by layer.

The map of the world: Fal'rath in all of it's glory.

There are two kinds of beings in the universe: the Erodun…and everything else. Eden, the highest among the Erodun, is the god of the land and the ruler of the world. Discontent with her loneliness, she created her angels of light, her fellow Erodun. Together they would fashion a beautiful universe, but all good things must come to an end. Yggdrasil, Eden’s right hand and most trusted angel, turned against her. He raged against everything she stood for. If she is light, then he would undoubtedly be the embodiment of darkness.

Mural depicting Yggdrasil's fall from grace and the ensuing battle with Eden.

Many of Eden’s companions died in the fight against Yggdrasil. She once again found herself increasingly alone. After a time, she decided she would create once again, so she fashioned the world of Fal’rath and all of humankind. Together, with her remaining angels, she would care for this new world and continue to breath life into her creations. They would worship her – their creator – and in reward for their constant faith, would receive joy everlasting.

Our Previous Films

 

Cast

Every week we'll be announcing cast members for Electron Blade. The first member we're announcing is Tim Russ of Star Trek: Voyager!

What We Need & What You Get

Though Tommy and Callie have quite a bit of experience making something from nothing, this project is bigger than anything they've done before. From renting a studio, to hiring their electric team, and most importantly paying their actors, designers, and crew, the money we earn will be spent on hiring the talent to truly grow the project. Of the $60,000 they are asking for, not a cent of it will reach Tommy or Callie's pockets. Even if they don't earn the whole budget, they're still going to do everything in their power to bring this project to life. 

Preliminary Budget For Pilot Episode

In exchange for your help, you'll be rewarded with anything from Fal'Rath swag to a spot on the team helping to create and write our story!

The Impact

Electron Blade is a story that needs to be told, a story about the outcasts and the derelicts finding family and hope in each other, a story about compassion no matter what the creed or color. It's about standing up for what's right and what you believe in, and to always have hope in the face of despair. In a world so full of despair and intolerance, TK2 Films would like to shed a little bit of light into the darkness.

In the past, Tommy has launched two incredibly successful Kickstarter campaigns, one for "Star Trek - Horizon" and "Runaway", both exceeding their asked for budgets, and TK2 Films has continued to have a growing network of fans and supporters helping them to continue to create.

Risks & Challenges

So far, their main challenge has come down to the budget. While Tommy works freelance, and Callie serves beer when she's not creating, their combined salaries are not enough to hire the cast and crew and purchase the equipment necessary to launch their story! 

Everything they've created so far has either come from the generosity and time donation of their team, or money from their own pockets!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate anything monetarily, there are certainly other ways to get involved! Donating skills, ideas, and just spreading the word! Share the website www.electronblade.com, or our Facebook page!
story_txt:
Super Shorts
We will be releasing short films, once a week, for the next seven weeks. These short films take place in the Electron Blade universe and tell short snippets of stories that are complimentary to the story of our pilot. The first of these shorts follows Astoria Kortzy.


Short Summary
Tommy Kraft, creator of "Star Trek - Horizon", a Star Trek fan film garnering over 5.5 million views on YouTube, has teamed up with actress and writer, Callie Bussell in creating quality science fiction, forming their company TK2 Films. 
After years of cultivating a friendship, Tommy and Callie bonded heavily over dealing with unrelenting mental and physical health issues. Electron Blade started as a seed of an idea, and flourished under their necessity to find meaning in what often felt like a meaningless existence. As the themes in the story will show, it became their hope in the face of despair. After a winter's worth of writing, rewriting, rerewriting, casting, creating, and growing their team of talented individuals, everything has fallen into place, except one thing: the funds to make it happen.

Tommy and Callie on the set of RUNAWAY.
The Electron Blade Universe, called Fal'Rath, is a persistent universe spanning across multiple media genres including graphic novel, television, film, music, and novelization. In building this universe from the ground up, all of the media will heavily interconnect, sharing multiple characters viewpoints, and uncovering pieces of Fal'Rath's history and mystery layer by layer.

The map of the world: Fal'rath in all of it's glory.
There are two kinds of beings in the universe: the Erodun…and everything else. Eden, the highest among the Erodun, is the god of the land and the ruler of the world. Discontent with her loneliness, she created her angels of light, her fellow Erodun. Together they would fashion a beautiful universe, but all good things must come to an end. Yggdrasil, Eden’s right hand and most trusted angel, turned against her. He raged against everything she stood for. If she is light, then he would undoubtedly be the embodiment of darkness.

Mural depicting Yggdrasil's fall from grace and the ensuing battle with Eden.
Many of Eden’s companions died in the fight against Yggdrasil. She once again found herself increasingly alone. After a time, she decided she would create once again, so she fashioned the world of Fal’rath and all of humankind. Together, with her remaining angels, she would care for this new world and continue to breath life into her creations. They would worship her – their creator – and in reward for their constant faith, would receive joy everlasting.
Our Previous Films


 

Cast

story:
About Cathy Richardson's Project 365

Hi! I'm a singer, songwriter, musician and producer and I've been playing music professionally for the past 25 years. Most notably, I've been the lead singer of the classic rock band Jefferson Starship for the past decade. Before that I toured with Big Brother and the Holding Co. after portraying Janis Joplin in several cities in an Off Broadway show called Love, Janis. And since I started my career in the 90s, I've been an original artist, writing songs, producing and releasing independent albums under my name, Cathy Richardson Band, and the Macrodots. I even received a GRAMMY Nomination for the album art on my 2003 release the Road to Bliss, as a 100% DIY music artist. 

Jefferson Starship is a fantastic, high profile gig that is an incredible showcase for me as a performer, but we are only on the road part of the year. That said, it's my main gig so I need to keep myself pretty open to accommodate the ever-fluctuating schedule. So, last December, I had this crazy/ambitious idea to post a song every day this year on my YouTube channel. It would increase my reach to new fans and inspire daily engagement with my existing fan base. And, hopefully, create another revenue stream- something I can do either from home or the road- to supplement my income when live shows are scarce. 

A lot has changed in the world and my life since I first started my quest for rock stardom. There are lots of new and different ways to make money in music but independent artists like me really need to hustle, diversify and get creative to make a living. 

Project 365 is a ginormous undertaking and I really had no idea what I was getting myself into when I started. Yes, I had major apprehensions and, in spite of them, with the encouragement of a few close friends, I dove in head first.

That first week, I thought, OH MY GOD, WHAT HAVE I DONE, when I began to see the enormity of time that simply recording a video takes, let alone editing, uploading and posting it. I immediately wanted to throw in the towel. I contemplated the level of humiliation from announcing a year long project and giving up a few days into it. Right away I could see that I had a giant learning curve and technical difficulties to overcome, I needed to devote a lot of time to it, and I needed some new and updated equipment. The first thing I did was buy a cheap tripod and new digital video camera since the one I was using was from the late 1900s. 

And I kept making videos. Now that I've gotten into it, there are so many things I could use to make better videos. Lighting, backdrops, a better tripod, professional editing software, and a new, faster laptop to run said software, for example. 

At the moment, my videos are getting an average of about 200 views each. I looked at my year-to-date YouTube earnings today and it's $25, about enough for dinner at Chipotle, but not even 5% of the new camera cost. Obviously, I need a lot more views in order to make YouTube a revenue stream of any significance! I could use part of the budget to promote the videos and get more views. 

I'm also spending at least 1-3 hours on each video, sometimes more. I would be extraordinarily grateful for the energetic exchange of monetary reward for the amount of work, talent and time that goes into doing this every day. Maybe I could even pay someone to help me!

A couple weeks ago, right before I hit 100 videos, a fan from Facebook sent me a check for $100 to support the first 100 days. I cannot tell you how enormously grateful I was to receive that check because it truly could not have come at a better time. She told me she thought all my viewers should donate to keep me going. It got me thinking.

If 100 fans pledged $1 a day to my project, that budget would help to:

  • Update and upgrade my equipment to produce higher quality videos and increase productivity
  • Promote the videos > get more views > make new fans > expand my audience to tour as a solo artist > increase YouTube revenue
  • Help me keep the lights on at home. Literally. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I set the goal at $36,500 to represent the impact of just 100 people pledging $1 per video. I feel like this is a realistic goal, I have 1000+ subscribers on YouTube and 8.5k on Facebook. I realize not everyone can afford to pledge that much but some might be into a smaller donation to the cause. There might also be those wealthy patrons of the arts out there who wouldn't bat an eye at throwing down for the entire budget. Some, like my Facebook fan who came up with the dollar a day concept, might prefer to break it up into quarterly donations. Indiegogo campaigns only run for 60 days so I can always run another campaign down the road.

The Impact

When I am finished with this year, my goal is that I will significantly reach more people, make new fans and subscribers. My YouTube channel will be a self-sustaining income source and I will not have to ask my fans to donate to the cause, the videos will be free and my gift to the world. The quality and presentation of the videos will be of a higher standard. And when I have posted 365 videos, the world will know that I can (and will!) sing anything. My territory as a solo artist will expand so I can come play more shows for all of you outside Chicago when Jefferson Starship is not touring. And I will keep going! I'm already thinking ahead to 2020's Project 366! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute cash, I get it. You can still help!

  • Watch the videos from beginning to end, and let the ads play!
  • Get the word out and let people know about Project 365
  • Do you have used equipment or other resources to donate?
  • Leave a comment, give a thumbs up!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I love and thank you so much for your support and encouragement. I promise to keep singing for you and producing more, and better, videos!! xo Cath

story:
Creator Corner

Hi Guys, I'm Dawntavia "Dawn" Bullard. The Creator, Writer, Producer & Director of Brownsville. WOW! I can finally add Director to my title. This project is my directorial debut and I'm so excited to share it with you. Join me on this ground-breaking show that pushes the envelope.

I was born & raised in Miami, Florida. In fact, I grew up in the inner-city of Brownsville. The same place the show is centered around. This series is based on real life events from my childhood and also real life events some of my friends experienced and shared with me. This is a passion project at the core of it. Very personal to me,  which is why I invested everything I had plus some "I Owe Yous" into the making of Brownsville. I believe in it so much that I personally invested over $12,000 into production.

Some of you may know me as an actress. I've been privileged to be a working actress in Hollywood. I've worked on some amazing TV shows like "Underground on WGN & Devious Maids on ABC. Also, my latest film "Den Of Thieves" starring Gerard Butler will release in theaters early 2018. Make sure you go watch it, I play "Chaminade". Feel free to check-out my full acting/writing resume on IMDB at www.imdb.me/DawntaviaBullard 

I'm not just an actress. I'm a filmmaker. A storyteller. A writer. I began my career into the film & television industry as an actress. Moving to Los Angeles after grade school. Leaving my comfort zone at just 18 years old. Yes, I was afraid but I went anyway. Yes, I was alone but I went anyway. Yes, I was nearly broke, but guess what... I went anyway. No one was going to convince me my dreams were just dreams. No one. - "If you don't believe in yourself, no one else will"

So I went out and followed my heart. I quickly realized Hollywood was not going to hand me, some young black girl from the inner-city an opportunity. Trust me, I asked and they said NO!!!!! I didn't want a handout. I just wanted an opportunity to work for it. Prove myself capable. But, no one in Hollywood was ready to give me a shot. So I went back to school, studied, read every book I could on screenwriting and began writing my own short films. Created my own acting opportunities. I soon after moved to Atlanta, the Hollywood of the South where my career blossomed.

Story - What is Brownsville? 

The teens of Brownsville are always rife with problems. Whether it's about sexuality, growing up, drugs or parents, there's always something going at Brownsville High and at their homes.

We can all relate that being a teenager is hard, cruel, sometimes lonely, sometimes tragic. Especially when life at home ain't that much better than life at school. 

Brownsville will be the complete opposite of the 90’s teen drama shows Hollywood presented to us. Shows I watched and loved but hardly ever saw a brown face in them. Shows like Dawson’s Creek, 90210 and The O.C. which followed a group of white friends around their privileged lives.

This series is ground breaking in the sense that there has never been a teen show that follows a group of ten Black and Hispanic friends on their coming of age journey.

Brownsville seeks to serve a greater purpose to our youth by meeting them where they are. By creating characters they feel connected to and introducing plots and twists to their story-lines, we aim not to promote sex, drugs and violence but to instead take our audience on a journey through the real day to day struggle of bad, sometimes tragic, decision-making our youth experience daily.

THE CAST - NEW FACES 

We have an incredible cast of talented young people. They act, sing, dance, you name it. This is there break-out performance and they are so eager to be on this journey with you all.

The Girls: 

  • Jasmine Walker plays "ASHLEY"
  • Aerin Pruitt plays "PRISCILLA" 
  • Chrysta Taylor plays "ISABEL" 
  • Thalia Myers plays "ROSCHELLE" 
  • Tatyana Carter plays "TUDY" 
  • Iyaari Batts plays "KEISHA"

The Boys: 

  • Shaquille Lazier plays "BRANDON"
  • Crispus "Shun" Hendrix plays "DEE"
  • Larry Anderson plays "SNUG" 
  • Randy Hicks III plays "SHOE-LACE"
  • Judson Medelus plays "PEANUT"

What We Need

POST-PRODUCTION

Now that we've shot everything for season one.  We've already invested over $12,000 for the filming of all seven episodes this summer. We paid for filming equipment rental (lights, camera, sound), the crew (AD, Cinematographer, Sound technicians, Grips), Set Decorations, Wardrobe, Travel and meals.  

Right now our number one goal is to complete post-production for all seven episodes with the most powerful imagery and incredible music and sound possible so that they show is the best quality it can be. 

First, we will begin post production with the editing phase. Out of all the footage we filmed this summer, the editor will cut each episode out. This will take roughly 420 hours sitting in front of his computer day end and day out to edit all 7 episodes. We pay the editor hourly. 

The second phase is the sound engineering phase to work on sound effects and foley for each episode. This person is paid by the hour.  

The third phase we will hire a Music Composer. This person will add music and scoring to each episode. This will take about 200 hours to work on the music for all seven episodes. This person is paid hourly.

How You Can Help

You can be apart of this series. This is YOUR opportunity to join forces with us and create art. Please buy one of our amazing perks. Your financial gift to this show will take us into the next phase in this passion project. CLICK on a PERK to the right.

The Impact

Your financial gift will allow all of us, the cast & crew the opportunity to live out our dreams of writing, directing, acting, producing and most importantly you are funding something bigger than our dreams. You are funding what accomplishing our dreams will do to the people who look up to us and depend on us.

The younger generations who watch us work hard everyday to be successful. Your token of love & support today, will plant the seed into someone's mind that people do believe in us, no matter where we come from or what color our skin may be. And for that, I say thank you a million times.

This series will remind all of us about those sensitive years in our lives, adolescent years and how those decisions we made back then impacted our future, sometimes for the good, sometimes for the bad. We hope this series inspires and entertain you. 

Risks & Challenges

Let's be honest! Our BIG goal would be to have this web-series win an EMMY. Yes. A real EMMY for best new media content. We can totally do it. BUT; please understand that this is a goal of ours and not a definite. 

Another Goal is to sell the show to the marketplace; Netflix or a cable network. We will take our finish product to be considered by distributors. 

Also, another goal is to submit the series to many film festivals around the country and abroad. We believe we will be accepted into many festivals and win awards along the way but that's not a definite either. We submit and wait to be accepted into the festival. We have to complete the project first.

As they say, without risk there's no reward. I believe that. I hope you believe that. FAITH is what qualifies you to overcome those hurdles in life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute financially at the moment, no worries, you can still help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Send a text. Post on your social media accounts. Ask friends to support this campaign and help bring more opportunities to young people who inspire to be great! 

When one of us win, we all win!

This series will remind all of us about those sensitive years in our lives, adolescent years and how those decisions we made back then impacted our future, sometimes for the good, sometimes for the bad. We hope this series inspires and entertain you.

Let's be honest! Our BIG goal would be to have this web-series win an EMMY. Yes. A real EMMY for best new media content. We can totally do it. BUT; please understand that this is a goal of ours and not a definite. 

Another Goal is to sell the show to the marketplace; Netflix or a cable network. We will take our finish product to be considered by distributors. 
Also, another goal is to submit the series to many film festivals around the country and abroad. We believe we will be accepted into many festivals and win awards along the way but that's not a definite either. We submit and wait to be accepted into the festival. We have to complete the project first.
As they say, without risk there's no reward. I believe that. I hope you believe that. FAITH is what qualifies you to overcome those hurdles in life. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute financially at the moment, no worries, you can still help:
Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Send a text. Post on your social media accounts. Ask friends to support this campaign and help bring more opportunities to young people who inspire to be great! 
When one of us win, we all win!

story:
Meet The Team

 

 

My name is Emmanuel Christian and in many ways four halves make a whole is my story. Am I an immigrant of ambiguous origin who was forced to live with siblings for a huge inheritance? No, no I am not. I was born in Brooklyn but raised in Ghana. I didn’t move back to the US until college and when I did move back I had to rediscover my mother, navigate a new dad (and to a small extent an old one), two new siblings, my blackness as an American and identity in general. “4 Halves Make a Whole” is a show about family and race but it’s also a show with characters that happen to be a family and happen to be different races. Furthermore, It’s also a show that doesn’t take itself too seriously because if there’s one thing I’ve learned in my life, it’s that sometimes you just have to laugh.

I’ve been in the entertainment industry for about five years now, primarily in front of the camera. This project is my first production..

 

My name is Tamara Tonge and I am Co-Producer, Co-Creator and Co-Star of “4 Halves Makes a Whole”. Film making has always been an interest of mine. I've always been attracted to anything that involves strangers coming together as one to create something great. Back in May, I found myself sitting on my living room couch watching the web series “Awkward Black Girl” created by Issa Rae. It had been my second time watching the series, but this time around I decided to research a little about the series. To my surprise, in a nutshell, “Awkward Black Girl” was just an idea that Issa Rae had and eventually made the decision to create and share with the world. She's a black woman who was inspired to create a web series and she simply went out and did it. Now, fast forward to 2017, she is one of the people on a rapidly growing list of successful black women who other aspiring entertainment industry members can look up to. I couldn't help but wonder one thing. Why am I just sitting on the couch? In that moment, I was both inspired and determined to make the move from admiring filmmakers, to becoming one. “Four Halves Make a Whole” has been nothing short of a labor of love since it's fruition and I can't wait to see it through to the end. 

 

Since graduating with a Bachelor’s in Film & Video in 2009 from Five Towns College, Michael Fels has been working on Independent Feature Films, Independent Short Films, Music Videos, an HBO TV Show, Public Service Announcements, Commercials,  (NYU) New York University Graduate Films, (SVA) School of Visual Arts Graduate Films, & (NYFA) New York Film Academy Short Films, Pilots, and webseries.  Films Michael has worked on have played in the Cannes Film Festival, Sundance, and many more.   Michael has over 55 credits on IMDB (Michael Fels). Visit his website  www.MichaelFelsFilmmaker.com to see his full resume, reel, and his bio

 

Micheal Miceli, Winner of 13 screenwriting awards over the past 3 years, including the 2011 New York Independent Film Festival’s Best Comedy Short Film (Honored).  Miceli also won an award for Best Director of a Comedy Short Film from the Best Actors (in a) Film Festival in 2011 before being awarded “Best Short Script” from the LA Comedy Awards in November for Damaged Goods.  Funny, energetic and motivating, Miceli is one of the NY area’s hottest young filmmaking talents

Dolapo C Olorode is an up and coming producer with a passion for creative content that inspires a generation of dreamers to eventually become doer. Her educational background consist of a Bachelors and Masters degree from one of the top business schools in the country, the University of Illinois Urbana - Champaign. Currently residing in New York, she has been working on various projects for 3+ years which include working as a producer and chief editor for Arfpro studios production company where she produced and built the sizzle reels for shows like "Trish Humphries Show" and "Charity Chef" which was later pitched to major networks such as BRAVO and MTV Networks. Not only that, she has just finished wrapping up a short film with King Henry Films as the executive producer titled "To Raise a Child" which is set to be released to all major film festivals in earlier 2018 as well as she is now working as a producer for a music documentary with “Chasing my Dreams films.” 

 

Lander Camarero: Bilbao, 1981. Writer, Director, DP and Editor, he has shot all around the world in countries as India, Iraq, Austria, Oman, USA, Cuba, Peru and Argentina. He founded his production company named "Pressure Filmak". The analytical documentary about fiction What About Columbus was his first work under the label, followed by the short films A Political Story, A Serious Comedy and A Revenge Story, three completely different takes on activism. Right now he's producing and writing "The Coffee Advisors" in NYC, a comedy series about conspiracy theories and the 9/11 events. 

 

BUDGET

As you all know, or maybe some of you don't, making a 10 episode web series (10 minutes per episode) is almost like making a full length feature film. The budget below reflects what we anticipate needing based on the previous shoot/episodes that have already been shot. As we see this as a very collaborative production, some of the perks for your contributions are really fun ways to join the team!

 

Impact

This campaign/show hopes to inspire people to ask important questions about identity as well as help people to embrace the idea of seeing the world through the eyes of others. On the logistics side, the campaign is also poised to inspire and promote women of color to be more prominent in the entertainment industry as their views and contributions are heavily valued and necessary- Big ups to our 2 producers Tee and Dee

Risks & Challenges

The producers and team have already put a lot into this project (finances, resources, time etc) and we realize the biggest challenge to creating this has been funding as it has been the biggest limiting factor.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Our ultimate goal is to create a  show that not only brings laughs, but also has a message that resonates and to do that we have to be able to reach out to as many people as possible. As such, any shares, likes and social media marketing would be greatly appreciated to get the message out there. We call it insightful amusement!

story:
I'm Hyapatia Lee, a Cherokee Blessed Woman.  I studied for several decades with medicine men and women from many tribes.  Several years ago I was elected Blessed Woman for the Lost River Band of the Cherokees where I began to share what I had learned.  I have seen this information help countless people and I feel it is too important to be kept hidden any longer.  In this TV series, I  introduce you to Native Strength, a system for emotional balance and enlightenment that was given to us thousands of years ago by the Star People.  We live on The Planet of The Children, as our ancestral family in the stars call it.  Our immaturity as a species puts us at greater risk for self-destruction. Legends abound all over the western hemisphere of interactions with Star People.  Pictographs on caves and rocks illustrate devices and experiences reported in tribal histories and traditions.  The Native Strength path is shared with the help of medicine wheels that can be compared to the circles the aliens used in the movie Arrival to share information.  Contributing to this campaign will help spread these important traditional teachings around the world and expand our television audience.   Our goal is to raise $10,000 to bring happiness, health, harmony, humor, and hope to our world through the Native Strength path.

 

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Your money will be spent on:

EQUIPMENT    

CREW  

STUDIO EXPENSES

LOCATIONS

STOCK FOOTAGE & AUDIO

FILM FESTIVAL SUBMISSION FEES

Any money received will go toward producing the Native Strength series, even if we don't reach our goal.

 

WHERE TO SEE THE NATIVE STRENGTH EPISODES

Native Strength can be seen on TV in Washington, DC, Virginia, Milwaukee, and on ROKU and we are adding new areas all the time. This is a link to the pilot episode that introduces the Native Strength series.  This episode will be seen at the Emerging Filmmakers Project Docs and Mocs Film Festival at the Bug Theater in Denver, Colorado during the 4:00 pm block on December 3, 2017.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HGbIDwJk0Tc&amp...

 

The Flowering Tree episode explains the inner personas with a traditional medicine story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-RPc_gi81Q&amp...

 

The third episode of the first season of Native Strength is about following your dreams and includes the classic traditional story of Little Jumping Mouse.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OHj8VNyNEzg&amp...

 

The Plants episode of Native Strength introduces both healing plants for the body and teaching plants for the mind.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p1ASbpIxXaw&amp...

 

The South episode begins our journey around the Wheel of Life with an examination of the importance of perspective.  This episode includes six teaching stories to explain how the energy of the South can be used in both positive and negative ways.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HghnVGj4UqQ&amp...

story:
Who We Are

  • My name is Alex deCourville. I am an actor, writer and comedian.
  • Pinheads is a passion project of mine. This is our second season and the show has come to mean a lot to all actors and crew.
  • A lot of great actors are working on this and we're bringing in more people for season 2.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're ballparking our needs at $1,000. This money will be allocated to sets, props and food. Any money we make can be difference between eating and not eating on set.
  • Unique perks can make you a part of the show - including producer credits and even cameos. If you contribute to Pinheads, it won't just be our show, it can be YOUR show.
  • Every little bit helps. If we don't make our full thousand dollars, whatever money we make can help.

The Impact

  • People love shows such as It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, The IT Crowd and Cheers. Now you can be a part in getting another show like that to the big stage.
  • In season 1, we were able to work with stars such as Obscurus Lupa and Oreo - the body model for Rocket Raccoon
  • Pinheads was a quarter finalist in the NexTV Pitch Competition, with one of the contest runners giving high praise to the series.
  • We were able to produce a first season. Imagine what we can do with your help.

Risks & Challenges

  • We faced problems in the first season: Actors dropped out, schedules conflicted, 
  • In spite of all this, we were able to get the first season completed and distributed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the money? There are ways to help:

  • Spread the word about our campaign! Not everyone can afford to give money, but if you know anyone who can afford to be a part of our show, send them our way.
  • Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pinheadsfanpage/
  • Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/PinheadsFanpage
  • Buy some merchandise: https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/552295-pinheads
  • Watch the show! Viewership counts. Be sure to like, comment and thumbs up all our videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pbyUoe8x-0E&amp...

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHAT AM I DOING?

Crossing Japan from the southern most point of the main land to the top of Hokkaido. This will be done by ferry, bike and foot but without the use of trains, planes or driving.

There will be a time limit of one month and I will be trying to experience the known and the unknown parts of Japan as I cross the country meeting people and musicians.

On route, I will make 2 things:

1) A video documentary of the journey

2) A piece of music constructed from recordings with various musicians in various styles all across Japan.

WHY AM I DOING THIS?

Honestly, it's simply a dream project for me, combining my love of music, Japan and film making. If you'd like to see any of my previous film making or music production please let me know!

I do believe this will be a unique project unlike anything i've ever seen produced in Japan before.

WHY DO I NEED MONEY?

I will be taking a month out of my normal activities to do this and there will be many costs along the way like puncture repair, accommodation, buying a second hand bike, getting to and from the start and finish line to my home either side of the adventure. This is to just name a few. If you want more information then please let me know and I'll give you a breakdown of my predicted budget.

WILL I PROFIT?

I will use the money as best as possible to make the journey possible and the finished products as good as possible, but this is all quite possible on the cheap. I want to be prepared financially but I should be able to cope with most problems. If I do end up with a profit therefore, I will be donating funds towards a charity of my choice. I am looking at several brain tumour foundations and it's a charity close to my heart, but I will update you once I know for sure.

story:
Short Summary

I thought of Ghost Town while in my freshman year of college. It all started when I asked the question: What if a ghost made someone draw a dick on a board in front of all their classmates? Then I laughed because I thought the image was super funny. How I got to the full story I couldn't tell ya. But I recently graduated college and I finally have time to make this thing. Before I go into the "real world" and get an entry level job in showbiz where all my time will be spent slaving for some exec, I want to make something that is MINE, where I'm the creative head and I am my own boss. I want to be a Showrunner in the future so your contributions will allow me to get a head start on that and bring my daydream of ghosts forcing a kid to draw a dick on a blackboard come to fruition. 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $4500 to fund two episodes that will serve as proof of concept on our larger Indiegogo campaign that we will launch at the end of April that will have a goal of $25,000. The funds will be split between the two episodes. Most of the money will be going to makeup, costume, and special effects. I (Ameerah) have a personal belief system that ARTISTS DESERVE TO BE PAID. So factored into the budget is payment for our producers, actors, and head of departments. Most of our crew will be young college kids and those of them that are soon to enter the enterainment biz deserve some pennies for thier trouble don't you think?

The Impact

Ghost Town will obviously focus on death. As someone with a very dark sense if humor I’ve always found death to be a little hilarious. However I am aware that this is a very real subject, mortality. Ghost Town aims to look death in the face and smile about it. Suicide, depression and grief are all explored within Ghost Town but also issues of life. Death is scary but Life is hard. Kevin and his friends bond over Life and the struggles of getting through it. For those that struggle through life, which is everyone, I think this series will be one of those shows you can point to when you talk to your friends at 3am and say “that’s how it feels” and be understood.

There is also a theme of self acceptance that is unique to Kevin’s arch. Kevin is Chinese American and although being  Guide is not unique to Chinese people in this universe, his ability link him to his grandmother and the rest of his family line who have had this gift. It draws him back to his family and an aspect of himself that he struggles to accept. So there is a general element of self-acceptance but also the embracing of heritage and culture from the perspective of a person of color in America.

And the show is just gonna be a laugh.

 

So share and donate. And don’t die.
