story:
Join the Action!

We're pioneering episodic storytelling and audience participation as an integral part of nonviolent moral direct action to protect our planet from the worst effects of climate change.

Our community is fighting for clean air, fresh water, healthy children and a prosperous future. We're not alone. With the global threat of climate change driven by entrenched commercial and industrial interests, every person on earth faces the same challenges. Most are either in denial, feel powerless, or don't know how to take action and join the fight.

With Our Climate: A Collection Action to Save Our World, we will document the strategies, methods and direct actions we deploy in an asymmetrical struggle against a global, multibillion-dollar corporation. We will capture the drama, intrigue, victories, and setbacks in our uphill battle. Just like in the global climate wars, surrender is not an option. We're all fighting to save our home planet on a tight timeline. The threat to our county is even more imminent.

While the stakes are high, and the sacrifices are serious, we're a fun-loving, warm and often hilarious community filled with characters you'll want to bring into your life.

Unlike documentaries that are released after the dust has settled, nobody knows the outcome of our struggle. Our audience will follow our actions through Facebook Live and periodic, high-quality episodes on Facebook and YouTube. We will be pitching streaming services such as Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime to reach a broader audience, increase the frequency and improve production values.

We intend to build a global platform that documents the fight for environmental, social and climate justice in communities around the world and right here at home.

Let's Escalate

We're launching a global boycott, divestment campaign and direct actions aimed at preventing the construction of a heavily polluting factory. We'll be disrupting supply chains, targeting distributors and customers, and calling out complicit politicians in the most public ways possible.

Our tactics will span from nonviolent moral direct action in the tradition of MLK and Gandhi, through power-mapping and value-chain leverage to corporate culture-jamming antics. 

This fight could get expensive. While we're a volunteer army, we need transportation, lodging, printing, and online marketing as well as videographers, editors, media relations, court costs, lawyers, and bail money.

We'll be fighting battles in Charleston, WV, our state capital, at the headquarters of our opposition in Denmark, throughout Jefferson County, in Washington, DC, and at trade shows, events and corporate offices across the globe.

We're raising $10,000 for the initial half-hour pilot. The benefit of this approach is that the funding for the pilot and each episode also covers the costs of the direct actions that will be covered! If all goes well, we plan to crowdfund the entire season while also pitching streaming services for a distribution deal.

Contributors will receive amazing perks, include books by leaders of our movement, tickets to the Premier Hoedown, t-shirts, hoodies, stickers and other fan favorites.

If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll use the funds for the next direct actions and do our best to produce high-quality content like the video on this page, and our coverage of the Danish Embassy Action, Senator Manchin Action, Denmark Rally at Town Run and other events for distribution through social media in support of our cause.

On the Front Lines of the Climate Wars

West Virginia is known for its pepperoni rolls, rivers, mountains, and fossil fuels. In Jefferson County, we're fighting the construction of a heavily polluting mineral wool insulation factory by the Danish multi-national company Rockwool. 

Rockwool was offered over $37 million in incentives to build the factory for only 150 low-paying jobs, a cost of $250,000 per job. The residents of Queens rejected Amazon's "HQ2" because they felt the $60,000 per job price tag was too high. Even at an average salary over $125,000, locals would have preferred their tax money went to schools, parks, infrastructure and other investments in the commonweal.

So what's driving the project? 84 tons of coal and 1.61 million cubic feet of fracked gas every day. While the rest of the world is shutting down coal plants and transitioning to renewable energy, the West Virginia state government is hell-bent on extracting, distributing and burning as much coal and fracked gas as possible before they can be stopped.

Jefferson County is home to one of the last clean air- and watersheds in West Virginia, and we boast the state's most vibrant, diversified economy. The state of West Virginia and its allies in Jefferson County government are willing to sacrifice the environment and economy in order to create a new market for fossil fuels.

Through Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, citizen researchers learned of the state's intention to create a 1,000-acre zone for heavy industry loaded with water, sewer and fracked gas infrastructure, with Rockwool as the anchor tenant.

Most distressing for residents was the location of the Rockwool plant directly across the road from an elementary school and economically distressed housing development. The 156,000 tons of pollutants permitted annually include toxic chemicals such as phenol, benzene, formaldehyde, and methanol, as well as small particulate matter and greenhouse gasses. These pollutants can cause chronic and fatal diseases of the kidneys, liver, lungs, heart, and brain. They cause premature births and birth defects. The plant would further strain an already stressed health system.

But this is where it stops. 

As Jay Mansfield, a local hero of our movement says, "Jefferson County, WV is where bad ideas come to die," referring to the abolitionist John Brown's raid on Harpers Ferry that signalled the beginning of the end of slavery.

Situated in the Potomac Highland Valley at the confluence of the Potomac and Shenandoah Rivers, Jefferson County is home to fierce fighters who are willing to stand up to fossil fuel interests and end their reign in West Virginia, and worldwide. A victory here will signal a blow to global fossil fuel interests intent on creating new markets for greenhouse-gas emitting fuels before we finally muster the political will to transition to a net-zero economy.

The project team has deep experience in movement organizing, video production, social media and entrepreneurship. As we strike a blow against the commercial and industrial interests that are destroying the planet, we'll be engaging, entertaining and educating a global audience in activist strategies, tactics, and techniques.

As a contributor to our project, you'll see the results of your contributions and help us build our movement and defeat the polluters and their cronies in government.

The Challenges We Face

We are fighting an uphill battle against powerful industrial and commercial interests. We might not be able to stop the factory. 

By documenting our struggle through episodic storytelling that unfolds over time, we hope that even if we lose the battle of Jefferson County we will help win the global climate wars. We will not surrender because we cannot. Humanity only has one home, and we must protect it. Everything must change, starting here and starting now.

We will be open and transparent and use our platform to connect with and promote our allies fighting other battles around the world. We will use our stories to inspire, energize, motivate and mobilize. We hope to turn our audience into activists, followers into organizers, friends into leaders.

Join Our Campaign!

Even if you can't provide financial support, you can still join our campaign for clean air and water, healthy children and a prosperous future in communities around the world and right here at home.

Please help us get the word out by sharing our campaign, join our Facebook group, follow us on Twitter and learn more about how we can change the world through non-violent moral direct action.

Let's win!

story:
Short Summary

Picking up with the Bruins in the middle of their 2018-2019 season, All In will follow the natural storyline, sharing the real-life struggles, successes, and accomplishments of the team and players as the season plays out. Each episode will move our chronological timeline forward while keeping the focus on the stories outside of the boards. We will work directly with the coaches, players, and community figures to identify themes and messages that hold true to the this years team and transcend the game. This season is projected to include ten, 44-minute episodes. It will be created without commercials and be formatted primarily for online viewing. 

 

Meet the Teams

acowsay cinema was founded on the principle that the story always wins. We are a 2x Upper Midwest Regional Emmy-receiving full-service production company. We use visual storytelling to communicate purpose-driven messages. Past partners include Great Clips, the Minnesota Wild, Samsung, United Way, and Johnson & Johnson.

 

TFA Productions mission is to produce purpose-driven content through the power of storytelling that makes a difference in communities around the world. With over 25 years of experience in the Olympic and Paralympic Movement, TFA Productions is a leader in providing unparalleled access to the world’s largest sporting events. Through the years TFA Productions has established significant relationships with Brands, Agencies, NGB’s, Organizing Committees and Media Partners including NowThis, Comcast NBC Universal, and MacGillivray Freeman Films.

 

Our Campaign 

Our passion for this project is rooted our work having created another hockey driven docu-series called Dream. State. We spent the previous two winters following along on the journey of Minnesota State High School hockey programs chasing their dream of a state title. We were fortunate to be welcomed into the lives of the young men we followed and told their story, as well as those who supported them along the way. Dream. State. was a passion project that ultimately received an Upper Midwest Regional Emmy in 2017 and 2018 for Best Sports Program outside of news.

 Sports, at the core, are what bring players, families, and communities together. We are humbled to be in a position to tell  more in-depth stories of the Austin communities and truly hope that All In inspire the next generation on hockey players.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Tier 1: $5  //  Sign me up!

Available - Unlimited

Included:

- Email list for BTS Exclusive content

 

Tier 2: $10 //  More than Just Friends

Available - Unlimited

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

 

Tier 3: $25 //  Become Part of the Experience

Available 50

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

 

Tier 4: $50 // Thank you's from The Team 

Available 40

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

- Special Thank you from Bruins Players and Organization

 

Tier 5: $100 // A Weekend with The Bruins

Available 30

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

- Special Thank you from Bruins Players and Organization

- Tickets to weekend Series for Bruins

 

Tier 6: $250 // Be a part of the story.

Available 20

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

- Special Thank you from Bruins Players and Organization

- Tickets to weekend Series for Bruins

- Sit in on a special writing session with producers of show, location: TBD

 

Tier 7: $500 // Making it possible. 

Available 10

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

- Special Thank you from Bruins Players and Organization

- Tickets to weekend Series for Bruins

- Sit in on a special writing session with producers of show, location: TBD

- Series Poster signed by the team.

 

Tier 8: $1000 // Get your name in the show.

Available Unlimited

Included:

- Email List for Exclusive BTS Content

- See the official trailer a week early

- Meet the writers & producer of the series, location: TBD

- Special Thank you from Bruins Players and Organization

- Tickets to weekend Series for Bruins

- Sit in on a special writing session with producers of show, location: TBD

- Series Poster signed by the team.

- Special Thanks with your name in End Credits.

 

Total Goal: $10,000

 

The Impact You'll Make

$10,000 will cover the hard costs as we seek out additional funding for All In in early 2019. It will ensure that we don't miss out on key moments to our story, such as Paint The Town Pink. This campaign is built around allowing you, the donor, the chance to be a part of this shows success. We can't do it without you and want to embrace that this isn't our story to tell without the support of the community. 

 

The Team:

Director, Editor, Cinematographer: Tyler Eichorst

Tyler Eichorst is a Director, Editor, Cinematographer, and Business Owner living in Minneapolis, MN. Tyler got his start in broadcast television but found his true passion in telling stories at a deeper level. Since founding acowsay cinema, Tyler has worked with some of the world’s largest brands including Johnson & Johnson, Samsung, United Way, and Great Clips. Tyler has received two Upper Midwest Emmy’s in Best Sports Programming Outside of News for Directing two seasons of an all-access hockey docu-series “Dream.State.” that aired on Fox Sports North. He is also a recipient of Minneapolis Ad Fed 32 Under 32.

 

Executive Producer: Jeremy Snyder

Jeremy is a Partner at TFA Productions and a proven and experienced content marketer in the sports and entertainment industries. In 2010, Jeremy also founded The Factory Agency, and is a top partner with Paralympic athletes, helping them reach their potential. His achievements include securing and negotiating marketing, endorsement, appearance opportunities, media outreach, philanthropic support for the talent representation division and oversees the development and production of TV, Film and Commercial projects tied to the development and growth of the Paralympic Movement.

 

Executive Producer: George Bauernfiend 

George is a Partner at TFA Productions, focusing on strategic marketing, partnerships, business development. He was previously BP’s Head of Olympics & Paralympics for 6 years, creating a unique leadership position in the Paralympics that is widely recognized amongst partners, business and community leaders, the USOC and athletes. Prior to that, he was Vice President of the BP-Ford Strategic Account, leading all retail, consumer and dealer programs across North America, driving significant growth and mutual value for both BP and Ford. George is an innovator and has several “firsts” to his name including leading BP to be the first brand with an Athlete Ambassador team with more Paralympic (5) than Olympic (2) athletes for the Rio Games. BP was awarded the U.S. Paralympics Amazing Impact Award. His passion for the Paralympics is strong and includes having been to the last 4 Paralympic Games in London, Sochi, Rio, and PyeongChang.

 

Producer: Danny Krueger

Danny is a Producer based in Minneapolis, MN. Danny has worked in a wide range of video categories including, Documentary Storytelling, B2C & B2B Advertising, Experiential, and non-profit filmmaking. Some past partners Danny’s worked alongside include Great Clips, Fox Sports North, Red Bull's Wings For Life, and The University of Minnesota. With every project Danny approaches, he believes in telling the “why” through storytelling.

 

Editor, Camera Operator: Alec Kintigh

Alec is a jack of all trades when it comes to storytelling. From acting as a DP on commercial shoots to editing award receiving docu-series, he has a knack for storytelling. Since starting his career he has gotten to work with some of the world’s largest brands and sports teams including The Minnesota Wild, Johnson & Johnson, Samsung, and Great Clips.

 

Camera Operator: Alyse Iorio

Alyse got her start in Madison working with teams such as the Milwaukee Brewers and Wisconsin Badgers. While out there she has been the recipient of three Chicago based Midwest Emmy’s before packing her bags and moving back to her home state of Minnesota. Alyse has continued to work with some of the worlds largest brands putting story first including United Airlines, NBCSN, and American Diabetes Association. Outside of film, Alyse is also a head coach for the Wayzata High School Dance Team and has been named Coach of The Year, and received a Championship Coach Award for all the time and effort she dedicates to her team.

 

Camera Operator: Gerick Engle

Gerick has always had a passion for filmmaking. After attending Film School in Montana, he moved back to his home state of Minnesota to continue his film career. Along the way, Gerick has worked with a variety of brands and projects over the years including the Minnesota Vikings, Con Agra, and the American Heart Association.

 

Assistant Camera Operator: Beth Resch

Beth Resch is a recent grad from Minneapolis Film school. During her time in Film School, she was part of Gopher Digital Productions capturing all gopher sport related content including Men's Football, Men & Women Basketball, and both Men & Women Hockey Teams.

 

Creative Manager, Assistant Producer: Jenny Olson

Jenny started out on the West Coast working on Animal Planet’s Chasing Bigfoot, The X-Factor, and ABC’s WHODUNNIT, before following her roots back to Minnesota. Since her return, Jenny has worked with a variety of Brands including Forever Bride, Tuttorosso Tomatoes, and Great Clips.

During her time in Film School, she was part of Gopher Digital Productions capturing all gopher sport related content including Men's Football, Men & Women Basketball, and both Men & Women Hockey Teams. Creative Manager, Assistant Producer: Jenny OlsonJenny started out on the West Coast working on Animal Planet’s Chasing Bigfoot, The X-Factor, and ABC’s WHODUNNIT, before following her roots back to Minnesota. Since her return, Jenny has worked with a variety of Brands including Forever Bride, Tuttorosso Tomatoes, and Great Clips.

story:
About RxR

Clarissa and Karisa created this series after undergoing one of the hardest years of their lives. They laughed until they cried and took all those weird, uncomfortable moments and birthed Rylan and Rylee. They both realized they hadn't seen or heard a story like this before. Rather than wait around hoping for it to make it to the screen, they decided to make it themselves. 

The Creators

First, let's start with Clarissa Thibeaux. She's an orphan diagnosed with cancer (so she gets it), but you wouldn't know it if you met her. This actor/writer/producer with her "underwhelming" origin story has used her perspective to create characters with depth...even sometimes unknown to them. If you want to check out some of her acting work, go download Hulu and search for Marvel's Runaways. You'll see her playing a shape-shifting alien, which she was clearly type cast for.

On to Karisa Tate! 2019 Karisa is worlds away from the people pleasing, yes-person Karisa of 2016. Her journey of self realization has allowed her the ability to break down more barriers than she could've imagined. She has excelled in Voice Over, directed multiple comedy sketches, and has a blossoming script supervisor career (her latest project premiered at the 2019 Tribeca Film Festival).  No longer will she tip toe around while her roommate is sleeping! She get's to make the noise now, bitch. And she has been loudly letting her creative freak flag fly. If you want to see where her creative freedom has taken her, check out her website. You'll see her be a viral instagrammer, frantic secretary, brown-nosing production assistant, casting director victim, and so much more. 

Campaign Importance:

This is a story about two girls who don’t even know how much they need each other until circumstance throws them together and they find out exactly what they need. 

Making a project like this takes a lot of ingenuity and persistence. We have been working on this project for three years now and we are finally ready to share it with everybody. BUT we need your help to make the show as great as we know it can be :). In order to pay for the best cast, cinematographers, producers, sound, and crew, we'll need funds beyond our own. This story deserves to be told and we want to have the best team to tell it, which is where YOU come in. 

Below, we have outlined exactly what we need help with and where your much appreciated donations will go. The filmmaking process is a costly one and we want to make sure not to cut any corners! 

RxR has helped us cope and has given us a way to give back to people who might be experiencing similar life-changing moments. Plus, it's a female-centric show, featuring strong female friendships! Boo-yeah! And even better, it actually passes the Bechdel Test! What's the Bechdel test, you ask? It's a test where the only requirement is two women talk to each other about something other than men. Yep, seriously. That's it!  If you didn't know, now you know. Go check it out! It's time we heard more stories like this.

The Impact

This is not going to be the end for Rylan and Rylee! We're hoping to take this webseries and bring it on the festival circuit. We want to get the word out and continue pitching this idea. We've already had some interest from a few production companies based on the idea alone, so the goal would be to show them how great the series could be once produced. YOU could help us make this a reality!

As with any project, this is going to be a learning process for us, but we are confident that we have a story that will touch a lot of people and that is extremely relatable. Yes, it's a cancer story, but it's not a story about cancer. 

Incredible Director

Christa Boarini is at the helm of our ship and we couldn't be more grateful for her vision. Christa was born and raised in Guatemala City. She left her home country after high school to get her BFA in Film & Television Production from New York University and graduated in 2010. Since then Christa has worked on over 10 features, most recently working closely with Divide / Conquer on projects such as High & Mighty (Sundance ’18), the VR series Door No. 1 (Hulu) and CAM (Blumhouse). Christa’s most recent directing credit is the Guatemalan short film MARADENTRO, which she also co-wrote and produced. It was shot on location in Guatemala with local talent and embodies the same combination of grit and magic realism that characterizes much of Christa’s work.

Badass Producer

None of this would be possible without Joanna DeLane -- both an incredible producer and actor. Joanna can be seen in various TV Shows including “Future Man” and “Saint George.  As a producer, she has several projects currently in development as well as in festivals, these include “Yallah Habibi”, “Bedtime Story” and “Village of the Gramned”.  She, along with other actress friends, have created a platform and community for lady filmmakers called “Ladies Above the Line". With plans to develop content driven by women and people of color, Joanna hopes to be the change we all want to see in front of, and behind, the camera.

Brilliant DP


 

Jordan Michaud-Scorza is the awesome lady behind the camera bringing our vision to life. Growing up as a child with a distaste for giving class presentations, Jordan quickly learned she could get away with making films for all of her middle & eventually high school classes instead; to her she, was pulling the wool over her teachers eyes- didn't they know this was more fun and not actual work?  Her love for telling stories through this visual medium brought her to Emerson College in Boston where she studied Film Production, focusing on Cinematography.  She started her career in Los Angeles in the lighting department before shifting to shooting full time.  Since then, she has been Director of Photography on dozens of projects- short films, commercials, music videos, and multiple webseries.

Our Cast

The lovely Alison Martin will be playing Carol, the good natured cancer group leader. Alison Martin Alison Martin - IMDb was born and raised in NYC and began her professional acting career in Boston, performing in America’s Longest Running Comedy, Shear Madness. While in Boston, she wrote for and acted in the children’s television series A Likely Story, for which she won an Emmy Award for acting.  Back in New York, Alison appeared Off-Broadway in original productions of works by Peter Tolan, David Ives and David Mamet. She then wrote for and performed in the Lifetime Channel’s series The World According to Us, for which she received another Emmy nomination. Alison made her Broadway debut playing opposite Nathan Lane in Neil Simon’s Laughter on the 23rd Floor and traveled cross country in the national tour. 

In Los Angeles, she has starred in hundreds of commercials, two of which she improvised that went on to win Clios. Alison has guest starred in numerous television shows most recently How to Get Away with Murder, The Big Bang Theory, Code Black, has recurring roles in American Princess, There’s Johnny, Grace & Frankie, has appeared in several movies including the upcoming Soul Survivor, The Year of Spectacular Men, Four Christmases, Sleepover, Blades of Glory, and is best known on the Comic Con trail for her work in Larry Blamire’s Trail of the Screaming Forehead and The Lost Skeleton Returns Again. Alison is a producer/performer on The Audio Adventurebook of Big Dan Frater which just won a MarkTime award as best comedy album, she is a member of the ECHO theater company, having just performed as the SOCCER MOM in Wolves and she is the editor of the amazing online magazine www.insidewink.com HOME - insidewink. Thank goodness she is married to actor Daniel Hagen and has two wonderful children. 

Armi Abiera will be playing Karen, the community center's perfectionist receptionist. Armi Arabe Abiera is an actor, director and producer and has appeared on television, film, and many national commercials. Armi has traveled the world as a singer and actress performing lead roles in such blockbuster musicals as The King and I, Mamma Mia!, Beauty and the Beast, and Miss Saigon. Armi is the voice of Tuptim in Warner Brother’s animated Feature Film The King and I. Armi resides in Orange County, CA with her husband, four daughters, and Honey, her labradoodle. 

Jannica Olin will be playing Veronica, a group member that always has everything the way she wants it. Swedish born actress Jannica Olin is Hollywood's Bald Blonde. A graduate of The Neighborhood Playhouse in New York, Jannica has worked in theatre (The Willows), film, commercials and music videos (Janelle Monae, Jessie J) in the US, UK and Sweden.
Her one woman show (IM)PERFEKT had its' world premiere at the Hollywood Fringe Festival in June 2019 to sold out houses and took home the Producers’ Encore Award. Jannica was also nominated by the Los Angeles Women's Theatre Festival for the Diverse Diva Award, received an Honorable Mention by Tvolution and was awarded the Critics' Choice award by Better Lemons. In 2017 Jannica was nominated for the Los Angeles Business Journal’s Women’s Summit; an event that recognizes and honors outstanding professional women who have made significant contributions to their professions and the Los Angeles community. In October 2018, Jannica was invited to share her journey with Alopecia in the powerful TEDx talk; “Welcome To My New Normal” in Normal, Illinois. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can only pitch in a few dollars, every donation helps. It's cliche, but so true! And if you're looking to help us spread the word, please share the project on social media with all your friends. We've been working on this for about three years now and we're so excited to share it with the world! We just need YOUR help to make this vision a reality. Thank you!!!

story:
The Story

 

This show chronicles the adventures of an unusual crew that must stick together to survive in the hostile world of deep space. Living on a spaceship, their livelihood is the repossession and salvage of other vessels for the mob in the lawless, far reaches of space. Though they initially believe they just have a job to do, they will stumble into the tangled web of a dark mystery with a merciless villain who will stop at nothing to bend the universe to her will.  

In this universe, the earth has long been lost and forgotten, but humans are still the only known intelligent life. Technical advances help humans to extend their life and abilities but can also be misused in their corruptible desire for power.

This world is controlled by the heavy hands of super corporations, a matriarchal political order, a commercialized military division, and mafia. But those in power will soon learn that individual people and their actions still matter and can make a significant influence on humanity.

 

Stylization and art

Our visual world is inspired by golden age science fiction from the 1950s with a slight touch of cyberpunk. With custom designed CGI models, we have outstanding visuals, colors, cinematography, and world designs. All 3D models for the show are uniquely created and stylized in a retro theme. Outfits and makeup are also inspired by the same decade, but with the addition of modern technology. Though effects and settings can be a frequent downfall for independent SciFi productions, the skills and resumes of our production team will create a fantastical masterpiece. 

Technology design in the show

Our star spaceship is designed to retrofit for towing gear to pull collected ships behind. With additional booster engines constantly being tinkered on and enhanced by our inventive main character, it is equipped to handle the adventures (and the mishaps) that our repo crew may face in space. 

Inspired by 1950s industrial design, we merge current and predicted technologies to create our look. Below are a gravitational ray gun, a service robot, and more unique models, characters and scenes.

This is a universe filled with retro style rockets, robots and others elements. Each has it is own character, it is own story.

 

Locations

We have CG created environments, designed and developed by award-winning, published artists. Most model assets are created in Cinema 4D. Our stunning digital environments are developed with World Machine, Vue and Terragen. They are filmed on a green screen with compositing in After Effects and Premiere Pro. Full workflow involves many steps and many different applications to achieve the desired result.

 

Characters and the Actors that Play Them

The script is rich with interesting, dynamic characters. From Oz, the rogue-ish and innovative ship's captain to Brigette, a formerly enslaved computer whiz with a dangerous secret. All of our actors are familiar with the main scripts, however, the characters' life stories, with their goals, hopes, and secrets will not always be shared between them.  Actors will be living the story as it is progressing and the resulting dynamics and discoveries will make their interactions compelling and believable in a whole new way. 

 

Our team

Vladimir Chopine - Director, story developer, and digital artist. Award-winning published digital artists. With a unique visual look at the world. Produced multiple short films and award-winning traditional and computer animations. He was featured as world top matte painters in 3D World Magazine. He provides digital environment certified training for the studios, agencies, and artists. As well offering over 3000 video training at youtube as well www.geekatplay.com website. His digital compositing style highly recognizable www.chopinephotography.com and it is expressing in this show.

Mariah Proctor has worked primarily as a theatre actress but has always had a great love of film. She graduated from Brigham Young University with a Bachelor's in Theatre and went on to receive her Master's Degree in Creative Writing at the University of Oxford. She recently completed her directorial debut, a film set entirely inside the car, which explores the private emotional lives we have when we think only our vehicles are watching. The film is entitled, 'The Way They See Us' and Mariah also plays the principal character, Alexis.

Ischa Bee - is a professional Film and Stage Actor, Singer, Model, Voice Over Artist, and Performer. Represented by Talent Management Group in SLC, she has booked jobs for Film, Commercial, Voice Over and Modeling with clients such as Intel, University of Utah Credit Union, Ken Garff, Subway Sandwiches, Late Shift Inc. and many other Production Studios for various projects. As one of two members of Performance Art/Music duo MiNX, she is the writer of lyrics, singer of songs, producer of recordings and music videos, stylist and costume creator... as well as being responsible for a slew of other duties in her role as COO- Chief Operating Officer- of MiNX Music LLC. She has also parlayed some of these skills into other successful stage-production projects, acting/singing and more in several shows at Rose Wagner Performing Arts Center. Anyone who knows Ischa knows her love of Aliens and all things Space and beyond. Playing Brigitte in The Amazing Space Adventure Series is a true delight, combining several of these passions, and the happy bonus of getting to work with a fabulous cast and crew to bring it to life.

Noah Kershisnik was raised on theater and film. He spent his youth performing Shakespeare plays in a traveling children's theater, and developed a passion for performance and storytelling. There he met friends with similar interests and started producing short sketch comedy. He got a BA in media arts and loves writing, designing, directing, and especially acting in films and theater. In 2018 he started his own theater company, Little Man Theater Company, with a very well received production of HAMLET which he designed and produced in addition to playing the titular role. Later that same year he worked with Fish W.W. Burton on his premiere piece, A BESTIARY, once again taking on one of the lead roles in addition to producing and designing the show. In his free time, he loves to make his own clothes, garden, bake sourdough bread, and Coach CrossFit.

Steve Lesser is a film Actor from Orem, Utah and is represented by the Talent Management Group. He has been married for 28 years and has two boys. He has a day job in Business Management. On the side, his creative outlets are playing sports and film acting. Steve was nominated for Best Film Actor in 2017 for the film Penrose. As the only actor of the film, he carried the entire film on his shoulders. In 2018 he was nominated for best ensemble cast for the film Hanneli and Anne and in 2019 he was nominated best ensemble cast for the film WWII Zombies. All three nominations were by the Utah Film Awards and all three films were nominated for best film of the festival as well. Each year he enjoys acting in films, as well as local and national commercials. Steve is excited to play the role of the Boss on the Space Journey series. He said, “I love the idea of merging the retro outer space shows of the 1950’s with a touch of modern technology. I think everyone dreams about life beyond the boundaries of earth and the adventure of interacting with people and species that live on other planets. I hope you will enjoy our journey of space in this series as much as I do”

Victoria Kochanek is a talented, emerging film and voice-over actress. She has an established modeling portfolio with various companies and professional artists. In her spare time, she is an avid cosplayer/impersonator of different pop culture icons and a traditional sketch and ink artist. Victoria plays the role of the Mob Boss's significant other, but that is only scratching the surface. You will have to wait and see to find out who this character is and her true intent.

Aleksandr Kuznetsov is a CG artist, 3d content creator. He created many popular 3d assets, that were used in film and game productions. 

 

Special thanks to Flashback TV https://www.facebook.com/flash1tv/

FLASHBACK TV is the new streaming TV Network offering classic movies, retro TV shows, and original and independently produced programming.
Flashback TV was created and developed by film lovers, like you, so all the films we air are presented in their original theatrical condition, with no commercial interruptions or editing.
Flashback TV offers films from every genre including Sci-Fi, Horror, Thrillers, Film Noir, Comedy, Action, Westerns, and War films.
Check out Flashback TV at www.flash1tv.com or watch us on Roku world-wide!

 

For more information about the show please check  https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9868466/

Why we are looking for funding.

Even with CGI and green screen technology, we still need to build sets, props, and costumes for the cast. At this point, the project is being solely supported by cast and crew,  but to make future progress possible, we need your help.

The Impact

Without your support, it would be nearly impossible to complete this project at the scale and production value it deserves:

  • With your participation in this project, you will be involved in bringing to life a new world and so many intriguing characters. You will play a role in both creating and discovering a unique universe with a sincere, human story.
  • Our team is made up of great talent with many successful projects already under our belts: professional actors, award-winning VFX and CG artists, cinematographers, and experienced directors. Be sure to check our profiles.
  • It is hard to create great art alone. We are already very enthusiastic about this project. We hope to have your passionate collaboration and engagement in the process of creating this science fiction television series.

Risks & Challenges

We are dedicated to this project, we plan to have a prompt and efficient timeline for completion. There is also an element of unpredictability in filmmaking. Difficulties and delays may arise for a variety of reasons, but we are committed to meticulous planning and risk management that will minimize the effect of unpredicted setbacks.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for additional talented collaborators that would like to join our team. Actors, production, VFX, grip, designers, if you have the desire, we have things for you to do.

From Oz, the rogue-ish and innovative ship's captain to Brigette, a formerly enslaved computer whiz with a dangerous secret. All of our actors are familiar with the main scripts, however, the characters' life stories, with their goals, hopes, and secrets will not always be shared between them.  Actors will be living the story as it is progressing and the resulting dynamics and discoveries will make their interactions compelling and believable in a whole new way. 

 
Our team

Vladimir Chopine - Director, story developer, and digital artist. Award-winning published digital artists. With a unique visual look at the world. Produced multiple short films and award-winning traditional and computer animations. He was featured as world top matte painters in 3D World Magazine. He provides digital environment certified training for the studios, agencies, and artists. As well offering over 3000 video training at youtube as well www.geekatplay.com website. His digital compositing style highly recognizable www.chopinephotography.com and it is expressing in this show.

Mariah Proctor has worked primarily as a theatre actress but has always had a great love of film. She graduated from Brigham Young University with a Bachelor's in Theatre and went on to receive her Master's Degree in Creative Writing at the University of Oxford. She recently completed her directorial debut, a film set entirely inside the car, which explores the private emotional lives we have when we think only our vehicles are watching. The film is entitled, 'The Way They See Us' and Mariah also plays the principal character, Alexis.

Ischa Bee - is a professional Film and Stage Actor, Singer, Model, Voice Over Artist, and Performer. Represented by Talent Management Group in SLC, she has booked jobs for Film, Commercial, Voice Over and Modeling with clients such as Intel, University of Utah Credit Union, Ken Garff, Subway Sandwiches, Late Shift Inc. and many other Production Studios for various projects. As one of two members of Performance Art/Music duo MiNX, she is the writer of lyrics, singer of songs, producer of recordings and music videos, stylist and costume creator... as well as being responsible for a slew of other duties in her role as COO- Chief Operating Officer- of MiNX Music LLC. She has also parlayed some of these skills into other successful stage-production projects, acting/singing and more in several shows at Rose Wagner Performing Arts Center. Anyone who knows Ischa knows her love of Aliens and all things Space and beyond. Playing Brigitte in The Amazing Space Adventure Series is a true delight, combining several of these passions, and the happy bonus of getting to work with a fabulous cast and crew to bring it to life.

Noah Kershisnik was raised on theater and film. He spent his youth performing Shakespeare plays in a traveling children's theater, and developed a passion for performance and storytelling. There he met friends with similar interests and started producing short sketch comedy. He got a BA in media arts and loves writing, designing, directing, and especially acting in films and theater. In 2018 he started his own theater company, Little Man Theater Company, with a very well received production of HAMLET which he designed and produced in addition to playing the titular role. Later that same year he worked with Fish W.W. Burton on his premiere piece, A BESTIARY, once again taking on one of the lead roles in addition to producing and designing the show. In his free time, he loves to make his own clothes, garden, bake sourdough bread, and Coach CrossFit.

Steve Lesser is a film Actor from Orem, Utah and is represented by the Talent Management Group. He has been married for 28 years and has two boys. He has a day job in Business Management. On the side, his creative outlets are playing sports and film acting. Steve was nominated for Best Film Actor in 2017 for the film Penrose. As the only actor of the film, he carried the entire film on his shoulders. In 2018 he was nominated for best ensemble cast for the film Hanneli and Anne and in 2019 he was nominated best ensemble cast for the film WWII Zombies. All three nominations were by the Utah Film Awards and all three films were nominated for best film of the festival as well. Each year he enjoys acting in films, as well as local and national commercials. Steve is excited to play the role of the Boss on the Space Journey series. He said, “I love the idea of merging the retro outer space shows of the 1950’s with a touch of modern technology. I think everyone dreams about life beyond the boundaries of earth and the adventure of interacting with people and species that live on other planets. I hope you will enjoy our journey of space in this series as much as I do”

Victoria Kochanek is a talented, emerging film and voice-over actress. She has an established modeling portfolio with various companies and professional artists. In her spare time, she is an avid cosplayer/impersonator of different pop culture icons and a traditional sketch and ink artist. Victoria plays the role of the Mob Boss's significant other, but that is only scratching the surface. You will have to wait and see to find out who this character is and her true intent.

Aleksandr Kuznetsov is a CG artist, 3d content creator. He created many popular 3d assets, that were used in film and game productions. 
 
Special thanks to Flashback TV https://www.facebook.com/flash1tv/
FLASHBACK TV is the new streaming TV Network offering classic movies, retro TV shows, and original and independently produced programming.Flashback TV was created and developed by film lovers, like you, so all the films we air are presented in their original theatrical condition, with no commercial interruptions or editing.Flashback TV offers films from every genre including Sci-Fi, Horror, Thrillers, Film Noir, Comedy, Action, Westerns, and War films.Check out Flashback TV at www.flash1tv.com or watch us on Roku world-wide!
 
For more information about the show please check  https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9868466/

Why we are looking for funding.

Even with CGI and green screen technology, we still need to build sets, props, and costumes for the cast. At this point, the project is being solely supported by cast and crew,  but to make future progress possible, we need your help.

The Impact

Without your support, it would be nearly impossible to complete this project at the scale and production value it deserves:

With your participation in this project, you will be involved in bringing to life a new world and so many intriguing characters. You will play a role in both creating and discovering a unique universe with a sincere, human story.
Our team is made up of great talent with many successful projects already under our belts: professional actors, award-winning VFX and CG artists, cinematographers, and experienced directors. Be sure to check our profiles.
It is hard to create great art alone. We are already very enthusiastic about this project. We hope to have your passionate collaboration and engagement in the process of creating this science fiction television series.


Risks & Challenges
We are dedicated to this project, we plan to have a prompt and efficient timeline for completion. There is also an element of unpredictability in filmmaking. Difficulties and delays may arise for a variety of reasons, but we are committed to meticulous planning and risk management that will minimize the effect of unpredicted setbacks.

Other Ways You Can Help
We are always looking for additional talented collaborators that would like to join our team. Actors, production, VFX, grip, designers, if you have the desire, we have things for you to do.

story:
"There was an idea... to bring together a group of remarkable people to see if they could become something more." - Nick Fury, founder of The Avengers.


In March of 2020, the pandemic struck, ushering in a tide of nationwide lockdowns, economic slowdowns, and civil throwdowns.

Canada lost almost 2,000,000 jobs in April alone, and the entertainment industry all but vanished overnight, leaving so many working professionals with serious concerns over when our livelihood might return. Some of us even wound up homeless. 
Flash forward to Fall 2020: a plan is formed by a collective of such artists, (henceforth known as Chez Poulet Productions), in an attempt to keep working & providing. But how to adapt to a now entirely digital medium? What to create in order to keep entertaining audiences? How can we remind ourselves and each other to keep fighting for a better tomorrow?

"I have no idea where I am going to be tomorrow, but I accept the fact tomorrow will come. And I'm going to rise to meet it." - Donna Troy

 

The League of Extraordinary Gentlepeople (L.E.G.P.) is a fictional web series about a team of Canadian Super Heroes, (not Alpha Flight ;) and the first creative content produced by Chez Poulet Productions.

Chronicling the formation of "The League," the nine-episode series follows a group of ordinary citizens, as they struggle to navigate the socioeconomic, psychological, and ethical challenges of the pandemic and their city's sinister past. All while keeping their tights laundered.

We at Chez Poulet Productions are seeking to raise enough funds to produce our first major project, The L.E.G.P.,  to be released in Spring 2021. 

 

 
You can help our heroes save the city. You can help the less fortunate survive the pandemic. You can help yourself to all of our great content and perks in exchange! We are lucky to be able to create at all in these trying times. And we appreciate every nickel. Really.

So please, help us help you have all you want of awesome, superhero goodness. And we'll all get through this together.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

"Life doesn't give us purpose. We give life purpose." - The Flash.

Our team was born to create great content. Check out our bios and you'll see. What we're asking is the means to get it out of our minds and into your hands, er, screens.

Your donation provides us with everything a creative studio needs: Cameras, Costumes, Lighting, the stuff we can't get for free, etc...  

Plus the aid from the pros where we need it most. Like social media and sponsorship.

We even have a profit share model in place to pay as many people as possible. The larger the amount raised, the more we'll be able to help so many of the unemployed.

The more we make, the more awesome we can make The L.E.G.P.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


"If there is nothing but what we make in this world... Let us make good." - Beta Ray Bill

Donate & Pledge - Donating to our campaign is the best and most effective way to contribute. All funds raised go to improving The L.E.G.P. and equipping ourselves to produce more content down the road.

Share - Even if you can't donate, you can be super. Share our campaign on your favorite platform: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email, or word of mouth. Every little act of heroism helps! We appreciate any and all promotion of the campaign. Seriously earns good hero karma :)

 

 

Zach Counsil, is CTA & CCC Award-winning artist and a familiar face in the Canadian entertainment industry. A former, long time Ottawa resident, and previous Artistic Director of Eddie May Mysteries Dinner Theatre, Zach will be returning to his roles as writer & director/choreographer of the series. 
 

Ash Proulx, A sedulous figure of the backstages of Ottawa and Toronto. Ash first worked on the project as Production Manager and will be using her own flair as First Assistant Director.

 

Laura Wheeler  Ottawa based lighting and set designer Laura Wheeler, Prix Rideau Award nominee, spearheads the art department in this reimagining of the League of Extraordinary Gentlepeople. 

 

Garret Brink  For a decade Garret has been an avid AV in the Ottawa community. He will be bringing his vast array of experience and knowledge as Technical Director of the project.

 

Andrew Alexander Andrew Alexander is a professional photographer, writer and designer living in Ottawa, Canada. Andrew’s specialty is theatrical photography, using both still and moving images to document and promote new works. Andrew has produced and directed seven short films, and six music videos since 2012, as well as writing and producing over a dozen theatrical plays. His portfolio can be viewed at www.andrewalexander.ca.

story:
When the half-human half-demon Crowley Family moves to Willow’s Wood, they think they can just live a normal suburban life amongst the humans. But things quickly turn upside down when the youngest member of the family, Luna, summons ancient demons and accidentally unleashes them upon the town.

With the help of her friends Sam, Kieran, and Holly, and her demonic pet cat Dante, Luna must undo her mistakes and face her underworld roots.

Can Luna bring the darkness and the light together, or will she fail in bridging the two worlds?

What is "Luna's Underworld?"

“Luna’s Underworld” is a 2D animated musical adventure series produced by Riley Quigley that deconstructs concepts like “heaven” and “hell”, having a family friendly tone while still dealing with heavy topics like good and evil and having a bit of a gothic atmosphere.

Luna must uncover her past and confront her own ideas of good and evil throughout the series. Each episode allows her to mature a little bit more. At its core, this is a coming of age story that highlights acceptance of others.

In order to hire the people necessary to create the pilot, I need the proper funding. Why am I focused on just the pilot right now? Because animation is expensive and time consuming. If I'm able to create a pilot for this show, I have more to pitch to investors and/or crew members who can help create more episodes.

If you support this project, you can get a wide-array of perks, such as (but not limited to) concept art, song downloads, behind the scenes livestreams, and even a digital premiere invitation!

Why Indiegogo?

I'm not rich. I don't have the money to create this show, let alone a pilot. However, if crowdfunding succeeds, more money could come to the production of the show. If we reach our goal of $6,000, an editor and voice actors can be hired. All Indiegogo money will go 100% to Luna's Underworld in it's purchasing of equipment and software, and to pay the talented crew. Speaking of which...

The Team

CREATOR/DIRECTOR/WRITER/PRODUCER

  • Riley Quigley

ARTISTS

  • Becca Emslie (Art Director)
  • Layne Morgan (Background Design & Paint)
  • Charles Moss (Storyboard Artist)
  • Abbey Long (Storyboard Artist)
  • Lucy Walker (Storyboard Revisions)
  • Karla Cubacub (Storyboard Revisions)

MUSIC/AUDIO

  • Darian Jones (Composer/Lyricist)

CAST

Risks and Challenges

2D animation can be incredibly time consuming and expensive. There's no guarantee that a pilot will be made, but we do have a concept, and we're determined to make it into a full fledged show. 

How can You Help If You Can’t Donate?

If you can’t donate for whatever reason, you can still contribute to the campaign by spreading the word and taking advantage of Indiegogo’s sharing features!

story:
Short Summary

It's been a long road for us to find our feet with Mining Boom but we're now in a position to get stuck into a proper web series thanks to you! We're blessed to have such a strong, passionate following that has encouraged us to start a crowdfunding campaign to get Mining Boom up and running. Unfortunately, the old animation game is quite pricey to produce but if we get a boost with crowdfunding and open up to doing commercials, we can make it happen and expand our following enough to keep the show running.

Crowdfunding will also allow us to start producing straight away and not have to go through the lengthy process of getting approvals from funding bodies.

The more funds we can raise through the crowdfunding and commercials, we'll not only be able to make more episodes but also make them quicker!

What We Need & What You Get

If we reach our goal of $120,000 we'll be able to make a Season of a least 7 episodes at around 4 minutes each, hopefully more. Any funds received above our goal means more episodes!

We're always looking for ways to keep our costs down to deliver more episodes for the given funds. The more episodes we make in a season, the easier it will be to lower the costs per episode.

An added bonus of a web series is we can make the episodes as long as they need to be and not waste funds on reaching a set duration. 

If we don't reach our goal, we pay a higher fee to Indiegogo, but we still receive the money to make episodes with.  We'll make what we can with what we get.

story:
Thank you! 12/3/19

Thank you to all that supported! We raised $15,391! We are grateful for your love, kindness and willingness to be the change you wish to see in the world!

Special thanks also to Old Delhi Music who is donating thousands of dollars worth of musical instruments to the prison program!

Much love, Michael + Bianca + Vasanti + all the incarcerated adults in the IPBYS Prison Program.

FUNDRAISING UPDATE: In the first days since the campaign launched we raised $8775, over 23% of our goal. Thank you for all who have supported so far! Note: most of those donations were given off-line and are not reflected in our indiegogo campaign numbers. Help us reach our goal, donate today!

ABOUT THE BHAKTI YOGA PRISON PROJECT

Our prison system is broken.

Over 2.6 MM people are incarcerated and struggling for survival, meaning and purpose behind bars. While the prison industrial complex is committed to feeding, housing and clothing their bodies — what about their souls?

Conscious Living® TV is partnering with IPBYS prison program to go behind the prison walls to film the work of a small band of inspiring bhakti yogis who are providing love and compassion to America’s forgotten souls through yoga.

Please help us complete filming and post-production on this important episode of Conscious Living® TV airing on Amazon Prime. Additionally, your donation will also support the IPBYS 501(c)3 Prison Program by providing much needed resources to share spiritual teachings, on-site visits and outreach to countless incarcerated souls.

This project will bring love, understanding and inspiration to the darkest corners of America. Through bhakti yoga, incarcerated students are encouraged and supported to take responsibility for their actions through an understanding of karma, to release anger in favor of acceptance, to develop positive and hopeful outlooks on the future, and to practice more love and compassion in every part of their lives. 

ABOUT THE PARTNERS

IPBYS Prison Program, a branch of the non-profit organization IPBYS Outreach, is dedicated to the spiritual and personal development of inmates, delivered through an interactive educational program on Gaudiya Vaisnava philosophy and its meditation practices. They provide books on the spiritual teachings of yoga, write letters to inmates, make personal visits and support the structure of weekly kirtan and devotional time where incarcerated adults can chant, sing, meditate and share their love with the Divine together.

Conscious Living is currently in post-production on it's fourth season. Largely self-funded for the last 12 years, your contribution will allow us to complete the long and extensive post-production process on this episode and finish our 4th season, which will air across 120 regional cable TV markets in the U.S. and on Amazon Prime in 2020.

Your donation is 100% tax deductible through the IPBYS, 501(c)3. Funds will go towards bringing the work of the Bhakti Behind Bars Prison Project to the world including: 

Post Production: $18,000

Production: $12,500

Camera, Lights and Equipment: $5,500

Distribution and Marketing: $1750

Total: $37,750

100% funds raised over this amount and 5% of all funds raised will go directly to IPBYS, 501(c)3 and provide interactive programs to incarcerated yogis.  Donate today!

story:
The Series 

We Run New York is a documentary-series focusing on the different running groups and/or individuals within New York City’s diverse running scene.  Our goal is to highlight the more humble and unassuming qualities of each episode’s subject matter, e.g. the daily routine and struggle of a runner in an environment inhospitable to one, rather than focusing on just flashy success stories.  More than anything else, it is the humanity of running that we want to examine, and explore the different reasons people are drawn to running.

The Crew

Director/Editor/DP: Harry McFann ran track and studied film at Columbia University.  While there, he ran a personal best of 1:47 in the 800, was an All-American, and won multiple conference titles.  He is based in New York City, and continues to be part of the running community there.  As a freelance videographer he has worked on projects ranging from pieces for The Yes Network to promotional material for a Broadway show.  

Producer/Creator: Paul Snyder is a freelance writer, currently living in Flagstaff, Arizona, but with every intention to relocate back to the City in a year's time. His work's been featured in Running Times and Meter Magazine, and he's currently a staff writer for Citius Mag. He was teammates with Harry at Columbia, but was much slower. He loves writing about New York and running, and has been wanting to work on a project like this one for years.

Additional Photography: Gus Reed and Harry have worked on numerous projects together over the years.  A videographer specializing in dance, he has created video for organizations including Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, New York City Ballet Education, and The George Balanchine Foundation.   

Music Composer: Vincent Oppido holds a BA and MM in Music from George Mason University in Fairfax, VA, and a Graduate Certificate in Scoring for Motion Pictures and Television from The University of Southern California, Los Angeles, CA.  Vinny has scored numerous films, some of which have screened at film festivals around the world, including Charlie Joe’s Hotel Motel (Hollywood Film Festival and Madrid International Film Festival - nominated for Best Short Film), Cineastes (Greek Film Festival), and Lovely Day (Hollywood Reel Independent Film Festival), Panofsky’s Complaint (winner of Best Score in ‘Los Angeles Cinema Festival of Hollywood’). 

Not Your Typical Running Documentary 

Most sports related videos or documentaries amount to little more than extended promos. We want to avoid the typical flair and cliches that many of these sport documentaries find themselves repeating endlessly. It is not our goal to only tell stories about people running impressive times or races. Rather, it is the runner's lifestyle itself that we want to focus on, and how it manifests differently for different runners - the struggle to balance one's running life with one's "civilian life". We hope that while following the lives of these different runners we will be able to explore larger socio-political issues that relate to American culture as a whole.

Whose Stories Are We Telling?

We have five 30-minute episodes planned out and they will be distributed via YouTube.  Each episode will focus on a different team, individual, and/or race.  

  • West Side Runners: A group consisting primarily of immigrants, many of whom make their living off the prize money they earn from races.  These are some of the fastest runners in the region, but also some of the worst off, financially.   Some of the athletes who can't afford housing even live with the team's president, Bill Staab, in his apartment.  
  • McCarren Park: When most people think of Brooklyn, they think of Williamsburg, hipsters, and gentrifcation.  We will use McCarren Park as a lens to examine the rapid changes occurring in Brooklyn, and check in with the different people who use the park, including The Williamsburg Track Club and North Brooklyn Runners.
  • Francis “Gags” Gagliano: Born in the Bronx, Gags is a legendary figure in the running community who has established himself as one of the greatest middle distance coaches in the country.  He is currently the head coach of the NJ★NY Track Club.  We will take a look at his legacy throughout the running community, from the teams he coached, to the coaches who ran under his guidance.  
  • New York Athletic Club: NYAC is a historic New York club whose members include some of the most elite in the city, both athletically and socio-economically.  We will explore the different roles tradition plays in this club's long history and current place in the national running circle.  
  • The 5th Avenue Mile: The final episode will focus on the history and different runners preparing for this unique New York road race.  Here we will see many of the runners we have followed in previous episodes come together in a single event.

The Big Picture 

In this docu-series we will shed light on the smaller, more intimate moments in the lives of runners so as to craft a narrative where anyone can find something to relate to.   We want to capture the smallest of details so that the viewer sees the unseen, the minor, and the hidden. That which is subtle to the point where they are invisible to most eyes.

These are stories whose appeal is not limited to only runners and New York residents.  One of our goals for how we tell these stories is that the inherent drama that comes from the difficulty in running, combined with the human element to each story that we will focus on, will create a wide reach in the show’s appeal.  In addition to the wide audience that can be reached with this series, there is also room for the show to grow.  These stories are everywhere across the country, and we are uniquely positioned to not only find them, but to tell them the way they should be told.

How You Can Help

We want this to be the best documentary possible, and your generous donations will help make that happen!  Any donations will help fund:

  • Compensation for all crew and collaborators

  • Lighting and other equipment rental

  • Travel Expenses (any out of town races we cover)

  • Post-production 

  • Music licensing 

  • Race and archival footage licensing 

There are many more stories to tell about New York running, and any additional funds will go towards producing additional episodes, including one about the New York City Marathon.
story_txt:
The Series 

We Run New York is a documentary-series focusing on the different running groups and/or individuals within New York City’s diverse running scene.  Our goal is to highlight the more humble and unassuming qualities of each episode’s subject matter, e.g. the daily routine and struggle of a runner in an environment inhospitable to one, rather than focusing on just flashy success stories.  More than anything else, it is the humanity of running that we want to examine, and explore the different reasons people are drawn to running.
The Crew

Director/Editor/DP: Harry McFann ran track and studied film at Columbia University.  While there, he ran a personal best of 1:47 in the 800, was an All-American, and won multiple conference titles.  He is based in New York City, and continues to be part of the running community there.  As a freelance videographer he has worked on projects ranging from pieces for The Yes Network to promotional material for a Broadway show.  
Producer/Creator: Paul Snyder is a freelance writer, currently living in Flagstaff, Arizona, but with every intention to relocate back to the City in a year's time. His work's been featured in Running Times and Meter Magazine, and he's currently a staff writer for Citius Mag. He was teammates with Harry at Columbia, but was much slower. He loves writing about New York and running, and has been wanting to work on a project like this one for years.

Additional Photography: Gus Reed and Harry have worked on numerous projects together over the years.  A videographer specializing in dance, he has created video for organizations including Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, New York City Ballet Education, and The George Balanchine Foundation.

story:
Synopsis

Alejandro Hernandez (New Amsterdam, American Dreamer, Instinct), Paul Pilcz (Gotham, Boardwalk Empire) and Gavin Earl Johnson team up with Writer In The Dark Productions to bring you DRIVEN: The Series. Driven is a short form web series concept to be made as an IGTV series. Each episode of Driven will shine a light on real time, real talk conversations that happen between people in their cars. All episodes will cover multiple different genres. What happens when a bride dives into the backseat of an Uber after running away from her own wedding? What does a clown carpool look like? What happens between two 85 year old men once they get into the car after Man "A" has just buried his wife? See it all on DRIVEN: The Series.

What We Need

The goal for season one of DRIVEN: The Series is to fully produce 10 episodes to premier on IGTV and to do that, we need your help. The $6,500 we are raising will help us to achieve that goal. Paired with some private donations, this money will be going towards:

Pre-Production:

- Script breakdown

- Location scouting

- Shot list composition

- Prop(s) designing

- Equipment Rentals

The Crew:

- Director

- Assistant Director

- Director of Photography

- Assistant Camera

- Production Designer 

- Sound Recordist

- Script Supervisor

- Actors

- Hair Supervisor

- Makeup Supervisor

Post-Production:

- Video editing

- Sound mixing

- Color grading

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not help in a monetary way, that is a-okay. We appreciate your time and consideration in helping us make this concept a reality. If you are unable to make a monetary donation at this time, we only ask that you help to spread the word and share out page with any and everyone who you may think would be willing to help us reach out goal. It takes a village and every little bit helps!

story:
Happy Slashers is an animated comedy series that turns all of our horror fantasies and dreams, er...nightmares into reality.  Dive deep into the depths of Hell inside Krueg's boiler-room where O'Face, Jay, Chuck, Tex and of course their therapist Krueg meet for group therapy sessions to become A+, high class, model citizens so that they can be placed safely back into society. 

They Solemnly Swear To NOT Be Assholes Anymore.

They Promise.

For Real This Time...

 

THE CAST

 

THE GOAL

We are looking for a minimum of $12,500 to fund the Pilot episode of Happy Slashers. That money would allow us to pay our amazing cast, made up entirely of horror ICONS. Plus the ability to produce the highest quality, most professional animation possible, in addition to adding an amazing soundtrack scored by horror composer Alexander Taylor!

THE PERKS

Very limited comic of a few important scenes from the Pilot! Autographed by the entire cast

 

Happy Slashers DO NOT DISTURB Door Hang / Officer Doofy Door Hang Autographed by Dave Sheridan himself!

Sleepaway Camp Blu-Ray autographed by Felissa Rose! ONLY TWO AVAILABLE!

MAYHEM Blu-Ray autographed by Director Joe Lynch! ONLY ONE AVAILABLE!

HAUNT DVD autographed by Damian Maffei and Chaney Morrow! ONLY ONE AVAILABLE!

Scary Movie Blu-Ray autographed by Special Officer Doofy himself! ONLY TWO AVAILABLE!

Scream Queen! My Nightmare On Elm Street Official Soundtrack autographed by composer Alexander Taylor!

 

AND MANY MORE!

 

MEET THE SLASHERS

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially and receive one of our AMAZING perks during this crazy time, we totally understand. BUT there are other ways to help. Mainly SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! with all of your passionate horror fans on every social media platform you have!

...or else!

story:
visit our site

 

We are in the midst of a revolution

Crafted Season 2 x Asheville, NC

At a time when most independent, specialized businesses are being pushed into obscurity by an overly monopolized, global economy, craft beer is flourishing. This is evidenced by the juggernauts Anheuser-Busch, MillerCoors, and Heineken [which composed of 90% of the total beer market in the 2000s] experiencing steep declines, yet brewery jobs are at an all-time high. People are drawn to craft breweries because of their commitment to higher quality ingredients, unique flavor profiles, and because they all begin the same way - as a labor of love. This makes for a great story and a better community. 

Crafted is celebrating these brave brewers by showcasing not only their brews but their stories on a national level so they can reach a broader audience. Each season features four different breweries from one region. At the end of each season, these four breweries come together to create one collaborative beer, available in 4-packs of 16oz cans, that viewers can buy at each featured brewery or directly online from crafted-culture.com. We hope that by bringing these stories and their inspired brews into the living rooms of enthusiasts everywhere that we can foster a collaborative and community crafted culture. 

 

FOUNDERS

 

Craig Chapman - Producer & CEO

Craig has 20 years of experience in New York as a production manager working for MTV, VH1, Nickelodeon, Logo, and more. He currently produces Crafted, a series on Amazon Prime.

 

Christopher Berger - COO

Chris has a decade of experience in the food and beverage industry educating patrons on brewing styles, locations, and ingredients in craft beer. Additionally, he has 5 years of experience in commercial sales and marketing.

 

MISSION

Crafted is revolutionizing the way people can experience and try new craft beers from breweries all over the country. Viewers can watch the Crafted digital series that tells the stories of four different breweries each season. They can then order and try a 4-pack of a collaborative beer created by the four featured breweries. 

 

FUNDING GOAL - $7,000

Most of the funding we are raising will go towards producing season 2 of Crafted in Asheville, NC. These funds will also provide us with other necessary tools to make this business a success. 

 

$300 - further development of our e-commerce platform 

$300 - legal expenses for contracts, release forms, terms of service, etc.

$3,800 - travel and production expenses - rental car, hotel, food, production assistance, and equipment rentals plus contingencies.

$200 - beer packaging retail license so we can buy and ship mix-pack packages

$1,600 - post-production - editing, music license, and art

$500 - marketing

$300 - contingencies

 

PERKS

Our perks are huge on bragging rights. You will be able to tell friends and family that you helped support an all-new concept for people to experience and try new craft beers. You could even share one of those new beers with them while watching the episode and showing them your name in the credits.

 

WHY SHOULD I CARE?

If you are a fan of craft beer and the culture and community that surrounds it, Crafted will be an exciting project for you. Your support will go to help create a one of a kind series that explores the passion behind craft breweries and break down decades-old barriers that have prevented craft brewers from getting their creations into the hands of fans outside of their immediate geographic location.

 

TRACK RECORD

Season 1 of Crafted has clocked in over 50,000 views of the series in the first two months. The season 1 collaborative beer sold out of 1,250 4-packs in just two weeks. This was accomplished with a completely boot-strapped dream, drive, determination, and action that was a proven success. With season two, we look forward to expanding this success even further now that we have a fully realized business plan in place. 

 

TURNING A PROFIT

We love telling stories of passion and emotional commitment. Crafted nails each one of these triggers for us. The response we received with season 1 from craft beer enthusiasts was astounding! Our payment comes from making a quality and engaging series that people love and connect with and one that ultimately drives sales of the 4-packs of collaborative beers. 

The series has high engagement because it happens almost in real-time for the viewer. By the time the last episode airs, viewers get to taste the collaborative beer only a couple of weeks later. We also engage the audience with live conversations with the brewers, can artists, brewery owners, and ingredient makers along the way. To further engage the viewers, we also include a special "behind-the-scenes" episode and other relevant content on the Crafted website like foods to pair with the beer, recipes, and more. All of this creates a complete, real-time, craft beer experience for each season.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Crafted is an all-new concept that is charging headfirst into an untapped business model that is full of firsts. Crafted is part digital series and part craft beer e-commerce opportunity that presents a risk that is unmeasured and can not ensure our success. We are facing this challenge aware it will be difficult to navigate but also knowing it has the potential for huge success. We believe the rewards will far outweigh the risks.

 

 

Even if you can not contribute any coinage, you can still support Crafted. Follow us on social media and share our Indiegogo campaign on your own social media and with friends you think might like the series by using the Indiegogo share tools on this page at the top.

Watch Season One on Amazon Prime

Thank you for your support!

Follow us on social media and share our Indiegogo campaign on your own social media and with friends you think might like the series by using the Indiegogo share tools on this page at the top.Watch Season One on Amazon PrimeThank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is S.J. Hermann, author and filmmaker. Bullying and the effects it has on its victims is a topic I'm passionate about. Six years ago I began writing what would become a trilogy of books that dove into the psychological effect bullying has, but with a supernatural twist. Though the main characters dealt with being bullied on a daily basis and handled it in their own way, from self harm, to anger and isolation, they had each other to lean on. I wanted to ask the question, if two high school friends who have been humiliated for years suddenly had the power to strike back at their tormentors, a question I pondered ever since I graduated high school. I wrote the characters with passion for I was once them and suffered the same humiliation as they did.  

At its core, Morium is not about the supernatural horror element, but a story about bullying and friendship and the paths two of the main characters take in regards to their new powers one of them calls, "The Gift." This isn't a good versus evil story, it's a right versus wrong which makes Morium stand out against other bullied teens get supernatural powers story. To bring this story to life has been a passion of mine, for each character has a piece of me in them. 

 Funding will cover finishing the first season of Morium which will consist of four fifteen to twenty minute episodes. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Needing to raise $6,000 to pay the extremly talented cast, feed them, location costs, possible expansion of crew. 
  • Unique perks for donating.
  • Chance to watch the episodes with the cast before they are released. 

The Impact

As I victim of bullying and self harm, I believe this series will bring forth the importance of people of have suffered from bullying and the psychological effects it has on them. What if you had the powers to get back at those who have harmed you, would you do it? That is the main question behind the series using horror and supernatural elements. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would truly appreciate shares for this project. Even if you can't contribute, by helping spread the word brings my passion closer to reality.
