What if you had the powers to get back at those who have harmed you, would you do it? That is the main question behind the series using horror and supernatural elements. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I would truly appreciate shares for this project. Even if you can't contribute, by helping spread the word brings my passion closer to reality.

story:
When Was The Last Time You Watched a Reality Television Show that Not Only Entertained You but Showed You Exclusive Behind the Scenes Access into the Industry?

The Going Pro reality series promises to be something different than the typical reality show...

  • Real Athletes playing for a chance to change their lives
  • Behind the Scenes peek into the minor league sports industry
  • The cast are Real players on a Real semi pro basketball team, not one made up just for TV
  • Learn what motivates players to chase their dreams
  • See the ups and downs of Owning a minor league sports team 

We want to bring positive reality television to you - and we need your help!

Going Pro is an INSIDE LOOK into the Lives of Players, Coaches, Staff all Fighting for a common goal. To take the team and its players to the next level!

 

The Synopsis

12 players compete to rebuild the Akron Aviators, a minor league men’s basketball team after a difficult season that was eventually cut short by the Covid-19 pandemic. They all have one goal in mind - to win a CHAMPIONSHIP and take their careers to the next level!

Over the course of the summer, the players will be developing skills both on and off the court. Follow the players as they fight for a spot on the team and get the attention of international scouts and coaches from the world's top leagues. GOING PRO also gives viewers a behind the scenes look at how the owners built and try to maintain a pro basketball team, with all the ups and downs that are normally hidden from the public. 

Their skills will be put to the test as they try to find chemistry after not playing together for over a year! New players are invited and fighting for veteran spots. Playing last season doesn’t guarantee anything as the owners look to take the team in a new direction during a competitive summer league season across the northeastern United States. With just 6 weeks to get in shape and become a team, will the Akron Aviators be able to pull it together and win a Championship?

Why is it so important to tell this story?

Every year hundreds of college basketball players go undrafted. They all have talent, a dream to chase, and a story to tell on the court. With more and more semi pro leagues developing there is a hunger basketball between the NCAA and the NBA.

Because the cast, who come from all walks of life, have some of the most amazing stories to tell about overcoming their life’s obstacles. 

Our goal is to produce GOING PRO as a pilot and shop to a few already interested networks. We are preparing to shoot the whole 10 week summer season.

(owners David Brooks (L) and Brian "Essince" Collins (R) with Akron Mayor, Dan Horrigan.

story:
Campaign Overview

We know that you want more Lah-Lah! So let’s work together to bring your favourite band back to your screens, now with some amazing new technology! And best of all, you can also grab some fantastic exclusive Lah-Lah perks  only available here!

We’re almost ready to get into studio with our new show The Stripy Sock Club, and we need your help to fund a gap in our financing because funding for preschool TV shows in Australia is in a crisis.

So, we’ve set up this Indiegogo campaign for The Stripy Sock Club where you, our supporters can purchase great perks for YOU and, in doing so, contribute funds toward the making of this series for US! We hope you purchase the best perk that you can so we can make the show a reality. We have the studio booked for production in January 2019 and some great perks ready for you, so let’s do this together!

Amazing Perks
(things we give you to say 'thanks!' for your support)

Over here at Lah-Lah HQ, we have been having such a great time thinking up ways to be grateful. Grateful to you that is! So we've designed a range of very Stripy things from postcards and planners to goody bags and personalized songs & messages from Lah-Lah. And then, for the Super Stripes among you (yes, we know you're out there... it's OK to love a kids band even when you're all grown up!) we have some truly amazing experiences including an intimate High Tea Party with Lah-Lah & Buzz, tickets to an exclusive series screening event or even dancing in an official Lah-Lah video clip as part of the series! So, if you love Lah-Lah, it doesn't matter whether you have a lot or a little to give, we've got you covered with some wonderful thanks from us that will be yours forever! And gee, it's September already ... that's almost Christmas...

Project Overview

Lah-Lah Productions is in planning to produce a new broadcast series - The Stripy Sock Club - featuring the beloved characters of the Lah-Lah's Adventures preschool TV show, and are launching this Indiegogo campaign to fund just the $300,000 gap in the show's $1M production budget. There's a gap because it's getting harder and harder to fund quality pre-school content with less broadcasters making local shows and budget cuts to our beloved national broadcaster and screen funding bodies. But we're not giving in :)

What Is The Stripy Sock Club?
The Stripy Sock Club is the club to join for every girl and boy. Meet new musical friends and their fascinating instruments in each episode. Join Lah-Lah and her adorable band of quirky and fun loving musicians as they do their best to work as a team, make great music, discover fascinating instruments from around the world and find new club members. So grab your stripes and join the club!

The Stripy Sock Clubhouse
The Stripy Sock Clubhouse is quaint and homely - and is shaped like a giant stripy sock! It is nestled between lush rolling green hills. The sock's cuff has a small pitched slate roof, there are cute square windows and a large hobbit hole-like door at the sock’s ankle. At the back of the heel there is a flight of cute wooden stairs with banister leading inside.

The Music
Lah-Lah is a band and they love to play songs, so every episode features a new Lah-Lah original. The songs are great fun for the kids at home to sing, dance and play along with. Every song has been specially crafted include to highlight early childhood music learnings such as high/low (pitch), fast/slow (tempo), loud/soft (dynamics), stop/go (notes & rests). They do so across a broad palette of musical styles from around the globe including Latin, jazz, Gypsy, klezmer, rock'n'roll, pop and a touch of classical.

The Musical Guests
The guests are a showcase of Australia’s rich and diverse musical landscape, including both traditional orchestral instruments such as harp and tuba, as well as lesser known world music instruments such as the oud and charango. The musicians themselves are as colourful and diverse as the instruments they play. Children are also daily visitors to the Stripy Sock Club where they enjoy a voyage of musical discovery with Lah-Lah.

Background

Lah-Lah is Australia’s premiere band for young children, performing original Australian songs influenced by a diverse palette of musical genres. Since formation ten years ago Lah-Lah has proven to be a hit with families with its annual national tour and international broadcast platform culminating to date in two Australian Clubs Entertainment (ACE) awards for Best Children’s Show and a 2017 ARIA nomination for Best Children’s Album. In 2018 Lah-Lah was inducted into the What's On 4 Kids Hall Of Fame. The cast are all leading musicians and performers in their own right and each has their own adorably quirky character in the band.

Lah-Lah has been making screen content for almost ten years, beginning with a series of music videos co-produced with Nickelodeon Australia in 2009, broadcasting first on Nick Jr. and more recently on ABC KIDS in Australia. In 2013 Lah-Lah, with production companies Stella Projects in Australia and Bardel Entertainment in Canada, made the series Lah-Lah's Adventures for BBC Australia, Seven Network and the Canadian networks BBC Canada and the Knowledge Network. Lah-Lah's Adventures is now also broadcast on Virgin Media in the UK and NBC Universal's kids channel Universal Kids across the USA. More recently Lah-Lah has begun producing regular online video content in-house including music videos and music education resources. The Australian Children's Television Foundation has also recently licensed Lah-Lah's Adventures to create a series of music education resources for primary schools.

The Stripy Sock Club is our love project. We have been developing and refining the show's format over the past three years, which has then dovetailed perfectly into the timing of an industry first partnership with the wonderful RMIT University to use their brand new state of the art studios in Melbourne.

After our exciting test shoot there earlier this year, we are now ready to take The Stripy Sock Club to the screen and we need your help to make this happen. For us, crowdfunding is the perfect way to engage directly with you, our Lah-Lah fans both in Australia and around the world. We want to invite you to join us and be a part of the Stripy Sock Club's journey (and get some really cool exclusive goodies to you along the way)!

How will the funds be used?

The Stripy Sock Club will be a technically groundbreaking production using the cutting edge in virtual studio techniques. Through our unique partnership with RMIT University in Melbourne, the series will be shot in a brand new state-of-the-art 'virtual set' studio. The specially designed cameras integrate with Zero Density software to allow us to composite the live action band into incredibly photorealistic 3D virtual sets modelled in the video game industry's Unreal Engine 4 in real time. With the musical calibre of Lah-Lah combined with the technology of RMIT's studio, The Stripy Sock Club will sound magnificent, look amazing and we won't have to spend months and months in post production - we can get the new show to you quicker!

We need your support to bring The Stripy Sock Club to life. The funds you give, when you choose your exclusive perks, play a key part in closing the gap in the production budget. Your contribution will help us to make the most of this incredible technology with the best creative - scripts, designs, 3D modelling, music and musician guests.

We were recently awarded development funding by the Australian Children's Television Foundation (ACTF). With this, took the Lah-Lah's Big Live Band to the new RMIT University studio to test out the technology using one 3D modelled Stripy Sock Club environment. The results are amazing and we hope you are as excited as we are - have a look:

 

Our Goal

Our goal is to raise the full $300,000 production budget gap to allow us to produce a 26 x seven-minute episode series of The Stripy Sock Club for broadcast.

But what happens if you don't raise the whole goal amount?
It's simple. We'll make as many episodes as we can with whatever we raise. We're committed to producing this show in January-February 2019.

Risks & Challenges

Funding challenges for preschool content in Australia

The Australian Government is currently undertaking a review of Australian and children's screen content. In response, the free to air commercial television broadcasters are lobbying to have their obligation to present quotas of new Australian children's programming scrapped. Preschool producers are already in a difficult position as their content doesn't attract anywhere near the licence fees from broadcasters that adult content does. Should these broadcasters be successful, the amount of quality children's content produced by Australians for Australians will dangerously decline as the newer online broadcasters don't currently have any obligation to program new Australian content either. This will put strong downward pressure on the quality of local children's shows, damaging the public's opinion the industry and profoundly short-changing our kids in the most important stage of their identity development.

A lot of preschool content on Australian screens now consists of animated shows from overseas, with funding tied to the potential for revenue from toy sales. As our show focuses on making music, we don’t really have funding coming in from toy licensing. Funding for a show like ours comes from broadcaster license fees - which are getting smaller all the time, government funding - which is getting harder to access, and angel investors - who demand large chunks of profits and merchandising rights. Therefore, we’ve chosen to tread this completely new funding path with you and Indiegogo.

We are now in the middle of their 10th Birthday Party national tour around Australia and strongly believe that this crowdfunding campaign will allow Australian mums and dads to have a voice in the type of TV content they want their kids watching. A successful campaign will give hard proof to government and broadcasters that parents want shows such as this that are not only entertaining and educational, but also uniquely Australian.

Perks/Rewards 
The exact shoot and release dates are still to be finalised and some rewards may be delayed as they tie in with these. However, we'll send you regular updates so you'll know the progress of the campaign first hand, your rewards and of course the show.

*Perk/Reward Terms and Conditions

  • You are responsible for ensuring your availability to attend event based perks on the dates set as refunds will not be provided if you are unable to attend.
  • If you are required to travel to attend an event based perk you will be responsible for all travel and accommodation costs.
  • For the Dance In A Music Video and The Ultimate Stripy Experience perks, while we aim to include footage of all participating guests, we cannot guarantee your shots will make the final cut. In either case you will receive footage of your performance by email.
  • For the Lah-Lah Full Band Performance perk, the contribution covers the performance by the band with all instruments plus the meet & greet session. Audio and lighting production is not included and will need to be arranged separately. Lah-Lah is based in Sydney, any performances outside the Sydney metro area will require transport and also possibly accommodation provided additionally. A Tax Invoice can be provided where the performance is a creditable supply to your company. For more information please contact info@lah-lah.com

FAQs

We're starting to receive some great questions regarding our show and the campaign, so below I'll be adding the most common questions with our thoughts. So please, leave a comment above in the campaign, we'll reply to everyone and this section can become more helpful for all. Please click the arrows to read the answers to the questions.

why is the ABC not funding this? Isn't that what our tax goes towards? Why does your show need to be crowdfunded when clearly you're bringing money to the ABC in terms of loyal viewers etc? (thanks to Tanya M)


Lah-Lah is an independent production company that makes TV, online video, music and live concerts and merchandise products. We are a small family business run by Tina (Lah-Lah) and Mark (Buzz) with just two other wonderful staff. We manage all our live touring, promotion, music production and merchandising in house and, in 2013, worked with two other independent production companies – Stella Projects (Australia) and Bardel Entertainment (Canada) to co-produce Lah-Lah’s Adventures. The ABC, while we love them, actually has very little to do with Lah-Lah other than having bought a license to broadcast our show on ABC TV and iView for the last few years.

ABC KIDS gets its content for broadcast in a few ways. Firstly, they produce their own preschool content, namely Playschool and Giggle and Hoot. Then they commission a very small number of shows from independent producers. Commissioning is a system where they get creative input in the development of a new show and often have some equity position in it, for this they have to contribute quite a lot to the total production budget, perhaps 30%, they don’t pay for the entire production. The ABC funding cuts have meant that the budget for commissioning new Australian preschool shows is tiny. We understand that they would dearly love to be able to commission more content for kids, but unfortunately, it’s just not the reality they face. Finally, The ABC acquires broadcast licenses, at very very low cost (in our case it could be 2-3% of the total production budget) for shows that have already been made. This is one of the the main ways that the ABC is getting new preschool content for the channel and how Lah-Lah’s Adventures came to the ABC (the show was actually commissioned by BBC Australia and the Seven Network). Producers accept this in part because they have no choice, with little other broadcaster competition in Australia there are few places to sell our shows to, but also because many of the other productions – mostly animated – can be dubbed into foreign languages and sold to hundreds of other territories, helping to recoup the budget, or by commercialising the characters into licensing properties sold to toy companies. Our issues here are a) as a live action show for pre-schoolers, our content is not suitable to be dubbed into foreign languages for preschools – this is a common position of international broadcasters - and b) as we focus on music and instruments and getting kids participating in music making, we are less focused on licensing to toy companies than we are to making great music and shows for kids. Furthermore, the free-to-air commercial broadcasters are currently actively campaigning to have their Australian children’s content quotas scrapped entirely, which removes even more sales opportunities from us producers.

The total production budget for The Stripy Sock Club is much more than the $300,000 we are aiming to raise here from our audience - making high quality screen content is very very expensive - however we are seeking other funding sources to bring the show to life including broadcast license sales to free-to-air, pay TV and streaming broadcasters in Australia and international English speaking territories as well as government funding initiatives from Create NSW, Film Victoria and Screen Australia and investment in the series from players in the industry. In short, it takes a community to make a show and that’s why we are asking you to help.

 

What's the best way for me to help you grow the campaign after I've contributed?


Comment and share!

Indiegogo is, like so many web platforms these days, run by algorithms that track lots of metrics to decide who to support further. Indiegogo's business depends on campaigns going well, so it actively promotes the more successful ones. They have a number of tools for you to help us, including the comment sections on our campaign page and the share buttons at the top right. Use of these features is tracked by the platform and goes towards something they call GoGoFactor, which is how they gauge which campaigns to promote. So please, comment & share :)

 

How much will it really cost to make the show?

Making high quality screen content costs a lot! There are just so many people and so much equipment to make it look any good.

Some examples are based on what our federal screen financing body Screen Australia expects in commissioning rates from broadcasters. To apply for general TV production funding for example, a show must have attracted $440,000 per hour of content from a broadcaster. Doing some quick maths, that means that for a show that has a typical 13 x 30-minute episodes in its season, they’d need to secure almost $2.9 million from a broadcaster to even be eligible to apply for extra funding. That they’d need to apply for extra funding indicates that $2.9M isn’t enough to cover production costs, with Screen Australia funding up to an extra $2M on this kind of project. So, the production budget could be at least $4.9M (and very likely considerably more).

By contrast, our first show Lah-Lah’s Adventures had a production budget of close to $2M for its 26 x 12-minute episodes, which is a really low budget by comparison. With some technological advancements that we are being invited to use at RMIT and working on a shoestring, we’re aiming to keep The Stripy Sock Club’s 26 x 7-minute episode budget to just under $1M.

We are funding the difference between that budget total and your wonderful contributions by applying to government screen funding bodies, seeking investment from the industry, and entering into an industry first partnership with RMIT University – allowing us to use their facilities and equipment in return for giving their students an invaluable opportunity to work on a for-broadcast show as part of their studies.

We're starting to receive some great questions regarding our show and the campaign, so below I'll be adding the most common questions with our thoughts. So please, leave a comment above in the campaign, we'll reply to everyone and this section can become more helpful for all. Please click the arrows to read the answers to the questions.
why is the ABC not funding this? Isn't that what our tax goes towards? Why does your show need to be crowdfunded when clearly you're bringing money to the ABC in terms of loyal viewers etc? (thanks to Tanya M)Lah-Lah is an independent production company that makes TV, online video, music and live concerts and merchandise products. We are a small family business run by Tina (Lah-Lah) and Mark (Buzz) with just two other wonderful staff. We manage all our live touring, promotion, music production and merchandising in house and, in 2013, worked with two other independent production companies – Stella Projects (Australia) and Bardel Entertainment (Canada) to co-produce Lah-Lah’s Adventures. The ABC, while we love them, actually has very little to do with Lah-Lah other than having bought a license to broadcast our show on ABC TV and iView for the last few years.
ABC KIDS gets its content for broadcast in a few ways. Firstly, they produce their own preschool content, namely Playschool and Giggle and Hoot. Then they commission a very small number of shows from independent producers. Commissioning is a system where they get creative input in the development of a new show and often have some equity position in it, for this they have to contribute quite a lot to the total production budget, perhaps 30%, they don’t pay for the entire production. The ABC funding cuts have meant that the budget for commissioning new Australian preschool shows is tiny. We understand that they would dearly love to be able to commission more content for kids, but unfortunately, it’s just not the reality they face. Finally, The ABC acquires broadcast licenses, at very very low cost (in our case it could be 2-3% of the total production budget) for shows that have already been made. This is one of the the main ways that the ABC is getting new preschool content for the channel and how Lah-Lah’s Adventures came to the ABC (the show was actually commissioned by BBC Australia and the Seven Network). Producers accept this in part because they have no choice, with little other broadcaster competition in Australia there are few places to sell our shows to, but also because many of the other productions – mostly animated – can be dubbed into foreign languages and sold to hundreds of other territories, helping to recoup the budget, or by commercialising the characters into licensing properties sold to toy companies. Our issues here are a) as a live action show for pre-schoolers, our content is not suitable to be dubbed into foreign languages for preschools – this is a common position of international broadcasters - and b) as we focus on music and instruments and getting kids participating in music making, we are less focused on licensing to toy companies than we are to making great music and shows for kids. Furthermore, the free-to-air commercial broadcasters are currently actively campaigning to have their Australian children’s content quotas scrapped entirely, which removes even more sales opportunities from us producers.
The total production budget for The Stripy Sock Club is much more than the $300,000 we are aiming to raise here from our audience - making high quality screen content is very very expensive - however we are seeking other funding sources to bring the show to life including broadcast license sales to free-to-air, pay TV and streaming broadcasters in Australia and international English speaking territories as well as government funding initiatives from Create NSW, Film Victoria and Screen Australia and investment in the series from players in the industry. In short, it takes a community to make a show and that’s why we are asking you to help.
 What's the best way for me to help you grow the campaign after I've contributed?Comment and share!
Indiegogo is, like so many web platforms these days, run by algorithms that track lots of metrics to decide who to support further. Indiegogo's business depends on campaigns going well, so it actively promotes the more successful ones. They have a number of tools for you to help us, including the comment sections on our campaign page and the share buttons at the top right. Use of these features is tracked by the platform and goes towards something they call GoGoFactor, which is how they gauge which campaigns to promote. So please, comment & share :)
 How much will it really cost to make the show?Making high quality screen content costs a lot! There are just so many people and so much equipment to make it look any good.
Some examples are based on what our federal screen financing body Screen Australia expects in commissioning rates from broadcasters. To apply for general TV production funding for example, a show must have attracted $440,000 per hour of content from a broadcaster. Doing some quick maths, that means that for a show that has a typical 13 x 30-minute episodes in its season, they’d need to secure almost $2.9 million from a broadcaster to even be eligible to apply for extra funding. That they’d need to apply for extra funding indicates that $2.9M isn’t enough to cover production costs, with Screen Australia funding up to an extra $2M on this kind of project. So, the production budget could be at least $4.9M (and very likely considerably more).
By contrast, our first show Lah-Lah’s Adventures had a production budget of close to $2M for its 26 x 12-minute episodes, which is a really low budget by comparison. With some technological advancements that we are being invited to use at RMIT and working on a shoestring, we’re aiming to keep The Stripy Sock Club’s 26 x 7-minute episode budget to just under $1M.
We are funding the difference between that budget total and your wonderful contributions by applying to government screen funding bodies, seeking investment from the industry, and entering into an industry first partnership with RMIT University – allowing us to use their facilities and equipment in return for giving their students an invaluable opportunity to work on a for-broadcast show as part of their studies.

story:
Sophia Reaves, established actress, producer and director is on a mission to change Hollywood for the better. She stated in a recent interview, “I want to affect those I work with in a positive manner by creating an atmosphere of respect, appreciation, cooperation, and camaraderie, so that they may go forth and implement positive change within the industry." She continued, "I also want to keep fighting for females and those of color to be recognized by the industry and to enjoy equal pay as well.  "I am blessed to have worked with some of the most talented people. It was truly a joy working with the cast and crew of “Roses Underground”. I appreciated those that gave their all, those who went above and beyond what was expected to insure the success of the project. We were able to build a sense of family and high regard for one another.” Not only is this production about empowering those involved, where they now know firsthand that the underdog can prevail, I want to inspire the general public as well. Through participation in this campaign, I want those participating to feel involved in the production of this web series because you truly are a part of history in the making for a more diverse Hollywood and one where women are represented in strong roles!

 

The Plot

Two half-sisters, Cassidy and Joanna, who want nothing to do with each other find themselves forced into a union to find their father Michael (Mike) Delofante, a detective who has gone missing. Joanna, trained by a sensai, followed in her father's footsteps and became a cop but, after uncovering suspicious evidence involving her father, hunts down Cassidy to solicit aid in her search to find answers. Cassidy, who was raised on the street, is heavily involved in the underground fighting scene and Joanna believes that Cassidy may be the link to finding their father. Cassidy and Joanna will find themselves on a twin collision course to find their father, and discover a secret that may undo the threads of truth and the very world around them.

 

 

 

What We Need to Wrap Episodes One and Two with an Early 2018 release & What You Get

 

For the total budget goal of $12,500 in the next 60 days, definitely achievable when all who want to see stronger roles for women in the industry and more diversity throughout Hollywood, "cast their vote" by contributing at the level comfortable for them to allow for the completion of the first three episodes.

Your contributions in helping us meet this goal mean that episodes one and two will be completed in terms of post production, allowing for an early 2018 release of  this web series.  

In terms of incentives, we wanted to make it exciting for all who participate and we think we have achieved that! Check out the incentives and know that at any level that you participate, you will always receive every incentive listed for donation levels up to that level.

 You Can Help Vote for Diversity in Hollywood by Supporting "Roses Underground"

What this campaign means is truly a "vote" for diversity in Hollywood, empowering roles for women, and giving many the opportunity to showcase their talent in ways they hadn't before. It always means the completion of an exciting and inspiring web series, where true gifted individuals finally received a leg up through this series coming to fruition. The opportunities created from the immensely talented individuals involved in Roses Underground, both cast and crew are well earned.  Please view the trailer, visit the Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/afemaleactionseries, and please participate at a level comfortable for you! Sophia Reaves has a strong and proven background in the TV/Film industry, so this project with the help from the public will be a produced and distributed by early 2017 upon meeting our goal. Sophia Reaves has produced ten short films through her production company 31:30 productions in the past year. She produced and acted in a short film called “Cuckoo’s Nesting” as a test run for the “D.C. 48 Hr Film Project.” It was nominated for Best Director (Jesse Jenkins), Best Cinematography (Jacob Drum Heller), Best Screenplay (Cisco Davis, Jr.), and Best Acting (Sophia Reaves and Mackie Lou Vigal) at the 2016 WMIFF, World Music and Independent Film Festival. She also produced the short film “Guber” for the the 2016 DC 48Hr Film Project. Reaves film“Guber” made the top 3 in its category and was selected to be shown at the “Best Of” DC 48Hr Film Project Screening & Awards. Sophia Reaves was also nominated for Best Director for her work on “Guber” through WMIFF. Others nominated for “Guber” include Best Cinematographer, Edwin Koester and Best Acting, Jesse Jenkins.

 

Through the wide range of contribution levels we hope that all can feel and truly be included in this campaign, as everyone who supports this production is truly part of it. Please also show your support by using Indiegogo's share tools, as sharing does help bring additional supporters to the campaign. Each person sharing is immensely valuable too as you are helping the campaign to have far reaching positive effects, and creates awareness about the project. Every dollar counts, so regardless of the level at which you can contributor please know it is appreciated and is of immense value.

The cast and crew, and Director/Actress Sophia Reaves thank you for being here and showing your support!!

story:
In March 2017, the first season (five episodes) of DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS launched on the brand new YouTube channel LESBIAN BOX OFFICE! It has proven to be a hit, rising by 2,000 views every day.

DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 1 was only achievable with the support and funding given by Indiegogo supporters. You helped us create a sexy, sassy, uber modern web series where romance, betrayal and mystery entangled three lesbian couples and their gay male friends. 

We need to make the remaining seven episodes so we can present the complete twelve episodes to potential broadcasters and distributers. 

We now need to raise completion funding so we can continue to tell the story of Fran & Cam, Brooke & Nicola and Gemma & Jude who, along with their friends and families, face even more sexual entanglement, lies and suspense.

We want to continue producing a drama where lesbian characters are more than secondary characters, where contemporary lesbian relationships are first and foremost to the plot and where not one lesbian is killed, maimed or turned straight! 

Since launching DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS  SEASON 1, we have been struck by how much a lesbian specific drama series is appreciated. Traditional broadcasters still lag behind digital networks and web channels, when it comes to the representation of lesbian characters and their story lines.

DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS is at the foremost of web based drama for the uber modern viewer.

By funding DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 1, Indiegogo contributors helped cast seasoned actors like Rachel Shelley, Guinevere Turner, Charlie Hardwick, Nimmy March, Caroline Whitney Smith, Toby Sawyer and Topher Campbell in vibrant roles.

Indiegogo funding also helped introduce talented stars like Victoria Broom, Tuyen Do, Jake Graf, Helen Oakleigh and Sophie Ottley  to a wider audience. Since DFG hit the small screen, Victoria Broom has been nominated for three Newcomer awards, including DIVERSITY IN MEDIA Newcomer Award. Victoria also won the DIVA READERS AWARD at the DIVA250 AWARDS. 

Indiegogo funding also helped DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS crew from the best creatives, including prize winning cinematographer, Oona Menges, who helped make DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS look like Hollywood on the small screen. 

DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS itself has been nominated for various awards and has screened in worldwide festivals.  In fact, it was the first ever web series to be screened at the BFI Flare Film Festival. 

The press for DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS  was rather spectacular, with positive reviews from Sight & Sound, The Independent, Time Out, Variety and The Evening Standard. Here are links to a few of the articles and reviews :

http://www.bfi.org.uk/news-opinion/sight-sound-...

http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment...

http://www.standard.co.uk/goingout/film/bfi-fla...

https://www.timeout.com/london/blog/five-brilli...

http://variety.com/2017/film/news/new-alan-cumm...

DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS was also featured on the front cover of DIVA MAGAZINE. We will continue to work with DIVA, as a valued Media Partner who will keep you update with the development of DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 2 from script to screen. Watch out for articles, competitions and events associated with all things DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS. 

Myself (Writer, Jacquie Lawrence), Campbell X (Director) and Fizz Milton (Producer) cannot thank our Indiegogo funders enough and pledge to make DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 2 even better, bigger and bolder!  

All of the cast will be back and we will be announcing some exciting new cast members. 

We need £15,000 to help reach the budget level we have set for DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 2 2. We have raised 4/5 of the budget already. The £15,000, if raised via Indiegogo, will go towards funding the production, so that it is up on the web before the end of 2017 ! 

The perks for DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 1 have just been posted to contributors. They include signed photos, t-shirts and DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS paperbacks.

DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 2  will have similar perks but we will have more availability to accommodate additional parts for those who pledge money to appear as extras. Season Two will feature some social events (without giving away any spoilers, one scene will include a society wedding) and we will be pledging the chance to be a  'wedding guest'. 

As we have managed to raise most of the budget, we will still be able to make the series if our Indiegogo funding goal is not reached. So, please be assured that your contribution will be used to make that better, bigger and  bolder  DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS! 

Our Indiegogo supporters are literally changing the landscape of LGBT programming !

Even if you are unable to contribute, we can use your help in spreading the word about DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS. Please share the word that we are raising finance for DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON 2 and that DIFFERENT FOR GIRLS SEASON  1 can be seen, free of charge, at: 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxri5xtdddBw0V...

story:
Nothing says ‘scream queens’ like two women approaching a deadline, over budget, with their PMS synced more frequently than their shared google drive.

Allie & Lara just want to see their first epic creature feature WOMANTIS make it to the big screen, but all the Dude Bros and hard NO’s are really holding them back. The solution? They are going to make it themselves! 

If you’d like watching a Langoliers style plane-wreck in slow motion, then this is the series for you!


Poster by Matthew Therrien Illustration

 

Alicia & Larissa met in the spring of 2016 and have been joined at the hip ever since, preparing for the wide birth of their creative baby.

They conceived ALLIE & LARA MAKE A HORROR MOVIE last summer, incubated it to full term and are ready to start pushing it out there into the world!

This is first project they have in production, with two more in the development phase.

  

“This is exactly the sort of show I would make if I weren’t so fucking lazy.”
- Brian Collins, Birth. Movies. Death.

“Think Scott Pilgrim meets Deathgasm via A New Nightmare and you’ll get the vibe.”
- Jonny Bunning, Bloody Disgusting

“Yeah whatever-- alls I want to know is, can it make me a sandwich?”
- Satanzilla, BD User Comment

“No.”
- BloodyDisgusted, BD User Comment.

“Is it made to look this bad on purpose?”
- Alanmac, BD User Comment.

"You're not helping #womeninfilm by funding one person's project because they're a woman."
@vickle_victor, obsessed Twitter fan, marketing specialist.

 

Follow Maddy @maddyfoleyfoley

Follow Heather @HeatherDicke 

Follow Sharon @sharongrumbelle 

Check out Conor's other projects on: @Astron6

Follow Vanessa @nessbot

 

Follow Alicia @AJFaucher

Follow Larissa @larissa_thomas

Follow Larica @LaricaPerera and Camp 905 Productions @camp905

Steve doesn't have twitter! WTF? Follow Astron 6 @Astron6

Follow poppin' Pierce @100_tacos

Follow Emily @EmilyMilling and CanMAKE Productions @CanmakeP

 

  • PERKS FOR CREATIVES! Because this series is about making a movie, we've included perks for creators to help get your creations off the ground. Want to know what really goes into making a web series? Pick our Preparation W(eb series) perk. Alicia and Larissa are the creators, writers, producers, amongst many other things - and will give it to you straight.
  • PERKS FOR HORROR-LOVERS!
  • PERKS FOR STRAIGHT UP, AWESOME FANS!
  • PERKS FOR DO'ERS! Live in the middle of nowhere? Want to produce but can't find projects you connect with? Start getting some producing credits with our Producer perks. We have different tiers for different budgets.

 

Paying our cast and crew. They won't get to eat, and we'll all have to shoot the entire thing in Alicia's apartment and alley - but it'll get made. And well, "Womantis" might have to become "Garbage Can Lady." Doesn't have the same ring to it, but we know Sharon can pull off any creature we turn her into.

 

  • HIGH RISK! HIGH REWARD! We'll be shooting during Mercury Retrograde. Your contribution will help ease the suffering of planetary meddling. Take back the night. For all of your lost data, broken laptops, accidentally sent drunken texts. CONTROL YOUR (OUR) DESTINY! (The reward is emotional.)
  • ARE WE CURSED?! We might be, don't you kinda wanna see where that goes?

 

Don't gots the money but you gots the notion to help us get this series in motion? Or maybe you just like our project and want to be more involved. Here's what to do!

  • SHARE US ON YOUR SOCIAL! Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, email! Blog about us! Vlog about us. Engage with us on social. Retweet! Comment! Tattoo our faces on your face and then snap a photo using Snapchat's face-swap with our faces. Name a beer after us! Draw us fan art (we'd f**king love that so hard.)
  • Toronto horror bloggers/vloggers/podcasters - if you want to cameo on our series - we'd LOVE it. We'd also love you for eternity if you featured us on your site, or wanted us to come talk on your podcast. Contact us directly and let us know how we can make that happen if this project interests you!
  • We also need volunteer crew (general PA-ing, transportation, gif-making, behind-the-scenes videos). If you live in Toronto and are free during August/September (mostly weekends + Mondays) get in touch with us. (Note: Must be responsible, capable, committed, focused, and thick-skinned.)

 

STAY TUNED FOR THE FOLLOWING:

  • Episode 1 is live now -- check the "Updates" section!
  • The video message from cast member SHARON BELLE is live -- check the "Gallery" section!
  • A message from our other director STEVE KOSTANSKI
  • Dropping a deuce in week 3 - Episode 2 comin' at ya!
  • Updates/Progress Reports/Periscopes/Messages of love and support.
  • More, more, more!!!

Don't want to miss a thing? Donate and/or join our email list!

IMDB

TWITTER

FACEBOOK

INSTAGRAM

 

WHO ARE ALLIE & LARA? 

Allie & Lara are FICTIONAL characters created by our writers Alicia Faucher & Larissa Thomas. They are portrayed by actresses Maddy Foley & Heather Dicke respectively.

SO, ALICIA & LARISSA DON’T PLAY THEMSELVES?

No. These are FICTIONAL characters with similar names.

DID THE ACTRESSES THAT PLAY ALLIE & LARA WRITE THE SHOW?

No. Maddy & Heather are both skilled improvisers, and are given room to play, but this is primarily scripted content provided by our writers.

IS THIS A HORROR MOVIE?

No. This is a comedy web series about two women making a horror movie.

MORE FAQs: https://www.allieandlaramakeahorrormovie.com/faq/

Thank you for checking us out! Please spread the word!

Allie & Lara just want to see their first epic creature feature WOMANTIS make it to the big screen, but all the Dude Bros and hard NO’s are really holding them back. The solution? They are going to make it themselves! 
If you’d like watching a Langoliers style plane-wreck in slow motion, then this is the series for you!
Poster by Matthew Therrien Illustration
 


Alicia & Larissa met in the spring of 2016 and have been joined at the hip ever since, preparing for the wide birth of their creative baby.
They conceived ALLIE & LARA MAKE A HORROR MOVIE last summer, incubated it to full term and are ready to start pushing it out there into the world!
This is first project they have in production, with two more in the development phase.
  

“This is exactly the sort of show I would make if I weren’t so fucking lazy.” - Brian Collins, Birth. Movies. Death.
“Think Scott Pilgrim meets Deathgasm via A New Nightmare and you’ll get the vibe.” - Jonny Bunning, Bloody Disgusting
“Yeah whatever-- alls I want to know is, can it make me a sandwich?” - Satanzilla, BD User Comment
“No.” - BloodyDisgusted, BD User Comment.
“Is it made to look this bad on purpose?” - Alanmac, BD User Comment.
"You're not helping #womeninfilm by funding one person's project because they're a woman."@vickle_victor, obsessed Twitter fan, marketing specialist.
 


Follow Maddy @maddyfoleyfoley

Follow Heather @HeatherDicke 

Follow Sharon @sharongrumbelle 

Check out Conor's other projects on: @Astron6

Follow Vanessa @nessbot
 


Follow Alicia @AJFaucher

Follow Larissa @larissa_thomas

Follow Larica @LaricaPerera and Camp 905 Productions @camp905

Steve doesn't have twitter! WTF? Follow Astron 6 @Astron6

Follow poppin' Pierce @100_tacos

Follow Emily @EmilyMilling and CanMAKE Productions @CanmakeP
 




PERKS FOR CREATIVES! Because this series is about making a movie, we've included perks for creators to help get your creations off the ground. Want to know what really goes into making a web series? Pick our Preparation W(eb series) perk. Alicia and Larissa are the creators, writers, producers, amongst many other things - and will give it to you straight.
PERKS FOR HORROR-LOVERS!
PERKS FOR STRAIGHT UP, AWESOME FANS!

PERKS FOR DO'ERS! Live in the middle of nowhere? Want to produce but can't find projects you connect with? Start getting some producing credits with our Producer perks. We have different tiers for different budgets.

















 

Paying our cast and crew. They won't get to eat, and we'll all have to shoot the entire thing in Alicia's apartment and alley - but it'll get made. And well, "Womantis" might have to become "Garbage Can Lady." Doesn't have the same ring to it, but we know Sharon can pull off any creature we turn her into.

 



HIGH RISK! HIGH REWARD! We'll be shooting during Mercury Retrograde. Your contribution will help ease the suffering of planetary meddling. Take back the night. For all of your lost data, broken laptops, accidentally sent drunken texts. CONTROL YOUR (OUR) DESTINY! (The reward is emotional.)

ARE WE CURSED?! We might be, don't you kinda wanna see where that goes?

 


Don't gots the money but you gots the notion to help us get this series in motion? Or maybe you just like our project and want to be more involved. Here's what to do!


SHARE US ON YOUR SOCIAL! Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, email! Blog about us! Vlog about us. Engage with us on social. Retweet! Comment! Tattoo our faces on your face and then snap a photo using Snapchat's face-swap with our faces. Name a beer after us! Draw us fan art (we'd f**king love that so hard.)

Toronto horror bloggers/vloggers/podcasters - if you want to cameo on our series - we'd LOVE it. We'd also love you for eternity if you featured us on your site, or wanted us to come talk on your podcast. Contact us directly and let us know how we can make that happen if this project interests you!
We also need volunteer crew (general PA-ing, transportation, gif-making, behind-the-scenes videos). If you live in Toronto and are free during August/September (mostly weekends + Mondays) get in touch with us. (Note: Must be responsible, capable, committed, focused, and thick-skinned.)

 

STAY TUNED FOR THE FOLLOWING:

Episode 1 is live now -- check the "Updates" section!
The video message from cast member SHARON BELLE is live -- check the "Gallery" section!
A message from our other director STEVE KOSTANSKI
Dropping a deuce in week 3 - Episode 2 comin' at ya!
Updates/Progress Reports/Periscopes/Messages of love and support.
More, more, more!!!

Don't want to miss a thing? Donate and/or join our email list!


IMDB
TWITTER
FACEBOOK
INSTAGRAM
 

WHO ARE ALLIE & LARA? 
Allie & Lara are FICTIONAL characters created by our writers Alicia Faucher & Larissa Thomas. They are portrayed by actresses Maddy Foley & Heather Dicke respectively.
SO, ALICIA & LARISSA DON’T PLAY THEMSELVES?
No. These are FICTIONAL characters with similar names.
DID THE ACTRESSES THAT PLAY ALLIE & LARA WRITE THE SHOW?
No. Maddy & Heather are both skilled improvisers, and are given room to play, but this is primarily scripted content provided by our writers.
IS THIS A HORROR MOVIE?
No. This is a comedy web series about two women making a horror movie.
MORE FAQs: https://www.allieandlaramakeahorrormovie.com/faq/
Thank you for checking us out! Please spread the word!

story:
Dr. Juli Returns!

Dr. Julianna Grimaldi is a world renowned expert on anything and everything, with an answer for every question.  As veritable fountain of knowledge, Dr. Juli is tasked with providing simple, everyday answers to many of life's most challenging queries, such as why men think their farts are funny, why reading the comments section kills your brain cells, and why people who are drunk think they're all that.    
            

                                               Check out Ask Dr Juli on Facebook

Ask Dr. Juli stars Lana Gautier as the title character and is written by Ron L. Palmer.  We're the ones heading up this campaign and we're excited about bringing this show back.  During season one, we made a lot out of a little, using money from our own pockets to fund the show.   It was a labor of love and we didn't mind it, but now for season two we'd like to take it to the next level.   All twelve season two episodes have been written and we've got loftier goals for locations and casting.  In short, we want season two of Ask Dr. Juli to be special!


That's where you come in.  We're creating a special campaign that puts you right in the heart of the project and gives you a stake in it as well.   Want to be an associate producer?  We can do that.  How about impressing your friends and co-workers as an Executive Producer!  Yup, we can make that happen.  Want to have a walk-on role in an episode?  We've got one written for you already.  Those are just some of the perks available to you.  Keep reading to find out more!  

Get in on the Action!

Let's get straight to the point... producing any type of entertainment content is expensive, whether it's a feature film, television show or a web series.   In order to bring season two of Ask Dr. Juli to life, we've budgeted $2,000 per episode.  With twelve episodes planned, that's a total of $24,000.   And that's doing it on a shoestring budget!   If we reach our goal, that amount will ensure that everybody who works on the series -- actors, crew members, support staff, etc -- will get paid.  If we raise more than our goal, we'll increase the budget and compensate everyone at a higher rate.  We'll also be able to increase the production quality of the series.   It'll look better, sound better and we'll have a better overall product.  Some elements that would otherwise be logistically unaffordable would now be doable.   Bottom line, whatever money is brought in through this campaign will be put into the production and promotion of the project.  On top of that, you'll be helping create jobs!
          

By now you're probably asking, "what's in it for me?"   This is not an ordinary crowdfunding campaign where you'll get a hat, a t-shirt or a metaphorical pat on the back.   You have a chance to get your name -- and even your face -- attached to this project in one of many way.  Those perks include:

  • Associate Producer or Executive Producer credit
  • Have a character named after you (or a friend)
  • Have your name listed on a question sent to Dr. Juli
  • Have your business name mentioned in an episode
  • Attend the red carpet gala as a VIP!
  • Actually be in an episode!  With lines!

Those are just some of the amazing items your contribution to the project could net you.  We'll have a lot more for you to choose from, but having your name attached to the project and celebrating with the cast and crew at the red carpet screening are among the enticing offers you can peruse.  

             

Just the Beginning!

We accomplished a lot with season one of Ask Dr. Juli, providing clever, intelligent humor for those who appreciate not having their comedy spoon fed to them.   Each episode featured interesting and hilarious characters, most of which are slated to be back in season two!  During season one, we assembled a large cast, shot and edited each episode, and spent countless hours promoting the show.   We did so much with so little... just imagine what we could do with a legitimate budget to work with! 

          

Here's what you can take away from this:  You'll be with us on the ground floor (well, technically the second floor) as we create this and other projects.   If you've ever wanted a taste of the Hollywood lifestyle, this is your chance to grab a piece of that.   Imagine if someone had offered you a chance to help get Seinfeld off the ground?  How cool would that be to say you were a part of that?    We don't know if Ask Dr. Juli -- or any of our other subsequent projects -- will ever be Seinfeld-big  (or even Joanie Loves Chachi-big), but we're certain that if we don't bust our rumps to make it happen, it never will.    Come along with us on this ride,  and it could very well be the thrill of a lifetime! 

Get Caught up on Season One!

At this point, I guess we probably shouldn't have assumed that you're familiar with Ask Dr. Juli.  If you're not, that's okay.   Our fan base is extremely loyal, but it's small.  They appreciate intelligent, sophisticated humor, but aren't big "sharers" on social media.   You can learn more about the program by checking out the Ask Dr. Juli website, linked below.  That's another thing we did ourselves with a limited budget!

Click here to check out the official Ask Dr. Juli website!

This is one of our favorite episodes of Ask Dr. Juli.   Check it out, then click the link below to binge-watch all 12 season one episodes.   You'll be happy you did!

                                                     

 
Binge-watch all of Season One right here! 
 
           

Ask Dr. Juli is loaded with a cast of colorful characters guaranteed to tickle your funny bone (figuratively, not literally -- although we're not necessarily opposed to making that a perk).  Many of these insanely hilarious folks are slated to return in season two, and we're excited about expanding on their back stories.   You can help keep them alive! 

            
 

Act Now!

Even if you can't contribute -- we get it, you've got bills to pay and mouths to feed -- there are things you can do to help the cause.   Please share this campaign with anyone you think might like to be a part if season two.    And please be descriptive -- don't just just click "share" on Facebook and be done with it.  Write something when you share it, explaining why you think your friends, family and colleagues might be interested.  Think about it -- how many social media posts have you ignored simply because the person who shared it didn't bother to say anything about it?    You don't have to do anything, really, but whatever you can do to help bring season two of Ask Dr. Juli to life would be greatly appreciated.  
            ​

Still not convinced?   That's okay, take some time to think it over -- and by that we mean no more than a few seconds then hastily hit the "contribute" button!   But seriously, we're about to embark on another season-long magic carpet ride and we hope you'll want to join us for the fun.  For as little as five dollars, you can live the Hollywood dream (vicariously, of course) and for a few bucks more -- okay several bucks more -- you can physically be a part of this thrill ride!  We hope you'll come along!  

Now go check out those perks!   Thanks and... Good bye!

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED, BUT YOU CAN STILL DONATE TO SEASON 2 BY CLICKING THE BUTTON BELOW. THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING THE SERIES.

 

Empire star Jussie Smollett serves as executive producer of Giants, the latest project from writer, director and actor James Bland. The first season of the series is currently streaming on Issa Rae’s (HBO’s Insecure) YouTube Channel via ColorCreative.TV.

Giants is a scripted digital drama series starring Bland, along with Vanessa Baden Kelly and Sean Samuels. The show follows three black millennials: Malachi (Bland), Journee (Kelly) and Ade (Samuels), each battling their own inner giants as they approach age 30. Giants transcends the typical coming of age story by pushing new boundaries of very real issues including mental health, sexual identity, religious skepticism and unorthodox methods of economic survival.

Giants is a series that speaks on a variety of social issues that are often stigmatize, trivialized or overlooked all together. The characters in Giants face these issues head on, while authentically reflecting the black millennial experience, and giving a voice to those who battle in silence or without a platform. We've begun an incredible journey with the characters in this series that we want to continue. There's still so much to say. We want the opportunity to show you (the audience) how these characters overcome their challenges to find peace, liberation and happiness.

The Giants season 2 crowd fund campaign will run for 60 days. During this time, we'll be in pre-production with the goal of shooting the second season this summer. You can expect new episodes to roll out fall 2017.

James Bland (Writer/Creator/Director/Executive Producer)

Jussie Smollett (Executive Producer)

Takara Joseph (Producer)

CJ Faison (Business Development)

J. August Richards (Writer/Director/Consulting Producer)

Will Catlett (Writer/Director)

Ben Corey Jones (Consulting Producer)

Vanessa Kelly (Writer)

Drew Anthuny (Music Supervisor)

Please help spread the word!

USE your INFLUENCE: Help us make some noise about our campaign and the work we are doing!

     1) Follow us on all social media at @giantstheseries
     2) Tweet, Post, Message a friend about this great show and how they can help!

story:
THE STORY

When Lucien, a young soldier, returns to the Resistance Army base above the Arctic Circle, he arrives as a newly promoted Captain. A normally welcome moment is less so, as the promotion came in accordance with the death of the Lt. General, who told Lucien to leave him behind. However, after the torture of a vampire prisoner yields a glimmer of hope that Lt. General may not be dead, Lucien recruits his daughter Demetria to the cause of rescuing him from vampire captivity. The Major General shoots them down immediately, citing the need to preserve resources during the time of the Midnight Sun, a 4 month period of uninterrupted sunlight above the Arctic Circle. But the two are determined, and Tikaani, an under-appreciated tech guru who has been developing specialty weapons for the war on his own, becomes the third member of the team. There’s some trepidation from Demetria, as she is wary of Tikaani’s growing relationship with Lucien, and his influence over the mission after he’s nearly captured by the Major General and fed a piece of information that may throw a wrench in their plans. Despite all this, the trio embark on their journey and as they move further into the danger, they have to overcome vampires, harsh conditions, and an unwillingness to trust each other, in order to accomplish their mission.

WHY THIS PROJECT

I’ve always wanted to work with genre material since my parents bought me a copy of The Exorcist for Christmas, and so getting to tell stories about complicated people with weird monsters is a dream.

This project was accepted into the Film Independent Incubator Lab so it’s already got a track record of awesomeness! Working in the Film Independent Incubator Lab has been the best thing for this project because as an African-American in the industry, they’ve been incredibly supportive of my desire to bring a diverse characters to the screen. Having the main hero, Lucien, be gay and his relationship with the Tikaani, the Asian tech guru being a strong focus of the story was just as important, if not more, than fun action scenes. Given I actually have an engineering degree, it was wonderful to write a minority character who gets to use science and technology to defeat the monsters. All of these choices began to enrich the story beyond what you’d normally see in a mission based adventure and I’m really proud of being able to get the project into production.

I also want to test the boundaries of storytelling. This is so much more than a web series, it’s a world that we’re building. After you watch an episode, you’ll be able to head on over to our website and delve deeper into the world of the midnight sun. Think Pottermore, but rather than awesome things relating to Harry Potter (#Slytherin4lyfe), you get detailed info on vampire history, a cool text based game of a vampire attack, and a tech shop with designs from the show.

CAN'T GIVE? THEN SHARING IS CARING

If you can't contribute money, you can still help.

Help us get the word out there via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, Phone-A-Friend, anything will help.

Tell all your friends, family and colleagues and use the share buttons below. This series is meant to be engaging and fan friendly, so why not start with this campaign!

WHO I AM

Terence Johnson is an award winning producer/director and an MFA graduate of Loyola Marymount University. Born in San Francisco and now living in Los Angeles, Terence had a non-traditional route to filmmaking, with a pit stop at Georgia Tech, where he got a Bachelor’s of Science in Civil Engineering. Given the strong analytical education and desire to see the devil in the details, Terence loves working within the frameworks of genre, particularly in horror-fantasy, to tell visually nuanced stories about humanity through allegory and thematic content, as well as being loosed from the shackles of normal storytelling tropes. He recently produced Room 205, a parkour zombie short film, that won Best Live Action Short at the Atlanta Horror Film Festival, and has received thousands of Youtube views, and a FoF Sound Design nomination, on his short film The Pull of the Moon. He’s a Film Independent Incubator Lab Fellow, working on Midnight Sun: Extraction, an interactive 6 episode web series that will debut in 2017.

THEN SHARING IS CARINGIf you can't contribute money, you can still help.Help us get the word out there via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email, Phone-A-Friend, anything will help.Tell all your friends, family and colleagues and use the share buttons below. This series is meant to be engaging and fan friendly, so why not start with this campaign!WHO I AMTerence Johnson is an award winning producer/director and an MFA graduate of Loyola Marymount University. Born in San Francisco and now living in Los Angeles, Terence had a non-traditional route to filmmaking, with a pit stop at Georgia Tech, where he got a Bachelor’s of Science in Civil Engineering. Given the strong analytical education and desire to see the devil in the details, Terence loves working within the frameworks of genre, particularly in horror-fantasy, to tell visually nuanced stories about humanity through allegory and thematic content, as well as being loosed from the shackles of normal storytelling tropes. He recently produced Room 205, a parkour zombie short film, that won Best Live Action Short at the Atlanta Horror Film Festival, and has received thousands of Youtube views, and a FoF Sound Design nomination, on his short film The Pull of the Moon. He’s a Film Independent Incubator Lab Fellow, working on Midnight Sun: Extraction, an interactive 6 episode web series that will debut in 2017.

story:
SQÚAD is hilarious, authentic and unapologetic!

SQÚAD is a vibrant comedy series created by Helena Morgane about a group of 5 Black women navigating life under the same roof in Rio de Janeiro. After the 2 oldest roommates drunkenly decide to post an ad specifically looking for Black roommates, we discover these perfectly imperfect characters whose cultures blend by living together and experiencing Brazil.

In order to showcase the vision for the show, Helena Morgane and co-writer/producer Sophie Duker decided to put together a temporary cast and crew at the beginning of 2017. We thank them for allowing SQÚAD to go from a script to taster scenes essential to crowdfunding!

SQÚAD is an ode to women of the African diaspora, where we step away from the African-American representation typically used by default. We aspires to make you laugh (...HARD!) and shift the way we show blackness in the media.

 

 

We have an international power team in place to guarantee our campaign hits the marks we need for funding and to ensure season 1's production goes as smoothly as possible!

(Left to right)

HELENA MORGANE, is the creator of SQÚAD and will star as Taslim. She supervises all aspects of the campaign. She's a multidisciplinary storyteller as well as the creator of the docu-series Kaleidoscope Stories.

ANDRESA PINHEIRO NUNES is co-producing and in charge of the research for SQÚAD in her native Brazil. Andresa is also a filmmaker passionate about journalism and the documentary genre.

CHAUNTELLE LEWIS is in charge of SQÚAD's social media strategy. Chauntelle is a social media specialist and graphic designer. She's also a member of SXWKS in London.

CESAR VALDEZ, is our awesome community manager monitoring our social media. He is also our video editor and owns a production company in Mexico.

PRESS PILLAY, is a boutique agency in charge of SQÚAD's PR and branding.

 

YOLA is a West African businesswoman in the making. She went to boarding school then got an Ivy League type of education. She’s in Brazil to develop her business, though she ultimately desires to go back to her home country to advance its economy; she says stuff like ‘Africa is rising’ a lot. Her eyebrows are always on point and she plays loud naija mixes. Yola struggles between being expected/wanting to marry a man soon to start a traditional family, and her ongoing sexual exploration with women.

 

DIANE “D” is an African-American yoga instructor with doula aspirations who’s attempting to be vegan – but failing in secret. Yola and her are besties and have been living in the house the longest. “The ad”is her idea.  D is celibate, very curvy; struggles with it 30% of the time but knows she’s sexy as f**k. She isn’t college educated, only speaks English and is still resisting opening up to other languages. She’s that blackity black woman who talks length about “AFRICA” – but has never actually been there. Diane could not imagine being in a relationship with a non-Black person and is actively hostile to people she deems aren’t “woke” (a word she overuses).

 

TASLIM “Taz” is an Afro-European woman raised by a muslim father and a Christian mother. This is her first time living out of the nest and FAR AWAY, but she’s far from naive. She eats pork, but does ramadan sometimes - often finds an excuse not to. She occasionally drives her roommates crazy with her loud music and food thefts. She will bust random dance moves or invent lyrics in convos. Her instagram following is crazy, she loves to thirst trap every now and then, and is the ultimate plug for a good time. Taslim works in a sex shop but is still trying to find how to best channel her calling. 

 

ROSIE identifies as Afro-Latina. She was raised by a fierce Nuyorican mother (think Rosie Perez). She’s a polyglot. Her father, a very successful Brazilian musician, taught her Portuguese growing up. She’s in Rio to reconnect with her roots. She’s a down-to-earth curious hippie constantly switching jobs because she struggles with her purpose. Rosie’s roommates will probably be her very first experience of sisterhood: she usually has guy friends and her friendship with Aaliyah is on-off.

Recurring character:

AALIYAH isn’t a roommate but is often around. She’s in the country to pursue a masters or doctorate. She speaks fluent Portuguese, a powerful asset in her environment. She has almost no black friends back home and is used to operating in mostly white spaces. She likes (spending) money, has an elitist side to her and a sugardaddy with whom she blurs the lines of dating. She’s a troubled soul whose stay in Brazil is a chance to explore her identity and independence. Aaliyah is becoming drawn to blackness after spending a life of seeing it as ‘other’.

 

 

Crowdfunding is far from being the easiest route to take for creatives and entrepreneurs! That said, we consider it a powerful asset in the way we create and consume Film and TV nowadays.

We are choosing crowdfunding as a way to fund our very first season (10 episodes), because we deeply believe in the strength of our concept and know it will open more doors for other forms of funding! 

We already have 3 episodes written and 7 will be written as soon as wrap our Indiegogo campaign! We paused our creative process to fully dedicate our attention to this step of pre-production.

As you'll see, we set our campaign at a minimum of $15,000, but our ACTUAL goal at this stage is to hit $40,000 (or more) to create exactly what we envision. 

Where will your money go?

Here's a chart showing you the breakdown of our budget. All these elements are the reason why $40,000 is our goal, from pre to post-production, budgeting right is how we keep the quality of our content up to par.

If we exceed our goal, we'll probably do a few rounds of victory dance, but we'll also be able to invest in festival submissions, get higher end equipment and just overall make sure our final product has the very best sound and image! Exceeding a goal also sends a strong message to potential collaborators!

If we end up not reaching our $40,000 goal, the money will remain assigned to SQÚAD 's first season. We would likely use it as leverage when meeting with production companies or use it as a base when start a follow-up campaign to hopefully gather more funds. We are simultaneously looking into different forms of support and crowdfunding is leading the way.

By choosing crowdfunding, we are creating a special bond with you, our audience, and making room for creative freedom. This is where you can express and support what YOU want, and what's better than contributing to the change we want to see in the world?!

Our expected timeline will be as follows:

- Crowdfunding: October - November 2017

- Writing of the remaining 7 episodes; December 2017 - February 2018

- Scouting and casting: February-March 2018 .

We will be choosing between filming in Rio de Janeiro and Salvador de Bahia and start casting locally

- Production: April 2018

We aim to film our entire season in 4 to 5 weeks.

- Post production: May-June 2018

- Online release: June or September 2018

 

 

Please keep in mind that every single donation, share, follow or email will be important to us (yes, even that 1 dollar/euro/pound at the bottom of your pocket). You can also see it as a cool way to sacrifice a coffee/sandwich or two to help us out!

What is crucial is to keep the word spreading, as word of mouth is not to be underestimated in crowdfunding! Every person around us can potentially be interested, so if SQÚAD is a project you truly believe in and want to see come to light, LET EVERYONE AND THEIR MAMA KNOW! We can't do this without YOU!

Now, if you already have your donation ready, we got you covered! We value you and view your donations are a token of your trust, we have prepared some exciting perks (some will be revealed later during the campaign!)

We also want to throw a referral contest! 

Share your own personal Indiegogo link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or anywhere on the web. If your friends end up contributing to the campaign, for every 5 donations we get thanks to you, we'll hook you up with a ticket to the nearest SQÚAD launch event! And for every 10 people you'll be able to access the full season in HD exclusively before the online release!

Here’s how it works:

1) Login to Indiegogo.

2) Create your personal share link by clicking on the “Link” icon button or click on one of the social media buttons. Copy and share your unique link with all your friends on social media, email etc.

3) You can keep track of your referral progress by clicking on the "Referrals" in your Indiegogo “My Profile" page.

The referral contest will run until the November 21, 2017. Donating does not prevent you from participating in the contest, everyone is welcome!

Like we mentioned before, every coin will count, but sometimes we just really can't contribute.
If that's your case, we understand! 50 shares, followers or emails can be as powerful as $50.
Here's you can still be a part of the movement:
 
  •  Look at the instructions above to participate to our REFERRAL CONTEST by sending a few friends our way! You share AND become eligible for some of our prizes!
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Instagram and Twitter
  • Share our content on social media, email or whatever way inspires you!
  • Invite people to this Indiegogo page: www.igg.me/at/sqdcomedyseries
  • How about writing an article or blog about us?
Don't forget about the share buttons at the top right side of our page.
 

 

- Coming soon-

 

Filming in a different country always carries a risk factor , but thanks to our current local collaborators and thanks to the relationships Andresa Nunes has established in Brazil, we are convinced we already have the tools to ensure the production of our first 10 episodes will be as smooth as possible!
 
Potential delays are a part of most productions, and our job as professionals is to make sure we keep control 
Our extensive experience in all aspects of production both individually and collectively will be the main asset to handle hurdles like this. We also commit to updating you with our milestones along the way. Transparency is the best policy!
 
(Illustration by Dorcas Creates)

story:
PREMISA

¿Qué hacen los cazavampiros después de cazar?

SINOPSIS

Arturo compagina su trabajo en una oficina con un trabajo nocturno muy especial: cazador de vampiros. Coke, su amigo y uno de sus compañeros de piso, le ayuda en la tarea de limpiar las calles de seres inmortales. A parte de esta ardua tarea, deberán mantener el orden público para que el caos no cunda entre la población y Clemente, el tercer inquilino del piso.

PERSONAJES

Diana (Aída Mediavilla), Reyes (Yaiza Redondo) y Clemente (David Arroyo) acompañarán a Arturo (Adrián Puertas) y Coke (Sergio Muñoz) en sus aventuras nocturnas. ¿Quieres conocerlos?

 

ESTÉTICA

Desde “Friends” (de la que nos interesa el formato de sitcom de colegas), pasando por “Cómo conocí a vuestra madre” (por sus saltos temporales y piruetas narrativas), mezclando con “Buffy Cazavampiros” (de dónde cogemos el mismo rol para nuestro protagonistas, y algo del sentido del humor exagerado de Joss Whedon), y añadiendo una pizquita de “Sobrenatural” (para las intros copiaremos su estilo, y algo de su estética western). Así mismo reconocemos la influencias de webseries españolas de éxito como “Bicho Malo” (por sus relaciones entre compañeros de piso), “Que vida más triste” (por su acercamiento hacia lo anodino), hasta “Samurái Jack” (por sus cambios de formato de imagen). Finalizamos nuestras referencias estéticas con dos películas clave del género de comedia de terror: “Zombies Party” (por introducir la comedia romántica en el género de terror), y “Bienvenidos a Zombieland” (por su gamberro sentido del humor).

QUIÉNES SOMOS


El equipo técnico del proyecto lo componen:

Productores Ejecutivos: Álvaro Panadero y Adrián Puertas

Productoras:  Blanca García, Lucía Pascual.

Jefa de producción: María Navarro.

Director: Antonio Fernández

Guionista: Álvaro Panadero, Antonio Fernández y José Fernández Rubio

Director de fotografía: Álvaro Fernández

Operador de cámara y Aydte de fotografía: David Labajos

Script: Isabel Cacho

Directora de arte:  Ana Cobos

Sonido: Gonzalo Muratel

Aydte de producción: Sandra Miguel de Prado, Hidalia Herrera Benito y Miguel Jorge García

Responsable de comunicación: Yaiza Redondo

CALENDARIO

Actualmente nos encontramos en fase de preproducción. El rodaje del piloto se realizará el 14-15 y 21-22 de octubre, y una vez finalice, dará comienzo la postproducción en octubre (edición + sonorización) para tenerlo listo para el Bilbao Web Fest. A partir de noviembre, dará comienzo la entrega de recompensas.

¿A QUÉ DESTINAREMOS VUESTRAS APORTACIONES?

Vuestras aportaciones se destinarán a gastos de producción tales como: equipo técnico (alquiler cámara + complementos, equipo de sonido y equipo de iluminación), dirección de arte (vestuario, atrezzo y caracterización de personajes), actores (dietas), gastos generales del equipo (imprevistos, transporte, dietas y alquiler de localizaciones) y recompensas (chapas, guión firmado, póster de la webserie con los personajes principales, y camiseta) 

REDES SOCIALES

FACEBOOK

WEB

INSTAGRAM

YOUTUBE

Para cualquier duda, sugerencia y demás…¡escríbenos a afterhuntserie@gmail.com!
¡Muchas gracias!
