story:
Each show is entirely student run and is part of the Intermediate Television Production: TV Bootcamp class.

OUR LITTLE GIRL follows Donna and Carol, a lesbian couple who adopt a seven year old girl, but all because of a smudge on the paperwork, they discover that their little girl is not seven but seventeen years old, and with just one month until her 18th birthday, the couple must make the most of their time with their new daughter before she goes off to live on her own like she has always planned. 

  • Created by Amanda Rose
  • Executive Produced by Ali Golub
  • Produced by Madeleine Lee
  • Written by Amanda Rose, Tucker Garborg, Zach Nagin, Brianna Burke, and Rachel Brown
  • Directed by Payton Leihgeber, Brian Koch, Ryann Nelson, Delaney Mazen, and Lily Newton

  • Director of Photography Troy Enoka

 

MICHAEL AND ANWAR follows, of course, Michael and Anwar, two friends and former college roommates. One night after Michael has told Anwar about his upcoming engagement to his girlfriend Louisa, Michael and Anwar decide to celebrate which leads to a kiss between the two of them. The series follows Michael and Anwar as they struggle with the fallout of this kiss, its effect on their other relationships, and their sexuality. Ultimately Anwar must choose to pursue his feelings for Michael, or let them go.

  • Created by Isabel Mitchell
  • Executive Produced by April Chang
  • Produced by Alex Hambrick
  • Written by Isabel Mitchell, Aless Veliz, Blythe Spindler-Richardson, Kevin Nittolo, and Amanda Matthews
  • Directed by Maddy Oliver, Arsh Harjani, and Paige McCall

 

DINNERTIME follows Gary and his upper-middle class family after Gary loses his job in the financial recession of 2008.  Gary, his wife Susan, their teenage daughter Ashley, and 'tween son Matthew must learn to cope with their loss as their father struggles to stay strong and find a sense of normalcy.

  • Created by Gabby Ragland
  • Executive Produced by Matthew O'Connor
  • Produced by Paula Sison
  • Written by Gabby Ragland, Jesse Shore, Josie Auferoth, Zoë Smith, and Vivian Gisle
  • Directed by Cameron Penn, Jack Kennedy, Jamie Zoll, and Nikki Pardee

 

Castings by Monique Simmon

Assisted by Josie Auferoth

 

Art Design by Paige Spindler-Richardson

Assisted by Brianna Burke
story_txt:
Each show is entirely student run and is part of the Intermediate Television Production: TV Bootcamp class.OUR LITTLE GIRL follows Donna and Carol, a lesbian couple who adopt a seven year old girl, but all because of a smudge on the paperwork, they discover that their little girl is not seven but seventeen years old, and with just one month until her 18th birthday, the couple must make the most of their time with their new daughter before she goes off to live on her own like she has always planned. 
Created by Amanda Rose
Executive Produced by Ali Golub
Produced by Madeleine Lee
Written by Amanda Rose, Tucker Garborg, Zach Nagin, Brianna Burke, and Rachel Brown
Directed by Payton Leihgeber, Brian Koch, Ryann Nelson, Delaney Mazen, and Lily Newton
Director of Photography Troy Enoka
 MICHAEL AND ANWAR follows, of course, Michael and Anwar, two friends and former college roommates. One night after Michael has told Anwar about his upcoming engagement to his girlfriend Louisa, Michael and Anwar decide to celebrate which leads to a kiss between the two of them. The series follows Michael and Anwar as they struggle with the fallout of this kiss, its effect on their other relationships, and their sexuality. Ultimately Anwar must choose to pursue his feelings for Michael, or let them go.
Created by Isabel Mitchell
Executive Produced by April Chang
Produced by Alex Hambrick
Written by Isabel Mitchell, Aless Veliz, Blythe Spindler-Richardson, Kevin Nittolo, and Amanda Matthews
Directed by Maddy Oliver, Arsh Harjani, and Paige McCall
 DINNERTIME follows Gary and his upper-middle class family after Gary loses his job in the financial recession of 2008.  Gary, his wife Susan, their teenage daughter Ashley, and 'tween son Matthew must learn to cope with their loss as their father struggles to stay strong and find a sense of normalcy.
Created by Gabby Ragland
Executive Produced by Matthew O'Connor
Produced by Paula Sison
Written by Gabby Ragland, Jesse Shore, Josie Auferoth, Zoë Smith, and Vivian Gisle
Directed by Cameron Penn, Jack Kennedy, Jamie Zoll, and Nikki Pardee
 Castings by Monique SimmonAssisted by Josie Auferoth Art Design by Paige Spindler-RichardsonAssisted by Brianna Burke

story:
'We put the fun in Dysfunctional'

The U&D Escapaids are known for building and solving puzzle rooms. Now all four members have agreed to reveal what happens in their everyday normal lives together, and the not so normal situations they find themselves in.

If you like The Office, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Mascots, Parks and Recreation, or Trailer Park Boys, then you'll love Meet the Team. This comedy mockumentary series has stemmed from the delusional mind behind YouTube gaming channel, Unmedicated and Dysfunctional, in conjunction with an elite team of comedians and gamers. 

With this project funded, we will be creating opportunity for new creatives in the Sacramento and Placer County area, as well as giving new actors and artists the boost they need to be successful. We will also be donating all unused funds to St Jude's Children's Hospital.

"Every penny put into this project will benefit the community one way or another. We're really striving to create opportunity and change a few lives with some good laughs."  

-The Team

 

You can follow Meet the Team for updates by clicking on the links below!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UDEscapaids/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/UDEscapaids?lang=en

IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt6650004/ 

 

You can also check out the actors here!

Kenz Massagli

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kenzmassagli/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/kenzud

IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6410868/?ref_=tt_cl_t2

 

Aryn Rozelle

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/arynrozelle/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ArynRozelle

IMDb: http://imdb.me/arynrozelle

Website: http://arynrozelle.com

 

Millie Jean Warren

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MillieJeanWarren/

IMDb: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5341417/?ref_=tt_cl_t5

 

Puneet Prasad

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/djPUN/

Website: https://puneetrecords.wordpress.com/

 

Unmedicated & Dysfunctional is a new and innovative YouTube gaming channel created by Makenzie 'Kenz' Massagli. When the channel first launched in August of 2016, it was an outlet for Kenz to be able to get through withdrawals from antidepressants and help others who suffer with mental disorders.

After a year of hard work, dedication, and an amazing subscriber base, Unmedicated and Dysfunctional has turned into so much more! In the future Unmedicated and Dysfunctional will be creating opportunity for creatives (such as entertainers, artists, game developers, and musicians), hosting mass fundraisers for research and charity, and hosting live events. 

"This channel is something that I am incredibly passionate about and would love to watch grow. Because of my subscribers, I was able to make it through such a rough patch. If I can inspire, teach, or bring happiness to at least one person, then Unmedicated and Dysfunctional will keep going. I still find time for school and research, but you guys are my number one priority!"

-Kenz

Subscribe today!

http://www.youtube.com/c/UnmedicatedDysfunctional

For 17 days of filming we will need about $20,000! 

Here is the breakdown:

  • $4000 at most for shipping perks and Indiegogo costs (Shipping is included in perk price)
  • $4000 flat for primary actors (Each Primary makes $1K flat which is about $75 a day)
  • $1500 emergency funds 
  • $500 flat for music (Yes, there will be a musical episode!)
  • $200 a day for camera
  • $200 a day for audio
  • $125 a day per extra actor  
  • $100 a day for food
  • $100 props and costume

Total Cost = $19,850

*All excess funds will be donated to St Jude's Children's Hospital

 

Guest Appearances:

There will also be some amazing Guest Star Appearances including Sumo Wrestler Michael Wietecha, and Diesel Brothers Model Kalista Duvey.

A special thanks to American River Ace Hardware for sponsoring us with a majority of props, 6 Players Studio Theater who is currently performing Miss Saigon with our own Aryn Rozelle, The Company at Del Oro Highschool who is allowing us to use their stages for our musical episode, and comedian Paul Vlahos who is donating lighting for production! 

Tune in to these awesome shows to get to know the team before the official release on December 8th!

8/8 - Uncontained

(http://www.uncontainedpod.com/listen)

 

8/12 9pm (pst) - Video Game BANG! 

(https://www.twitch.tv/videogame_bang)

 

9/11 - Talk Tripe

(https://talktripe.com/listen/)

 

10/31 Halloween Team Special - Unmedicated & Dysfunctional

(https://www.youtube.com/c/UnmedicatedDysfunctional)

 

For booking, contact Kenz at makenziemassagli@gmail.com

  • I'm a Host for a TV Show/Podcast/YouTube Channel, can I have The Team on my show?

Absolutely! The Team will be available for booking throughout the indiegogo campaign, production, and episodic releases from August 1st 2017 through February 16th 2018. Please contact Kenz at makenziemassagli@gmail.com.

 

  • I'm an entertainer, could I be on Meet the Team?

We are always looking for extras and cameos! If you are interested in auditioning or would like more information please e-mail a headshot and resume to Kenz at makenziemassagli@gmail.com.

 

  •  Was my contribution successful?

Hopefully yes! If your contribution was successful Indiegogo will send you an e-mail confirmation! If there are any issues please let us know by leaving a comment and we will do our best to get the issue resolved or accommodate you.

 

  • Can I claim more than one perk? 

Yes! You an even claim a perk for someone else! However, Indiegogo only allows one perk selection at a time so each perk must be made in a separate order. If you do make multiple contributions we will ship all of your rewards at the same time!

 

  • When will my perks be shipped? ​

Awards that require shipment will be shipped out the 3rd through 4th week of October. Digital rewards can be redeemed via e-mail in part as soon as the campaign is over. Some perks however will be available after the complete release in February of 2018 since they include HUGE spoilers. 

 

  • How do I pick my perk options? 

At the end of the indiegogo campaign we will have access to your e-mail address and be able send out surveys for each perk so that you can specify exactly which item and sizes you want! All we need is a filled out survey by October 8th.

 

  • What Sizes are wearable items available in?

​T-Shirts and Hoodies are available in sizes S through XL. The Fanny Snacks come with an adjustable strap that can accommodate any size for the perfect fit (and snack)!

story:
The Pitch

Become a producer of the TV comedy series UNDERCURRENT set in a Minnesota river town that’s a little dark around the edges.

The Project

In the river town of Confluence, there is a shroud of mystery surrounding an undiscovered treasure buried along the river by Depression Era gangsters.



But that’s not all that’s about to get dug up from the past.



Joe Samuel, a former big city detective has returned to his hometown to care for his ailing mother. No sooner than he has unpacked his bags, Joe is sought out by Marjorie Steen, the newly-elected mayor of Confluence. Marjorie and Joe have a past and she is on a mission to clean up the “dirt” in her town. That fight against the local corruption is bankrolled by a wealthy citizen who wishes to remain anonymous.

Joe reluctantly agrees to investigate and brings on two assistants. One is the exuberant Gage Murphy, a self-absorbed actor who is beset by fits of rage.

The other is the quirky Pauline Hingis, a former hairdresser turned tech expert.

Soon, this unlikely trio is investigating the shady dealings of local men’s store owner Jimmy Rickman while getting to know all about Confluence’s long-time, openly-dishonest police chief, Larry Spinkter.

The Proposition

Why is  UNDERCURRENT worth your investment? Because this TV series combines unforgettable comedic characters with drama, mystery and romance that can only happen in a small, nearly-forgotten river town. So, for us to bring UNDERCURRENT up to the surface we need to make more episodes. The pilot is shot and is in post-production. Episode-2 is written and ready to go. So when we ask you to donate, it’s more than just a “call to action...” it’s a call for lights, camera, action!

The making of this “MNIndie” is a story of it’s own. Cast and crew, some of the finest talent in Minnesota, has worked long days shooting the pilot episode for little or no money because they believe in the show. But that has to change in order for us to put Confluence on the map. That’s where you come in.

The Perpetrators

Bill Williamson
as Joe Samuel

A Twin Cities and Milwaukee theater veteran who has starred in over 200 industrial films. Along with Bill’s film work, he has also been in dozens of TV commercials.

Heidi Fellner
as Marjorie Steen

A South Dakota acting veteran who has appeared in recent episodes of ABC’s “In an Instant” and independent feature films including “Zombies” and Cold November.” Heidi also does voiceovers for Target and American Express.

Adam Glatzl
as Gage Murphy

A native New Yorker whose training has been in theater and who recently starred in the Cineapolis feature “Soiree.” Since moving to Minnesota, Adam has starred in dozens of films, commercials and industrials.

Amy Cocchiarella
as Pauline Hingis

A Minneapolis native who got her training in Los Angeles and returned to the Twin Cities for acting and comedy performance. Amy appeared in Patrick Coyle’s “The Public Domain” and with Woody Harrelson in “Wilson.”

Mike Shaw
as Police Chief Larry Spinkter

A former radio announcer and voiceover artist who specializes as a character actor. Mike, who has starred in dozens of theatrical productions, was born with the face of a corrupt cop.

Michael Paul Levin
as Rickman

An actor and writer who has been working in the Twin Cities for over 30 years, Michael Paul Levin has appeared in numerous theatrical productions, TV commercials, and films. He is a writer for “A Prairie Home Companion.”

Bick Smith
Writer/Producer

A veteran of film, TV and theater who has been carrying the idea for “Undercurrent” for many years since his broadcast news days in New York. He began his non-fiction writing career after moving across the country to Los Angeles in his 1985 Ford Escort.

Cynthia Schreiner Smith
Director

One-half of CyBick, Cynthia has directed Minnesota TV, theater and improvisation for more than three decades. “Undercurrent” is the Saint Paul native’s cinematic directorial debut.

Justin Schaack
Director of Photography

A Minnesota native and graduate of USC’s School of Cinema-Television. Justin has received numerous Best Cinematography awards and nominations at film festivals across the U.S.

Nick Kesler
Cameras

An Emmy Award-winning Cinematographer with experience in narrative storytelling. Nick travels to every corner of the country, directing pilots for HGTV and the Food Network.

Joe Berglove
Cameras

A broadcast veteran of 33 years at WCCO TV in Minneapolis, Joe has more recently focused on short film. Two of his feature scripts have won prestigious national awards.

David Moldenhauer
Sound

A classically-trained musician in his youth, now an audio specialist. Aside from designing sound for numerous short films, Dave has been in TV broadcasting for 15 years.

Sean Skinner
Producer

An Emmy Award-winning photojournalist, Sean has been filming, editing, producing and directing news stories, documentaries and short films for 20 years. His company, Red 23 Films, has won numerous awards in Midwestern film festivals.

The Budget

story:
I want to create change and make a difference

I want to get kids away from screens and playing

I want to reduce obesity and inactivity

I want to inspire kids and families to have fun being active

I want kids to experience what it's like to explore and go on adventures

I want kids to ask for and enjoy eating healthy foods

 

A television series will be the most effective way for Captain Active to reach, educate and motivate hundreds of thousands of young kids of all backgrounds.

 

Why?

  • Kids need an active, positive, enthusiastic role model
  • Childhood obesity and inactivity are at an all time high
  • These episodes will be unique, there's nothing like them on TV
  • Government programs aren't working well enough
  • We need to be creative to appeal to and inspire kids
  • Kids love Captain Active's energy, colour and personality
  • Watching Captain Active on TV will increase the amount of unstructured physical activity children do and influence them to want to eat healthier foods
  • The Captain Active program of touring stage shows, online videos, kids classes and social media interaction has evolved in the past three years to be highly effective, but its reach is still limited
  • Captain Active is both a sports scientist and a Dad, so he understands the physical activity requirements for children and how to effectively engage them

 

After exhausting all other channels, I'm now taking the bull by the horns to develop a professionally produced television pilot series to pitch to broadcasters and distributors.

 

Each episode will include studio filmed game and cooking demonstrations of Captain Active from inside his Fruit and Veggie Rocket, on-location filming of Captain Active with high profile sportspeople showcasing their sport and an overarching storyline that ties it all together (in short, Captain Active comes from Activeland to overcome the effects his arch nemesis, the evil Lazy Cray Cray is having on the people of planet Earth!)

 

With my marketing and production partners, we will pitch the pilot series to broadcasters and distributors.  When they experience how awesome the episodes are and witness how amazingly children respond to Captain Active, they will be jumping at the opportunity to commission a full series of episodes!

 

To assist in funding these pilot episodes, I have approached a range of organisations BUT, I also need your help...

 

so your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to throw in a few dollars (a total of $10,000 ensures at least one epic studio recorded episode), get your friends and family excited to also support the project and to encourage relevant businesses to get behind us

 

...and of course, to be active just like Captain Active!

story:
THE STORY

The Adventures of Becktron and Sally is an exciting animated adventure about a spirited princess from the far off world of Becktropolis - a distant planet with three suns: red, yellow and purple.  Becktron was born under a yellow sun, which is quite rare and gives her the most extraordinary powers.  The yellow sun of Becktropolis is dying and so Becktron decides to explore the universe and help find a new one.  

Unfortunately, she gets lost trying to find the Planet Kepler and lands on Planet Earth instead!  There she rescues a flip-flop loving, science geek named Sally and her dog AJ from Jelisa and the Mean Girls. Becktron has natural superpowers and Sally makes the most amazing inventions with her creativity.  Together, the girls use their powers to fight crime, stand up to bullies and help us understand that everyone has a unique purpose and destiny.

The story features STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) skills and encourages all children, but especially girls to be problem solvers. Our target audience is young boys and girls between the ages of 7 and 12. Becktron and Sally are exciting heroines whose cross-cultural friendship, will help boys and girls understand the importance of tolerance and acceptance.

OUR HEROINES

BECKTRON

Becktron is a tween princess from Becktropolis – a planet in the Elexa Solar System.  One day, Becktron realized that she wanted to do more than live in a palace like a pampered princess.  She wanted to fly a spaceship and explore the universe like her brother Binyamin. The yellow sun on her planet was dying and she wanted to help find a new one.  So off she went, flying her spaceship into unchartered territory until – she unwittingly discovered a planet with a yellow sun.  Little did she realize that Earth has its own problems to solve - indeed!

SALLY 

Sally was the tallest girl in her 7th grade class.  She had red hair and a face sprinkled with freckles.  Sally loved to read how-to-books, wear flip-flops, play with AJ her dog and Noah, her five-year old neighbor.   And Sally was smart.  Real smart.  Every year she won the school science fair.  Unfortunately, everyone doesn’t like the fact that Sally is so smart – especially Jelisa and the Mean Girls.  One day, they play a mean trick on Sally - a very bad trick – indeed!

 

THE PLAN

After a lot of work, we are ready to animate our pilot episode.  This is the first step in a bigger plan to establish the Becktron animated series.  After completing the animation for the pilot, we plan to enter it at festivals around the world. We hope this will lead to a television series and brand licensing for toys and other children’s products.  The hope that one day there will be a full-length feature film – but first things first.  We need your financial support to help us cross the finish line and bring this amazing story to audiences around the world.

As a mom, I know how much pressure children are under to fit in and perform.  This project shows children to accept the differences in themselves, as well as others.  It encourages them to be brave and use their unique talents to make the world a better place.

We decided to share our journey on Indiegogo because we wanted to partner with progressive, forward thinking people who want to invest in projects that are fun, creative, but also make a difference. This project will inspire children (and a few adults!) to dream and reach beyond the stars.  The book, upon which the pilot is based is currently in the libraries of numerous elementary schools around the country - teachers find our story our characters easy for children to relate to.  And kids all love Becktron and Sally!

 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

We need to raise $75,000 to complete production and distribute this short film in domestic and international film festivals.


Pre-Production: 10% - will be used to finish character models, art work, and storyboards.
Production: 50% -the bulk of funds raised will be used for actual production of the film’s animation (time & labor intensive).
Post-Production:  20% - voice talent, music and licensing rights, editorial/post, composting and sweetening.
Distribution: 10% - legal fees, press kits, marketing materials, festival, fees and travel.
Perk Fulfillment:  5% - Thank You gifts for all of our generous friends and supporters!Platform Fee: 5% - Thank you Indiegogo for helping us reach our dream!


RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have big plans for the Becktron project, but we realize that the longest journey begins one step at a time. That’s why we are starting with this short film. Like any new venture, our biggest challenge is to raise sufficient capital to ensure that we can achieve a high standard of excellence.  With your financial support, we will make the kind of film our audience deserves and one that you can be proud of being a part of.

In today’s market, there are tremendous opportunities for The Adventures of Becktron and Sally. The box-office success of movies such as MOANA, Hidden Figures and Get OUT! - reflect a growing acceptance by mainstream audiences of diverse characters and storylines.

MORE WAYS YOU CAN HELP BECKTRON SOAR TO THE STARS….


REFERRAL CONTEST

You can help by referring our campaign to your network and encouraging them to give…

1) Log in to your Indiegogo account
2) Go to our crowdfund page
3) Share the campaign directly using the buttons on the left or copy the unique URL you get by clicking the “Link” button
4) Refer our Indiegogo campaign with anyone you think would be interested in supporting this project.

 

SPECIAL PERKS……

The person who raises the most Referral $$$ will have a supporting character named/drawn after them and receive 4 tickets to the NYC VIP Screening & Cocktail Reception.

Everyone who raises at least $100 in referrals will receive a signed limited edition coloring book and 1st edition copy of “The Adventures of Becktron and Sally Slappers” book.

The referral contest lasts until the end of the crowdfunding campaign.  We will have more details on these contests in the coming weeks.  If you have questions please contact me using the link above.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP….

Even if you can’t donate, the biggest way you can help is to spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign and encourage everyone you know to give…and give ….and give (generously!).  The more people who donate, the better chance we have of reaching our goals.

It’s impossible not to love people who help you achieve your dreams.  Please know that we love you and REALLY appreciate your generosity.

                                       GOD BLESS YOU AND THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
story_txt: THE STORYThe Adventures of Becktron and Sally is an exciting animated adventure about a spirited princess from the far off world of Becktropolis - a distant planet with three suns: red, yellow and purple.  Becktron was born under a yellow sun, which is quite rare and gives her the most extraordinary powers.  The yellow sun of Becktropolis is dying and so Becktron decides to explore the universe and help find a new one.  Unfortunately, she gets lost trying to find the Planet Kepler and lands on Planet Earth instead!  There she rescues a flip-flop loving, science geek named Sally and her dog AJ from Jelisa and the Mean Girls. Becktron has natural superpowers and Sally makes the most amazing inventions with her creativity.  Together, the girls use their powers to fight crime, stand up to bullies and help us understand that everyone has a unique purpose and destiny.The story features STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) skills and encourages all children, but especially girls to be problem solvers. Our target audience is young boys and girls between the ages of 7 and 12. story:
The origins of Highland Park TV

In 2014, we (cofounders Rob Getzschman and Stoney Sharp)  bought a 1992 television switchboard known as the Video Toaster, deemed obsolete by today's standards. Over the next two years, while working day jobs in television production, we scoured eBay, Craigslist and local resources to track down all the components required to realize our dream: a fully functioning obsolete three-camera SD television studio.

Why would anyone want this? Two reasons:

1) We have both been producing video since high school, and we've collaborated since 2010, including work for ABC Freeform, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, IFC, MTV, Funny Or Die, UCB, College Humor and more. We know the difficulty of media production for people at every level of experience, whether the barriers to entry are social, financial, technical, or educational. We wanted to create a place where people could experiment and make media that could be incredible, weird, purposeful, or useless. We wanted anyone who had an idea to be able to try. We wanted a place where creative people could make ambitious, weird, and unwatchable television without any fear of failure.

2) The Telecommunications Act of 1996 effectively killed public access television, where anyone in America could make TV if they wanted to. Public access was a place where the creative fringe could thrive, and that weirdness found its way into the public consciousness in very real and meaningful ways, from Weird Al's hit feature film UHF to Wayne's World to Tim & Eric Awesome Show Great Job. It's our belief that a healthy fringe promotes a healthy mainstream by osmosis. And without public access television mandated by law, we need something in its place. And for Los Angeles, that something is Highland Park TV.

 

The purpose of the campaign 

This campaign is intended to fund Highland Park TV for another year. We are completely volunteer-staffed. Our volunteers show up to run cameras, light and direct productions, run the sound board and Video Toaster, and create stuff together like a hive mind. After financing the project out of pocket for four years, we would like to broaden our community participation and support by crowdsourcing our largest expense: the price of rent for 2018. We never charge people to make stuff at HLPtv, and the community has functioned like open-mic television: show up, put your name on a list, and make a show when it's your turn. 

What we offer in return is some pretty okay swag: stickers, posters, t-shirts, a VHS collection of our best work, and the chance to make an appearance of your own on some of HLPtv's longest-running shows! See details in the perks.

 

Why is HLPtv important? 

It is our feeling that American media has reached "peak polish" — that is, there is scarcely a moment in our collective media consciousness that feels authentic, that shows the rough edges of reality, that reveals the hand of the creator. The broadcasting and advertising we see has been polished to death, and our public figures are media trained to the point of inspiring narcolepsy and/or chronic fatigue in our public. At HLPtv, we "DO IT LIVE" and leave the rough edges on for everyone to see and appreciate. Our obsolete tech, rough mixes and mistakes are our aesthetic. And after years of being paid to polish things to death, we revel in making stuff that is unquestionably unprepared, off the cuff, and totally authentic.

story:
A play on Drunk History, Drunk HerStory is a web series that highlights the struggles women face on a daily basis, as told by our hilarious HerStory-tellers over a glass of wine (or six). 

Why Do We Need to Tell HerStory

The issues women face are real, they are unjust, and they are pervasive. They are comprised of moments in the workplace, on dates, online, in the classroom, in the bedroom, in the media and beyond. But we often only get to talk about these "issues" when they are, in fact, issues. A serious problem occurring in that moment, prompting people to take sides, shut down, and either stop the constructive dialogue or stop listening.

Our HerStory-tellers are a racially, sexually, religiously diverse group of individuals who identify as women. Our HerStory-tellers imbibe while they tell their comical, relatable, and often cringe-worthy stories of everything from dating in 2018 to their job as a corporate manager.

The desire is not to make light of real issues. The HerStory movement speaks about feminism in a way that is accessible and engaging with the hope that a wide audience will be receptive to our stories. This is an entirely new platform for women to be heard.

What We Need

We need to push the women's movement forward, but we can't do this without you! We are raising $5,000 to fund our series crew, production, and release- supplementing the time and money they have already donated to making Drunk HerStory a reality.

The Impact

We hope the Drunk HerStory series becomes a storytelling platform that empowers, educates, and facilitates a community of female ambassadors to change the perception and environment surrounding women’s issues.

We know talking about these things isn't always easy. By sharing them in a casual, fun, intimate environment, we are breaking the barriers around discussing these issues. Women will be sharing with elements of humor and candor, not to lighten the issue, but to emphasize our resilience and strength.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may not be able to financially support our cause, but we would still love your support in the Drunk HerStory movement! If you would be willing, please share our crowdfunding page with your own community. It's time to achieve women's equality in a whole new way. Cheers to that!

story:
Would You Like To Understand?

Justin Antonopoulos, star of the 1998 Christmas favorite "Rudolph's Return," had a hard time coping with his childhood in the spotlight. After years of struggling to escape his Hollywood past, he found solace in Jehovah's Witnesses, a religion whose followers believe the end of the world is imminent and only 144,000 chosen believers will live in heaven after Armageddon.

When the studio announces a 20th anniversary reboot of "Rudolph's Return," Justin's dedication to his new faith is put to the test. Will he become one of the 144,000, or will Rudolph return to destroy him once again?

Who Is Responsible For This?

Kate Gallagher (Writer/Director)
Cameron McMullen (Supervising Producer/"Justin")
Sarah Cooper (Associate Producer/"Christina")
Brittan Smith (Production Designer/"Ezekiel")

A young and diversely experienced power team of artist in Los Angeles, the four individuals listed above have committed themselves to telling you Justin's story of tribulation, self-exploration, and understanding one's place in a very confusing and dark world. 

Why Should You Trust Us With Your Money?

We've already filmed two episodes on a tiny budget, but we need more funding if we're going to produce six more with the same level of quality! Here's where your money would be going:

  • Equipment rentals: because cameras are expensive, like really expensive!
  • Production Crew: because talented professionals will only volunteer their time for so long!
  • Locations: because even set dec legend Brittan Smith can't make a small apartment look like a church!
  • Set dressing, props, and costumes: because we want to keep it looking good, we want to immerse you in the world of The Witness!
  • Food for the cast and crew: because 12-hour shooting days are no joke and eating is important.
  • Marketing: because we want the world to hear Justin's story.

How Can You Spread The News?

Here's what else you can do to help us:

  • Share a link to this campaign on the social media platform of your choosing
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Sign up for our mailing list on witnessthewitness.com for email updates on our progress
